description:
The best Cheesecake I have ever had. This is a true gem. Make sure to order or arrive EARLY. They sell out every day.

Its light, fluffy, perfectly flavoured with a full body taste. It will have you grabbing for seconds before you know it.
author: Mike A.

description:
Best cheesecake I ever had in my 22 years living. 

Cutting the cake with a string is all the proof you need of this claim.

Call ahead if it's at a special event you want to devour this heavenly dessert or else.
author: Rebecca B.

description:
BEST CHEESECAKE EVER!

I will never forget the taste of this cheesecake - it's different than any cheesecake that I ever had and I immediately fell in love after the first bite. Both the texture and the taste is amazing! It's creamy, jiggly, soft and fluffy. 

There's a string that comes with the box for you to cut the cake with since the cake is so soft and fluffy - using a knife would destroy it. 

Do call in and reserve the cake in advance since they run out pretty quickly and also remember to bring cash!
author: Katie M.

description:
I have had this place bookmarked for YEARS...I kid you not. It is seriously the best cheesecake I've ever had and always a crowd pleaser for birthdays or potlucks! 

They said they always recommend the traditional ..since you cant go wrong with a classic!

Be sure to go early or call ahead to make sure you can get what you want! I called on a Friday and they were completely sold out at 1pm! Meeps...SF folks know whats up!
author: Jennifer S.

description:
Food: 5/5 i ordered a small traditional cheesecake. It was super light and fluffy. The cheesecake was like a mix between American and Japanese cheesecake. The cake was not too sweet which is a plus imo. 

Service: i recommend ordering ahead. The man that I spoke to on the phone was really nice and informed me CASH ONLY. 

Price: tad pricey. But it's worth especially for a special occasion :)   the cake was 16 dollars 
Remember CASH ONLY.  

Would I come here again? Yes! I've never had any combo like that before.  And we were able to finish it pretty quickly
author: Celina D.

description:
Got a small original cheesecake for a friend's birthday. It can be cut into 8 bitesized slices, good for 4 people.

I called 10 minutes ahead to pick up a cake on a Wednesday at 2 pm. The cake was $16 and I paid in cash. Metered parking was easy to find by the shop at this time. I was in and out within 7 minutes (the smallest window possible on the meter).

The cake itself truly was the best cheesecake I've had. Some fluffy cheesecakes don't taste rich enough, like a proper cheesecake, but this one really does balance a light almost whipped texture with a creamcheese taste.
author: Jill F.

description:
I've been on the hunt for cheesecake that is similar to Japanese cheesecake -light, fluffy and slightly sweet- and this is THE place to go to just for that. 

There was no line until 9:50am (ten minutes before opening) on Saturday. Even so, the line was short and had about 8 people behind me, I was first in line. I didn't reserve any cakes, but it seems they make a good amount to sell for walk ins. However, I suggest going in early to ensure you don't leave disappointed with no cake in hand. Their packaging is nice enough to gift to others. I bought a small and large traditional cheesecake. They were still good from sitting in the fridge overnight but melted just a tad bit. Happy to have some leftovers to freeze and enjoy in the coming weeks!

Seems they have increased their prices over the years, but the prices are still fair and reasonable. Call their business ahead of time and listen to their automated message to ensure they're open and not on vacation.

Parking is easy to find around the neighborhood. I wouldn't park right in front of the shop (the spot without a parking meter). Since it's not an actual parking spot, you'd be blocking the lane and your car can get clipped.
author: Donna M.

description:
By far the best cheese cake I had so far in the bay area. I can't believe I didn't know this place exist until I saw it from a local blogger. 
Super fluffy, not too sweet
They would show you how to cut it if you don't know how (use the wire!)
Cash only
you can reserve a cheese cake ahead of time to make sure they save one for you
I've saw reviews that they sold out before closing time and it's true, they only have so many a day, which means they are always fresh!
author: Gary C.

description:
Zanze's makes one of the best cheesecakes I've ever had. That means a lot to coming form someone who doesn't even like cheesecake. 

This place is located in a small little store front along the side of ocean ave. It is highly recommended that you call in to place an order because these cheesecakes fly right off the shelves. This establishment is cash only. 

My favorite is the cheesecake with the fresh blueberries. It gives it a nice subtle tart flavor that mellows down the creaminess of the cheesecake. Cheesecake is fluffy and light. When handing it to others, the cheesecake just jiggles in the plate. Fishing line is provided to cut the cheesecake. It slices through, I cannot believe it's not butter. 

You really can't go wrong with any of these cheesecakes. Great for all occasions.
author: Timothy C.

description: Finally got to try Zanze Cheesecake! They're closed Sunday-Tuesday but I called them and left them a message on what cheesecake I wanted and the size. They gave me a call back the next day to confirm everything. I suggest people to call ahead and reserve your cake because they can sell out at a early time. Parking was easy to find in the area. I got a medium traditional cheesecake 25$ (BE SURE TO BRING CASH) The cheesecake itself was very light and fluffy as everyone describe it was. However it's not for me but I did enjoy it. :)
author: Tina C.

description:
Amazing.  Light and fluffy like those Japanese cheesecakes.  My sis brought one for my mom's bday (plain flavor).  

It was really really good!  They are in high demand.
author: Serina K.

description:
Finally i got to buy their cheesecake after hearing so much about this place...Decided to come here on a saturday as a walk in right when they open which was 10am since i keep hearing that their cheesecakes get sold out quickly even though it was risky not to call in ahead of time. When i finally came few minutes before opening....and as i was driving by this place while i was looking for parking, there were actually people waiting outside the door before opening. I surprised that people actually wait before opening for cheesecake. People continue to come after i got my cheesecake...I understand why Zanze cheesecake is so popular 

Its the most FLUFFIEST cheesecake  you will ever get...and its light in flavor. The crumb on the top makes it have that extra texture.

I got medium of original cheesecake which cost $25. Its little expensive but it can feed a lot of people. It can serve anyway from 10 - 16 slices depending how many slices you want to cut . The staffs does provide you a string that they tape on the box. 

This place is small

This place accept cash only 

Friendly staffs. They can help you how to use the string of how to cut the cheesecake if you never been there before

Will definitely come back here again for any special occasion
author: Julie N.

description:
The best cheesecake hands down!
After you try this place, you will change your perspective on cheesecake!
author: Candice L.

description: Got a medium original cheesecake for my bf's birthday and it was absolutely delicious!!!! We called ahead two days before to make sure we get one. When my bf picked it up, he said that there were a couple of people that walked in the store trying to get a cake but they were already sold out so def call in advance! I swear I could've easily finished half of it in one sitting. It's so light, not overbearing at all. How to describe it..... its not like whipped cream, definitely thicker than that but way less dense than a New York cheesecake. You just have to try it for yourself! Also love cutting it with the string!
author: Pearl Oyster A.

description:
My favorite Cheesecake place! Their cheesecakes are so fresh, soft, fluffy and not too sweet. You could also put it in the fridge for couple hours before serving if you like. It's suggested to make a reservation, because they usually sell out.

REMEMBER TO BRING CASH
author: Andrew Y.

description:
BEST CHEESECAKE EVER!!! Seriously though, you need this cheesecake in your life. When my friend recommended this place to me, I didn't think much of it. But there's no doubt why this place is so highly rated and always sells out. As others mentioned, be sure to reserve your cheesecake. I actually called in the same morning for pick-up at 3pm since they weren't open on Monday and Tuesday.

Parking can be tricky, but I was able to find one in the neighborhood. The shop is tiny --basically here for you to pick up your cheesecake and go. It was super quick and easy. The lady taught me how to cut the cheesecake with fishing wire and to keep it in the refrigerator until 15 minutes before consumption. For a small original cheesecake, it was $16. Next time, I am for sure going to get a large instead because it's that good.

The cheesecake is cheesy, creamy, and fluffy. It's not as dense as an American cheesecake but not as airy as a Japanese cheesecake --literally the perfect European cheesecake. I'm in love and I can't get enough of it!

P.S. This place is CASH ONLY!
author: Cindy Z.

description:
How did I JUST discover this place? This is officially my new favorite cheesecake spot - & probably the only one I'll go to from now on.

Why?
- Texture: SO fluffy - it's the perfect in between of an American & Japanese cheesecake. 
- Taste: is AMAZING - not too sweet - like most cheesecakes - and you can really taste the amazing flavor.
- Price: For the quality you taste, the prices are very reasonable.
- Sizes: They offer small, medium, large.
- Flavors: While I opted for the traditional one, the other flavors sounded amazing. The "other" ones seem to rotate but for now, I'm going to stick to the OG.

TIPS:
- CASH only.
- The worker said that most sell out well before their closing time - so she recommended placing an order ahead of time in case you can't come by at least 3 or 4pm.

Happy cheesin'!
author: Rachel Y.

description:
Zanze has a very unique type of cheesecake. There's the Japanese light and fluffy cheesecake, the dense very sweet classic cheesecake and then there's zanze's cheesecake the perfect mix of the two and in my opinion the best cheesecake I've had in my life. 

The closest thing I've had was Eileen's cheesecake in New York but that's still a distant second. Zanze just has the perfect sweetness and texture that just melts in your mouth.

Only issue is they are like Golden gate bakery and are closed A LOT because they gave mastered their craft and are just open to appease the masses. But Zanze is at least consistent and you don't have to check a website unaffiliated with them to see if they are open, just calling and listening to the voicemail will do. They go on summer vacation every year and are closed Sunday - Tuesday. But check the tips section to see what people are saying.
author: Conway W.

description: This cheesecake was something out of this world!! The cheesecake itself was light and airy which is by far very different than what I'm used to eating for cheesecake.  Definitely not your typical sweet and overly rich cheesecake but the opposite.  If you don't like cheesecake then I would suggest you try this place because after eating it then you will love this cheesecake! Its one of those things you have to cross off your bucket list! Trust me.
author: Christina M.

description: So light and fluffy, yet creamy! The "crust" is on the top. Get the original, the chocolate ruins the flavor.
author: Madison L.

description:
Best cheesecake I've ever tasted and everyone that I've introduced this cake to agrees! 
Make sure you call ahead to reserve a cake if you're planning on coming on Friday or over the weekend! Very friendly and genuine staff. They're very efficient so the line moves fast! 

On Saturday, I parked on the street right outside the shop and was the first person outside their door at 9:45am. 3 minutes later, someone got behind me to wait in line. By 10:00am, there were 7 people in line. When I came in on a random Wednesday afternoon, there was no line and no one inside and they had plenty of cakes left. On a Friday, i called them at 1:00pm and they he sold out. 

Call before you go in! They do answer the phone!
author: Kay H.

description:
Alright, I'm just going to be straightforward and put it out there - the best cheesecake that I have ever tasted... 

5 stars for taste - it's airy, fluffy, just the right amount of sweetness. It's not dense like most cheesecakes. They supply a fishing line to use to cut the slices. It's a little pricey, but well worth it! 

Tips: 
1. You may want to call ahead (they either have sold out or not open/vacation) passed by a few times with them being on vacation 
2. Plan ahead and arrive a few minutes before they open (there may be a line, but haven't had any issues of waiting longer than 20 minutes) 
3. Get it with the chocolate shavings 
4. Cash only

Highly highly recommended cheesecake shop when in San Francisco!
author: Diane R.

description:
I'm giving this place 3 stars because their cheesecakes are my favorite. 

HOWEVER, you should probably always call to see if they have product. They have regular hours, but honestly you can never get a cheesecake. They're either always sold out or just closed. Whenever we go, we can NEVER buy a cheesecake. It's really frustrating. I just wish I could go in and buy one now, but who even KNOWS?????
author: Allyson L.

description:
Very creamy, SOFT cheesecake, but be aware! it is different from the traditional New York cheesecake!!

I am more used to the thick New York style cheesecake that has more of a rigid texture. The Zanze's cheesecake was like a new type of cheesecake for me since it was really really soft and creamy. Don't worry though, you get the same authentic and strong cheese taste hehehe Instead of having the pie-like crumb sheet, you get powder of gram cracker-like crumbs on top of the cake, it's just perfect with a cup of iced coffee :D 

***THEY ONLY TAKE CASH IN STORE, MAKE SURE TO DROP BY AN ATM IF YOU WANT SOME DELICIOUS CHEESECAKE***
author: Jane L.

description:
I don't like cheesecake. But plot twist... this is the best cheesecake I have ever had in my life. It was so hard to share my slice of cake because I just wanted it all to myself. The cake itself is airy and creamy and the crust is just the right thickness with a hint of sweetness and crumbliness to round out the whole cheesecake package. 

I have been promoting this amongst my friend group. Hope to get more cake soon
author: Julia T.

description:
This place is the great! Cash only! They also have hours that work for them not you! My kinda place! Call before to make sure they are open and also show up early they sell out daily! 

The consistency of the cheesecakes are like a fine moose. They have an unforgettable taste and you will question what additive substance they have inside them. This is one you need to be careful with you might try to eat the whole thing in one sitting. 

They hold up well in a fridge and they also provide freezing instructions for those of us who like to buy in bulk!
author: Sean G.

description:
This is not your average, heavy, thick cheesecake you can only eat a very small slice of, this cheesecake is light and fluffy, not too sweet and good enough to eat the whole damn thing without sharing....at least for me, one who doesn't share desserts or french fries.
Sam is the nicest gentleman you'll ever meet. Part of the experience of Zanze's is having Sam wait on you.  I used to own a business on the same street and would stop to see him often. He is always cheerful and friendly and has been at this location for decades. 
The shop is very small and pleasant, but this is all you need to pick up the best cheesecake you'll ever eat.
This cheesecake is like no other, which is why you should try it at least once and you will find yourself in a new cheesecake heaven.
author: Kanika J.

description:
Fluffy. Amazing. Cheesecake.

Come early or order ahead because they sell out fast. Also don't make the same mistake as me and bring cash/checks! They don't accept credit card.
author: Kimberly H.

description:
THIS.IS.SUPERB!! 

If you are like me, who doesn't like the traditional cheese cake because of its heaviness, you should definitely give Zanze's Cheesecake a spin. Zanze's offers European-style cheesecake, which is more like a soft-airy cake in texture and very light. Also love that these are not overly sweet, but enough of that creamy-cheesy taste to keep me wanting more. Pricing is a tad pricey with $16 for small (personally I could devour this all myself :P), but so worth it! Hands down one of the most scrumptious cheesecake around and a great place to indulge your sweet tooth cravings. 

Can't wait to try more of their creations!
author: Veronica C.

description:
I've had a change of heart after having another slice. As mention in my previous review I prefer my cheesecake a little dense like the New York style. I realized that after chilling it for a while in the fridge. It gave it the nice creamy and not too dense texture that I love so much. The only reason why this is not a 5 star is because I love crust and this didn't really have any but aside from that this is a fantastic cheesecake and one that I will for sure come back to.

This time I'll be sure to pre-order a day before those flavored ones.
author: Andrew T.

description:
Sam's the man!  I don't recall if we've ever met (maybe when I was a kid?), but I always look forward to his gentle smile eminating from the back.  Front of the house service is always pleasant.  

Excellent quality and care seem to go into each and every cheesecake we've picked up from here, year after year, decade after decade.  The simple beauty of the cheesecakes is almost as good as the taste and ethereal texture!  

Thank you to Team Zanze's for being a part our countless celebrations through years passed, and years to come!!
author: Jamie S.

description:
Have you ever had a cheesecake literally melt in your mouth? I haven't until I found Zanze's! Super fluffy, light, and creamy all at the same time. 

I ordered a medium ($25) which was plenty for 10+ slices. If you don't plan on eating it the same day, I do suggest on freezing it, but do thaw it a couple hours before serving! I thawed mine too late and my guests had to adjust to the stiffness - the string also struggled with slicing. Waited another hour; however, and that cheesecake was fluffy AF! 

**CALL IN FOR A PRE-ORDER! They tend to sell out and CASH ONLY!**

*ONLY OPEN WEDNESDAY-SATURDAY* I needed my cake on Tuesday, so I pre-ordered and picked it up on the previous Saturday. Only downfall about this place is that they're closed practically half of the week, but for some affordable and light cheesecake, this would have to suffice.
author: Jana V.

description:
Meant to review this place years ago.  Absolute BEST cheesecake ever in life.  Remember:  Order ahead!  This place is very popular and is only open a few days a week.  

The owner/ baker is a sweet old man.  I sure hope he passes on this recipe to his loved ones so they can keep this business going for years to come! My favorite is the original.  Very fluffy and creamy.  

I really don't understand folks who rated this place 1 star for selling out of cheesecakes early.  Snooze you lose!
author: Ana Marie L.

description: I was able to get a Large Plain German style cheesecake for a work event. Everyone who had never had this experience was so impressed with the fluffy light delicacy. This is cheesecake like no other. I feel so lucky to have been able to walk in and get a cake on a Wednesday. The very next Saturday as I'm walking by, the line is around the block. (Father's day weekend). Order ahead to assure your treat.
author: D T.

description:
I hate cheesecakes but I love Zanze's. It's not your typical cheesecake. It's soft, smooth, not too sweet or rich, and not made from a chain restaurant Factory. 

I bought one recently for my parents to try and they are already asking me to get more!

Must try in San Francisco!
author: Gordon L.

description:
Love Zanze's still. Make sure you call ahead to see if they are open!  CASH ONLY!

I like lists what can I say? 

When I look at reviews sometimes just want to know where to go or how a user compares one venue against another to see if we have similar tastes. 

Here is a look at how I rank the SF Bakeries I've visited and I indicated what they're known for or a dish I recommend:

Rod's SF Bakery rankings (and what they're known for or what I like). ?) Follow my profile to see my most recent reviews I hope I can be helpful since so many Yelpers have helped me discover new places. 
1 Neighbor Bakehouse=cinammon almond bostock
2 B Patisserie=Choco Bannana croissant
3 Zanze's Cheesecake=Regular cheesecake
4 Ariscault =Croissant
5 Yasukochis=Coffee Crunch Cake
6 Chili Pies Baking Co=Pies
7 Dynamo Donuts=donuts
8 Golden Gate Bakery=Egg tart
9 Mr Holmes Bakehouse=Green tea croissant ,Cruffin, 
10 La Luna Cupcakes=cupcakes
11 Three Babes Bakeshop=pies
12 Anthony's Cookies=Cookies
13 New Hollywood Bakery=Egg tart
14 Dianda's Italian American Pastry=Napoleon , Cannoli
15 Mission Pies=Banana Cream Pie
16 Schubert=Swedish Princess cake
17 Yummy Bakery=egg tarts
18 Stella Pastry & Café=Cannoli , Tiramisu
19 Craftsman & Wolves=Rebel within
20 Bob's Donut & Pastry Shop=any donut 
21 Noe Valley Bakery=dipped cupcake
22 Café Greco=Cannoli 
23 Kings Bakery=Tres leches cake
24 Benkyodo Co=mochi
25 Cupcake cove=cupcakes
26 Cups and Cakes Bakery=cupcakes
27 Good Mong Kok Bakery=dim sum
28 Karas cupcake=cupcakes
29 Mission Minis=cupcakes
30 Sift Dessert=cupcakes
31 Tartine Bakery=lemon tart
32 Jane The Bakery=matcha twist , cardamom Lattice Bun
33 Café Madeline=various goods
34 Panaderia La Mexicana=mexican sweet bread
35 Hot cookie=Cookies
36 Les Gourmands Bakery=Croissant
37 Mee Mee Bakery=Cow ears
author: Rod M.

description: Melt in your mouth cheesecake! Only original flavor unless you call in 24 hours ahead. Definitely will be back.
author: Pete N.

description:
Bought the pumpkin and original flavors for thanksgiving. Call me a purist, but I like my cheesecake dense and hearty. This cake feels light and airy as the other reviewers have noted. It has a consistency like whipped cream cheese smear on a bagel. 

They also provide wire on the box for slicing. I thought it was just for decoration at first. Glad I tried it but I think I prefer NY style over this "Japanese?" Style cheesecake.
author: William V.

description:
Sooo good, light & fluffy!! I do not like cheesecakes but I can gobble up an entire Zanze's Cheesecake within an hour!! 

I attended a potluck party for a women's meet-up & one of the participants got it for us..I initially hesitated (as I don't like cheesecake) but after trying a spoon, I went back to it again & again..Very delicious!!
author: Lna A.

description:
Accessibility (Parking / Wait Time)

1/1 Star: easy street parking. No wait.

_____

Service (Waiter / Cleanness / Ambiance)

1/1 Star: clean. Smells great inside. The old couple that works there are very nice and sweet. If you tell them your cheesecake is for a birthday they will too it off with a small piece of happy birthday chocolate.

_____

Taste (0=Not Edible / 1=Edible / 2=Good (average) / 3=Must Try!)

3/3 Stars: The cheesecake is a must try! It's going to be the softest most fluffy cheesecake you've ever had! It's so soft that you need to cut it with the provided fishing line string. If you use a knife, you'll smash and flatten the fluffy cake.  It's very light and airrie.

_____

Overall Experience

5/5 Stars 

_____

Last Words
If you know you're going to be buying a cheesecake a few days ahead of time, I highly suggest you call in and reserve it.  They often sell out of cakes before the end of business hours but will stay open for people to pick up their orders.
author: Elliott N.

description:
"It's so fluffy!!!!" - Agnes from Despicable Me.

She wasn't talking about that fluffy unicorn...she was referencing Zanze's Cheesecake. A slice of cheesecake here will change your perspective on all future cheesecakes you consume. It's so light, fluffy, and it just kinda melts in your mouth. I love the fact that the cake does not have the traditional hefty crust but, instead, has a light topping. 

All the cakes here are made fresh and the staff are incredibly friendly and helpful. If it's your first time trying this place out, they highly recommend you try the plain cheesecake before trying out the different fruit/chocolate toppings! 

PROTIP: if you're planning to buy a cheesecake during any holiday, make sure to call a week or two ahead to reserve one because they often sell-out regularly.
author: Andrea K.

description: Amazing cheese cakes ! Check their hours and preferably reserving one if you really want to eat one! They sold out quick daily and it's definitely worth it! Whole family loves it!
author: Precious K.

description: My sister in law has been a big huge fan of their cheese cake and I became one as soon as she bought my family one. I never really like cheesecakes for the deadly sweetness and sometimes the heavy milk/cheese taste. Their cheesecake is not only gentle to your taste buds its texture is amazing the cake melts right there in your mouth. I was on waiting list today and luckily I got one for my friend as our Xmas eve desert and they LOVED it!!!!!! Every single one of my friends loved their cake. It's not ordinary cheesecakes.... You have to.... MUST try it!!!!
author: Jocelyn S.

description: Indescribably delicious light not-too-sweet cheesecake you have ever wrapped your lips around!  I cannot show you a photo of our exquisite raspberry topped large cheesecake because once it was cut (by the provided plastic fishing line-thank you), it magically disappeared!  I am not a great writer & am bereft of proper words to describe this piece of eatable artwork!  But don't take my word for it--find this tiny shop on Ocean, find a parking spot, bring a cash or check, and leave your preconceptions behind!  No dense cheesecake here!  No graham cracker crust!  This is NOT your NY style cheesecake!  Truly a San Franciscan treat!
author: Molly M.

description:
Best cheesecake I've had!! It's light, fluffy, and it doesn't have a heavy feel to it like with NY style cheesecakes. 

Make sure you call in ahead of time to reserve your cheesecake. Don't count on dropping in for a cheesecake. They're likely to be out! 

Pro tip: Put left over cheesecake in the freezer. It  tastes even better frozen!
author: Sophia G.

description:
For anyone who knows me, they know I'm not a fan of cheese and I can never eat more than two bites of cheesecake because it's so heavy and dense. Well, I've finally found a place where I can have a whole slice and finish it, all in one sitting! If you're like me and don't like cheesecake (or cheese), I highly recommend this place because it's one of a kind :)

My cousin bought a large traditional cheesecake for a family gathering and I was hooked ever since. Similar to what others have said, it really is fluffy, light, and creamy. On my sister's graduation day, my boyfriend went and brought one up to Sacramento for us. He told us that the kind lady advised him on how to cut it (using the fishing wire) and she also wrapped it with plastic wrap. I called ahead to order for a next day pick up and the lady who picked up said they are able to do that. When he arrived, he was able to purchase another small traditional cheesecake for his sister's birthday, so he walked out with two cheesecakes! 

I purchased another one on a Saturday and I called Friday afternoon to see if they are able to do so and the lady said they are. I'm not sure if we're just lucky or what, but the past two times we're been, we were always able to pick up another cake or pay for a size bigger! Anywho, this place has the best cheesecake and the graham crackers on top are the best! Sometimes, I even eat that part from my boyfriend's slice ;)

Just a few things to keep in mind:
**Always call ahead to order
**CASH ONLY
**Traditional cheesecake prices: $16/S, $25/M, $32/L
*There's meter and street parking available
author: Vicky L.

description: Great cheesecake, different from what I was used to. Pretty expensive, but all worth to support a local mom and pop shop. Sam and his family that run the shop are great, very nice. I love the novelty of cutting the cake with a fishing wire.
author: Eva C.

description: The lightest cheesecake you will ever experience! My family and I come to Zanze's on special occasions to pick up 2-3 cheesecakes since everyone loves this dessert and always wants seconds. I suggest calling in an order before picking one up so you are guaranteed a cheesecake. If not, then you wait in line and hope that they don't run out. They close their store once they've sold out for the day. On Thanksgiving and Christmas, you have to call in an order at least 2 weeks in advance because they sell out fast during these holidays. All the staff are super friendly and patient. Sometimes you can see the owner making the cheesecake in the back. I don't know how it keeps doing it! :) This is a must try dessert place, just make sure the plan ahead.
author: Jessica Y.

description: Before 2pm on a Wednesday and it is sold out even though the hours state they are open to 6pm? What a poor business model. I can't stand snobby businesses who have arbitrary availability and hours just because they are popular.
author: Andy N.

description:
You've heard correctly - hands down the best cheesecake in San Francisco!!!

Originally came here during Thanksgiving week but realized they were only serving those that preordered the week prior... Bummer. Yelpers - be prepared to preorder before the holidays or you'll be missing out!

My mom finally got her hands on a cheesecake the first day they reopened after Thanksgiving (Wed. Nov 30)! $16 for a small - I thought "wow, what the... so pricey" but it is definitely worth it! The smell is very light but delicious and that's exactly how it tastes! It's a bit dangerous because I feel like I can eat almost a whole small one myself! =P the texture is so creamy and melts in your mouth - you'll be grabbing your second slice in seconds!

Props to the owner who has a passion for making these delicious cheesecakes that creates smiles and happy tummies :')

Street parking is available. I would recommend driving with someone to help pick up the order because they work inside quick to pass your cheesecake and collect $! Oh yeah - don't forget it is cash only! Enjoy!
author: Nicole C.

description: Best. Cheesecake. Ever. EVER!!! Birthdays, holidays, any special occasion is a good excuse to have this piece of heaven. Tbh, we've even gotten an extra small original because we knew we would crave some the day after our event. That is how amazing this cake. Not too sweet, super fluffy, just perfect. Thank you Zanze's team!!
author: Jenny K.

description: Omg!. I love this fluffy, mouth melting cheese cake.  I would advise people to come early because the can sell out fast.
author: John X.

description:
Every time I come home or celebrate any holiday, my mom buys me a cheesecake from Zanzie's. Hands down the BEST cheesecake ever. This was my first time trying their pumpkin cheesecake (for Thanksgiving holiday) and it is now my new favorite flavor. The cheesecake is extremely fluffy and melts in your mouth. I had to order them a month in advance, since they sell out quickly. Already their cheesecake is sold out for the next two months. 

I've given these cheesecakes as presents and people love them. If you're gifting them and bringing it onboard an airplane, let them know and they'll pack it airtight and designed for flight. 

The shop is really tiny and a little hard to find but definitely one of the hidden gems in San Francisco. I will be going back for many more years and recommend everyone to try it.
author: Melinda L.

description:
Ordered a MEDIUM original cheesecake for $25! Can definitely feed around 12 people! 

Very light and fluffy cheesecake ! One of the better cheesecakes that I've tried thus far in my life! I love cheesecake and I'll definitely come back to try the other ones! I'm telling you guys that it is really really good!
author: Shirley G.

description:
Had a wonderful experience purchasing their cheesecake.

First, tried this at a friends house in Santa Clara. Then, not knowing. My cousin have tried this a few years ago. So now, our feet led us here today.

Happiness found! I'm glad to have one today.
author: Jeyem V.

description:
Every time I need to impress someone, I bring them a cheesecake from Zanze's. The first time my then girlfriend (now wife) met my parents in New Jersey, she brought a Zanze's cheesecake on the plane across country. Obviously my parents love her.

That's how good this cheesecake is. When a relationship is on the line, we turn to the cheesecake.
author: Ian W.

description:
I've heard about Zanze's for a while but never got to try it. Finally, the husband and I hosted a dinner party recently with the cheesecake as the star of the night, and everyone gave raving reviews. It is the fluffiest western style cheesecake I've ever tried (not to be confused with the Japanese style cheesecakes).

Be sure to order ahead of time or call right when they open to reserve an original cake. Their store hours are sometimes irregular (winter breaks, random midweek breaks...etc), so plan ahead or definitely call before you go.

CASH ONLY!
author: Melody C.

description: How have I not written a review??? Simply put, Zanze's is part of our family tradition. Birthdays, get-togethers... whatever it is, you'll likely find a Zanze's cheesecake there. I even thought about ordering it for our small wedding banquet but decided I didn't want the wait staff to butcher it. I couldn't really expect them to respect the fishing wire, could I? Anyway, I selfishly wish they weren't so popular so it would be easier to buy the cheesecake but I am really happy for this family. Thank you guys for your gift to the community!
author: Alice C.

description:
This is probably my favorite cheesecake I've ever had. 

It is soft, light and fluffy ! 

It is well worth the wait for these hand crafted delights. 

I recommend trying one of each of you get a chance. 

I picked up a original small on my first visit and it was great to share with 3 others. The cheesecake is not heavy and has just the right amount of sweetness.

I am excited for my next order - the chocolate and raspberry later this month !
author: Kirpa W.

description:
Someone told me about 6 years ago that there is one of the best cheesecake store on Ocean but never told me the name but 6 years later I've finally found it!

Ugh, I can't explain my love for cheesecake, it's one of my guilty pleasures.

I walked in after promising myself that I'd buy the smallest cake there but I walked out with the largest cake. lol I spent $32 on a large cheesecake but no regrets because life is too short to not enjoy it. 

I took a first bite right when I got home, and I knew instantly that I was going to be coming here often. It was the most fluffiest, and the richest cheesecake I have ever tasted. When it was kept in room temperature, it was so fluffy that i felt like I was eating whipped-cream. When you eat it refrigerated, it was more solid.

I personally liked it when it was cold because when it was kept in the room temperature, it tasted a lot more creamy and rich. 

I have no regret in finishing the whole cake by myself in 3 days (well, I did share a few bites with family members but they aren't a big fan of cheesecake) and will I do it again? Probably yes!
author: Elaine C.

description:
I've been coming here for years!  Their cheesecake is always consistent, light and fluffy, full over flavor that just melts in your mouth. Order ahead, they provide a fresh product, not sitting in the freezer getting old. I for one am happy that they run out,  because of that reason,  I'm always getting something fresh. 

Please bring back the mocha cheesecake!
author: Bonjing B.

description: I can never eat cheesecake from the Cheesecake Factory anymore after having a slice of this fluffy piece of heaven. What I love the most is that it's not an overwhelming sweet like the Cheesecake Factory. I can have so many slices of Zanze's because it's the most delicate and fluffy cake that literally melts in your mouth. And this is coming from someone who doesn't have a sweet tooth
author: Charissa S.

description:
***queue Fred Astaire and Leo Reissman***

"Heaven, I'm in heaven, 
And my heart beats so that I can hardly speak
And I seem to find the happiness I seek
When we're out together dancing, cheek to cheek"

That's how I feel when I eat a cheesecake from Zanze's. If the texture weren't similar to, what I can only describe as light, fluffy puffs of clouds that I imagine Cherubs sleep on, I'd forgo the fork, grab a slice with my hand, and it like an apple or a cookie. 

If it weren't for the traditional and distinct slight cream cheese-y taste, I wouldn't know what I would be taking a bite of. It's so light, delicate and airy, yet with a mild hint of sweetness and a soft hint of tartness. It's pretty much what I imagine cheesecake brought down from heaven to taste like.
author: Lainey C.

description: Absolutely delish!!! Why is it so fluffy & soft... so. so perfect!! Cheesecake you're so good!!
author: Lizzel D.

description:
Preordered two large traditional cheesecakes for my best friend's surprise graduation party and she was literally in tears when she saw them. Zanze's is her favorite cheesecake but she rarely has time to go out there and pick some up.

Cheesecakes sell out VERY QUICKLY, so I'd definitely recommend preordering if you have an event. The staff were also so nice when I placed AND picked up my order. So I definitely appreciated how easy the entire process was.

I actually had a slice for the first time the day of the party, and now I can see why my best friend loves this cheesecake so much. Not to mention, my boyfriend also loves cheesecake and I had to fight him from eating it all during the party, haha!
author: Michelle D.

description: I didn't know about this place before. I usually don't buy bakery in the store (l prefer to cook myself). I was surprised (a lot of people are visiting this place) !!! Delicious cheesecakes !!!! Fresh and creamy. Their cake are not too sweat. I advice you to check their working hours because a lot for people can be here. Their cakes are sold out very fast. No credit card, only cash.
author: Alex T.

description:
If you search for the best cheesecake on Yelp, you'll probably end up here like I did. I wanted to get something special for my roomie's birthday, and wasn't just gonna half ass it with a grocery store cake. 

I called a week in advance to reserve an original cheesecake, which is a good idea on a Saturday because they do sell out. When I arrived at 9:45 AM, there was already someone in line. By the time the doors opened at 10, there were ~8 people waiting behind me. I was really surprised to see that this little bakery in an obscure part of town would be so popular, but after tasting the cake, I totally get it. 

The owner gave detailed instructions on how to slice the cake with the fishing line they provide. I was nervous about messing it up, but it sliced right through like butter. It's so light and fluffy that it feels as if you're eating air, except it isn't zero calories. 

My roommates all loved it, and I'd say it's worth the trip out here.
author: Karen S.

description:
Super light and fluffy! I can eat multiple slices in one sitting. They sell out really early. I recommend you calling in to place an order. I came here around noon on a Saturday to pick up my order and they already had a sign on the door "Sold Out".

I've tried the original and raspberry. I like the raspberry one more than the original. For the raspberries and blueberries cheesecake, they pour on the toppings when you get there.

They have the pumpkin spice flavor for thanksgiving until Christmas Eve. I didn't get to try it but will go back this year.
author: Ivy L.

description:
Hands down the best cheesecake in town

Light and airy (like eating a cloud) 
Rich yet delicate 
Balanced in sweetness 
Reasonable pricing
Great as a birthday cake alternative or any celebration for that matter
Seasonal fruit topping or chocolate shavings are also an option

Overall Thoughts 

A heavenly bite of cheesecake
author: Eddie W.

description:
It was ok. Decided to pick up a special Pumpkin Cheese cake for a dinner party as I was in charge of dessert.
I thought it would be nice to treat my friends to a "fancy, well known, delicious" cheesecake that everyone has been raving about. 
Ok - I get it, it's soft. But I've had softer and creamier. I ordered 1 day in advance to pick up the next day. They sell out, so call ahead. I waited about 20mins in line for my pre-order cheesecake. 
Very nice lady who took my order and serviced me.

$18 for a small that fed 8 adults (barely)

I probably would not go out of my way to get this cheese cake again.
author: PreciousSwt P.

description: Probably the best cheesecake I've ever had... Paired it with some wine, delish.  Have to come early, it's a first come first serve type of moms and pops store.  Cannot buy by the slice but by the pie.... comes in a few sizes.
author: BENADICK F.

description:
I do like cheesecake, few friends stated this spot would be a place I may like, it is close to the area so figured why not try it out, called in on a random day, closed, called again 2 days later closed, checked he website, it stated to open again by February, odd, waited and called again on the day supposedly it was to be open, I spoke with a man, he was very friendly, told him this is my first Zanze's cheesecake is there one you recommend? He stated have our original first, after you have our original you can sample what else we can make.

I requested for a small original cheesecake and when on the phone with the man it seemed like they were already out, I called at 11am on the dot, so it seems this places cheesecakes are a hot commodity, he checked and double checked and said I have a few left so we will put you down for one.

Before coming here I had a few folks that have tried their share of cheesecakes in several places, allot of the feed back was 50/50 some really liked it others were just like ehhh it's like a frozen cheesecake but better???? They all agreed in regards to the preparation and how the cake is cut is different.

So let me describe the taste as opposed to your store bought frozen variety. So if you have ever had the store bought Lucky's or Safeway, you get that thick heavy taste of semi thick cheese and super chewy cake taste that is semi sweet. Or if you go to cheesecake factory it is slightly better where you don't get the semi hard crust of older cheesecake that has been sitting in a freezer for several weeks, again softer but taste wise same, semi sweet but thick is taste when biting down.  Zanze's verision is very different, airy, light, delicious, sweet but not too sweet, if your using a string to cut a cheesecake that is impressive on its own.

I do recommend a sample of this cheesecake shop, it is very different from most spots, fresh made daily, place an order thru the phone and pick up is a recommendation, if you just show up, they may not have any in stock, oh also cash only folks and these cakes are pricey but tasting it is well justified, I will be back for another type of cheesecake next time

cheesecake ***** wow
price $$$
service ***** they tell you how to cut this cheesecake, mind blown hahaha
ambiance *** small shop, small front area, two people that I saw run the show two elderly folks, both are very nice and take pride in their product
author: Clarence A.

description:
MAKE SURE TO CALL AHEAD TO ORDER! 

This place is really popular so I ordered over the phone at 11:30 on a Friday morning to reserve a small original cheesecake. By the time I got there at around 2pm, all their cheesecakes were already sold out and the staff here just wait for customers to pickup their cheesecakes until 6pm. The staff here is super friendly and nice to talk to. If you are a first-time customer, they also tell you how exactly to cut the cheesecake with the fishing line. 

The small original cheesecake was very light and fluffy indeed. It is 6 inches and can cut 6-8 pieces which is perfect for 2-3 people to share! The medium is a bit bigger at 8 inches and can serve 10-12 slices. I ate the cheesecake the day after I bought it and it was still very good indeed. You can also request a little happy birthday sign which is edible! This cheesecake definitely reminds me of the Japanese-style cheesecake. I wish the cheesecakes here were a bit cheaper so I could buy them more often.
author: Catherine S.

description:
I spent hours looking through Yelp last year, trying to find something more personal than the usual cake for my boyfriends birthday. What better than his favorite dessert, cheesecake. Thank goodness for Yelp leading me to Zanzes! 

We both fell in love and had to continue the tradition of a birthday cheesecake this year :)

For a small original cheesecake it is $16. I will say, it is well worth your $16! Of course if you can, get the next size up, sharing the bliss is caring. We both have family that are selective about their desserts, everyone loved it! 

The beauty of this cheesecake is alluring to the eye with its simplicity. There's more to it when your senses are engaged in the feather like exposure of its perfection. There is no overwhelming heavy cheesecake here that lingers around unwanted.  It's sweet in the most gentle way.

I recommend this place, especially if your willing to try something new. 

I do suggest calling in advance to have one reserved, they can sell out! They also do kindly include fishing line to cut the cheesecake, we found it best to use a plain ol knife.
author: Suzette C.

description:
Love love love their cheesecakes! The owner is very nice and friendly, as well as the workers.

I like to get their pumpkin cheesecakes for the holidays: Thanksgiving and Christmas. But you MUST preorder ahead of time like a month or so before the holidays. On those holidays, they let customers who preordered pick up the cheesecakes. If you show up on those holidays without preordering, don't waste your time waiting in line unless you are willing to show up near the end of the day to see if they got any extras to sell. 

If you are not a pumpkin kind of person, don't worry! Their traditional cheesecake is also the best one to get! Recently, I've tried their cherry cheesecake and it was yum! Maybe because the cherries were soaked in alcohol. You can even smell  it! :D
author: Jessie B.

description:
Zanze's is probably one of the only life-changing cheesecakes I've had the pleasure of devouring in my short-lived life so far.

I grew up near this well-established neighborhood bakery, but didn't become a customer until this past weekend. I placed my order via phone 2 weeks in advance for two cheesecakes  - I am very glad I pre-ordered, since they were sold out within 45 minutes of opening the day before Mother's Day!

THE OVERVIEW.
+ The best, lightest cheesecake you'll ever have (German style!)
+ Their cheesecake sizes actually make sense (a small is perfect for 4-6 people, a medium for 6-8, etc)
+ They're extremely specialized and ONLY sell cheesecakes (with a few toppings that vary seasonally)
+ Cash only (starting at ~$18 for a small)
+ Their cheesecakes are sold (frozen) at the old Tower Market in case you need your fix when they're closed

You either come here because of word-of-mouth, or you made a very happy turn on your way down Ocean Avenue. Do yourself a favor, and pick up one of their heavenly cheesecakes soon!


EDIT: What grinds my gears is nearly every single bad review for Zanze's is from people wailing that this isn't "New York style" cheesecake. That's more of a 'you' problem, and not a 'them' problem - you don't go into a Japanese bakery and get mad that they don't have Russian tea cakes, do you? NY and German style cheesecake are completely different, stop trying to compare two separate things!
author: Claire S.

description: Hands down the best cheesecake in town! Light, airy and fluffy not your average cheesecake. It is not too sweet and not too heavy, which makes it almost impossible to have just one slice. The owners are friendly and sweet. They don't sell slices, only whole cakes, but let's be real, you wouldn't be able to have just one slice anyway. They also don't take credit cards.
author: Diana K.

description: Blame on myself for not ordering 2 - 3 weeks in advance before Holiday Rush...now I am only looking at delicious Zanze cheesecake pictures in Yelp. Next opportunity will be in January 2018 once they return from year end Vacation.
author: Hendra W.

description:
What an absurd business-- constantly out of stock, and no concern for customer service.  If you can't manage inventory or communicate with your customers (e.g. answer your phone or maintain a social media page to let customers know you're sold out or are closed because you're on vacation), maybe you shouldn't even bother having a storefront in the first place.

After three failed attempts to exchange money for cheesecake, I've vowed to never give this business another chance.
author: John M.

description:
If, like me, you've always found cheesecakes to be much too heavy in a cloying sort of way, then prepare to have your preconceptions blown away by the truly heavenly stuff that Zanze's makes. 

"Heavenly," in fact, doesn't even begin to describe how light, soft, and mousse-like these cheesecakes are. As most everyone has noted here, you cut the cake with a thread of fishing line that comes along with the takeaway box. The consistency of it all is truly airy, for lack of a better word. What's more, the cakes can last a long time if you freeze them right away, per the directions that they come along with.

Make sure to call ahead with a reservation, especially before busy holiday periods. Otherwise, get in line before the shop opens, and be prepared to accept whatever they have in stock. Highly recommended for a special occasion or celebration.
author: Vincent L.

description: Have not visited Zanze's for over 10 years. Decided to make the 1.5 hour drive up to it last Saturday. The cakes are still so delicious and dreamy! Stay true Zanze's!
author: Johnson W.

description:
Perhaps it was the numerous reviews that describe how deliciously delicate this cheesecake is or the intrigue of wanting to experience cutting a cheesecake using a fishing wire or the challenge of getting my hands on a cheesecake that I kept trying even after 3-4 unsuccessful attempts. What makes it difficult to get Zanze's cheesecake is a combination of the limited opening hours (Closed: Sun - Tues) and limited cheesecake supply. 

I tried a number of times on Saturdays but had no luck.. once because it was graduation weekend so they only took pre-orders, another instance I called beforehand and the lady said they had 4 small cheesecakes left but by the time I arrived 15min later, there was a "Sold Out" sign posted on the door. This was at noon on a Saturday.. just 2hrs after they opened! I guess they close shop early even though their Saturday hours are 10am - 4pm.

After the 4th try, it was finally success! I called on a Wednesday right when they opened and asked that they hold one of the cheesecakes for me. The lady took down my name and reminded me it was cash only. I parked in one of the meters, ran into the store, and was elated that there was a beautiful cheesecake waiting for me. She quickly went over the details of how to properly slice the cheesecake using the fishing wire (1. hold the fishing wire taut with each end looped around your index finger and slice the cheesecake with one swift downward motion; 2. Release one end of the fishing wire and use the other end to pull the fishing wire through). Apparently it is such a delicate cheesecake that knife will ruin it.

The cheesecake itself is very light, fluffy, and delicate. While it is a good cheesecake, I prefer the more denser versions of cheesecake.

A few tips if you're trying to get your hands on one of Zanze's cheesecakes:
- Opt for weekday if possible (Wed - Fri 11am - 6pm or when they run out)
- If on a Saturday, either call ahead during the week to pre-order or call early and ask that they hold one of the cheesecakes for you (only works if you are planning on getting there right away)
- Meter parking is not too difficult to find
- Cash only
author: Ruby C.

description: omg!! their cheesecakes are amazing and so moist. i dont know what i have been missing all these years. they are really fluffy and flavorful. will definitely have to come back again to try a different flavor.
author: Bonnie C.

description: Ordered a small cheesecake to pick up. Hadn't had Zanze's in years....YES it is super light and fluffy however as a few others stated,  if you prefer the classic dense New York style cheesecake,  you may be disappointed as this is not that kind.  At first few bites, it seemed all nice fluffy and very lightly sweet... then as it gets more room temp, the texture just feels like a mass of whipped cream.  From reading the rave reviews,  if you like almost a whipped creamy dessert that only holds structure being very cold/refrigerated,  you may love this type.... however if you prefer the classic dense cheesecake, as mentioned- you may be disappointed. Zanze's is good but it is a specific kind of cheesecake that may not be for everyone. It had been years since I had it and now I remember why there may not have been a drive to go back. Just needed a reminder I guess.
author: Lucky P.

description:
I've been fortunate enough to call Zanze's my neighborhood cheesecake shop ever since I was a kid. I would walk by the glass shop windows, stacked with white boxes, on my way home from school everyday. Special occasions would often warrant one of these treats, where I would find one nestled in the fridge just waiting to be opened for dessert. When I got older, I soon came to realize that I had been spoiled with such a lovely bakery nearby that was not just my neighborhood cheesecake shop, but the best cheesecake shop in the city!

The cheesecakes are light and fluffy, but still silky and creamy. They're reminiscent of Japanese cotton cheesecakes, but are moister in texture. Only the original cheesecakes come with a graham crumb topping. The other cheesecakes are topped with fruit compote/whipped cream, or chocolate shavings, and do not have crusts. The only downside to one of these treats is you'll literally want to eat half the cheesecake. I can never resist seconds!

Call ahead of time if you need the cheesecake for a special occasion as they often sell out by the end of the day (especially on Fridays and Saturdays). Also, make sure you follow their advice to cut the cake with the provided fishing line or your cheesecake will run the risk of collapsing in some areas! 

These cheesecakes are nothing like The Cheesecake Factory, so if you're looking for a creamy, dense, and sweet cheesecake, this is not it. Zanze's is old-school. They let the cheesecake shine without any frills. They just add some amazing texture, but in the end, their cheesecakes are simple. And sometimes, simple is perfect.
author: Deanna Y.

description: Amazing cheesecake! So fluffy and creamy and firm and light and airy all at the same time. You should call to order in advance. We got there at 11am on a Saturday and they were already sold out.
author: Kelly H.

description:
Once I brought a pretty large piece of Zanze's cheesecake to my coworker for her to try. 
Her: I was only going to have a few bites and save the rest, but I finished it already. Where did you get it? I'm going to buy one myself!

Zanze's has the best cheesecake ever. I rarely ever speak in hyperbole. I also rarely ever like cheesecake. I'm all too familiar with the New York style cheesecakes that are too dense and heavy for my liking, but I've smiled and tolerated it every time somebody served one of those blocks of cream cheese pies with the texture of cold butter. 

Mr. Zanze, the sweet, kind, lovable baker, has been making these amazing cheesecakes since the 1970s. He takes after his father, who was also a baker and experimented with the cheesecake recipe to get it just right. Since then, Zanze surely has perfected this European-style cheesecake. 

Once I tasted it, I did a quick internet search to see what other cheesecake styles out there exist. Turns out there are way more than I can consume in a lifetime. I'll just stick to what I know and love... 

This cheesecake is so light, delicate, mousse-y, and souffle-like. Topped with graham cracker crumbs and powdered sugar, it is perfect. I've never tried different toppings, because the plain one is just too delicious. I could eat an entire cheesecake by myself.
If anyone needs an example of 'light as air,' this cheesecake is it. 

Each box comes with a little bit of rolled up fishing line for slicing purposes. That shows just how light it is. They do patiently explain to you how to cut your cake...
1. Pull fishing line taut.
2. Place fishing line over cake, pressing down to the table.
3. Pull fishing line across table and out of the cake. Do not lift fishing line up and out.

Apparently you can freeze these cheesecakes for up to three months too.

Another plus? They're affordable!
Small: $16
Medium: $24
Large: $32
At these prices, it's a great option to bring to family dinners or get-togethers while still spending less than most cakes.

I ordinarily am annoyed with cash-only establishments, but I don't mind it when it comes to Zanze's Cheesecake. 
Getting a cheesecake does require some planning, because they're only open Wed - Sat and close pretty early. Sometimes they run out, but you can order in advance.

I've heard that Mr. Zanze does not want to retire because he's devoted to his craft and loves connecting with his customers through his cheesecake. I don't know what I would do if he ever did retire.
author: Joy W.

description: Very soft cheesecake, the staffs are polite and awesome. Now, it's my favorite place to bring their cheese cake as gift to others. Love it.
author: Min-cheng H.

description:
Cheesecake isn't my thing. This probably shouldn't be mentioned but the last time I had a stomach flu, cheesecake was the last thing I ate and so my memory of cheesecakes were forever scarred from that moment on.

However, that did not stop my dad from buying cheesecakes from Zanze's now and then. It wasn't to torture me by any means, my dad simply has a love for their cheesecakes and who am I to deny him that simple pleasure of life?

My dad brought home a regular cheesecake for us before. He got the smallest size they had because my family doesn't eat much and one hour into having it in our home, I mustered up the courage to take a bite. After all, if this cheesecake came with a wire to cut it then I have to give it a go.

It was bomb. Zanze's cheesecake was light and fluffy and it was just delightful. Gone was that horrible memory of the stomach flu and in came the memory of this airy cheesecake. I know this is weird, but honestly Zanze made me love cheesecake a bit which I would've probably never said if you asked me this a year ago. 

Overall, I would probably send my dad back to get a cheesecake for me. If he hasn't already. Hehe.
author: Venus L.

description:
In a span of about 3 months, we got about 8 cakes from Zanze for birthdays and special events. They have one of the best cheese cakes I ever had. 

If you want to get a cake, make sure to get there early. They run out pretty fast.
author: Mali E.

description: How am I just now discovering Zanze's Cheesecake?? Why hasn't it been in my mouth before? I am truly upset that I'm just now experiencing this cheesecake. Pissed. Irate. Honestly, I'm a little hurt. What kind of friends do I have that let me life go on for so long without this luscious amazing cheesecake? None. I have no friends. I only have Zanze's Cheesecake now and that's just fine!
author: Amber F.

description:
Love Zanze's cheesecakes! They're light, creamy, delicious -- just so good. 

Zanze's has a variety of sizes and flavors for their cheesecakes, but I've only had the original. If you want to purchase a cheesecake, I recommend you go early when they open, as they often sell out quickly and close shop once they sell out. I've made more than 1 trip here only to find them all gone. You can also call ahead to order a cheesecake and arrange a pick-up day and time. If you're traveling with your cheesecake (i.e., buying it here to bring somewhere else), you can communicate that, and Zanze's will package your cheesecake for travel (didn't even know that was a thing). 

The old couple that runs Zanze's is super sweet!
author: Jackie Y.

description:
I love Zanze, not only for their cheesecake but also for their friendly and welcoming services.

To all the reviewers who commented about their business hour, they have extended hours to allow people who have called in to reserve to be able to come in till 6pm, which I think that is very nice of them to do so!  I also do not think limiting supplies is a poor business model, it allows them to keep up with their quality. 

If you are not one of those who like to plan ahead, you can still call in the day of to ask them to put one aside for you. Calling is easy, they are responsive and very nice!
author: Vivian N.

description: I bought my family the original cheesecake and the chocolate shavings one. Very light and airy the way I like it. Almost taste like Japanese cheesecake. Will return in the future
author: Tasha L.

description: Big thumbs up for Zanze's cheesecake! Best cheesecake I've ever had. The blueberry cheesecake is my personal favorite but the plain one is absolutely yummy too.
author: Luisa C.

description: plain and simple...the ricotta cheesecake is the best you will ever have!  you have to try it.  you will want more and more and more.
author: Mike M.

description:
I drove over two hours for this cheesecake! Damn, was it worth it! I read about Zanze's on a food blog and I was intrigued because they make a cheesecake that's similar to Japanese cheesecake. 

Zanze's specializes in ONLY cheesecake. Small, medium, or large. $16, $24, or $32. That's it, that's all they offer. You can have fruit on top but you have to call and place an order ahead of time. No slices, you buy it by the whole. These beauties come with fishing line to cut the cake. 

The cake is absolutely decadent! So airy and fragile. Like a little cloud. Not overly sweet, which is my main complaint about cheesecake. I was lucky to snag two small cheesecakes. One for me and one for my gf, and she and her fam also vouched that this was the best cheesecake they've ever eaten. 

Zanze's is only open from Wednesday to Saturday. I would call ahead of time to make sure they're open. It's CASH ONLY here.
author: Micki M.

description: Ever since we moved to the neighborhood 2 years ago, I've been meaning to try this legendary cheesecake place. I was thwarted a couple of times this summer, when the owners were on a weeks-long vacation, and the anticipation only upped my expectations. Nevertheless, when we finally got a cake for an event this weekend, it topped even my EXTREMELY HIGH expectations. It was like eating a cloud -- nothing I'd ever tasted before. Truly amazing.
author: Gaelen X.

description: This is a must try cheesecake!!! It is so good! Very small business definitely more of a takeout place since there's only a tiny table with one chair but with the amount of people that come in, forget about it. I didn't place in order in advance so I got the regular cheesecake since I think regular was the only option for walk ins. A medium size for $25. There are a few flavor topping but I believe those have to be preordered. I will next time I go! The cake is so fluffy, just the right amount of richness and full of amazingnessssss! The cakes are kind of small but WORTH THE PRICE!!! I will be back!!! Bring cash!!!
author: Yvette B.

description: Everybody loves Zanze's now. For years, it was a neighborhood secret. Now people from all over the Bay Area make the trek to buy their heavenly cakes. Yes, they area addictive. The Classic - is just that.
author: Kae D.

description:
You know that episode of Friends, where Chandler & Rachel steal a cheesecake from a lady in the building; they drop the cheesecake but it's so delicious that they eat it off the floor anyways? Well, that's Zanze's Cheesecake. I'm not telling you to steal someone's cheesecake or eat it off the floor, but I also wouldn't judge you if you did ;).

All you need to know is that the traditional cheesecake is fluffy and as light as air. By far the best cheesecake that I've ever had. Two thumbs up!

Tip: cash only; call in advance because they do sell out.
author: Carly Y.

description: 3 stars because it feels the most neutral, given that I came in 2 hours into their business hours to find a sign that SOLD OUT on their door. Why have posted business hours that extend til 6PM if you're sold out by 1PM? I'll likely be back to try again (having called ahead), but it's pretty crazy to me that you wouldn't have more supply (or shorter hours).
author: Nes F.

description: Finally tried Zanze's cheesecake, and it was amazing. To make get this extraordinary cheesecake, I had to plan for it carefully as I had shown up on a day when it was sold out. I had to show up on a weekday when they first opened with cash in hand to score a plain, small cheesecake. My husband and I loved the light, fluffy texture. It was just the right amount of sweetness. I only wished I would've have preorder a larger cheesecake with the fruit or chocolate topping.
author: Rosa T.

description: Great pastry and dessert ! I was small but cozy! IRA like buying cookies in my grandma's kitchen!
author: Angela C.

description: I happened to stumble upon this cheesecake bakery by chance when I was looking up places for delicious cheesecake and it didn't disappoint me. The owners are very nice and the cheesecakes there are really delicious! So light and fluffy which is something I haven't experienced before. Overall I am very satisfied and I'll be purchasing more cheesecakes from them.
author: Kelsey T.

description:
Such fluffy cheesecake! Portion size is quite large for a small at $16. Is it the best I've had? Unfortunately not. I've had creamier cheesecakes and better graham crusts. I did enjoy that they had a layer of graham atop their traditional cheesecake!

This place seems to have odd hours, on top of their already short hours. Then again, demand exceeds supply so they have the power here! Only street parking available, but it's quite decent at the hours they're open. I can see why the line is always out the door, but for me this is just A-Okay. If you know what you like, call in ahead for pickup as they run out fast. I'll stop by if I happen to pass by, but probably wouldn't make a trip out.
author: Kristi T.

description: The fluffiest and decadent cheesecake I've ever had. Ate it with friends post dinner party and everyone thoroughly enjoyed it. Highly recommend and will definitely be back!
author: Joey C.

description: Best cheesecake I've ever had. I usually don't care for cheesecake, but this is a light fluffy exception.   Every time I go to San Francisco I make sure to stop here.
author: Alisa N.

description:
Best cheesecake ever.

The stuff that you get from The Cheesecake Factory is like eating almost cured Elmer's glue.

Zanze's is like eating a billowy bite of air.

So fragile.
author: Evan W.

description: This was simply the most amazing cheesecake i've ever eaten. Very special. Suggest ordering in advance.
author: Janet P.

description:
happens to be in the neighborhood shopping with my mom and sister today and noticed this place is close by so we came here (based on recommendation from my friend's mom) - got the medium size traditional cheesecake to share - yummy! I never really care for NY cheesecake but this - this I love cause it's so fluffy and just slightly tangy - perfect!
now I found my cheesecake love - will get the large one to bring to my mom's for Thanksgiving
author: Mia C.

description:
Not necessarily one-star terrible, but I don't think Zanze's deserves this level of praise just because they're the only specialty cheesecake establishment native to SF.

Their cheesecake boasts unusually fluffy, soft texture, along with an extremely mild and forgettable taste. I'm just not a fan, I value cheesecake for its richness and depth of flavor, not the hype in this city. The proprietors were also cold and unfriendly.
author: Trevor W.

description:
Is it possible to eat a cloud? Because I think I just did. 

By far, the fluffiest cheesecake I've ever had. It was moist and soft with just the right amount of sweetness!

There are usually a few cheesecakes on hand, but most orders are made in advanced. The cheesecake is incredibly delicate so they give you a fishing line to cut it. You know you got the good stuff when you have to cut cheesecake with a fishing line! The sweet lady at the counter said a knife would ruin the texture so she showed me how to cut it properly.

CASH ONLY! I purchased a Traditional Cheesecake (medium size) for my parents who live out of town. My parents devoured its deliciousness. They said I'm not allowed to visit unless I come back with some cheesecake. 

...I hope they're joking.
author: Kristal D.

description:
Whether it's for a birthday or a gift for someone you love, I never hesitate to pick up a Zanze cheesecake for the occasion. The cheesecakes from here are light, fluffy and full of flavor. I usually call in to reserve a cake because they are usually sold out by 2! I have not tried other flavors, but other customers praise highly about them. 

The service is super friendly, never hesitate to ask them questions.

5 out of 5 stars
author: Nicholas H.

description: This cheesecake has never missed a family party of mine! My family has been getting cheesecake from here since before I was born. It's super rich and the texture is superb.
author: Ariana D.

description: Absolutely phenomenal cheesecake. This is the real deal European style cheesecake. Don't mistake this for NY style cheesecake. This is somewhat fluffy and has no crust, but if you love cheesecake you would love this! Amazing texture. Perfectly baked. Perfect amount of sweetness. Just perfect! A real European treat right here in SF.
author: Jen B.

description:
We preordered a cheesecake but when we went to go pick it up, thy said they had sold out and didn't have anymore cheesecakes in the whole store. Slightly disappointed that even if you "reserve"
In advance, your cake could still get sold to someone else.
author: Jessica D.

description: This super yummy cheesecakes ! I just cannot stop eating it! I even wish it was bigger! I even want to eat it everyday! Original ones are the BEST! But I also want to try other super good FLAVORS !
author: Xiaoyun Y.

description: This is my favorite cheesecake of all time because "IT'S SO FLUFFY!" (Just imagine Agnes from Despicable Me saying this.) Not only is it fluffy, it's the lightest cheesecake I've ever eaten. It is so delicate that they give you a string to cut it with. I always get so excited whenever I see that someone has brought Zanze's cheesecake to a gathering/party! My family of four loves it so much that we can easily devour one whole cheesecake in one day. If you want to get one, you should probably call to reserve one or two in the morning or days in advance because these fantastic cheesecakes sell out so quickly! So what are you waiting for, go call and reserve one now!
author: Shannon L.

description: We used to get Zanze all the time for a few years and then we came to a break.  Time flies and now it's been 2 years.  The medium cheesecake cake we had last week was a bit "soggy" in the middle.  We remember that it should be fluffy, wonder if the recipe changed???
author: Yen F.

description: Best cheesecake in SF, best cheesecake I've ever had (lived on the east coast (NYC, DC), west coast (SF, LA), Chicago, etc). Read ahead on their rules - obey and be WOWED!
author: Adam Y.

description: Drove from LA to buy this gourmet cheesecake but they're on WINTER VACATION TILL FEB 7th, 2018. I'm crying
author: Jodi Y.

description: I have yet to order directly but I was able to try the cheesecake for Thanksgiving & it's THE BEST I've ever tried! I can't wait when orders open up, I will most definitely be buying some for gatherings!
author: Precious C.

description:
Wonderful as always.
Yelp will not let me post just the above, so how about WOWEE!
Superlative! Fantastic! Amazing! Unbelievable! Holy Moly! Sock-a-magee!
author: George T.

description:
If you never had a slice of Zanze's cheesecake then you really never had cheesecake.  Yes, I just said that.  

If you have had it before then you know what I'm talking about.

I'm sure previous reviews mentioned this, but understand this place only makes and sells cheesecake, nothing else.  This is a family run place that's been here for at least a couple of generations.  Everything is made fresh by hand and on the premise.  This isn't Cheesecake Factory, so they only offer a few flavors here, regular and chocolate, the chocolate is just chocolate shavings on top of the regular.  If your lucky (and early enough) you'll be able to snag one of the berry ones but those go quick.  Thanksgiving time they offer pumpkin flavor which is really good too. But that's about it in terms of their selections.  

Now to the cheesecake.  Zanze's cheesecake isn't your dense, mealy and dry cheesecake that taste like Sheetrock.  It's the softest and the creamiest and fluffiest cheesecake you will ever eat in your life.  The sweetness level is just perfect and it literally melts in your mouth in the most delicious way.  Let me put it this way, if you get one of their cakes, you won't be stopping after the first slice.  

Their cheesecake is so delicate that they provide you with a fishing line to cut the cake, knives would NOT do this cake justice.  There's no crust, instead just a thin layer of a light topping that gives the cake a different yummy texture.  

For those going there for the first time, parking sucks there.  Also be prepared to be disappointed if you end up getting there late.  They only make a certain amount of cakes a day, once it's sold out, you're S.O.L.  The cakes are also not cheap  but you're paying for top quality so it's worth every penny.  

Enjoy it.
author: Kitai P.

description:
We had heard about Zanze's Cheesecake from my BF's colleagues. I had it bookmarked on Yelp for awhile since we don't make it to the city very often. On our trip after the zoo we decided Zanze's would be the perfect dessert to our day of fun. 

There's plenty of metered street parking in front of and around Zanze's. We were greeted by a woman who I'm assuming is part of the ownership due to her lovely nature. She said that they only had original and chocolate available in medium or large. Seeing as we had never been here before, we went with original. Toppings can often time mask tastes and original should be delicious. We were told how to cut the cheesecake and it didn't steer us wrong at all. We sliced 12 slices with perfect thanks to the helpful explanation. They have a "window" they pass the cheesecake through  and I'm assuming this gentleman might be the woman's husband who has been helping us. He popped his head through the window, asked if it was our first time and gave us his good gestures to enjoy the cheesecake. 

We made the trek back to San Jose with this "golden" cheesecake. We popped it in the fridge for a few hours before slicing. This cheesecake is amazing. Being a person who likes to cook and bake its usually difficult to impress me. I love how there is little crust unlike cheesecake you'd get in a restaurant or most bakeries for that matter. After having this cheesecake, I don't think I will be able to order a slice of cheesecake anywhere else. Thanks Zanze's for your superb service and wonderful cheesecake!
author: Stephanie G.

description: A family member brought a cheesecake from Zanze's for Christmas Eve and swore this was the best cheesecake ever. I tried and was definitely not disappointed. My family member used an unused fishing line to cut it as it was also very light. I definitely will go Zanze's to buy a cheesecake directly for my next party gathering.
author: Momoko S.

description: One of the best cheesecakes ever. So fluffy and smooth. I have only had the original. I think you need to order in for the other flavors, which can be seasonal. Also, ordering helps guarantee a cheesecake as I have heard of many stories of them selling out early. The fun part is the fishing-wire that you get to cut the cheesecake with. Definitely great for parties or just a random cheesecake craving.
author: Mike S.

description:
I finally made it in! 

On a lark, I decided to call when they first opened on Wednesday, and made sure that there were cheesecakes ready to go. (They have a few on hand.  Most of their business is done via orders, not walk ins, so I highly suggest calling ahead.)  Call ahead.  

It's a very unassuming place from the outside but it's nice inside. Clean counter. You can see their large and very clean kitchen, too.  

Cheesecake = I'm a fan of their traditional.  It's always fluffy, moist, and full of great flavors!  A most impressive dessert.  

Service = friendly and polite.  

Prices = moderate. Small cheesecake (6") $16.00.   Well worth it!  Cash only. Again, bring CASH. 

Hours = 11 am to 6 pm Wednesday to Friday, and 10 am to 4 pm on Saturday.  Yes, these are their hours, so as I said before-CALL AHEAD!!  

I love the label on their box, (which has instructions for keeping your cheesecake in the freezer) and the fishing wire (for cutting the cake!)  

Support your local businesses!!
author: Fannie S.

description:
This cheesecake is definitely a must try because of how different it is.   I guess this is how a german cheesecake is as opposed to a new york cheesecake.  Either way it is something that you have to experience because when you get it at first your wondering already about the string you use to cut the cake.  

Yes you need it it is that fluffy and soft that cutting it with a knife won't work too well. 

It is definitely really good and it has been around for so many years.   I love the consistency.  
I would give them 6 stars just for being there for more then 20 years.
author: Homer S.

description:
Stopped by for a plain large. Just as others have said...order in advance for non plain ones and it's def a very fluffy cheesecake.  We still prefer denser ones but def will make this a must-go when we are in the area.  

Very pleasant service as well. Enjoy!
author: Ben M.

description:
