my girlfriend loved all cheesecakes, until she went to zanze's. she's not too big on cheesecake anymore - zanze's has ruined her. other cheesecakes just don't taste as good anymore. 
we've tried traditional, blueberry and cherry so far. the traditional has been our favorite. my only wish would be more graham cracker crumbles.
author: Lou S.

description: Clean simple and classy place. The cheesecake is really good very soft not overwhelming. Their crust can be better. They are closed twice a year and every Monday and Tuesday I think but overall it's pretty good cheesecake.
author: Michele T.

description: I ordered a Zanze's original cheesecake for a party and it went down a treat! The cheesecake is delicious and light. I stopped by the store early one Saturday to pick it up. I recommend ordering in advance if you want one of their flavored cheesecakes which look amazing. The original flavor did not disappoint none the less. The large size was great for a party and would easily serve 16 portions. The store front is pretty small but you can see the kitchen through a window when you pick up your cheesecake. It's nice to see the bakers in action. The lady at the register carefully explained how to service the dessert which I really appreciated. I highly recommend this business. It's a hidden gem!
author: Denise M.

description: The best and most fluffy cheesecake ever! Super delicious! So soft and creamy. Not too sweet just right.  I'm definitely coming back and super excited to try the blueberry and pumpkin !!!
author: Cyndi L.

description:
The best cheesecake I have had in my life.

I've never had a cheese cake that is so fluffy and light like this.  It was absolutely amazing.

I was in San Francisco over the weekend with some friends when a local friend suggested this place.  We had no idea they would run out or we should have called ahead of time.  We pulled up to the store and saw the sign that they were sold out.  We stared and looked that they were going to be closed the new few days to our dismay.  Then a lady walked out and asked if we needed help.  She confirmed that they were all sold out but did say they had 1 large cake left which we jumped at.  I'm so glad we did.
author: John L.

description:
First time I eat this cheesecake and let me tell you this... it's amazingggggg
Worth every penny I will definitely come back over and over!!
author: Roilo R.

description: Absolutely delicious! One of the best (and only) authentic cheesecake place in SF.  Great service but make sure you call or order ahead, they're extra busy around the holidays.
author: Usha G.

description:
Does anyone remember that Friends episode where Chandler and Rachel eat the most delicious cheesecake ever?? Well, Zanze's cheesecake is what I picture it being like. When I'm eating Zanze's cheesecake, I feel like I'm eating the same cheesecake they ate in the show.

Let's get down to business. Here is what I got for my mom's birthday:

Medium Traditional Cheesecake - $23

I ordered the morning of and luckily they had some left. No Smalls however...but hey, I'll take a Medium (more of the good stuff for us!!) I go there to pick it up. The lady at the counter (I'm sure she's the owner) is super sweet and gets my cheesecake. She asks if this is for a special occasion and I tell her it's for my mom's birthday. She offers to put a "Happy Birthday" chocolate on top and packs it up. So thoughtful. And then I left....and had amazing, fluffy cheesecake later that night. 

Customer service was great. Taste, of course, is great as always. Of course, I wish there was more crust but you just can't find this nice fluffiness anywhere else. I've really grown to love (and seriously crave) it. Try it out for yourself! I will have to try another flavor next time.
author: Amanda L.

description: My friend ordered the traditional New York cheesecake here for a friends birthday. It was my first time trying it and I'm addicted. It was so light and fluffy I can just die. So so good, it was perfection!
author: Elaine L.

description:
The. Best. Fluffiest. Delicate. Cheesecake. I've. Ever. Had.

Beyond amazing. I heard about how great this place was so I had high expectations and it did not disappoint! It's like the Friends episode where you will want to eat it off the ground like Chandler and Rachel did haha. You have to order in advance but it's worth it. It's so delicate, they provide a string/thread to cut the cheesecake because a knife will not do it justice. Sweetness level is perfect, definitely satisfies your sweet cravings but has a good balance with the crust on the bottom. Each bite felt like eating a cloud, it's really delicate and moist. 

Overall, this place serves the best cheesecake you'll ever have and the owner and his wife are so adorable! They're super friendly and welcoming.
author: Angela T.

description:
I ate this cheesecake 1-2 days after the purchase date and it was still the best fluffy cheesecake I have had.  It resembles Japanese style cheesecake a bit too. 

I haven't tried any of the cakes with the chocolate or fruit topping but I hear plain is the best here because the cheesecake flavor isn't competing with the toppings.

Zanze's is only open a couple times a week and can sell out fast so I recommend you get here first thing.
author: Shannon L.

description: A SF institution... if you love cheesecake this must be on your Must Try list. Rich, beautiful, tasty... look at the hundreds of pictures for Zanzes... . Near SF State, near Stonestown mall just swing by and grab a cheesecake with shaved chocolate on top or luscious fruit. Glorious!  (You might have to double park, so bring a "runner" ) ... Happy Holidays.
author: Jacqueline S.

description: Zanze's is constantly sold out of their one and only product, which begs the question-- why post hours or have a store in the first place??  They would be much better off just distributing to local grocery stores because it's painfully clear that they don't belong in the retail sector.
author: Kelly C.

description:
I love this place! My family and friends have come here quite a few times for birthday cakes. Big tip, always call ahead to place an order! I called on Wednesday to pick up a cake for Friday. They open at 11AM and when I arrived 15 minutes before 1PM, there was a sign that they had already sold out of cheesecakes for the day!

I'm not usually a fan of cheesecake but their cheesecake is so dang good. I've always ordered the large traditional cheesecake ($30 cash only) and it's more than enough. The texture is super light and fluffy. The base is minimal as most of the graham is very fine and sprinkled heavily on top. The cheesecake is so delicate and there is a fishing string attached to the top of the box.

Everything is extremely detailed and the workers are super friendly! When I came to pick it up, the woman showed me my cake before boxing it and wrapped it with amazing detail. The man in the back even greeted me with a smile. They also add a small chocolate "happy birthday" sign on top of your cake at no charge if you ask. Hands down, best cheesecake ever. I'll forever be a customer!
author: Bing L.

description: they r never open!!!! closed for summer vacay until 8/23!!!! that said, i love their cheesecake!!! it's super fluffy and light and not overly sweet. it's truly the Best cheesecake ever!!
author: Christine T.

description:
I don't know who had the cajones to give zanze's 4 stars. I can only assume they had a stroke and accidentally changed their rating before posting the review. This is hands down the best cheesecake you will have in your life. There is no comparison. 

It is LITERALLY internationally renowned (read "WORLD WIDE") and will ruin you for cheesecakes forever. Every time you eat a cheesecake after zanze's you will be a little bit frustrated that you thought you could be okay with anything less than zanze's. You'd be wrong. There is no cheesecake after zanze's. It's actually a little eerie how much it takes you over. You can easily eat half of a cheesecake in one sitting. Correction - maybe that's just me. STILL - if you can (meaning you live in California, the United States, or somewhere on planet earth) get you some zanze's!
author: Oanh M.

description:
First some tips: Cash only and they don't take same day orders on Saturday

The cake was good, I had the plain flavor and it had a mouse-like consistency and was so creamy. I missed the traditional crust, however, Zanze's just has a graham cracker like crumble on top of the cake but I would have liked more.
author: Aliya Y.

description: Best cheesecake I've ever had! I bought it to stage a birthday surprise for my mom. She loved it and I was so happy with how the cake turned out. They have small chocolate signs that say happy birthday on them that are very delicate, like the cake. Do be careful during transport, as I did not completely secure the cake, so it rattled a bit. The cake is so soft, I think it wobbled enough that a lot of the chocolate shavings on top came off and when I arrived at my mom's house we had to re-center the chocolate "Happy Birthday" sign. But it still came out amazing! It does stink that you can't get two toppings (I had wanted to get both a raspberry topping with chocolate shavings over that) but even for the slightly more "plain" single topping the texture and flavor of this cake make up for anything you might see as a downside. 100% a winner.
author: Michelle B.

description: I almost finish the whole cake by my self. The taste is so light that you want to keep putting it in your mouth.
author: Uni C.

description:
Here to drop another 5 stars. Forget any other cheese cake place in San Francisco because this right here is the best...........

Don't bring out the knife please! I'll cut this cheese cake with my fishing line! "What?! stop messing around". But I'm serious!! *Cuts cake*
"Woah...."
author: Tim W.

description: Best cheesecake ever!! Taste nice n fluffy and not too sweet! I wish they're open more. Defiantly coming back here to try all the other flavors
author: C N.

description: I love this place in so many ways. The subtle sweet taste, the extremely soft texture, and the atmosphere there. It's so cute and nice. And the way they cut their cheese cakes... extraordinarily
author: Natsuki T.

description: Light and fluffy with just the perfect amount of sweetness. Blueberry is my favorite but you can't go wrong with Classic. It's what I want for Valentine's Day and Birthday every year. You better preorder your cheesecake, Mr. Zanze only makes a certain amount of cakes a day, all the fruit and special ones have to be ordered in advanced. I've heard you can also freeze the classic cheesecake and it will taste as fresh as the day it was made once defrosted. My family and I will continue to come here for years to come.
author: amber c.

description:
Zanze's has such light and fluffy cheesecake. First off, if your wanting to get one, highly recommend placing an order in advance. I'm not sure the chance if you tried to pick one up the day of but you might have to go super early. I got one here for a family's birthday, they aren't big on sweets so I got a small, half expecting my parents to only want a little. Cheesecake here is on point. Just the right amount of sweetness, insanely fluffy and so creamy. You don't even need a knife to cut this, they provide you with a fishing line to cut the cake instead of you having to use a knife, which the fishing line itself does a good job, that's how fluffy the cheesecake is. Parking can be difficult but not impossible. You can serve it at room temp or chilled, which is good for when I have limited fridge space. Definitely will be picking up a cheesecake from here for birthdays! 

Bring cash!
author: Tiffany Y.

description:
Tried to purchase it for thanksgiving, but I was just too late. VM said they were all sold out.

So, we bought small traditional yesterday. This time, I called one day ahead and reserved it.

It was so fluffy yet rich flavor. Almost like Japanese Cotton Cheesecake or even better. It melts in your mouth, but not too sweet like any other cheesecake....

Everyone loved it, and so happy to discover genuinely great cheesecake. Definitely worth a try!
author: Katie M.

description: Aka cheesecake Nazis  (see Seinfield reference). Fantastic light cheesecakes that you need to order months in advance, specially during holiday season). Ok, months is an exaggeration, kinda. Not too many selections, but that's good for quality control. Do not expect to come in here later in the afternoon to buy one if you did not place an order days before. Some times you may be to buy one of the extra small plain ones they made.
author: Ming W.

description: Sadly, I didn't read the reviews that mentioned this wasn't NY style cheesecake. Nevertheless, I thought it was a very good European style cheesecake. As many have said, it was fluffy. I was forced to buy the medium size (they ran out of smalls). It's a good thing they're not open on more days of the week and they don't make NY style cheesecake. I still have to go elsewhere to get that.
author: Ellen S.

description: Entering Zanze's store is like transporting into olden days. There are soft old songs playing, smell of cheesecakes, soft spoken friendly lady, no cash register, and just amazing feeling just like you are visiting your grandparents. Now for the cheesecake,  it was amazing! Fluffy, light and not overwhelmingly cheesy which I think the best cheesecake I ever taste. My husband who is so choosy in cheesecake, wholeheartedly agreed with me on this. Since I'm bringing this cake to Phoenix,  they can pack nicely for travel which you can request. I will definitely come again if I'm in Bay Area.
author: Munirah M.

description: This is the fluffiest cheesecake you will ever taste. It's like a little cloud in each bite. This is a European-style cheesecake unlike the dense New York style you get at Cheesecake Factory. If you ever watched "Friends" the TV Show, recall the episode "The One with all the Cheesecakes." This cheesecake will leave you wanting more.
author: Shirlene K.

description: There cheesecakes are pricey but fresh and very smooth. Better than Safeway. It's very light and fluffy . Cheesecake flavor is there but not strong
author: Russell T.

description: Love the cheesecakes here!  It is so light and fluffy every time.  It melts in your mouth.  We finished every bite every time!
author: HQ S.

description:
I preordered a large traditional cheesecake ($28) for Easter and it was a breeze to do so. Service over the phone and in the shop was very friendly! I even saw Mr. Zanze in the kitchen when I came to pick up the cheesecake. 

The cheesecake was even better than I remembered and for my family who just tried this cheesecake for the first time, they were blown away. It's a cheesecake that tastes like it's made of cream cheese cloud. Drool.
author: Maya S.

description:
I've never actually been here, but my best friend surprised me with their original cheesecake, because she knew I've been wanting to try it for the longest time.. Yes, she definitely knows the way to my heart.

Zanze's cheesecake is very fluffy and delicate. It's so soft, you have to cut it with a fish wire. I love how simple it is, yet so creamy. His cheesecake is so good, you're going to want to finish it in one sitting! I don't know if that is a good or bad thing....
author: Esther C.

description:
Zanze's Cheesecake is amazing! We got our first cheesecake around Thanksgiving of last year. Zanze's was sold out around the days of Thanksgiving, but luckily they told me the original (plain) cheesecake would last if I ordered and picked it up about 5 days before Thanksgiving. 

After that first cheesecake, my partner and I were hooked. We have even made bets with a Zanze's cheesecake as the stakes. Since then, we tried the cheesecake with the fruit topping (I think raspberry) and it was just as good. I think I would stick with the original cheesecake though because it is just that good. I also want to make a point to try the pumpkin cheesecake, which is seasonal. Unfortunately, we moved out of the bay area so I might have to pay someone to bring me a cheesecake. 

Parking around Zanze's is hard. There is only metered street parking. If you find a spot before you hit the restaurant, just take it and walk the block. 

CASH ONLY! Also, if you want a fruit topping, you must call ahead. You can walk in to get the original cheesecakes, but I have heard they sell out quickly. 

Also, Zanze's is closed the month of January. At least it was last year. I imagine this is because they are so busy during the holiday season that they need a break.
author: Chantalle B.

description: After eating this cheesecake, I died and went to heaven. This cheese cake is so creamy and rich, but not overbearing. You must eat it slowly and savor the taste. Let the cheesecake melt In your mouth. The price is very reasonable for the sizing and quality.
author: Chantel H.

description:
We had a dinner to attend and decided we wanted to bring something, a dessert perhaps. After some thought a Zanze's cheesecake seemed to fit the bill perfectly. We went early around opening hour so we were ensured a cheesecake (we've heard they sell out) which by the way was tough since we weren't going to be able to dig into it until dinner. 

We bought a medium sized cake for seven people. None of us are hugely into sweets so we figured a slice per person sufficed. Most in the group never had a Zanze's before so seeing the fishline was necessary as a cutting utensil for the cake opposed to a knife was the first indication this cake was special. The cake was a hit and everyone loved each light and fluffy, almost soufflé-like bite. I've personally never had a cheesecake like this before and immediately regretted not opting for a larger cake. 

Zanze's cheesecakes are tops. Five stars indeed.
author: Esther A.

description: The cheesecake here is the best I have ever had, and trust me, I have tried cheesecakes at a lot of places! It is a must try. The texture is so good and the taste is just perfect. The cheesecake is so soft, you actually need a string to cut it. Their hours and days of operations is something to consider before going to pick the cake up.
author: Roma M.

description:
Lemme start this off by saying... I hate cheesecake. 

"Wait... whuuuu?" you're thinking. 

Yup! I am not a fan. Ironically, one of my favorite restaurants is Cheesecake Factory LOL.

So it means A LOT when I say that Zanze's is not cheesecake, it's an experience. It is so damn light, so fluffy. I don't understand how the texture is what it is. It defies all rules of regular cheesecake at least to me. 

I know some of you are saying that this is German style cheesecake as opposed to New York style cheesecake so comparing the two would be unfair - & to y'all I say: "Aaaandd?"

This is the best cheesecake I've ever had in my life. Props to Mr. Zanze & the fam for holding it down and running this place on their own. I will definitely come back.
author: Abigail D.

description:
OMG cheesecakes! Can't stop eating.
My husband bought a cheesecake from here for my birthday and it is without doubt the best I've had in my life so far. I finished a full small cheesecake on my own in 3 days =)
author: Sharanya A.

description:
I've only tried the original cheesecake.  Not too sweet, fluffy, moist, delicate, gram cracker dust on top...just delightful. You use a fishing line to cut the cheesecake!  Using a knife will destroy the cake. 

You should place an order in advance if you want any fruit topping or the chocolate cheesecake. Can't wait to come back and try more cheesecakes.

Cash only.
author: Emily Y.

description:
Okay. Here's what's up:

I've been wanting to try Zanze's cheesecakes for years now. I've heard nothing but wonderful things. 

Part 1: For the past few months I've called ahead to pick up a cheesecake. Whenever I call a woman answers. I ask her if there is a small raspberry available (as I have heard raspberry is by far the tastiest). For the past five-six phone attempts she has notified me that there are no raspberry cheesecakes available. But that I could order one ahead of time. I thank her for the info to order ahead but normally when I have these functions they are last minute. I'm simply looking for a quick treat to pick up. 

Well, it's that time again. A few girls are coming over tonight and I want to pick up a special dessert. I call right when they open and ask if they have a small raspberry cheesecake (as it would seem unreasonable they would sell out minutes upon opening). I'm told by the woman over the phone they do not have any raspberry cheesecakes. I'm told I would need to order one. I say no thank you, I will try again another time. Then she explains that I can order one for today. I think to myself: Great! This is a dream come true! I'm finally getting a small raspberry cheesecake after all!

She asks me when I want it. I say the sooner the better. She tells me that the cheesecake will be ready in 30 minutes. I leave the gym, I pick up my dog and drive over to get the cheesecake. 

Part 2: I arrive 45-50 minutes after placing the order. The woman in the front doesn't greet me. She just stares at me. I say "hey, how you doing, I placed an order" and she immediately interrupts me and says the cheesecake isn't ready. Then she proceeds to lecture me on all the steps it takes to make the cheesecake... I explain to her that my dog is in the car and I'm parked a few blocks away. I tell her I'm going to check on my dog and come back in 10 minutes. I do that. Upon returning the first words out of her mouth: "I guess the dog survived" in the rudest, nastiest tone. I said nothing, paid for the cheesecake and left. 

Survey says: out of the four of us, two really enjoyed the cheesecake and two of us didn't. Why is there no crust?? All four of us thought this entire debacle was weird. 

NOTE TO OWNERS: Good service is everything!

You only accept cash. 
Your hours of operation are extremely limited. 
You make it nearly impossible to pick up a raspberry cheesecake. 
Your front of house woman is overly rude. 

I know you're popular and probably won't care that I had a poor experience. But it should be known. Based on service alone, I will never come back here. And no, your cheesecake was not worth all the calls and hassle.
author: Rosalyn W.

description:
Zanze's cheesecake, oh my goodness, where do I begin?! 

Okay, to be honest, I was never a huge fan of cheesecake. I always see it in Yelp, and every time I drive past it, I wonder how good it really is. My mom's birthday was coming up, and she's a huge cheesecake fanatic. After reading everyone's reviews, I knew this was the place to get cheesecake. I called in the morning right when they opened to order a regular traditional medium cheesecake, and a very sweet lady answered and told me it was no problem. The place is pretty small, but it's cute (: i told the lady that it was my first time there and she gave me a little discount (which was nice of her, she didn't have to do that). It might seem as if it's a little hard to find parking, but it's not, there's plenty of parking on the street! 

TLDR; bomb cheesecake even though I'm not a huge cheesecake person. Call beforehand or even a day before if you want one!
author: Tracy V.

description:
I often come here for parties and for my boyfriend. Every year, he wants a Zanze's cheesecake for his birthday. He even got a Zanze's cheesecake for my birthday! (We've been together for almost 11 years, imagine how many cheesecakes that is.)

Although I say this, I am also, truly, a fan of their cheesecakes. They are the most fluffy and airy cheesecakes I have ever had. Every one I know that has tried Zanzes loves it. They are so light that you have to cut the cake with a fishing line. I really love Zanzes and hope they are around forever. I mean, where else will I get these delicious treats?
author: Lyra C.

description:
+ best cheesecake in sf 
+ favorite is traditional 
+ friendly owners & great service 

- quite expensive but worth it! 
- cash only

Tips:
Check the store times by calling or checking on yelp! 
Try to reserve the cheesecake
Remember to use the fishing line to cut the cheesecake!
author: Kathleen U.

description:
I'd heard about Mr. Zanze through a newspaper article a few years back but didn't get to try his cakes until recently. Like many others mentioned, even if you don't like the traditional cheesecake, it is completely worth a try because Zanze's cheesecakes are the OG to the new "light as air cheesecake" trend that's blowing up on the internet right now. Support this sweet man and his delicious desserts! What's better than someone who makes a living by brightening up the birthdays, anniversaries, and just-because cheesecake cravings of others?

Notes: Parking isn't always available, but the cake is light enough and well packaged to take on the bus (K line runs nearby). Call in advance especially during the holiday season. Don't expect to stop at just one slice :)
author: Brittany L.

description:
I found Zanze's on yelp and placed my order ahead of time for pick-up. I told them I was traveling with it all the way back to Orange County so they wrapped it up for me. I carried it in a cooler to make sure it would be good for travel and it unwrapped just the way it was in the store. 

The size small was perfect, I thought it would be bigger, but it's good for 2-4 people. I used the fishing wire to cut it, and it came out in perfect slices. The cheesecake was so light and fluffy. I liked that the graham cracker crust was sprinkled on top rather than on the bottom.
author: Vy T.

description: There's no denying.... this is the best cheesecake on earth!! Get one traditional and one raspberry!
author: Betty T.

description:
We had the one with chocolate shavings. 

If you're expecting the usual dense cheesecake, this isn't it. It's more like a sponge cake and not very sweet--you'll feel less guilty after eating it I guess haha

It was so good!! Despite of the high price, it's worth buying it again. I might try the original next time.

Tip: I would call them first before heading to their store to check for availability.
author: irwin v.

description:
OMG!

Yes, I just ate their large traditional cheesecake (not all by myself) and now have ruined it for all future cheesecakes. Shared this with a coworker who thought nothing of it at first bite but as the fluffiness and delicate texture and flavor hit his palate his facial expression changed and experienced the goodness that this creation brings to taste buds. He then ate like 2 more slices in about 30 seconds. No joke.

I must try other flavors in the future.

The staff was super friendly and I got their standard cake cutting brief and demonstration. They're serious about their cakes.

My foodie friends were right about this place...it's legit. But my advice to you is eat all the other cheesecakes before you come here. This may be the pinnacle of cheesecakes. There, I said it.

Nom nom.

Remember, cash only. Pre-order when you have the time to avoid running out of cakes at the end of day. A simple phone call with cake type, your name and phone number will suffice.
author: Sam L.

description: I can never seem to get enough of this cheesecake! One of my guilty pleasures. It's so fluffy and rich with flavor, I can't get enough. It's not overwhelming either. Literally melts in your mouth! Love love love it!
author: Jea G.

description: Came here to buy a cheesecake for my boyfriend's birthday. I am so lucky because I got the last cake in the store. And the lovely old man are so nice, will come back and buy another cake for our next birthday. My boyfriend just love their cheesecake so much!
author: Angelala L.

description: Yelped a few places to find an authentic cheesecake and came across this one. Very close to where I stay, so decided to drop on without any occasion. Needless to say, it made my day into a great occasion of trying this cake. Too good and very fluffy. The sweetness is to perfection. I don't like cakes to be very sweet. A place to go for sure for everytime I crave for a cheesecake!!
author: Pradnya J.

description: My coworker brought in and cut with fishing wire one of Zanze's famous cheesecakes for a Friday team meeting. What a delight. So light and fluffy and gluten free too. Apparently the owner is a delight which means I may have to make the trek out there the next time I'm craving this rich cheese-cakey goodness.
author: Nikki M.

description: I go to art school in Oakland and my Sculpture for Animation professor brought us Zanze's on our last day of class. Our group of 7 girls plus our professor DEVOURED this thing! It was the classic cheesecake, and even though I'm lactose-intolerant, I indulged in some bites and buddy boy I saw the gates of heaven and Saint Peter was holding a slice of this divine, decadent, luxurious cloud of a cheesecake
author: Justine K.

description:
This Zanze's Cheesecake is the most mouth watering EVER tasted! Quite the baker's delicacy!!!
Small 'pick up' only storefront with plentiful street parking.
Can't wait to order another! The dark chocolate shavings atop are my favorite!
author: Michelle M.

description: The BEST of the BEST, I love this place. Cheesecake is amazing and fluffy. Make sure to call to see if they open before heading over!
author: Susan H.

description:
I can't believe I've joined the Zanze wagon so late! This bakery is heavenly!! Cheesecakes are readily available in a first come first serve basis, but they're only about 8-10 a day.. so pre-ordering them a day or two ahead of time is necessary. The lovely lady was very nice and helpful by showing me  how to use the fishing wire to slice the cakes.. Since it's soo delicate, she also let me know when to thaw it, how to freeze it, etc... Prices are very reasonable considering how popular the cakes are.. Anddd.. they now offer seasonal flavors, such as pumpkin cheesecake during the Holiday seasons.. traditional and blueberry are yearly.. I have pumpkin cheesecake on my list for what to try next.. The cheesecake is light, airy, and fluffy.. The cheesecake is strong with the cream cheese, but light because of the graham crackers used. You can literally eat 1 small cheesecake yourself if you're having a bad day.. it's not the best decision... but it's definitely "possible".. if you dare..... it's THAT airy and light.. 

To add another good note- when I went to pick up the cake, there were two pre-teens helping out at the bakery.. Though they didn't help with service, they were busily measuring out the fishing wire that will be attached to the cake box.. I do not see that as much anymore and really admire how family oriented the shop is. Please keep it up :)
author: Samantha W.

description:
I randomly walked in Zanze's without having herd anything about it prior....  I was just walking around,  waiting for my husband's dentist appt. next door to be finished .  

I walked in this little joint only to see cheesecakes and thought,  wow only cheesecakes,  they must be delicious since it's their specialty... (especially for $16 per small serving,  6 slices). 

I gave it a shot and boy was I impressed at first taste. I didn't have to think,  Is this a good cheesecake? I instantly said, Wow Mamma!!! The taste is just outstanding and texture is perfect,  not to mention that it looked heavenly. The only thing i would add is a bit of  more crust,  but that's the way i like my cheesecake.  Their crust is a light crumb,  but delicious.  It's sprinkled mainly on top and a little on the bottom. 


I didn't enjoy it as much at room temp as I did Refrigerated. There's a big difference.  At room temp,  it's more fluffy and not as pronounced in flavor.  Refrigerated,  it's all fluffy,  but a bit more dense with much stronger flavor.  It's all a matter of preference.  

It comes nicely packaged in a box lined with doilies and box tied with rope,  a perfect gift. 

They even include a piece of plastic string used for slicing the delicate cheesecake. Yes,  they mean business.  

They have other flavors available.  Strawberry,  etc.  And i have no doubt that they're nothing short of perfect.  I will be back again to try them out.  

In short,  i did a blind taste without having read any reviews prior and this turned out to be the best cheesecake ever!!
author: Katherine F.

description: Definitely the best cheesecakes ever! I have only eaten Zanze's cheesecakes twice at my cousin's house. We usually get the original. It truly is something spectacular. Something to note, I use to not really be a fan of cheesecake until I tried Zanze. It is the perfect balance of light, fluffy, and the amount of sweetness for taste! Graham cracker bottom is also very flaky and delicious. It's one of those foods that has your taste buds thanking you. The cakes are very delicate so it has to be cut with fishing line. Highly recommended!! 10/10
author: Jeanette Q.

description:
Tastes different than previous years.
It tastes a little bit heavier and less lemon flavor.   Sad:
author: Sara K.

description: The small is $16 and well worth it.  Lots of people drive from all over to buy these cheesecakes.  The fishing line is a nice touch and the bakers are pleasant here.  Street parking only.
author: Chris L.

description:
I've been avoiding places to review in order to find the perfect 600th to rant about.  Zanze's easily took the (cheese)cake.  

I called in at 11am to put a small blueberry cheesecake on hold for Wifey's birthday dinner.  The lady on the phone was extremely friendly and helpful.  She let me know that they closed at 4pm and I could come at anytime.  

I thought a small would be enough for 6 people.  When I walked into the shop, the lady from the phone greeted me with the same friendliness.  The man behind all of the cheesecakes also made an effort to peak out and say hello.  What awesomeness! I looked in the case and saw that a small just wouldn't be enough for 6.  She asked me if I wanted a bigger size without any hesitation.  They piled on the whipped cream and blueberries to order and sent me on my way with a marzipan happy birthday sign. 

She warned me not to put it on too early or else it'll get lost within the blueberries.  Cash only folks!  She also took the time to explain how to use the fishing line.  Zanze's closes Sundays through Tuesdays.  What an awesome find...

The cheesecake, itself, was light, fluffy, and delish.  It wasn't overpowering and the blueberries were a great complement.  I could probably eat the entire cake if it was served to me on a platter.  Well, let's hope I NEVER do that.  

5 super duper stars for my 600th review and reviewing this place proudly!  Yum!
author: Jen W.

description:
NOTE: CASH ONLY

Just bought the traditional cheese cake for a loved one's birthday. I've heard from others that the cheesecake here sells out extremely fast and that you have to go in early in order to pick up a cake. So, I called in ahead of time to reserve a small cake. The woman who picked up my phone call was soooo nice! She was just so sweet and big-hearted (you can tell by the way she greets you and responds to you). As I went to the bakery to pick it up, I mentioned that it was for a birthday and she gave me a chocolate "happy birthday" placard. She even made sure to open up the cake for me to make sure that I was satisfied! In all, the cake was the fluffiest, most amazing cheesecake I have ever had! DELICIOUS. It's extremely creamy but not too heavy. Honestly, I am not a cheesecake fan but Zanze's is changing me!!! I love how even though it is fluffy, it's still firm enough to hold up birthday candles! Would definitely visit Zanze's again! Costed me an even $16.00, no tax
author: Kimberly H.

description: Zanze is always my favorite cheesecake, the best cheesecake I ever have. I always get the original one, and I think the original is the best one.
author: Ruby L.

description: Best cheese cake ever , had to pre order this for the wife's birthday. She likes plain. But I like the blueberry one
author: Tim C.

description: I don't think they still need my five stars , this place more than that five stars ! We order cheese from here for all occasions. Never get tired of it ! Love !
author: Yan C.

description: The original cheesecake is creamy and delicious! There already has 6-8 people lined up before the store open. I would love to visit again!
author: Minnie F.

description:
Great small business with unique cheesecake!

**Note: Call ahead to double check their hours**

When you step into the shop you can feel the heat coming from the back and it kinda feels like you've been transported back to the 50s. The lady at the counter gave us great advice and I like how you can see the mastermind at work in the back. 

I purchased two small cheesecakes for a family gathering. One traditional and one blueberry. The cheesecakes are so delicious, light, and rich all at the same time. I actually preferred the traditional flavor. The cheesecake is so fragile that they give you fishing line to cut it. I highly recommend this place if you want to try a delicious unique cheesecake!
author: Alex C.

description:
Religious experience?  Practically!  This is cheesecake that's lighter than air and will send you into orbit.  Serve with some blackberries on the side and there will be a magical hush around the dinner table.

Feels like you step back in time or are transported to a small European shop.

Divine!
author: Sarah S.

description: Awhile ago I bought a cheesecake for my husband's birthday. When I went to pick it up, I notice it was hot and stuffy in there. I was very uncomfortable that it was hot. Don't the cheesecake need to refrigerated???
author: Wolfie M.

description: This is by the best cheesecake I have ever had. It's soft, fluffy, airy, and creamy with the perfect density. They close early so it's best to come when they first open to secure a cheesecake because they also sell out fast. The things are dangerously addicting and it's easy to finish off a small one by yourself in one or two sittings.
author: Aniah S.

description: Since I miss Wegman's cheesecake (the best) from the east coast, I have to find my new cheesecake place in SF. I like that their cheesecake is just the right amount of fluffiness and not too sweet. Prices are decent. $16 for a small one. You have to call the place before going there to make sure they still have it. They always run out so it's better to place your order ahead of time.
author: Pengilicious E.

description:
Hands down one of the best cheesecakes that I've ever had!

They just opened up again after going on vacation, so I informed the mama and she came back with a small original cheesecake. Apparently they don't sell them by slice :( Oh, and they're CASH ONLY.

They have two kinds of cheesecakes: original and blueberry. You can also add chocolate shavings or a "Happy Birthday" chocolate on it.
The lady who worked there told the mama to keep the cheesecake in the fridge and just bring it out 10 minutes before you serve it.

Back to the cheesecake, I felt like I was eating a cloud. It was amazingly soft, much softer than Japanese cheesecakes. Unlike NY cheesecakes, it's not heavy at all. I didn't feel guilty even after eating 3 slices. The flavors were just right...ugh as a matter of fact I'm going to finish the rest right now. Goodbye yelp!
author: Jackie T.

description: Best cheese cake in the entire Bay Area. They just came back from the 2 months vacation, I had been craving for the cheese cake.  Kudos to the family at Zanze's.
author: p l.

description: I was waiting in line excited to try their cheesecake, but the lady (cashier/baker) made a really rude remark to me. That put me off greatly and I walked out. For the price of the cheesecake, their customer service needs to be better!
author: Julie J.

description:
25 YEARS IN SF AND I DIDN'T FIND OUT ABOUT ZANZE'S UNTIL THIS YEAR

Sam has really perfected his craft. 

I wanted to do something different for my boyfriend's birthday, and instead of your typical birthday cake, I decided to try Zanze's. The shop is closed on Mondays and Tuesdays. Luckily, I called in first thing in the morning on Wednesday for pickup in the evening that same day. As a first-timer, I ordered the medium classic cheesecake with a small (edible) 'Happy Birthday' placard on top. Zanze's doesn't write on the cakes.

The shop is small, but Sam and his wife are just DELIGHTFUL. I recognized Sam from the pictures on Yelp and waved at him as if he were some sort of celebrity LOL. I told them it was my first time trying the cheesecake, and he came out to the front to chat a bit. The two of them are so friendly.  

As for the cheesecake..it's amazing! So light, and fluffy just as everyone else has said. 'Not too sweet' ..just how the Filipino moms like it haha. If we could, my boyfriend and I would order a medium to ourselves and just devour it. Do note that there is no crust like your typical cheesecake. It's also CASH ONLY. 

I will definitely be reserving a cheesecake for my upcoming family parties, etc. 

Support this small business, you won't regret it!!
author: Camille B.

description: Finally got to try it! Went early so that I wouldn't miss out. Got a small original cheesecake which is 6" I believe for $16. The small cuts into eight pieces and feeds from 2-4 people. Before eating it I placed it in the fridge for a little bit, but it could be eaten at room temperature and could also be put in the freezer for 3 months. It's pretty cool that you use a fishing line to cut through it so that it doesn't crumble and stuff. I love that it's light and fluffy. It's something different and not the same from other cheesecakes out there. I have recommended this place to others and also got a friend to buy one as well. I'll definitely be back to buy some more! There's also different toppings you could choose, which would probably be delicious since the plain one is already good
author: Maggie W.

description:
Fluffy, airy and melt in your mouth delicious. The reviews speak for itself. 

The nice lady greeted me right when I walked through the door.... As I was paying the gentlemen poked his head out through the window and ask how was my day. Very friendly peeps. 

I'll be back. 

My son and husband was wondering what/why was there no graham cracker crust. FYI it's super thin...
author: Liz N.

description: It Tastes so creamy, But not oily. I hope there open everyday. When I eat that will remind me something! It's Easy find the parking.
author: Heman C.

description:
I'm on cloud nine and please don't bring me down.

I love love love Zanze's cheesecakes!! Once you try it, you can't go back. It is seriously so light and fluffy... Everything you ever wanted and more! The only problem is they are only open 4 days a week and take lots of vacations so be sure to call to check if they are open. Mollie Stone's on Portola used to keep a stash in their freezer section but not anymore. What am I going to do when they are closed?!??! 

I guess I need to start hoarding them since I hear they are good in the freezer for up to 3 months!
author: Karmen T.

description: Ever look up in the sky and wonder what a cloud would taste like? Cotton candy? No! Wrong! Zanze's cheesecake! It's so fluffy I'm gonna die!!! I love the cheesecake here. I like how it is not packed with sugar where you would feel like you'd need insulin right after. One little slice can fulfill my big ol' tummy for dessert. Love love love! What you waiting for?!? Get yourself a whole darn cheesecake!!!
author: Al H.

description:
Tip: Cash only, metered street parking on Ocean.

Best cheesecake in all of the greater Bay Area!!

The reviews already speak for themselves! In addition to the undeniably delicious classic cheesecake, they also provide great customer service. On the day that I scheduled my cheesecake pickup, I received a phone call that I still had a cake waiting but that they were closing in a half hour. I notified them I was on my way and they said they'd be open whenever I got there!!

Also if you're buying the cake for a birthday, tell them. They'll add an edible "happy birthday" decal free of charge :)
author: Riana C.

description:
I want to keep Zanze's a little secret to myself forever.  I've hesitated writing this review because of it.  

But, good things and good people must be appreciated, recognized, and shared.  

I've ordered from Zanze's so many times.  I've ordered many variations of their cheesecakes.  You just can't go wrong.  If you walk by, and they happen to be open, just order whatever they have. You'll be pleased.

I'd generally recommend you call ahead of time to ensure their availability.  They close when they run out.  They're not a large scale operation looking to make a ton of money.  They are a high quality family run operation, and you can taste the quality in every bite.  You can even freeze their cheesecake and slowly appreciate it, and it'll still hold well.
author: Ghizal A.

description: 3 cakes so far in a month . Loved all of them . Favorite was the kirch one with cherry on top. Yummy yummy!
author: Blue B.

description:
Three words: FLUFFIEST. CHEESECAKE. EVER. 

The cheesecake is the lightest, most fluffiest cheesecake ever. And its DELICIOUS. 

Bonus: The staff are all the sweetest people ever!
author: Lisa N.

description:
So, we happened to have two different cheesecake at our dinner party.  One is a traditional New York cheesecake and the other is Zanze's cheesecake.

Zanze's cheesecake is really good and fluffy however it should not be classified as a cheesecake.  Cheesecake really should be more texture.  With that said i still enjoyed the "dessert" from This bakery.

I would say Zanze's cheesecake is like Cheesecake Mousse.
author: Christine C.

description:
I didn't know what delicious cheesecake tasted like until I had theirs! 

There's a cafe I love on Valencia with an older Korean couple that owns it. The woman is crotchety and hard to warm up to, but the few times you can get a smile from her, you feel like you won the lottery. The man of the duo is a sweet soft spoken man who always greets people warmly. I came in once on my birthday and when the man discovered the occasion, gifted me one of these Zanze's cheesecakes he for some reason had in the kitchen. I hadn't had one before nor had I ever heard of Zanze's until that day. 

I took the cheesecake home with the intention of sharing it with my roommates...until I took a bite. I hoarded that dessert like a junkyard dog. No one was taking a sliver of this from me. It was fluffy and delicately tart. I devoured the whole thing in one sitting. Yes, I'm disgusting. The cheesecake, however, was not.

GET THE CHEESECAKE!
author: BleepBloop P.

description:
Had to try it out, and it was worth it. It's fluffy, delicious, not overly sweet, and definitely not the gelatinous type of dense cheesecake. I would have liked a LITTLE bit more crust though, but not a huge deal. 

We called in around 11:20am to have them set one aside for pick up at 2pm, which they were very willing to do on a weekday. Smooth sailing after that. 

We had the original because it was our maiden voyage.. but might try that strawberry one next.
author: Subie C.

description: Very disrespectful with customers. I called to make sure if they have cake available to and then go since I had to drive for an hour and the person the phone telling me it is my problem and she cannot hold a cake for me!! This is not how u treat your customers! I would love to drive an hour for getting your cakes but Now I would never come there again!! Such a shame for u in treating people like this!!
author: Nazanin D.

description:
I pre-ordered a blueberry cheesecake for my birthday from Zanze's a couple of days in advance. I had to make a change with my initial order and the staff happily accommodated me no problem. I came in and was promptly greeted by a woman who assisted me with my order. Before I knew it, a man brought out my BEAUTIFUL blueberry cheesecake from the kitchen and boxed it in front of me. Both of the workers were super nice and even wished me a happy birthday! Definitely friendly people here at Zanze's.

I've tried their original cheesecake before which is really good, but I prefer the blueberry cheesecake more. The cheesecake itself is light, creamy, and just the right amount of sweetness--not like other places where the cheesecakes are heavy and kind of just sit in your stomach. Their cakes are so delicate and fluffy that using the fishing line they give you to cut the cake is a must for perfect slices. The blueberries are fresh and compliment the cheesecake really well. My family and I couldn't get enough of the cake and kept taking more bites! We're already planning the next time we can have Zanze's again. Maybe Thanksgiving or the next birthday in the family lol.

So my main point is, best cheesecake ever made by really nice people!

And just a friendly reminder, they're CASH ONLY and closed on certain days so make sure you check! Oh and (I think) you have to pre-order your cakes.
author: Cristina L.

description: Wow!!! The hype is true, their cheesecakes are fluffy not dense which sets this place apart from the rest of the cheesecake shops. Zanze's cheesecakes are incomparable. If you're looking for a traditional dense cheesecake, then this is not for you, however, I noticed if you cut and air out the cheesecake for half hour or so, place it back in the fridge for a couple of days, and the texture will become slightly dense. Always call in advanced to reserve your Cheesecake.
author: Jeff D.

description: Yummmm! Best cheesecake I've had in awhile. It's so tasy, fluffy, soft, and literally melts in your mouth. Come early because they run out fast and bring cash, no cards allowed. I thought I've tasted good cheesecake but this is a life changer! Best cheesecake Hands down.
author: John A.

description: If you like cheesecake then I recommend Zanze's cheesecake! They sell the best and delicious cheesecake in the city!
author: Emma K.

description:
Whenever I introduce someone to Zanze's cheesecake, they admit that it's one of the best cheesecakes they've ever tried. It's light and fluffy and not overly sweet. I've always called 2-5 days ahead of time if I am in need of their cheesecake. The workers there are always pleasant (on the phone and in person). I've tried the original and the blueberry cheesecake. They have fondant decorations (happy birthday, congratulations, etc) if you need it (free of charge). I love the concept of using the clear wire to cut the cake... no need for all the fuss with the knife cuts!

CASH ONLY. Plenty of metered parking.
author: Jay Z.

description:
I got it for my birthday and I literally finished the whole thing (small one which was like $16-18) by myself. So good.

This place is CASH ONLY! so bring some cash :)
author: C M.

description: My son love the Cheesecake , so I got him the  Zanze's for his birthday and he really love it.  The best Cheesecake in town.
author: Mimi L.

description:
At first I thought the floss they gave with their cheesecake was for my teeth...to clean out that delicious graham cracker crust and the cheesecake particles.

The floss is actually for cutting the cake (notice I said cutting the cake and not cutting the cheese LOL).

Came here to buy my cousin's cheesecake cake. We ordered the original, because I really didn't want to have strawberries, and even though it wasn't technically my cheesecake, I was going to be eating most of it.

I'm a pig that way. I love cheesecake, and I'm extremely picky about who makes it.

This place and the Cheesecake Factory are my go-to places. You'll never, ever, ever catch me eating a Costco, Target, or Safeway-esque cheesecake.

They said we could freeze it so it could last longer. 

No need. It was gone within 3 hours of buying it.

Chomp...chomp...nom...nom....GONE!
author: Jack R.

description:
Just adding on to the other hundred of raving reviews so I'll keep it short and simple.

"Ermergherd! It's so FLUFFY!!! I'm gonna die!!"

Yeah, that about sums it up. Now I just need to go back and try all the other flavors. If you happen to be by in October, try the pumpkin topping; it compliments the cheesecake very well.
author: Elizabeth T.

description:
Wonderful quality cake. 

Plan ahead on ordering your cake and be mindful of the hours of operation.

A hit for parties.
author: Veranna N.

description:
What else do I need to say, their cheesecake is probably one of the best. It is light and fluffy and really not that expensive. I've had the original and with shaved chocolate topping and both of them were the bombe‼

They only take cash and they are closed on Sundays, Mondays and Tuesdays.  Try not to go there at the end of the day, they have been known to have run out of cheesecake before they close. Must try if you like your cakes light and fluffy.
author: Tony L.

description: Here's the thing- Do they make a killer cheesecake?  Yes.  Is it the least bit convenient to get?  No.  I like cake a lot, ok people?   However, I basically have to stalk the place and the hours are insane and not intuitive- also huge breaks after the holidays.  I feel like at least someone needs to acknowledge that- ah, I feel better.
author: Gina S.

description:
Let me start off with this statement: I don't like cheesecake.

But ever since I was a kid, we would order Zanze's cheesecake on special occasions -- birthdays, holidays, anniversaries. The texture is unlike any cheesecake you've ever tasted before. It's so delicate that you must cut it with a fishing wire. It's essentially crustless aside from a few crumbles. 

I like the plain/original cheesecake over any other one. . . but honestly, I don't think you can go wrong.
author: Lianne G.

description:
It tastes like you're eating fluffy, cheesy air.
Pretty good if you're in the mood for something light.  It tastes so guilt-free (although its not) that it's easy to eat the whole small pie to yourself.

I had the regular and the one with chocolate shavings and I thought the one with chocolate shavings was better.

They were nice enough to wrap it in plastic wrap so it wouldn't move around if you are taking it far.  They also give you a little piece that says happy birthday if you need it. But they forgot to put it on mine even though I repeatedly asked for it. SIGH.

Service is friendly. 
Plenty of metered parking or free residential parking a  block away.
author: Heejin L.

description:
Excellent cheesecake. So different from others.
The only thing is they are always sold out and makes it frustrating for customers who drive a long way there. 
Always call ahead before going !
author: Josie C.

description: It's good for what it is (a cheesecake soufflé really) but it's too insubstantial for my taste - it's merely sprinkled with a little bit of crushed graham crackers. Not my kind of cheesecake, and a little bummed given how out of the way it was. I'd rather have Japanese cheesecakes, which have more of a bite to them, or denser NY cheesecakes.
author: Nicola L.

description:
It was a gift but this Cheese cake is pretty crazy. 

First, you can't cut it.  No no no... they provide you a fishing line so you can cut it with the line.  And when people says, "It melts in your mouth..." they never tried Zanze's cheese cake cause they do melt in your mouth.  It's not too sweet which  is exactly what I love.

This is great news for me as I age to my 80s (I hope I don't go beyond 90 or so cause I hate to write review on adult diapers)... YOU DON'T NEED TEETH FOR THIS!!!  

Besides it's not too sweet, it's so fluffy that you can eat without teeth, the cheese flavor is relatively light which I don't mind.  I think it's a healthy dessert (And no, I'm not going to find out nutrient facts cause I want to keep eating it)

Want to impress someone?  Get a Zanze cheese cake!
author: Mark L.

description: This cheesecake is definitely different than your regular cheesecake. It is super soft to a point where it tastes mushy. It didn't have much of a cream cheese taste. Overall it was mushy and tasteless.
author: Gloria W.

description: Quite possibly the best cheesecake I've ever tasted. Fluffy, light, airy and not too sweet. So good!! I'm not a huge fan of heavy and dense cheesecakes so this is just perfect. The establishment is small so it's buy and go and the lady at the counter was super friendly. Will be back for a larger size. Give it a try if you love cheesecake !
author: William Y.

description: the cheesecake here is really good!   I love that its light without crust (thus good for me, a gluten intolerant person).   they have many special flavors too, such as pumpkin and blueberry.
author: Shuting Z.

description:
I had the most charming experience with the older gentleman at this shop.

the man himself is a legend, which adds character to this place. the cheese cake differs from traditional ones in the fact that these ones are light and fluffy instead of dense. these cheesecakes are so fluffy that in order to cut it, you have to use a fishing wire. definitely one of the best cheesecakes I've ever had. 

I just wish Zanze sold cheesecakes by the slice. I can't eat a whole one by myself...
author: David Z.

description:
It had been awhile since I had had some cheesecake from Zanze's and I had a hankering for some again so once I found an excuse to get a cheesecake (sister's birthday) I called and placed an order for pick up.  Found parking pretty easily first thing on a Saturday morning but I could see it being more difficult later on in the day.  I was pretty much in and out, paid for my cheesecake and out the door I went with it.  

I had been hyping it up to my sister and when we finally had some it wasn't as mind-blowing as I remembered it to be.  I don't know if it was just an off day or if the ingredients had changed but I realized then and there that I prefer my cheesecake denser and creamier with a thicker crust.  Their cheesecake is super light and fluffy with only a sprinkling of graham cracker crust on top.  However, it's not all that bad as I actually still get a craving for it every once in awhile, usually when I'm driving in the area.  

One thing to note: the man behind the counter handling the cash used his ungloved, unwashed hand to put the "happy birthday" piece on.  I was bothered by it and in hindsight I should have said something at the time :/
author: Carnita M.

description:
Oh my, oh fucking my.  This shit is heaven. There's something to be said about a place that seemingly has arbitrary hours that don't adhere to any sensible work schedule. It's not easy to get to this place if you work 9-5. But it adds to the journey. They're really reasonable considering the quality. 

I've never had a cheesecake like this in my life. I mean, you use fishing line to cut it, imagine that in your mouth. For the fanatics out there, this place is well worth the venturing. Plenty of parking, cash only, take out only. Guys, make your ladies happy, bring her anything on the menu(there isn't much).
author: Elton F.

description:
Finally had the chance to stop by before my dentist appointment. Their opening times vary and half the time they are closed due to other circumstances. 

They are cash only! 

I was fortunate to purchase a small cheesecake for about 11 dollars. The lady who packaged it was nice and asked if I needed someone to teach me how to cut the cheesecake. This is no ordinary cheesecake. You cannot simply just cut through it with a knife. A cheesecake of this caliber needs to be cut with a fishing line. Yes. A fishing line . 

You wrap it around two fingers and slowly 'floss' it through to get a perfect fluffy slice of cheesecake. This cheesecake is unbelievably light!!! The pros: um, a friggin pillow in your mouth. Cons: I can eat the whole cake by myself. What? I have no shame.

There is a light citrus-y flavor to is. Crust is perfectly flaky with a graham cracker feel(but lighter). Nicely packaged.

There was only 1 other couple in the store at the time but I heard it can get busy. It was about 11 dollars and I was in and out in 5 mins. Will be back!!
author: Wendy X.

description:
Have you ever eaten something so fluffy, so light, that it tastes like you're eating a little piece of heaven? And yes, it's fluffier than eating marshmallows. 

First off, I HATED cheesecake until I tried Zanze's. I always opt for the original cheesecake, which is cut with a fishline because it is just THAT fluffy and delicate. It is the only place I will get my cheesecake. 

When you take your first bite, you're like, "Okay, it's pretty good". 

And then you take your second bite, but this time, you'll be speechless because your taste buds have absorbed and processed every inch of the deliciousness of this cheesecake. You will feel pure bliss, or you might feel like you died a little on the inside just because it is THAT uplifting. This cheesecake is the epitome of a food orgasm. Yes I said it. UNCENSORED. It's like you're having an orgasm in your mouth. With each bite, you will feel a jolt of dopamine or serotonin or maybe even oxycontin rush through your brain...well at least I have. 

Not only that, but this little hidden gem is owned by the sweetest people so I am not surprised that their sweet concoction has captured the mouths of so many. 

Definitely a must try. 1000000% recommend it. 

Heads up: highly recommend to pre-order in advance for special occasions or holidays because they do run out fast.
author: Shirley L.

description: Sister bought an entire original cheesecake and I shared a slice with my partner. It's a light and lemony Japanese-style souffle-esque cheesecake, but halfway through my half of the slice (that's a quarter) it began to taste much less magical than it did at first.  After the degradation, it became only an average confectionery.  Not sure I would buy this myself.
author: Letitia L.

description: Soft...fluffy...cheese-cakey goodness. Make sure to use the string in the box to cut the cake, or you can just use a spoon and eat it all.
author: Christian H.

description:
I'm a semi-annual repeater of this business. 

During the last decade, I've met the pâtissier, customer service lady that I'd assumed his family member, his disciples- male and female, and they always made me grateful to be their customer. (Great chefs) x (Great Ingredients) x (Great recipe) = Great Food. The first sign of great food is great people working there. 

This is one of the last places in the city that I have 100% trust in their quality in every item they serve. I really wish they had non-cheesecake items too, but I can't complain when their specialty is immaculate. 

Every bite melts on your tongue so be sure to take time tasting every molecule of it. Perfect sweetness. Perfect Citric acidity. If this is how any pastry is supposed to be made, most pros will be out of business, for sure. 

Next time you wonder what you should buy for your friend's birthday or family gathering, consider Zanze's cheesecake. Worth a freeway drive.


* (Great chefs) x (Great Ingredients) x (Great recipe) = Great Food
Well it's a figure of speech and don't get too mathematical. Chef/Ingredient/recipe is the 3 major contributing factors for a dish. Great chef doesn't necessarily mean he has great recipes all the time. If he's not working with the right recipe, his calculations might fail.
author: yota L.

description:
I have been DYING to go to this shop just because I've heard so much about the cheesecake here. 

The shop is very small and the opening hours are a little difficult but trust me, it's worth getting a cheesecake. 

I had friends who were visiting at the time so I bought a medium sized cheesecake. The person helping me suggested that we get traditional because it was our first time. 

The cheesecake here is Italian style which means the cheesecake is airier and less dense compared to New York style cheesecake. Zanze's cheesecake is exceptionally airy. Heavenly airy. You use a fishing line to cut it!

So we take the cheesecake, sit down, and slice it up. After the first bite, I had to sit back and take it all in because it was just so damn good. Oh God. 

That cheesecake was pretty big for a medium but it was gone within a few hours. Do yourself a favor and get a cheesecake. I'm aiming for the blueberry one next.
author: Sofia R.

description:
I want to be a Golden Girl when I GROW up!

Instead of drunkenly chowing down on pizza and wings at 1 AM, I want to devour a cheesecake but not just any cheesecake...I WANT A ZANZE'S CHEESECAKE! http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/8oT00ympYI-mQ8KEetQ63g?select=h2Ox-C3oQCe7hePqEbXy6Q

A European-style, crust less cheesecake so light, soft, and fluffy that if a souffle and a mousse had a love-child, Zanze's Cheesecake would be IT. A delicate, circular piece of heaven that's velvety, slightly sweet with a nuance of lemon flavor and a light dusting of graham cracker crumbs to give it just a hint of crunch...it's made with love and tender care by the loveable Mr. Zanze himself. 

HOT DAMN! Imagine if the Golden Girls had Zanze's Cheesecake available to them in Miami. His cheesecakes would be bringing ALL the girls or shall I saw "women" to the yard especially Blanche. 

Sixty and STILL gettin' some? Oh hell yah, I want to be a Golden Girl when I GROW up!

Other Notes:
*CASH ONLY
*To avoid a sell-out, order your cheesecake in advance.
*Original Small ($14), Medium ($21), Large ($27); +$1-3 more for fruit topped cheesecakes.
*Keep refrigerated and take out cheesecake 10 minutes prior to serving.
*When using the fishing wire to cut the cheesecake, pull the wire towards you/away from you. Do NOT pull the wire straight up otherwise the delicate cheesecake will crumble to pieces. Bon Appetit!
author: Cherylynn N.

description:
It's so fluffy I'm gonna die!!

I had ordered a medium traditional cheesecake for a birthday over the phone and picked it up the next day. Process was very smooth and service was so courteous.   

These cheesecakes are unlike any I have had before, largely because most places make the denser variety.  These however, are so light and fluffy, it's like I didnt eat anything at all!  Ergo no guilty feelings.  

I almost docked a star off because of this since I should feel satisfied after eating something so delectable, but I end up wanting more.  Then I reasoned to myself, it's just so good, you can't help but want MORE!  Such a fine line...
author: Renee L.

description: Would have loved to give a positive review but... it's stormy out, pouring but I NEEDED something sweet and yummy.  So I searched for "sweets" near me and CHEESECAKE! Perfect! I bundled up and made my way to  this establishment. Two ladies were inside folding boxes, no greeting, barely eye contact. "What do you have today?" The reply "nothing". Not "nothing today but I'm so and so days we will have something". Just "nothing" for a small business the customer relations sucks.  Won't be back and cheesecake is my kryptonite!
author: Autumn A.

description: The best Cheesecake in San Francisco! I always get the original one even though there are seasonal flavors. I like to cool it overnight before I eat it. It comes with fish string for cutting, but my gf and I will just eat the whole thing without cutting it :)
author: Tim C.

description:
Okay, damn, I got told. Cheesecake's not one of my favorite desserts so I'm pretty picky about a GOOD cheesecake. I was at a friend's potluck and I was told "THIS IS THE BEST CHEESECAKE EVER!".

Psh. I'm always being told "this is the best ____" ever and become severely disappointed. But after staring at it for awhile wondering if it was worth the extra calories, I finally gave in.

It

Was

The

Bomb.


I got told. Don't let it happen to you.
author: Joanne Y.

description: I am not a lover of cheesecake....this is the exception.  It's very special for all the reasons listed by others.
author: Sue O.

description:
I called to reserve two small cheesecakes on a Friday afternoon and I'm so glad I did because they sold out by the time I got there! It's definitely the best cheesecake I've ever had: soft, moist, and super creamy. 

Service is also exceptional. You can tell they really care about their cheesecakes! I mentioned I was traveling with them and they wrapped it up with extra care and even added a happy birthday sign.
author: Allison S.

description: If you are craving for cheesecake  , this is the right place to  go . Delicious , very smooth ,creamy not too sweet . Reasonable price . I love the original cheesecake &  the blueberry flavor . It's very addictive ! Yummy yummy it really melts in your mouth . .
author: Erlinda A.

description: Finally, after several attempts, I got my cheesecake. By far the best cheesecake I found.  Ordered the pumpkin toppings cheesecake, it never disappoints me and my guests. While picking up my order, Mr Zanze, picked at their windows and wish me a Happy Thanksgiving . Really nice Man. Oh btw, You really have to call and order in advance, or else you can always see the sign says.. "WE are sold out".
author: Liza M.

description:
First time I ate their original cheesecake was just to try it out and see if it would be good as a birthday cake. Having driven by this places for well over a decade when I used to go to CCSF and 24HF, I never really thought much of the place... DEFINITELY WORTH IT.

Second time I ate it was for Lunar New Year as a dessert, of course. Still delicious!

Third time I ate it was for that birthday... still very good and everyone loved it.

Fourth time I ate it, it was leftovers from the first time and it was frozen. SO good! If you like the flavor of Zanze's cake but wish the density was higher, freeze it. It is ready to eat immediately!

This was all in the span of 7 days. Don't judge me.
author: Timothy L.

description: This place is really adorable , it's a very cute store and the cheesecakes since the beginning you can tell they are really good for its price :)
author: Henry L.

description:
I usually don't care about how big of a slice of cheesecake I'll get because I'm never a big fan, but when it comes to Zanze's cheesecake, I SO care! 

I'd been hearing about this place forever, and when I finally got to order one for my mom's birthday--I was beyond excited. I placed an order for a small one, and my sister helped me pick it up. When I got home, I immediately open the fridge, and just couldn't wait to see it and smell it (knowing I can't eat it yet). The cake, just by looking at it, already look super soft and fluffy! When I finally got to taste it, oh gawr, it was so good! It was perfectly sweeten and like its look, it was super soft and not heavy at all. It melts in the mouth without effort. After I had a slice, I didn't feel like I gained a million pound or what not. When my family and I were done with the whole cake...I wish I had order a bigger one. Next time!
author: Mandy C.

description:
My heart longed to try Zanze's popular and decadent cheesecake for forever!

The first time I had Zanze's was for a friend's birthday, it was a traditional cheesecake with rum soaked cherries. I didn't care much for the cherries but the cheesecake itself was delicious.

I recently went to Zanze's to buy a cake for my uncle's birthday. The owners are extremely nice!

The cheesecake is extremely delicate, so they provide you with fishing line to cut the cake with.
author: Mabel Y.

description: Delicious creamy cheesecake. Best cheesecake I have ever eaten.Even show you how to cut the cake with a string. Very popular place to order cheesecake.
author: Dirk D.

description: I didn't come to this specific store but a family friend came by to visit and decided to give my sister the original flavored cheesecake. i got to try a piece of it. I got to say that was pretty good. Fluffy, moist, and soft the way a cheesecake should be like. It wasn't too sweet but certainly it was yummy :))) VERY.
author: Lynh N.

description:
As the other reviews state, the cheesecake literally melts in your mouth! It is light and airy and oh so delicate. Extremely delicious.

When they say call ahead to order, call ahead! They take orders same-day until 12pm so make sure to call in the morning if you want to order last-minute. They sell-out every day so do not expect to be able to buy a cheesecake if you did not place an order!

Tried my first cheesecake last week and got the traditional. Simple, delicate, and delicious. Prices are very affordable too. I do suggest letting it chill in the fridge or even overnight to allow the flavors to develop more. I seemed to enjoy it more and more each day as it got a tad firmer, but I think I like my cheesecakes a bit denser.

Cutting it with the fishing line they provide is also unique and fun. If you're a newbie like me they'll give you a quick demo how to slice it!
author: Allison R.

description:
Everyone needs to try Zanze's cheesecake!  

I'm glad the owner is getting more help these days. I always questioned, how much longer will I get to buy these delicious cheesecakes?

I stick to the traditional cheesecake but I have tried other flavors. I love how their cheesecakes are not as dense as other cheesecakes! They make their delicate cheesecakes fluffy and airy, with the crumb cake on top! This is what keeps people coming back for more.
author: Nicky C.

description:
Woooooow literally the best cheesecake I've ever had!!! It's so light and fluffy, unlike a cheesecake from the cheese cake factory... I felt as if I would be able to finish the entire medium sized traditional cheesecake myself! 

When we first walked in they were super nice! I am definitely going to be coming back for more!!!
author: Lorina L.

description: They're closed for their summer vacay until 8/24/16! Guess we'll have to wait 'cause everyone deserves a vacation :)
author: E E.

description:
After looking through so many reviews, I just had to try this place. When I walked inside, the owner and the lady were so nice. They said hello with a friendly smile. You can just tell that they're so passionate working there. 

I bought a medium size traditional cheesecake for $22. It smells so nice and it's so delicate. Like the other reviews, I would have to agree that it's very light and fluffy. It is the best cheesecake ever. You won't regret it.
author: Sarah F.

description: Love the fluffy texture and perfectly balanced sweetness of the cake but there was merely a sprinkling of graham cracker dust. I'm personally a graham girl when it comes to cheesecakes and the lack of a golden buttery crust left me 10% unsatisfied. With this cake, I can forgive the lack of the thick crust because it's all about that light whipped texture that feel like your literally eating clouds.
author: Elizabeth K.

description:
If you wanna know what a real cheesecake feels like...try this. I'm a huge fan of desserts and I've had a lot of different cheesecakes. But this is the real winner coz they don't have any of the extra stuff to make it more luring. It is cheesecake in its purest form. It's like drinking water from a natural spring. Also, I didn't know I can finish the whole thing in under 10 minutes. 
I'm sure a lot of us have watched friends multiple number of times. If so, I hope you remember the episode where Chandler and Rachel hog onto a stolen cheesecake, even after it falls and splatters on the floor. That's what I'm talking about here ;)
author: Megha J.

description:
The cheesecake is impossibly fluffy and airy. It isn't as dense as a NY Cheesecake nor does it come with an impossibly thick crust. It also isn't as cakey as a Japanese style one...so pretty much, its as good as it gets for me.

Per the box, it also supposedly lasts 3 months in the freezer...just take it out and thaw. Let's be honest, it'll never last 3 months. Part of me wants to try it, but the other part of me knows my stomach will get to it first. But I can tell you that after a few days, it will start to get a little more dense...as noted by me finishing leftovers over the course of 3 days.
author: Elaine Y.

description: This is hands down the best cheesecake that I've ever had.  Light and sweet and sour and airy and out-of-this world delicious.  I'm always amazed at how many long-term residents still haven't uncovered this amazing gem.  Lots of things in San Francisco have changed over these last few decades, but this place has not changed one bit and I hope it never does.
author: Trigby P.

description: Legitimately the BEST cheesecake i've ever tasted...ever! highly recommend this place to everyone. the cake is light and fluffy. i swear, it's like eating a mousse with perfection! definitely will be making this the best cheesecake i've ever eaten! seriously
author: Tupou P.

description: This is quite simply the best cheesecake in the world! It's not New York style which is not what I grew up with, but European-style....light, creamy, and tender as a maiden's prayer. It's no wonder it's on the list of the nation's 5 best cheesecakes!
author: Edith C.

description: These are THE lightest most flavorful cheesecakes you can find ANYWHERE! Wonderful family owned business that I have been buying from for years. Just ordered my large original to take to friends for Thanksgiving. They also make a pumpkin top for the holiday, but not knowing if my friends were already making pumpkin & other pies, decided to go with the original flavor. It's a treat for any occasion and they are only open Wednesdays-Saturdays, so place your order in advance when you need it! They keep in fridge very well and can be frozen IF you have to. Can truly recommend them as "baking artisans". You cannot go wrong purchasing from them....the only problem you will have is NOT eating the whole cheesecake yourself-lol! Worth every penny! They do not do traditional decorating, but will accommodate in a special way if you inquire. Happy eating!
author: E. Lynn D.

description:
I love the cheesecake! 
Puffy cheesecake you can't get anywhere else. 
I used to go there every week when I live nearby. 
I moved to Mountain view and I still come to buy. 
Good luck to get it on thanksgiving, long line and sold out in 15mins after opening on the day last year.
author: Emily K.

description:
First time trying their cheesecake through my brother, I literally just died of deliciousness. I usually don't eat cheesecake often but when I do now, I come to Zanze's. I bought my friend a mini cheesecake for her birthday and she wanted to devour it all by herself. The light and fluffiness of the cake is whats makes it heaven on earth. 

For those cheesecake lovers, this is a must try!
author: Julie B C.

description: Very lovable cheesecake that is a favorite of many foodies I know. I really like what I have tasted. It was very light and fluffy compare to typical New York style ones. It reminded me a lot of the Japanese cotton like cheesecake that I once loved as a child. Just a tiny little denser and richer. If that is your kind of cheesecake, reserve one already.
author: Mona W.

description:
We had to try the cheesecake here after reading all the yelp reviews and it doesn't disappoint. It's one of the best cheesecakes I've eaten thus far.

1. The shop has been in the area for greater than 30 years. That's a testament to the quality for sure.
2. We got the small regular flavor cheesecake. It can comfortably feed 4 people
3. It's a cash only place. Please make sure to carry cash since I didn't notice any ATM's nearby.
