4. Preferably order a day in advance because there is a high chance that they will sell out of cheesecake.. They are very popular... But of course you know that :)
5. It remains fresh even after being in the freezer for an entire day

Highly recommended
author: Divya R.

description:
This cheesecake is really one-of-a-kind.  If you haven't tried it, get yourself over to Zanze's asap.  The cheesecake is fluffy and flavorful, and not overpowering in any way.    Instead of the typical cheesecake texture, it's more like a mouse.  The original is great, though I am exciting to try out the other flavors as well.  

The pricing is very fair and I think I'd prefer this over a typical cake (like for birthdays) any day.
author: Samantha L.

description:
I fell in love with cheesecake at a very young age. Growing up, every time my grandma came to visit (usually around once a year), she would always make me cheesecake. I equated cheesecake with love, family, and everything else warm and fuzzy. I've had Zanze's bookmarked for a very long time, but it wasn't until my birthday this past weekend when my boyfriend bought me a cake. A cake straight from heaven. 

The first bite is simply indescribably and in all my cheesecake eating experience, I've never tasted a cheesecake as light and airy as this. Zanze's opened my eyes to the European-style fluffy and delicate cheesecake. It's not the type of cake you'll find at Cheesecake Factory where you just feel sick after a slice. No, I could have eaten a whole small cheesecake to myself and not feel guilty. Clouds IN MY MOUTH.
author: Cindy A.

description:
Best Cheesecakes Ever. The cheesecakes are nice and super soft and completely different from almost any other cheesecake I've ever eaten. 

I ordered 1x Large Traditional Cheesecake, 1x Blueberry. Between 4 of us, we ate this within 3 days. It was so worth the calories. 

The couple are very friendly. She asked if this order was for a large party, I was embarrassed to say it was just for 4 people. LOL.

In fact, as I am writing this review, I think I will make a trip out there to buy another round.
author: Derek N.

description: "I have to get you one to take home!" My friend said as we were already running late to the airport, but I'm glad she insisted. The owner carefully wrapped one up for me for travel and the airy cheesecake flew with poise and grace from San Fran to Chicago without losing a crumb. I shared it with my family the next day using the fish line provided to cut tiny slivers out and everyone agreed that it's the very best cheesecake anyone has ever made ever!
author: Anna G.

description: Queen of all cheesecakes. I'm typically not a fan of the New York kind, which simply feels like sweet cheese on diabetes. I would rather eat cheese just by itself. However, Zanze's Cheesecakes are definitely like none other. So fluffy and soft that it can be cut with a fishing line, paired perfectly with the crumbly bottom crust. This place is popular, definitely recommend getting there early or calling ahead to reserve! Also CASH only.
author: Mandy C.

description:
Always over achieve  your expectation, WoW! 
Have Zanze's for uncountable times. Always fluffy, airy, and delicious.
Original is my favorite. If no one stops me, I guess I could kill a small cake at once. LoL 
Just want to tell you all how tasty it is. 
Don't tell me you don't like cheesecake b4 trying Zanze's. 
Zanze's is the best in SF. 
Call and reserve your own one for security. 
Holidays tend to run out really quick. 
Seeing a "sold out" sign on the door could be heartbreaking. 

Love love love Zanze's
author: JustinE Y.

description:
If Da Vinci was a Renaissance man innovating the art and science of this time, and Tupac changed the Hip Hop game by speaking about deeper issues, then Zanze's Cheesecake is the epitome of "God's gift to mankind via the form of a Cheesecake."  

I've heard of Zanze's multiple times via friends' pictures on social media.  The first time I tried Zanze's was on my birthday. Mr. and Mrs. Zanze both wished me a happy birthday as I ecstatically bought a small blueberry covered cheesecake for myself and a large regular cheesecake to share.  

The cheesecakes are so delicately soft that you need to cut them using the fishing wire provided on the box.  All of friends and family who have tried the cheesecake could not put it down.  The weight I have gained from eating the cheesecake has been one of the only times in my life where I haven't felt "as guilty."

Best advice is to place an order one week in advance because you may run into the chance of them selling out quickly.
author: Brian L.

description: One of the best cheesecakes around. Very different from traditional cheesecakes in that Zanze's is fluffy and airy. The original is the best variation. For any holidays, you have to preorder at least 1-2 months ahead. This is a San Francisco icon.
author: Cris P.

description:
Bf's sister brought a small traditional cheesecake over to the fam's house almost a year ago..& I still haven't shared with you all how amazing this cheesecake was..for shame on me!  

This is the lightest and fluffiest cheesecake that I've ever had.  It doesn't make you feel guilty at all & doesn't give you that heaviness in your heart feeling.  Who needs the graham cracker crust when you can some of it sprinkled on top.  Truly an amazing cheesecake!  I hope she brings it over again this year!
author: Cat C.

description: This little gem of a shop operates by it's own rules. That known, follow the rules and you will be happy. These rules are different from normal businesses, but if that is the price to pay for a one of a kind cheese cake experience, so be it. One of the rules is order ahead. Another is there are inconvenient hours. Another rule is show up hoping for a cake without knowledge of the first two is almost guarantee of disappointment. A final rule is, this cheese cake is worthy of the inconvenience and everything else. It is the lightest, subtlest, creamy but not filling thing your mouth will ever know. Plain is transformative, the other flavors are just gravy. Or fruit jam.
author: E. W.

description: Best to preorder before hand because they will sell out! One of the best cheesecakes I've had so far. We order the traditional. It's soft and light. Best of all, it best in your mouth. This cheesecake is so good.
author: Kristie C.

description:
Honestly I don't even like cheesecake but my sister raves about this place
And always has me get her cheesecake from here. I love their cheesecake 

This is a tiny spot off ocean avenue very easy to miss cause you just drive by. The shop small but you can see everyone making the cheesecakes from the counter. 

Cheesecakes are fresh and very smooth in texture. For someone that doesn't even like cheesecake I actually really enjoy this one! 

Tip: make an order over the phone over the holidays they can sell out!
author: Joanne K.

description:
I came here to pick up a cheesecake my girlfriend ordered. It's a small little place. I'm pretty sure it's family owned and when you walk in it doesn't seem like a cheesecake shop. Nevertheless, we bought a small regular cheesecake ($16) for an after dinner treat. 

I'm glad my girlfriend went and decided to order one since she had this placed bookmarked for a long time. The cheesecake was delicious, fluffy and full of flavor. It's topped with cake crumbs giving it a nice grainy texture with each bite. 

I would definitely come and try the other flavors but you can't go wrong with the original.
author: Benjamin C.

description:
Well, I bought a Medium size cheesecake  for my fiance's birthday today. I pre- ordered for a small on Friday, the lady that took my order was very friendly! I called back and switched the order to a medium size, no problem at all. Wonderful customer service! I had my father pick it up the next day, and he said it was super busy, but since I had pre ordered ..it had gone smooth. $22 for a Medium size.

This review is basically to back up every other review. It has to be one of the best cheesecakes i've ever had by far. Having to use the fishing wire to cut it, just shows how delicate it is. Its almost like you're eating a cloud i don't its just so light and fluffy, and I love how they put the "crust" on top. I will definitely be coming back here, and will definitely recommend this to anyone who is looking for delicious cheesecake in SF!! Everyone that had a piece loved it!
author: Coraline J.

description: Delicious cheesecake with a soft and creamy texture. I've had this multiple times, and the quality is very consistent.
author: Reser P.

description:
Only one word to describe there cheesecake " Heavenly "
I almost ate a medium size cheesecake all by myself in one sitting ! 
Its sooooooooo good !
author: Eric C.

description:
A-W-E-S-O-M-E.

What's Cheesecake factory when you have Zanze's? 

Zanze's cheesecake is fluff-tastic. Very rich, aromatic and soft and it feels like you're eating a cloud that melts in your mouth.

NOMZ.
author: Lisa Z.

description:
Zanze's is a cute little bake shop on Ocean. It is a complete mom and pop shop. When I went in, pops, was in the back baking while mom was ringing up orders. I was a little disheartened when I found out that only the original flavor was available. The one with the chocolate shavings looks amazing!

The cheesecake is light and fluffy-- simply delicious! There's is no other cheesecake quite like this one. It has a complete different taste then you'r typical Cheesecake Factory style. If you're looking for thick and dense, this is the wrong type. Personally, dense cheesecakes are my favorite but Zanze's did an amazing job at getting me to fully enjoy a light one. I did taste a difference, however, between the cheesecake at room temperature and straight out of the fridge. The fridge gave it a slightly denser feeling, if that is what you like.

Definitely worth trying! I hope to go back and try their other flavors as well. On a personal note, I am always a little turned off when I see a "cash only" sign which Zanze's is. Make sure to make a trip to the bank first if you are like me.
author: Priyam D.

description: Amazing. The absolute most magical cheesecake i've ever had. I don't know how they make it so light and fluffy. This will be my show-stopping dessert that I take to parties from now on.
author: Anu A.

description: so soft, so amazing, possibly best cheesecake in SF! just be aware of their hours etc, I often walk by and they aren't open!
author: Emma G.

description: Damn, best cheesecake ever!! So fluffy and creamy when eaten fresh! Still great after refrigerated for a night or two. Got to try chocolate and blueberry flavors, though need to order ahead.
author: Lance K.

description:
I am a cheesecake whore, love it. My death row meal is a cheesesteak sandwich and cheesecake.

Being a former east coaster, I like my cheesecake dense, so while I was excited to try this cheesecake I was dubious. I was thinking "light and airy" might taste more like sara lee, or those "no bake" crappy cheesecakes.  This has the real cheesecake flavor of a dense NY style cheesecake but the texture is like no other cheesecake I've had. 

I fully enjoyed the zanze cheesecake and I will be back for more. I kinda wish they would make a dense version too :)
author: Amy W.

description:
I've been meaning to try this place ever since my cousin raved about it. And I finally got the chance to when I ordered for a dinner party a couple days ago. I got a medium raspberry cheesecake and the total came out to $24--not a bad deal for something so fresh and made with care. 

I preordered over the phone a day before and wasn't sure about the sizes, wavering between a small and medium. If you're in doubt, I'd go with the medium--it was just the right size for our group of 5 people, and we each had XL slices with some extra left over. (The small is best for an individual or couple)

I appreciate Zanze's because this is the type of mom and pop business that you don't see too often--a truly small operation that is run by a husband and wife. It feels good to support a neighborhood establishment. The service is friendly, and the fact that they include the fishing line on the outside of the box (for a smooth cut) is a nice touch.

As far as taste, the fresh fruit topping was great. I loved the tartness of the raspberries. And like everyone has said, the cake has a very light, fluffy texture--creamy and almost mousse-like. I think I'm more partial to the regular thick cheesecake though--that's where the minus one star comes from...but to each his own...If you're debating, I'd still give it a taste so that you can decide for yourself.
author: Lisa N.

description: All I can say is that this is the best Cheesecake that I ever had, super fluffy, light in sugar, and absolutely delicious.  The only improvement that I can say is please stay open for an extra day.
author: Wil M.

description: Lightest, most fluffiest cheesecake, EVER! It's not dense as most cheesecake places make them. So light and fluffy they provide you with a strip of fishing line to cut it. Wish there was more crust to it, but it's still good none the less. Not too sweet, but perfectly creamy, and airy. Must try it!
author: Jenny L.

description: One word... A.M.A.Z.I.N.G!!  Ran into this hidden gem by default & I didn't walk out disappointed. My favorite cheesecake spot was all sold out. I needed a cheesecake so I yelp'd cheesecakes & fund this spot & boy am I glad I did. I'm not sure if the lady that helped was the owner or not. But they only sell one kind of cheesecake. It's not New York style it's European style cheesecake. They're all plain, however they can add fresh berries or fruit to it if you want. The lady was so helpful in explaining why their cheesecakes are different from others. You're suppose to serve it warm, however I like it chilled in the fridge. It's SOOO airy & light. U cut it with a clear String that they provide to you.  Everyone at the party was so impressed with this cheesecake I gave about 6 people their name & number so they can go there. Best spot by far that I found on Yelp! So thank u Yelp! Haha
author: Royal H.

description:
Easily the best cheesecake I had.

It is the softest, most delicate and delicious cheesecake i had. It is certainly far from fancy, but it represents the fundamentals of a cheesecake at its best. No fancy ornaments, and a few flavors to choose from. Nonetheless, it is a must have for all those who truly love and understand cheesecakes.

I have heard few individuals say that the cheesecake is too soft, but as a person who have baked cheesecakes before, i quite don't understand what that means (cheesecakes are supposed to be soft..).  

This man did what Jiro did for sushi.
author: HW Y.

description: Utter genius. The cake just melts in your mouth. And the fishing line is really useful, as the cake might crumble with a knife. It's that soft! Seems hard to get an order, as they make limited quantities?
author: Anupam S.

description:
THIS IS THE BEST CHEESECAKE YOU WILL EVER TASTE!!! 

Extremely fluffy, light, and melts in your mouth!  It's perfection.  It's so fluffy that you don't even need a knife to cut through it.  Mr. Zanze gives you a fishing line to cut the cake and he'll teach you how to do it if it's your first time.

Mr. Zanze is an incredibly sweet, patient, and cute little old man.  He cares for his customers very much and makes his cheesecakes with love.  The shop is very small and hidden away from the hustle and bustle of the city.  Only about 50 cheesecakes are made daily.

My parents used to go here as a young couple and eat a whole small traditional cheesecake in one sitting!  My little sister who normally doesn't like cheesecake LOVES Zanze's!  It's THAT good.  You MUST go here at least once in your lifetime.  Zanze's holds a special place in my heart and I hope you enjoy his cheesecakes as much as I do!
author: Francesca L.

description: Not your typical dense and overly sweet cheesecake. It is like taking a bite of air...but mouth-watering, fluffy, cheesecake air. Best I've ever had.
author: Clarissa P.

description:
BEST CHEESECAKE EVER!

It's not like the one's we're used to...but that's why I love it! Light, fluffy, airy, but still creamy and cheesey.

Owner is really nice, but since he's the only one in the front, there is usually a wait -- but only of one or two people. 

And they also have very little store hours.. make sure they're open before you drive out here. I've come here many times when they're not open and I wanna kick myself everytime. What a tease.. just makes me want it more!
author: Athena L.

description:
I'm in love. 

Zanze's Cheesecake is a small shop that offers cheesecakes in six flavors and three sizes, but that is all you need. I had my doubts prior to coming here because I've never been a cheesecake fanatic, but Mr. Zanze changed everything. When I walked into his shop, when I brought the cake to the car, and even when I had my bites, the same reaction ran through my head: "IT SMELLS SO HEAVENLY!!"

Mr. Zanze is such a sweet man. When he overheard that my companions and I may not be enjoying his cheesecake right away, he walked out from his kitchen and told us to put the cheesecake into the fridge 10 minutes prior to eating for the best experience. Sigh, why didn't I take a photo with Mr. Zanze when I had the chance!? *still regretting*

Lucky us, we were able to enjoy the cheesecake right away. His cheesecake is A-M-A-Z-I-N-G, the best I ever had! With other cheesecakes, just two bites in and I'd already feel overwhelmed, but his cheesecake is beyond that. The texture is creamy but light and fluffy. Every bite melts in your mouth. It is also very delicate, somewhat mousse-like that you'll need to cut it with a fishing net (provided for free). Please, no knife. There's even a Youtube video on how to properly cut his cake (http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=fyyOCaNwMTs). What's even cooler is that it can last up to 3 months if stored in the freezer. I seriously wish I had the chance to buy another.

This place is a gem. I'm so jealous of all you San Franciscans!
author: Huong T.

description:
Get the Original cheesecake.

Delicate and smooth.

Beware of holidays and Order in advance! They get so busy that they stop taking orders. Very nice people.
author: Larry L.

description:
Came here because they had great reviews and we were trying to find a dessert to bring to a family BBQ. I was actually a bit disappointed by the taste. It is ridiculously fluffy that it almost tastes like cheesecake whip cream. If you aren't a fan of whip cream I wouldn't recommend buying their cheesecake. 
The staff was very nice and helped us instantly. 
I don't think I will be buying another cheesecake from them though.
author: Momoko K.

description:
One of the best parts about living on the western side of the city is that I'm closer to Zanze's Cheesecake. As you can tell by all the reviews, I'm not the only one who loves this place. Even though his cheesecakes are light and fluffy, they still have all the flavors that make a great cheesecake: sweet, rich, and cheesy. What sorcery is this? 

Someone mentioned that a Japanese/Asian cheesecake is a cheaper alternative, but it's not comparable when it comes to taste. Asian cheesecakes tend to be pretty soft also, but they're more starchy and aren't as rich or cheesy. They definitely don't have Zanze's ability to pack a full flavored cheesecake into a lighter package. Seriously, his cheesecakes defy the laws of physics.
author: Nei N.

description:
Zanze's Cheesecake is absolutely amazing.

First, the product. It is so light and fluffy, you hardly have to chew. It is neither too sweet nor too cheesy, just an airy delightfulness. Eating Zanze's cheesecake is what I'd imagine eating a cloud feels like. I've given this cake to multiple people who say they don't like cheesecake and they ask for seconds. The crust is light crumbs on the top rather than a hard layer on the bottom. I've ordered the small and it lasted me several days of delightful sweetness, between myself, the husband and one guest. 

Second, the service. The attentive and caring service of this establishment is what makes this a five star review. Two months ago, I drove 25 minutes each way to pick up a cake for the husband's birthday. He'd had a couple bites of a Zanze cake when we were over at a friend's place and promptly announced that we must have this cake for every special occasion. When I arrived, a polite older lady took my order and carefully boxed and wrapped the cake. She asked if there was a special occasion and added a happy birthday sign made out of chocolate to put on top. Only when she rang me up did I realize that they only accept cash. I was so embarrassed and told her that I didn't enough cash. I rummaged through my purse and pulled out enough for a small cake, not the medium caked that was already boxed. She paused, looked straight at me and said, "It's alright, why don't you pay me tomorrow?" I told her that I had gone quite out of the way to get here and wouldn't be able to come back. I apologized profusely and asked if I could have a small cake instead. She said, "You know what? Just take it. Tell your husband to have a happy birthday." This concession only cost her $5 but earned her a customer for life. I was so blown away by her kindness, I wanted to reach across the counter and hug her. 

Last week was my birthday and I knew that if I had a cake, it would be a Zanze's cheesecake. I came in, cash in hand, and ordered my cake. The same older woman boxed and tied the cake with care. They don't have an electronic register, she wrote down my order in a notebook and entered the amount into a calculator. She took her time to ask how my weekend was going. When I gave her extra money and told her that I owed her for the previous cake, she smiled and said thanks and have a nice day.

This place is old school and I love all the effort that goes into a delicious product and superb service!
author: Emmi D.

description: Had heard about this place for a long time and finally got to try it. Best cheesecake  in Bay Area!!! Cash only
author: Kiwi H.

description: This place is all cheesecake all the time. We got the last non-pre-ordered cheesecake available. And they teach you a special way of cutting it using a string. Pretty neat stuff. Specialization is the key to success in this day and age.
author: Andrew K.

description: Fluffiest cheesecake you will ever have.  They give you a length of mono-filament line to cut the cake.  Hours are limited and they sell out every Christmas season.  Worth the effort to get one.
author: Chuck B.

description:
To anyone reading this now, to save you the trouble of debating whether or not to buy their cake, JUST DO IT.

As the 300 or more previous reviews say, their cheesecake is simply light, airy and delicious. So my review is simply to support those reviews and to support Zanze's. And remember to bring cash please :) Last time I went, I didn't know and I was short $0.50 but the lady still gladly sold it to me.
author: Fiona L.

description:
I have been going to Zanze's for several years now because their cheesecakes are so good - a very nice balance between fluffiness and sweetness.

The level of sweetness is just right and I can eat a big chunk of the cake without feeling "sweet-heavy". I think a lot of other cake places nowadays just make their cakes sugar-loaded and overwhelming. Definitely give it a try if you like light cheesecakes.

Tips: If you want a cake during a holiday season (Thanksgiving and Christmas especially), it is best to pre-order and pick up! No kidding because their cakes got sold out so quickly and they are closed for many days during holidays. I didn't pre-order and got there one year and they sold out everything and closed for almost a week.
author: Lena H.

description:
This place is so worth trying if you never had it before.

I couldn't believe how amazingly light and airy the whole cheesecake was. Cheesecakes are usually creamy and dense, which is delicious, especially with a hot cup of tea or coffee. But Zanze's cheesecakes are light and fluffy, which makes them amazing. When you take a bite, it is like eating cheesecake clouds. You cut the slices with floss, and it actually works amazingly well. Cutting with a knife would probably ruin the whole cake because it is very delicate. So just use the floss taped on the corner of the box.

On the other hand, I noticed they are going on vacation until August 2012 (2 months). I would strongly recommend calling-in to check if they are open and maybe pre-ordering before jumping into the car and heading over to the store. It is small store and hours and cheesecakes could be limited.
author: Janice T.

description:
Whatever you do, whatever you THINK you know about cheesecake, do yourself a favor and try a Zanze's cheesecake!!
I have been eating Zanze's cheesecakes for 2 generations now (First, from his Father and now from Sam Zanze) and I can only tell you that this is the most amazing cheesecake ever, and there are absolutely no other that compare. 
This is a light, fluffy, airy, delicious cloud of cheesecake goodness!!
(If you like the heavy, dense, too-rich New-York style cheesecake, you just don't know cheesecake)
author: Christine Z.

description:
Light, airy cheesecake fans only! My parents send me to buy Zanze's for them every time before I go home. They're obsessed. It's fluffy and feels like you're eating a cloud. 

I did buy one for my friend who's a self professed cheesecake lover and he thought it wasn't dense enough, so I guess you have to have a certain taste for the texture.

Price is decent at $16 for a small, you get about 8 slices. Cash only. And the owners are as sweet as their cakes!
author: Winnie T.

description: Love the cheese cake, soft and not too sweet. Just sell it so quick!!! Need to come as earlier as you can.
author: Claire H.

description:
I'm not much of a cheesecake kinda gal, but this place has some pretty good cheesecake. I pre-ordered the small traditional cheesecake and it was light, fluffy and not too sweet. The owner's incredibly nice and she even showed me how to cut it with the fishing line (included). Very reasonable price. Make sure call ahead. I will definitely be coming back! 
Cash only.
author: Jingle A.

description:
An avid traveler who must get a taste of the best offerings of this lifetime. So I got an invitation from a friend to try offering of cheesecake that Zanze has to offer and without a doubt, seeing I am a pastry lover, I gave in. Hmm!!! I will definitely have no regrets about this venture as I was more than pleased with the presentation, taste, offerings and services I received when I stopped by. The environment is obviously safe for everyone to pass and stop by and if you feel the delights are too sweet for your diet, let me tell you, they are natural tasting, not too sweet yet not "fresh" as they seem to take careful actions in the preparation process. 
I enjoyed every bit of the experience and certainly will have to visit again in the near future...Good job Zanze.
author: Chevonize M.

description:
Beautiful, perfect, light, old world recipe!

$14 for a small cheesecake--- so delicate, to be sliced with a modified dental floss, just like fluffy Czech bread dumplings, knedliky! The recipe from Mr Zanze hails from relatives and family from the Dalmatian coast.

Lots of love inside the beautiful dessert, and it was a spectacular treat and convo piece to bring to an event! Lucky us Bay Area folk, and luckier still those in Lakeside and West Portal!!
author: Jana C.

description:
I've been meaning to go here forever but the operating hours just have never worked out for me.  Luckily I found a convenient Saturday and we bought two large cheesecakes for good measure.  Each large one provides 12-14 servings depending on how big you cut the slices.  And based on how light and fluffy these cheesecakes are, you may have to cut larger slices for people.  These are not the kind of cheesecakes where it's just so rich that the last few bites are just painfully hard to get down.  Zanze's cheesecakes don't even seem like what you envision a typical cheescake tasting like.  Can you believe that you're recommended to cut the cheesecake with a provided fishing line?  If you cut it otherwise with a knife or metal utensil, you risk having the cheesecake clump up as you cut slices and it just won't look nice when served.

You know you have a successful cheesecake business when:

- You see Sam Zanze working in the background even though he's been so successful in this business; just shows he's passionate about what he's doing (or doesn't want to give away the secrets to making his awesome desserts!)
- You only have cheesecake on the menu and the other varieties of cheesecakes are simply ones that add blueberries or raspberries on top.  So simple!
- You make a cheesecake with no crust and people are still flocking to buy it like people were after those Tickle Me Elmos back in the day (ok, not as dramatic, but you get the idea)
- You can shut down the shop for multiple months during summer and come back to start the cheesecake frenzy again
- You have a small shop, with no seating, just large enough to distribute cheesecakes to the customers

Too bad it's located all the way down Ocean Ave near SF State or else I'd probably be here a whole lot more often

Note: I haven't ordered around the holidays but Sam indicated that it's best to place a Thanksgiving/X-mas cheesecake order at least 2.5-3 weeks in advance just to be sure you'll get one
author: Albie F.

description:
Oh how I longed to taste you since cheesecake I do love and adore you. To my dismay it was just ok. Yes it was delicate and had a subtleness to it, not too sweet and tart. The fun part was cutting it with the fishing line that was provided. Maybe another time Zanze's but this time I think I will pass. 

PS CASH ONLY
author: Mary Ann B.

description:
This place has light and airy cheesecake. You are probably never going to find another place that serves cheesecake like this.
I got the raspberry one and it was so light and decadent. We didn't even eat it the day of, we ate it the second day. But it tasted so good. You could taste the cream cheese and the raspberry puree. But something about that raspberry puree was so fresh. It wasn't overly sweet. It was literally raspberry puree. 
Hands down, best cheesecake ever. You can eat the whole thing and not feel bloated. You'd probably feel guilty though, for eating a whole cheesecake.
author: Jessica H.

description:
Amazingly good cheesecake! You guys weren't kidding about the fishing line to cut it! =)

I really enjoyed the traditional cheesecake (Graham Cracker Topping)! Very light, very fluffy, not too sweet...very good! NOM NOM NOM

Store hours are kinda weird, cheesecake isn't. ;)
author: Marc E.

description: Best cheesecake ever! And ya know what? I hate cheesecake. So light + fluffy...super addicting. I've been converted. Seriously.
author: Julie L.

description: this cheesecake is bomb! fluffy. .light. delicious. its become our  dessert tradition for thanksgiving at my house.
author: Angela N.

description:
"Zanze" means "little angel" in Venetian told to me by the owner himself, Sam Zanze. 

 This cheesecake store on Ocean Avenue is a "little gem" of a find. 

 I was dissatisfied with a dense NY cheesecake that I bought from a school fundraiser so decided to purchase another cheesecake based on high Yelp reviews from this place.

Store front - Basic with the proper information that you will need.  We were recommended to try the "traditional" cheesecake first before jumping into the ones w/ fruit toppings. 

Cheesecake prices run between $14-$24 based on size (S-M-L).  Cash and Check only. 

I purchased the blueberry cheesecake and it looked so divine and light that I did not want to mess up the top.  

You can cut the cake with a fish line provided to you on top of the box.

I found an article on SFGATE in 1997. It says that the cheesecake is made with no flour or butter. It's souffle like because Sam uses "dry cottage cheese"

He makes 50 cheesecakes a day. Call ahead as he takes vacations.  

He only sells to Mollie Stones on Poterero Drive per the SFgate article but it's dated in 1997. Use at your own discretion. 


Article: http://www.sfgate.com/cgi-bin/article.cgi?f=/c/a/2007/04/15/PKGRJN8BKR1.DTL
author: Jboogie L.

description:
The best cheesecake in the city.  Sam is a wonderful man, doing amazing work!
You MUST try the cherry kirsch cheesecake.
Can't say enough great things about Zanze's!  Not to be miissed!
author: Peter C.

description: So fluffy and light! Don't forget to ask for the happy birthday piece if you're getting the cake for a bday.
author: Miri Kwon R.

description:
Zanze's serves super fluffy, airy cheesecake.

They are open during normal business hours, so it's pretty hard to get if you have a normal 9-5 job. 

Call me a heathen, but I prefer the super dense NY style myself, but this is good too. Zanze's is more similar to the Japanese style cheesecake souffle. There is no thick crust at the bottom, but a light dusting of crust on the top. You get a fishing line to cut this super soft cake. 

We got a medium size cake for 6 people. We were super full from dinner so we couldn't even finish half. I would say medium should be sufficient for 8 if it's after dinner. Maybe even 10 if you don't eat too much.
author: Julie K.

description: Omg.... This cheesecake has got the be the best cheesecake I've ever had. It's true, if you could eat a cloud, I would imagine it taste like zanze's cheesecake. I don't like my cheesecakes too rich or sweet and this cheesecake is absolutely on point. This is a must try at least once in your life. Lol
author: Ewan H.

description:
I have driven by Zanze's for years and the shop was never open.  Today the cheesecake gods were smiling on me, and on the way home from my dentist I saw the shop was OPEN!   I almost caused a car accident swerving over to park.  

I had their cheesecake once, but it was at a loud dinner party, likely competing with more glamorous looking desserts.  This cheesecake is unassuming but mighty.  

Do yourself a favor, plan on trying your first Zane's in a quiet space, with just your loved ones and that fish line for slicing.  So light.  So fluffy. Very un-NY, but this is a large enough planet where all cheesecakes can get along.  

Viva Zanze's! Awesome cheesecake and super lovely staff.
author: Susie M.

description: Best cheesecake I have ever had. Pair it up with a glass of Riesling and you will be very happy! The cheesecake is very light and fluffy. There's a certain way to cut the cheesecake, and they will always ask you if you have had their cheesecake before then they will show you how to cut it properly. They were also featured on the 7x7 magazine! Cash only :)
author: Stephanie L.

description:
To quote Nu Flavor:
"Heaven oh heaven can't you help me
I'm down on my knees please help me"

These heavenly whipped light cheesecake has brought me down to my knees with every bite. It's super fluffy and airy, a special take on a traditional cheesecake where they dust the golden graham crumbs on the top. They don't open on Sundays and they close early on Saturdays, I might have to plan accordingly to get my hands on you, but you are so so so worth it!
author: Elaine Y.

description:
Plain Cheesecake

Three words: Light, Fluffy, DELICIOUS!
author: Lisa H.

description: My mom used to take me here back in the 80's.  It was her favorite.  After many years, I went back with my son.  Zanze's is still amazing!  All they sell is cheesecake.  And it is as light and as fluffy as mentioned in the other reviews.  Although I am used to a heavier and denser cheesecake, the ones here are heavenly.  Try it, you'll like it!
author: Funk G.

description: This place is very awesome and unique. The cheese cake itself is very light and fluffy like eating through a cloud. It's night your average cheese cake which is normally thick and dense. This place is cash only which is fine...there is a ATM down the street. Sometimes I add the raspberry topping or was it strawberry, not sure but it adds that extra tartness to the cheese cake. With or without topping...it is very good!
author: Phi N.

description:
Never heard of this place, and was taken here on a whim by a friend. I had no idea what to expect, and my friend had not said anything about this place besides that it was really good cheesecake. 

Place is a tiny little shop amongst many along ocean ave, making it really easy to miss. Gotta park in the residential area since there is no private lot.

As for the cheesecake itself, OMG!!!! Never had I ever encountered something so simple looking, yet so... Amazing! I was confused as to why there was plastic string (fishing line) attached to the box. I learned that it was used to cut the cheesecake because it is so delicate. The fishing wire makes clean, precise slices. Knives would take big chunks out of the cheesecake so DO NOT USE KNIVES. To say the least, it is light. It was almost like a soufflé with a light graham cracker crust  dusted on top with powdered sugar. The flavor was so light and not overpowering. Its not overly sweet or heavy, making it a great change compared to other cheesecakes. 

If ever you are in the sf area, this is definitely the place to get spectacular cheesecake for a reasonable price.
author: Craig K.

description: I finally had the cheesecake and it was just Japanese cheescake so it wasnt anything too special
author: Jenny N.

description:
100 out of 100 on the health score. (didn't know that was possible!?)

Friendly; asked how I found them, suggested the original since it was my first time, taught me how to cut it.

The absolute best cheesecake I've ever had, in fact, one of the best CAKES I've ever had.  Not a big fan of the super rich, thick and creamy stuff so this was perfect.  If you don't typically like cheesecake, give this a go, it will change your mind.

You can't go wrong, and I can't wait to go back, and there's still half a cake in my fridge. YUMMM!!!!!!!!
author: Tiffany W.

description:
The most incredibly fluffy, and amazing cheese cake I have ever eaten. The cake is so soft that they give you a fishing wire to cut the cake and prevent it from falling under its own weight. Wow!!

The owners/staff are super nice and are very welcoming as well.
author: Anwar H.

description: I don't normally like cheesecake, but Zanze's is the only exception. It's the BEST cheesecake ever! I have never been to the shop, but I've been fortunate enough to have a Zanze's Cheesecake-loving uncle who always picks one up and brings it over for dessert at the house. It is the fluffiest, tastiest cheesecake. The reason I'm not a big cheesecake fan is bc I find them generally too heavy and overly rich. Zanze's is light and you don't feel like you're ingesting 800 calories (even if you really are). The cheesecakes are so delicate; they come with a fishing wire to slice the cake with. Awesomeness! Now that my uncle moved away, I must go there myself. Worth the trek out to Ocean Ave!
author: Liv A.

description: A simple cheesecake shop on Ocean. Simple and the best I have ever had! Creamy and fluffy cheesecake with chocolate shavings and fishing line to cut each slice.
author: Tess Y.

description:
My friends love cheesecake but it's very difficult to find a place that pleases them. One by one I've bought a cheesecake for them from here and each time it has been given their seal of approval. It's not your NY cheesecake slice where it's thick and dense. No, Zanze's cheesecakes are ultimately fluffy and nearly melts in your mouth. My mouth is watering just thinking about digging into a slice right now! 

The shop is really easy to miss though. Even though it's only street parking, it's not a very busy street so it shouldn't be that difficult. The storefront is so adorable and looks like the front of an elegant bakery. When you step in, all you see is a counter and a big wall w/a large hole. Sometimes you can see Zanze himself whipping the batter (by hand no less) through the makeshift window. The aroma of freshly baked cheesecake just surrounds you like a warm blanket. The smell is so intoxicating, it makes you want to dig into the cheesecake right when you get your hands on your parcel! 

To cut the cake, they tape a string of floss to the box (it's really too soft and fluffy to use a knife). They are extremely nice, so if you don't know how to cut the cake using the floss, they will gladly teach you!

I highly suggest calling in early to place an order as they run out extremely quick. You HAVE to try the cheesecake here if you love cheesecake!

Tip: Sometimes, if I made fresh compote I would also use it to accompany the slice since I love fruit w/my cheesecake. Not that it's really needed but sometimes, you gotta have fresh fruit!
author: Kitty K.

description:
Delicate, Delicious, Light 

I enjoyed the experience of cutting this cheesecake with a fish wire. It was fun for all of us! 

The taste. 
I got the first slice, Although it was gone too soon, I still got to enjoy it thoroughly. I added Honey Almond crisps to it, it was simply amazing- what can I say.

I rated it 4 stars because I feel like cheesecake needs to be a thicker. It almost took away from the fact that it was cheesecake by being so fluffy. But I still really enjoyed.
author: Karina G.

description:
I have nothing but incredible things to say about Zanze's!! The cheesecake is TO DIE FOR!! The owner is super nice, this place is small but very cute, small business owners who are passionate about what they do, hard working people who run there business every day and give it 100% It Makes for a great end product. 


Definitely Best Cheesecake In The Bay Area!!
author: Eva O.

description:
I don't have much luck with Zanze's.  Aside from the very first time when I randomly stopped in & got a Blueberry cheesecake 2 years ago, I have not been able to get another one again (always closed for vacation).

On a random day, the Boyfriend & I went over to his mom's office to pick up a package & since it was just half a block away from Zanze's, we thought "what the heck, let's go see if it's open."  Well what do you know, it was!  Our luck continued when we saw a Mocha cheesecake sitting in the glass case; usually this flavor needs to be ordered.  We quickly snatched it up.  The cake was good & tangy without overshadowing the coffee flavor.  The chocolate shavings on top were nice but it made cutting the cake with the fishing line difficult.  Of course, the texture was just as creamy & fluffy as I remembered.

I was slightly disappointed that we weren't greeted by Mr. Zanze when we walked through the door and the fact that I don't know when I will be lucky enough again to come here when it's open.  But given the cheesecakes I've had, it's worth the wait.
author: Karen S.

description:
Great Cheesecake.

We hand carried one to China for my mother in law.

Mr. Zanze is also a really nice guy.
author: Peter F.

description:
I was lucky enough that my BFF bought me a Zanze's cheesecake for my birthday. 

I was in love.... to the point where I wanted to roll around and rub the cheesecake over my face like lotion and bathe in it.

It was AWESOME. One of the best cheesecakes that I've had. It is light and fluffy like a mousse, but lighter!

Flavor was perfect and it was like eating fluffy cheesecake clouds...

In love..... 

They provide the fishing string to cut the cake with!

Go there. NOW!
author: Vicky L.

description: You can never go wrong with the original cheesecake here. Always light and fluffy and never too sweet. I tried the chocolate covered one once and it will never compare to the original. The chocolate shavings replaced the graham cracker crumbs and overpowered the delicate taste of the cake. Wished they had an option to put on extra graham cracker crumbs though.
author: Binh P.

description:
Small yet charming little store and people. 

I dont realy like sweets, but i do love cheesecake. And i have had this a few times and love gettint this for my birthday. So amazing and tasty, light and fluffy and for me, it doesnt get much better than this.
author: Benjamin B.

description:
My friends brought one during a party. It was just amazing. So I decided to get one by myself when I went to SF today. 
I believe there are many comments regarding its merits of being light and fluffy, so I am not going to repeat here. However, I would like to highlight its impressive choice of sugar usage. In my opinion, it is not so sweet as some other desserts in US, e.g., the cheesecake factory. I think this would be excellent for people like me, who would prefer reduced sugar food. "Reduced" upon US standard, but close to Asian taste.
author: Lichen W.

description:
AMAZING!  It was the best cheesecake that I have ever had.  

My friend was so sweet to buy me a cheesecake from Zanze.  The cake was very light, fluffy, soft, not overly sweet but very rich.  Just so GOOD!  

Too bad that I need to watch my diet, otherwise I can definitely kill the whole cheesecake by myself.
author: Liza T.

description: Light and fluffy, made with loving hands.  Enough said.  Beware that they do take vacations.
author: Helen L.

description:
I'm a fan after the first bite! I don't really have a sweet tooth but this is the perfect dessert for anyone - even freaks like me.
Every time my brother came to visit me in San Francisco we tried to get a cheesecake at Zanze's but it was either closed for one of their long holiday vacations or it was a Sunday or Monday. So FINALLY this past weekend (6/2014) we got lucky. The cheesecake's texture (fluffiness) was unexpected but invitingly new. 
This is a MUST try!!!!
author: M R.

description: Best cheesecake ever tasted!!! We always get the original, chocolate shavings and blueberry. Friendly staff Cheesecakes are so fluffy and delicate you use a string to cut it. Yummy!!!
author: Cindy A.

description:
Because of all the reviews and friends' suggestions, I decided to try Zanze's Cheesecake out. Since I work nearby, I randomly walked in on a weekday afternoon during my lunch break and was promptly greeted by the owner. The Yelp reviews didn't disappoint - he was SUPER nice and friendly, and the cheesecake was amazing! 

I got the blueberry small cheesecake, and the taste was just right. It's a sweet cheesecake but it's not overloaded with sugar, and it has the right amount of cream cheese taste to it.. Kind of hard to describe, I suppose - not too rich to the point where it's food coma-inducing, but not too light to the point where you can't taste the cream cheese. The whipped cream + blueberries + the jam were nice additions as well, and highlighted the cheesecake well (because, ya know, there are some cakes out there where the whipped cream and/or toppings are so overpowering that you could barely taste the actual cake). 

As some negative reviews have pointed out,  yes, it is fluffy and airy and yes, the texture is similar to mousse. I don't mind as much because refrigerating it will firm it up a little bit. Plus, you can't just can't find the right amount of rich, cream cheese aroma + tasty goodness anywhere else. 

It's a bit expensive, but hey, everything is freshly home-made with love and care by one lovely elderly man with his wife, not mass-produced by some company. Apparently, the owner goes on 2-month vacations during the summer, as well as a few weeks here and there throughout the year. They're only open on certain days of the week as well. Call ahead if you're not sure!
author: Charmian W.

description:
Best cheesecake ever!!  The texture is super light, fluffy and creamy but still has that rich cheesecake taste.  Similar to the Japanese cheesecakes but this one is a lot better!  They have diff flavors and seasonal ones but I like the traditional one that's topped with crumbled graham. So yum!  My mom is not a fan of traditional cheesecakes since it's too sweet but she loves Zanze's!  

Also love that it comes with this elastic string for you to slice the cakes...don't underestimate that little sucker! It makes the perfect slices effortlessly.
author: Cathy M.

description: I usually don't like giving reviews unless I've actually been to the place, but I just had to write something for the cheesecake from Zanze's. A friend brought some home to try and I just have to say WOW. It's definitely different than most cheesecake. It is super fluffy and soft, almost not like a cheesecake. The crust wasn't super hard like other cheesecake which makes the two aspects (crust and cheesecake) blend very well! The cheesecake is so soft and fluffy that Zanze's gives you a fishing line to cut the cake. If you cut it with a knife it just destroys the cake.
author: Ryan E.

description:
After living for 5 years next to this unassuming gem, we finally tried their cakes - we were lucky, apparently a customer did not come in to pick their orders and we were able to get it at the last minute. 
I don't like cheesecakes and I was blown away by this. Absolutely wonderful. Very light in comparison to what I had tried before and delightful to eat. 
Our dessert roadmap is now solved.
author: Francois D.

description: Best Cheescake ever! I use to live within walking distance and that was great, now I have to drive 6 hours to get it but it is soooo worth it.
author: Terry G.

description: Following BF to this neighborhood cheese cake place yesterday and glad I didn't miss it! The cheese cake is super creamy but light. And another word I would use to describe is silky!!!!! Definitely will come back again. To anyone who wants to go recently- The owner will be on vacation from Jun 26 to Aug 24. Hold your tummy until then :-)
author: Wendy S.

description:
The countless celebrations at my house aren't complete without cheesecakes from Zanze's. Light, fluffy, and perfectly sweet, the cheesecakes are completely delicious. They have a couple of different flavors (even pumpkin in autumn)--all of which I've tried--but my favorite is the traditional.

Mr. Zanze, a man sweeter than his cheesecakes, taught me how to cut the delicate cheesecake with a fish wire. It took me several tries but now I can cut a cheesecake into same size pieces. Ah well, if I mess up, I guess I'll just have to eat those pieces, too.
author: Jules G.

description:
the cheescake was ok. i honestly expected it to be better because of the great reviews.
the cheescake was more of a "mousse" rather than a cake. store hours seem bit limited and parking can be a pain. no real complaints though. i will probably come back if i feel like cheese mousse.
author: Peter R.

description:
So amazingly fluffy and always a crowd-pleaser. Trust the reviews and get here for some of the best cheesecakes you will have!

A couple of tips:
- Call ahead and place an order for pick up, or risk them running out of what you want, especially if you go right before closing. I've been there 10 minutes before closing without a phone-in order once and was super lucky to grab the last medium traditional (phew!)
- CASH only

It's easily apparent that Zanze's is a beloved neighborhood gem and never disappoints, unless when it's closed or they run out of cheesecakes (yikes!).
author: Jing D.

description: First timer. Zanze's fluffy, creamy cheesecake is in a class of its own. I tried the seasonal pumpkin cheesecake, the pumpkin was a little but enough to kill that pumpkin holiday craving. Although I am use to a thicker cheesecake with crust, Zanze's was definitely decadent but not to sweet. Going to come back for more.
author: Janelle M.

description: Different cheesecake as it is very light and soft with a wonderful flavor. This is a tiny storefront and an old family operation.  They sell-out regularly so call in advance and reserve what you want.  Warning:  all fruit topped cheesecakes require 24-hr advance reservations.  They can be short and gruff when you call them but are friendly and warm people when you are in their store.  And cash only!!  No credit cards or debit cards accepted!
author: Thomas G.

description:
yesssh!  Light and fluffy cheesecake while maintaining the cheesecake flavor!  I've had 'fluffy' style cheesecakes, but usually they lack in the actual cheesecake cheesiness and are the 'no bake' varieties.  I believe these are honest to goodness baked and I don't believe there is the gelatin in it that no-bake cheesecakes require.

Hours are dicey-not that they don't keep them, just that they are not that typical. Always check before going cuz I can never remember what the hours ARE.  They close down for a few months during the summer, I believe, so check first so as not to make the trek out and be disappointed.

Your little bonus:  a cutting nylon and brief verbal instruction on how to use it to cut your cake.  They thought of it.
author: Leslie W.

description:
My friend kept raving about Zanze's before, so when I was visiting her and she suggested we get a cake to split, I was all about it.

I didn't actually physically walk into the shop and meet the legendary Zanze himself, but I tasted the cake and I have to say that I've never had cheesecake this fluffy, light, smooth, and scrumptious in the last twenty one years of my life. With other cheesecakes, I would eat maybe a slice and start to feel sick to my stomach, but with Zanze's, I didn't want to stop eating. It's that good.

Also, when you buy a cheesecake, they hand you a fishing line to cut it with (NEAT), a testament to the delicacy of the cake, a work of art for sure. If you're in the area and looking for a dessert, then Zanze's is your place. I know it's mine and I'm definitely going to be raving about Zanze's for years to come.
author: Lewis C.

description:
WARNING: do not come here, you'll get addicted.

OMG. I have lived by Ocean Ave. most of my life, so why hadn't I tried Zanze's earlier?! I'd always heard great reviews about their cheesecake but because parking sucks here I've never just dropped by. They're located right across from the K stop, so it's convenient to come via public transportation but if driving, you have to find a spot. If you're lucky, the meters in front will be vacant. I've seen jerks park in the no parking area in front of the meters. Please don't do that! I know you're trying to avoid having to pay the meter, but there's a reason it's no parking! (Very narrow area for cars to pass...chance of scraping.) 

SERVICE: They are super friendly! I called to see if they had any cheesecakes left and they were able to reserve a cake for me. When I got there I found out their plain cheesecakes are available throughout the day but the ones with toppings are gone by morning. I was kind of annoyed because this jerk who parked in the no parking area beat me to the register so I was waiting for them to finish with him. This pair comes in after me and apparently the lady bringing out the cakes know them because they're regulars. Guess who got their cakes first. AND THEY DIDN'T EVEN RESERVE ONE! When the lady at the register told her I had booked a cake, she just pointed at the cake she just brought out and said, "This is for them." She then said she'd go back to grab me a cake. (I wasn't looking for trouble or trying to cause trouble plus she said it in such a nice way... So even though I was annoyed that I was first and I had someone outside waiting in the car for me, I just let it slide.) The lady at the register was also kind enough to ask everyone if they knew how to use the fishing line! She'll demonstrate if you say no.

FOOD: I'D LIKE TO EAT A WHOLE CHEESECAKE FOR DESSERT PLEASE. It is so soft and creamy. Beware, do not cut slices too thin. The middle point will collapse. I felt like even the fishing line wasn't delicate enough. It is not too sweet and definitely not heavy. 

PRICE: I'd say that it's actually cheap for a cheesecake.
author: Bonnie C.

description:
I have to say that I don't like desserts.. there is just something about it that it is too much, too sugary, too heavy.. I'm a savory kind of girl. Bacon and steaks! But then I met Zanze's. Oh my heavens.. It is so light, I can eat multiple slices.

BEST CHEESECAKE EVER!

One of the employees picked up at 11 am. We bought 4 for our company meeting and it was all gone within the hour after she got back. Our employees raved about the cheesecake and asked if we can buy all our monthly birthday cakes from here. (Sure why not!?!)

My favorites are blueberry and original.. I've heard about their coffee cheesecake, but have not been able to try it. I just hope that it is a seasonal thing and not discontinued.
author: Anne T.

description:
I myself havent personally ordered a cheesecake from here, but my bestfriend had and OMG! Thee Best cheesecake i have ever had. So light and fluffy, it just melts in your mouth!! not as heavy as other cheesecakes, but this one is super creamy and uhh just talking about it, makes me want to go out and order one! 

Def gotta order one from here soon. =P****
author: Joyce P.

description:
I've been hearing about the legendary Zanze's cheesecake for a couple of years now. I'm not that big on cheesecake, so I didn't really bother to give it a try. Well just this weekend, I needed something new to take to a potluck (Yea yea, I don't cook so I'm one of those people who just bring purchased foods to potlucks.. so sue me!), so I decided to give Zanze's a shot.

"WOW!"
"OMG This cheesecake is SOOOOOOOOOOO good!"

Such were the words that came out of my friends' mouths. 

I also feel that this might be the best cheesecake I've EVER had! Really airy and fluffy, and not overly-sweet like most cheesecakes. This is the perfect cheesecake!

Okay, I'm hooked. I need to go buy some more!
author: Kazu O.

description:
This probably was the best thing that could've happened to me after a long work week. I'd heard about the "best cheesecake in SF" but never really had the chance to try it... until now.

Zanze's bakery was unpretentious, homey, and quaint. The little store had a display for about five cheesecakes in different sizes. I came in looking to get a couple of slices for me and a friend, but found out that they didn't sell the cakes by the slice. No matter, I was willing to give it a try. 

The lady working there was super friendly. She explained to me that they only had the classic flavor because they were in the middle of baking. (Alas, blueberry cheesecake, I'll have to holler at you next time.) So I went ahead and purchased the medium classic cake with all the cash I had on me (yes, cash only and I was so glad that I had cash...) and rushed back to try it with my friends.

We ate the cheesecake while we watched Season 7 of Friends (The One with the Cheesecakes). If you've never seen that episode, I suggest that you watch it while eating Zanze's cheesecake. My friends' reaction upon trying the first bite was the same reaction as Rachel's and Chandler's in that episode. The cheesecake was rich in flavor but fluffy and airy in its texture. The wasn't a heavy graham cracker crust but rather sprinkled all over the top. Seriously, it was souffle-like and oh-so-heavenly... one of the best cheesecakes I've ever tried.

Thank you Zanze's for the most delightful cheesecake experience. I haven't had it since I was at Chikalicious in New York.
author: Lynn C.

description: Wonderful little mom and pop cheesecake bakery. They were nice and communicative for their open hours and getting the cheesecake done for me on a 4 days notice. The cheesecake was delicious. I was amazed by how light and fluffy the texture was, compared to every other cheesecake I've ever had or made myself.  I'm extremely happy with the product!
author: Michael C.

description:
AMAZING!

This place was one of my "must eats" prior to moving out of San Francisco. I'm so sad that I didn't try this place until a week before I left! =(

I had the regular cheesecake and my, oh my... I didn't know it was possible to make cheesecake that good. There is a great balance of flavor: Not too sweet, but definitely flavorful enough. The only danger is that it's so light and fluffy that it's easy to eat too much of it in one sitting.

I also liked that the crust was "sprinkled" all over the cheesecake, as opposed to packed too densely at the bottom. It makes for a good cheesecake to crust ratio.

I was hesitant about cutting it with the fishing line, but it's super easy because they'll teach you how to use it if you don't know how.

There's metered parking in the area, so parking wasn't difficult when I went (mid-afternoon on a weekday).

I haven't found cheesecake quite like this anywhere else... a must try, indeed! I'm just glad and fortunate that it landed on my list!
author: Angela K.

description:
This is the Best Cheesecake I ever had! Light Fluffy, no crust on the bottom. the original has crust crumbs on the top. Our favorite in the family is the raspberry one, the light tartness of the raspberries compliments perfectly the sweetness heavenly creamy cake.
The Owner is the nicest person you can ever meet, he is over 80 and keeps working at baking cakes.
You better order if you want to get a cake later in the day before closing or in the holiday season.
author: Edith L.

description: I finally got a chance to try their cheesecake. I can finally see what this place is all about. I ordered my cheesecake in advance but i wanted to see what other flavors they had.  The owner told me it's best for me to try the original first.  Which I thought was a really honest thing to say.  So I walked in and the owner showed me how to properly cut this cake with the fish line.  I was so excited to take my first bite and it did NOT disappoint me.  I love their cheesecake. It was light and fluffy, and it wasn't to heavy.  Actually i feel i can finish the whole cake. I don't feel like sharing it because it's that good!  I can't wait to try their other flavors!!!  I love you ZANZE!!!
author: Belinda C.

description:
The cheesecake here is unique and delicious. It's fluffy texture melts in your mouth. Even if you prefer the dense, rich cheesecake Zanze's cheesecake is at least worth a taste. Personally, my favorite is his original cheesecake. It doesn't need any toppings to make it any better. 

Mr. Zanze himself is also incredibly curious and one of the best sales people I have ever met. He spends a lot of time with each customer and makes sure you know how to cut the slices with his fishing line. Also, if you plan to order for Thanksgiving or Christmas, be sure to order months in advanced because he closes his stop and doesn't take any orders because its so popular. Excellent place and definitely worth a try!
author: Jonathan L.

description:
BEST CHEESECAKE EVER ! 


 I usually don't buy cake unless it was for a special occasion but this was the first time I bought a cake just to have cake. Well, the boyfriend had to go buy it because I'm at work during their business hours but point is, the cheesecakes are so good I can finish one by myself!
author: Winnie T.

description:
I recommend Zanze's Cheesecake if you are a fan of one that is lighter and fluffier in consistency than the dense and creamy ones.  Although I am a fan of the former, because of the main reason that I've had cheesecake exactly like this from Japan a few times in the past, Zanze's wasn't really anything particularly new or different for me.  However, if you've never tried a cheesecake of this consistency before, you should try it and you may be surprised at just how soft and fluffy it is, compared to the more traditional ones.  I had removed a star because it lacked a crust on the bottom and instead had crumbs on the top.

The place is really tiny, maybe only around 6-8 people max can fit in there at one time.  Unless you live around here, the location appears a bit inconvenient and out of the ways.  If you're not driving here, then taking the "K" line is likely your best choice.  Also, I have to agree that their cheesecakes are slightly expensive - a traditional small which could serve about 2-3 people costs $14 and the medium that I got that could serve 4-5 was $21 (you will not be able to buy a slice, you need to purchase the entire cake); so another reason I had to remove a star.  I have nothing against this place and I will say that it's pretty good and I'm glad I tried it, but personally, I did not think it was really anything that was so out of this world unbelievably delicious, worth justifying going back again and again for.  I say try it for yourself and see.
author: Kahanalei M.

description:
My body is a temple.  It is a temple devoted to the holy trinity of Cheese, Fat, and Sugar. 

So unsurprisingly, an offering that combines all three of these sacred ingredients is well received.  Particularly if this offering is deliciously light, creamy and topped with raspberries.

Therefore, Zanze's Cheesecake is the perfect offering for this temple.  I predict that many blessings will be showered upon purveyor of said cheesecake.  

(But maybe bring another one tomorrow, just in case.  Mocha this time?  I ain't gonna lie, the temple be greedy.)
author: Amy C.

description: After a year of trying to get a cheesecake from Zanze's... I was finally successful! Okay, to be honest, I really didn't try that hard but I have been really wanting to try this place out! Called after my run one morning around 11 and the lady that picked up was nice and said they only had a few left. You can call and make reservations though! Place is small and it can seem kind of pricey for a cheesecake... but you forget about the price after a few bites. SOOOOOO light and fluffy! I got the small and literally ate half by myself... I was reluctant in sharing the other half though. Would definitely come back just to eat the original again, but I wouldn't mind trying the other ones with toppings on them. Unfortunately, they're closed the entire month of January. Definitely worth a try if you're a cheesecake fan... make sure you reserve one or go in early... otherwise, you'll be like me and fail miserably several times!
author: Johnson S.

description:
i first heard of Zanze from my good friend in LA. Her dad is a cheesecake snob and Zanze is his favorite. 

Unfortunately when I called today to get directions, I found out that they are closed on Sunday, Monday AND Tuesday. At least the message said that the cheesecakes are also sold at Tower market in Twin Peaks. I headed over there in the afternoon and bought myself an entire frozen cheesecake for $13. After letting it defrost in my fridge, I took one bite and it was just as other Yelpers described --  light and creamy. Before I knew it, I ate 1/4 of the cake! 

I might have to venture to Ocean Avenue for the real deal on Wednesday and meet Mr Zanze himself.
author: Helen Y.

description: AMAZING cheesecake! So light and fluffy it's like eating air. I've only tried the original and was really impressed. I see they have other flavors and I can't wait to try their blueberry next time I'm in the area or really craving cheesecake!
author: Ryan L.

description: craving just this and didn't know it until I stepped inside-amazing service and tasty cakes!
author: Alana R.

description:
These are so addicting! I usually get sick of cheesecakes, but I could seriously eat a whole one by myself. Its mouthwatering delicious with great flavors and light/fluffy texture. Literally MELTS in your mouth. Ugh, I'm eating it just as I'm typing this out and I'm onto my third slice. 

GO GET ONE NOW!
author: Becky W.

description:
The best cheesecake I've ever had! It literally MELTS in your mouth! The texture is so light, creamy and fluffy. Plus the cheese isn't over- powering like the typical cheesecakes you'd buy. All the flavors in the cake are perfectly balance! 

Too bad he takes too many vacations! So no heavenly cheesecake for a while ):
author: Kim B.

description: Simply the best cheesecake! I have only tried the traditional cheesecake but they do offer variety.  The cheesecakes are so fluffy and delicate you have to use a fishing string (provided) to cut it.  The first time I bought one the lady was kind enough to teach me how to cut it.  The place is very small but very cozy.  They seemed to be very busy on Saturdays and eventhough they close at around 4 p.m there have been times they're sold out for the day since 1 p.m.  Also if you are thinking of grabbing one for special holidays you have to order at least 3 weeks in advance.
author: Betty R.

description:
So airy, and it melts inside your mouth! 

My bf got 2 different flavors for my mommy for mother's day...the raspberry and blueberry :) 

I enjoyed the blueberry flavor because it was sweeter and not as tart as the raspberry one :) 

Yum yum!
author: Tiffany K.

description:
Want to know Zanze's secret and save $27? Here I'll tell you!

The "secret" to getting that fluffiness and cloud like consistency is to simply... OVER BEAT your cheesecake filling. What do I mean? INCORPORATE 50% more AIR with a stand mixer (kitchen aid) with the balloon whisk attachment, add a $6 increase to your original price since you're serving "Cheapman's Cheesecake" and of course make it smaller! 

I'm not saying it's bad, it's just like everyone said-- light and cloudy. But I am not gonna be paying more for less... Get it? You can have this exact taste (and size) for a third of the price by simply buying a Japanese Cheesecake (or even Chinese Cheesecake) at Nijiya Supermarket, any Japanese supermarket, Sogo or any other Chinese bakeries, and it will have this light and airy consistency everyone is just gushing about for a fraction of the cost. 

This was a miss. Save your money on this one kids. I'll even throw in free fishing line to cut your cheesecake as novelty.
author: Jay L.

description:
LOVE LOVE his Cheese cake! I used to live in SF just 10 mins away from his store in Ocean Ave. My sister told me about this place when I went to SF State. I bought his cheese cake just for any  occasions; since I moved away....I can not find the same kind of Cheese Cake....! Cheese Cake Factory? they are NOT EVEN CLOSE!
I have not been back to SF and I truly miss his cheese cake....Great to know that he is still going STRONG!!!! 
I wonder if he is willing to ship his cheese cake to me.....
author: Just N.

description:
OK, so it's not exactly NY style cheesecake..but WHO CARES? They make a mean version of it themselves, which is incredibly smooth, creamy and refreshingly light rather than the dense version and minus the graham cracker crust which instead is sprinkled on top. It definitely helps to keep those calories in check and it makes a great dessert for when you're simply craving something light and mildy sweet. I've only tried the original but I can't wait to try the other flavors too. For reference, I ordered a medium cheesecake for a small gathering which feeds about 10-12, though the slices ended up being rather small slices so I would recommend it for no more than 8 people, especially when you're like me and it takes a little more to satisfy your sweet tooth! Also, don't try to cut this with a knife as it's extremely delicate so ask the lady beforehand the counter on how to use the little string that comes on the side for cutting it with.

FYI: Remember to come before 4pm or earlier than that if you want to be guaranteed a cheesecake and do bring cash as they don't accept credit!
author: Petra S.

description: The cheesecake are so good here. Too bad they don't open on Sundays. I didn't know cheesecake can be so soft and creamy.
author: Erik Y.

description:
I'm not much of a cheesecake kinda gal, but this place has some pretty excellent cheesecakes.

I love the fact that the focus is on the cheesecake; no flaky crust all around, no frilly toppings, no over-the-top fillings: just well-made, tasty, fluffy cheesecake.

If you want, though, they do have some very simple topping options:
+Shaved chocolate
+Blueberry compote (with a whipped cream border)
+Raspberry compote (with a whipped cream border)
+Sour cherry compote with Kirsch (a brandy made from sour cherries)

The owner's incredibly sweet and always makes sure to ask if the cheesecake is for a special occasion. We picked up a few birthday cheesecakes, and he offered a white chocolate "Happy Birthday" sign to include with the cakes.

Classy touch: fishing line is included to help cut clean, perfect cheesecake slices.

CASH ONLY, and a bit pricey ($14-$17 for a small; $21-$26 for a medium; $27-$31 for a large), but certainly cheaper (and far tastier) than Cheesecake Factory's cloying sugar bomb cakes.
author: Adena B.

description: A friend brought this to a party. So fluffy and light! Couldn't even tell that I ate it :p
author: Vivian L.

description:
I've eaten a lot of cheesecakes, and none of them compare to Zanze's. It is a bit of splurge on cheesecake but SO WORTH IT! The texture is what makes it so unique and good in my opinion - it is so fluffy and light. It melts in your mouth and now just thinking about it makes me want some haha. 

It's so fluffy and fragile that you have to actually cut the cake with a fish line, which they include it on the box. 

They also have various toppings. My favorite is the raspberry one. Adds a perfect tartness to the cheesecake. 

They have somewhat rare hours, so don't be surprised if you go and it's not open. 

Happy Cheesecake!!
author: Amy Y.

description:
So this place makes some AMAZING cheesecake PERIOD. And talk about SERVICEEE!! Extremely nice over the phone and in person! I told them, I need to ship it to LA and all I had to do was put it in a box to ship with soem wrapping so it doesnt shake around in the box and BAM! Good to go! 

You guys are great!! 

By the way, the smell inside is all you need to step in!
author: Hubert L.

description:
I did not know I liked cheesecake. 

I would never choose it for a treat. I remember heavy dense cheesecake with fake fruit on it from my childhood. My pops loved it and it was the one dessert I never requested to share. Maybe that is why he always ordered it in restaurants:)

Well this bakery looks old fashioned but it is not the old school dense cheesecake I remember. A friend had this at her house party and insisted I try it. I ate most of it. Lucky she had a back up for the other guests.

Light. Light. Sweet. Melt in your mouth. I have since gone in and ordered my own-- they have choices of toppings but there is no need for anything but the cake.

Bring cash. And order two not one. Just in case.
author: Dani K.

description:
I was thinking about what kind of cake I should give my boyfriend for his birthday and BAM, I thought about this place. I felt like this cake was seriously for me and not him since i LOVE cheesecake. When I first came to this place to order it, I can immediately taste the cheesecake in the air like seriously. It smelled so good. I got the medium traditional cheesecake. I asked the worker if they had one with strawberries but unfortunately he said the closest they can do are cherries. They really need to have one with strawberries because that's my favorite! 

Anyways, I picked it up and he even explained to me about the fish wire that was attached to the box. My boyfriend ended up liking the cheesecake which I was really happy about. The guests at the party really liked it too. I was so happy that it was a hit. My friends kept asking me if I had more haha. Next time for sure I'm going to get the large size. I love how it's so light and fluffy. I will most definitely ordering more cheesecakes here than getting it from the grocery store for parties and such.

Shout out to Jess M. for introducing me to this place!
author: Janice V.

description: I really wanted to be completely blown away by Zanze's cheesecake given how good the reviews are, but I wasn't. It was great-- don't get me wrong, but I like my cheesecake a bit more dense and with a bit more crust. The flavor was great (we got a traditional style cheesecake) but I enjoy a bit more crust with every bite.
author: Preeti R.

description: People have likened this to the cheesecake Joey and Rachel eat off the ground in friends. It's not a lie. This is the most fluffy, delicious piece of heaven you will ever find and hell yeah you would gladly eat it off the ground. It's unfortunate that you have to preorder anything but the plain cheesecake, but since I'm a plain cheesecake person anyway, doesn't bother me much.
author: Khanh H.

description:
Love their cheeses cake. Freshly made every day. And they usually sold out by 3pm weekday, 12p during weekend. Make sure u call advise. 
Their cake isn't too sweet. They are soft, and cheesesee.
author: Chong L.

description: Lov this place!!!lov the cheesecake it's really Fresh and delicious!! Too bad it's not open all the time sob
author: Luis L.

description:
Believe the cheesecake hype!

While I haven't actually physically visited the store, I HAVE tried their cheesecake and it is divine! I was gifted with what looked like a medium sized cheesecake for my birthday and decided to have it for dessert after my birthday dinner. The fish line that comes with cheesecake for cutting wasn't really much of a help (I guess it adds to the experience) and the cheesecake looked quite plain, but once you sink your teeth into the fluffy, moist, and perfectly creamy cheesecake, you will fall in love! Make sure you refrigerate it thoroughly before slicing that baby up, because having it at room temperature sort of takes away from the experience. I love you Zanze!
author: Joyce E.

description: BEST cheesecake ever!! Even my husband love it! I can have a whole small size by myself!! Their Price are reasonable! Definitely will be back.. Yummy...=D
author: Q.Q W.

description: Let me say first of all, that I am not a huge cheesecake fan because it is usually so heavy that all I can have is one bite. This cheesecake is like eating a cloud made of graham crackers, cheese and a touch of sugar. I could seriously eat an entire piece by myself and still want more. That's why I am ordering it for my friends passover feast this Friday!
author: Becky B.

description: This hidden gem on the not so busy side of Ocean Ave, is amazing! Not only are the cheesecakes to die for, but the owners are so nice and genuine! Love supporting local businesses. I like to get the original, and the cake itself is so rich and light, creamy, fluffy all things you look for in an excellent cheesecake =)
author: Eleana H.

description: I've been eating these cheesecakes since I was 13. It's more like eating a delicious cloud than an actual real mortal dessert, and is as central to my experience of San Francisco as the fog or The Giants. This is what it's like to taste heaven. Seriously amazing, and I don't even like cheesecake.
author: nate b.

description:
The owner is pretty friendly. He taught me how to use a fishing string(came with the cheesecake) to cut his cheesecake. it was a pretty smart idea so the cut would be really clean and neat. 

Great Cheesecake. It was really fluffy and smooth. Surprisingly, he did not put his cheesecakes into the frige (of course, I did when I got home) because all the cheesecakes were freshly made.
author: Evan L.

description:
The store is small and very simple. No dining in, this store only serving to-go order only. There are few old chairs for you to sit and wait while Mr. Zanze helping other customer. He always happy and informative about cutting his precious cake using the fish string that they provide on the top of each box.
