I think he always treat his cake as one of his "precious" =) Hands down for Mr. Zanze! I like that about him. When is the last time you buy something and the associate that help you really treat the item that they about to sell to you like one of their own precious item?!  Not very many I think. Everyone are so commercial now.

Taste: not too sweet, fluffy, and light. The cake can be consumed on room temperature, but I think it's best when it's cold.
There's raspberry and blueberry topping that can be put on top. All were homemade. I haven't try it yet, because he run out of the blueberries. 

The store will be close from July 1st - August 22nd, 2012 and it will be re-open on August 23rd. Mr. Zanze said he always took once a year vacation. Good for him! 

Just random thought for Mr. Zanze, when you're not making any cake, would you consider reading children book for the children at the library? Your voice is very comforting, like your cheesecake =)
author: Icey M.

description: We had a school reunion luncheon today and one guy was so nice to bring 2 of Zanze's large cheesecake for us to share. Normally I'm not a dessert person so I passed but after hearing everyone else raving about it I decided to take a few bites. They were indeed one of the best cheese cakes I've had, very soft and fluffy, tasty and not overly sweet or heavy. Since the cheese cakes were sitting in room temperature for several hours so it was a bit too soft for me, I bet it will be even better if served chilled.
author: Julie W.

description: OUT OF THIS WORLD! Think about your favorite cheesecake and imagine it 15x better. If clouds had a taste, they would taste like this cheesecake. I totally understand why there's a line and it's totally worth it. Place an order in advance or get in line at least 30 mins before opening to make sure you get one. Oh my god go get some now
author: Rob T.

description: I LOVE their cheesecake. I wish you had more business hours. Great service. Light and well balanced cheesecake. Normally, I feel cheesecake are sometimes too heavy. One slice of Zanzes is not enough. I barely knew I ate one piece. Yum!
author: Trish M.

description:
I'd love to come back to Zanze's just for another chance to chat it up with the adorable older couple who own the shop- they're just so warm and friendly!   

Oh, and of course the cheesecake is delicious too.  Not as dense as the usual cheesecake, but more substantial than the Japanese style.  With or without fruit on top, and a few sizes to choose from.  

Well worth the trek if you don't happen to live nearby.
author: Joanne G.

description:
This cute little Mom & Pop place serves some good homemade cheesecake!! 

Their cheesecake is so soft and light. It doesnt have a graham cracker crust like typical cheesecakes. They give you a fishing line to cut because a regular knife will ruin your slice. I think instead of using cream cheese, they use cottage cheese, which gives it its fluffy light texture. Also, its not as fattening. (YAY!)

But be careful! They only make a certain amount a day so they run out easily. They're only open certain times and days of the week so you should check their business hours.
author: Jean T.

description:
I don't know about this place. It was good and like no other cheesecake I had ever eaten but after eating the cheesecake from this place on two separate occasions I can't imagine going out of my way for it again.  

The cheesecake itself is extremely light and fluffy. It tasted more like a mousse than an actually cheesecake and the lack of crust didn't help it much either. Pretty much if you want a dense cheesecake go somewhere else. If you want a mousse with Graham cracker crumbs come here.
author: Domingo D.

description:
Just got a large traditional cheesecake yesterday for my hubbz b.day n it was heavenly!!!!! Oh so light n fluffy...not too sweet n creamy. It was our first time n we wio b coming bak for more :)) 

Zanzes is officially on vacation starting today June 30, 2012-August 23 . I believe it said the 23. 

Come try this delectable cheesecake!!

P.s.   Cash only.
author: Jay M.

description:
This review is strictly for the cheesecakes. i haven't personally been in the shop but  I will one day. 

The cheesecakes here are AMAZING!!!!. I've never tasted a cheesecake so light and fluffy. =) I'm glad they're not in the valley because i'll probably gain weight eating it everyday!.
author: Grace N.

description: Ok I returned to try the seasonal pumpkin cheesecake ($24), which is cheesecake with pumpkin spread on top. Since I love pumpkins, I was surprised that I didn't really care for the pumpkin spread (which had a slightly bitter aftertaste). I realized what I loved about Zanze's was the graham cracker crumbs dusted on top of the traditional flavor that contrasted nicely with the soft, light, and fluffy texture of the cheesecake. When it comes to Zanze's, I guess I'm a traditionalist after all!
author: Diana B.

description: One of very best cheesecake I like. Not too filling and it's just nice for after meal dessert. Very great as a gift to your family and friends during festive season. Call ahead because they are closed during some of the day and also placing order.
author: CH T.

description:
I was lucky enough to get to try one of these delicious cheesecakes when my supervisor brought two for my going away party

You can't go back to commercially made cheesecakes after this.

if it was more accessible, I would be wobbling around..happily wobbling
author: Whitne Y.

description:
this place is legitimately worth the hype. I brought one to a dinner party and my friends couldn't stop raving about it. deLICIOUS! and they're very friendly and refreshingly generous. it's a CASH-ONLY joint though, heads up!

ermahgerd, cherzkerrrrrk!!
author: Denise H.

description:
I'm not a huge fan of regular cheesecake because it's way too heavy. I usually can't finish a slice. But with Zanze's cheesecake I can easily eat more than 2 slices in one sitting. It's super light, fluffy and oh so delicious. Our friends that we shared the cheesecake with loved it also. The lady that helped me was super friendly. 

I'll be back for sure.
author: Jo S.

description:
The cheesecake is SO good. It's not heavy feeling like most cheesecakes. It's light and fluffy and SO GOOD. You can read tons of yelp reviews saying the same thing, or you can go out and get one to try for yourself. 

Enough said. GO GET SOME!!!
author: Jeannie L.

description: Officially my favorite cheesecake. Super light, fluffy, and delicate. The graham cracker topping is delicious! It is very easy to place an order and service is great. DEFINITELY recommend it! :)
author: Cynthia Y.

description: My favorite cheesecake place! Even though I like trying different flavors, especially blueberry, I've only stuck with their traditional and it will never disappoint. Made an order for a medium traditional the day before and the owners were so sweet when I went in to pick up the cake. As the man popped his head out of the kitchen window to hand the cake to, I'm guessing, his wife, he thanked me! The woman packing up the cake put a little chocolate "Happy Birthday" sign on top when she found out it was for a birthday. Ate the cake after the dinner and it was light, fluffy, creamy, with a little lemon tang to it. Delicious!
author: Christine P.

description: I love love love the cheesecake from Zanze. I bought the small one ($14), and after my first bite, immediately regret that I hadn't bought the large. The best way that I can describe the texture of the cheesecake is like mousse. It's light, airy and smooth, however, it does not in anyway affect the taste, the cake was delicious. The cake does not have a crust, but there was just enough crumbs on the top as a light topping. I was able to meet the owner Mr. Zanze himself. He carefully packaged the cake, and taught me the right way to cut the cake with the fishing line, so that I wouldn't break the structure of the cake. I was able to peek into the kitchen, and saw another old man happily baking away. This is such a lovely shop. I absolutely could not get enough of the cheesecake, and can't wait to return for more!
author: Helen Y.

description:
My boyfriend and I got to meet Mr. Zanze, who is such a sweet and charming man. He suggested that we tried the traditional cake since it was our first time having the cheesecake, and taught us how to properly cut the cake with the piece of string. He said that he uses Philadelphia cream cheese and there's no butter and barely any flour in it. Then he jokingly told us to eat plenty of veggies before eating dessert. But the cheesecake was so light and fluffy, it seemed like a guilt-free pleasure that required no veggie pre-gaming. 

Somehow I can really feel like a lot of love and care was taken to make the cheesecake. I never understood the concept until now. You just sort of feel/taste it, and I could definitely sense it from meeting Mr. Zanze that he takes pride in his cheesecake! I can't wait to try the other types there. :)
author: Wendy L.

description: DON'T EXPECT A TRUE CHEESECAKE. If you've had cheesecake, the thick, rich kind they eat on Golden Girls, then this won't match your expectations. This is a very different style, and yummy in it's own right. It's light and fluffy, not very sweet, kind of like an egg soufflé. It's pleasant, but not the indulgent experience a NY-style cheesecake will offer. And the people running this outfit are delightful.
author: G G.

description:
Another cake, another year, another birthday for Jr. Yelper.  
 I ate almost a 1/2 med cake by myself.  Well... I was gonna share with hubby, the last generous slice.  But, oh, heck.  It's like that commercial where the hubby goes get the coffee and when he returns, she ate the whole dessert. He stands there dumbfounded.
Mr. Zanze was his usual graceful self and commented that Jr. Yelper grew up eating the cheese cake.  Yes, sir-reeee.  

JR currently lives in LA and I told Mr. Z there are no Mr. Z's in So. Cal and he replied, "One is enough".  Nope.  I disagree. We need to clone Mr. Z, he's a national treasure!
author: Ry T.

description: This is the only cheesecake that I like!  Light and fluffy!  Wish they had more flavors tho.  A strawberry one would be nice!
author: Tina L.

description:
In my opinion, Zanze's plain cheesecake is The Best in the World.  There is no need to "adulterate" it with berries, fruit, chocolate or anything else.  
Go ahead!  Get one with any of the above additions.  It's still the best.
author: Robert K.

description:
Have you ever seen that Friends episode where Rachel and Chandler steal and fight over their neighbor's cheesecake? This is that cheesecake. I would eat this cheesecake off the floor and lick every crumb and I will fight you for it. I swear it's like eating air. Cheesecake air. Pillowy fluffly goodness that just melts in your mouth. 

For the longest time, I would drive up Ocean Ave and glance into their tiny little shop. Open? Nope..Weeks later, I'd drive down the other way, and glance in. Open? Nope.. boo. Damn you Zanze's, you're never open!! I want my cheesecake fix!! They're closed Sundays, Mondays, and Tuesdays I think. Open Wednesdays-Friday until 6pm and open Saturdays until 4pm. So if you find yourself passing by here and think, I'll get it next time or on the the way back, don't wait and get it!
author: Angela W.

description:
The cheesecake was awesome. Even my parents' picky taste buds were satisfied by the cheesecake. 
Although it was a bit pricey, it was worth the money. I would come back again.
author: Iris C.

description: So fluffy, tastes like heaven! I got the original cheesecake, as I was recommended to get by the woman working there since it was my first time. The medium size was only $22, very reasonable. The cake is so fluffy, that you get a fish hook to cut it, because a knife will simply break up the cake. I can't wait to come back to try the raspberry and blueberry ones. The cheesecake is delicious, come get one for sure. Also, they don't make a lot at all, I got the last medium size one and I came at 2pm. Preferably, reserve one.
author: Nikita K.

description:
Was able to reserve a small original cheesecake early in the day for pickup in the afternoon (recommended).  Plus, I secretly wanted to call to check if they were open.  This will my first try after hearing the many rave reviews.

Does everyone experience the hot and stuffy smell when entering this place?  Oh well, they make good cakes, so.... on to the pickup.  Very courteous and nice lady behind the small counter.  The display case had 1 large, 2 medium, and 2 small cakes.  I was here for a small but was lucky to get a medium instead.  

She eloquently boxed and tied my cake, and taught me to use the fish line to cut the cheesecake (that was taped to the box cover).  Cool!

Leaving the shop, after 5-10mins, I walked back to get another cake (for my sister that called because she is so in love with it), and the display case was only left with 1 small and 1 large!  Aghast!   Well, I made it out with 2 cakes (1 med $22 and 1 small $15 - cash only).

The taste - soft, light, fluffy, melts in your mouth.  Crust is on top!
author: Ju D.

description:
YYYYUUUMMYYY!  I have bookmarked this place for awhile and finally had a chance to go today.  I got there about 3pm and they only had the original cheesecake left and got 2 small one - one for a friend's bbq I was going to and 1 for another friend.

Had the cheesecake tonight and oh man, oh man was it light and down-right yummy.  I think it is the best cheesecake EVER.. I could have ate the whole thing, seriously.  

Will be a destination when ever I am in the city.
author: James L.

description: This cheesecake is fluffy, light, and delicious! I could really compare it to a cheesecake pillow!! :)
author: Mertani G.

description:
I went to Zanze's Cheesecake on Ocean Av on the week of Christmas and learned that they were sold out of cheesecakes for the holidays. Happily I return back here today and order 2 Raspberry cheesecake!! Ordering a large one for the office crew and a small one for myself to take home for a small party this weekend. 

The large was big enough for 12 generous slices or 16 slices for a decent dessert portion. The heavenly ultra smooth and creamy texture with Raspberry topping is truly the best kept secret for a long time until communication technology came along to spread the word. My sister in law brought this more than 20 years ago and was word of mouth to find this San Francisco Treasure. Mr. Zanze still produce these excellent creamy cheesecakes himself and still going strong!!
author: Wolfy W.

description:
Their cheesecakes are super fluffy. I think it's a love or hate relationship. 

You NEED to use the string they  provide to cut the cake because a knife will just destroy it.
author: Jess W.

description:
Zanze's produces a light, Italian style cheesecake that is delicious and rich in flavor. They only make a traditional plain cheesecake, although they do have a few options for toppings that are applied to order. 

I was fortunate to stumble across this place on Yelp and was welcomed at the store towards the end of the day by the owner himself who was prepping for the next day's cakes. He was warm and took great pride in his cheesecakes ad was very happy to meet a new customer (who will now be a customer for life). 

I found the cheesecake to have a great flavor that clung to the inside of my mouth and left me wanting more.  It was a rich dessert but not a heavy way to finish a meal because it was so light, almost mousse-like.  

I thoroughly recommend trying this place at least once in your lifetime.
author: Nick S.

description: My daddy really the original cheese cake. I love it too
author: Christy H.

description:
This cheesecake has been in this spot for over 30 years and I just recently tasted it for the 1st time this week. Look what I have been missing.  

The flavor and consistency of this cheesecake is what is memorable. Light and airy all fresh and real ingredients. 

The owner recommended I try the original cheesecake on my first taste. I was eying the pumpkin topped seasonal specialty. I am going to order that for Thanksgiving.  Nom Nom Nom.
author: Infodiva B.

description:
This my first time to the store.
Me and my friend bought a small original cheese cake each.  
Mr Zanze was so nice that we were able to enjoy one of our cheese cakes at the store.  
The cheese cake was so smooth. It is not heavy and not too sweet.  Just the correct sweetness, and it taste like ice cream.
I am so glad that I found this cheescake bakery.
author: Diana W.

description: Believe the hype. This place serves the fluffiest cheesecake. Not only is the cheesecake superb, but so is the service! I love Zanze's...oh and lets not forget that this place is located right by Comic Outpost. So if you're in the area be sure to stop by both places.
author: Desiree B.

description:
Wow. Simply amazing. Delectable. Delicious!

I have been DYING to try Zanze's for quite some time. It had been in my bookmarks for far too long and I finally got the chance to experience the wonders of a Zanze's cheesecake recently.

At a white elephant party, someone brought a cheesecake from here and I almost squealed. Once he cut it with the fishing line, I made sure to grab a slice before anyone else had the chance to discover how amazing it was. The cake was so moist, fluffy, and light. Completely different than any other cheesecake I have had. I cannot wait to go here and get a whole cheesecake to myself (that is the fatty in me coming out)!
author: Surge C.

description: Best cheesecake in the Bay Area if not in the world!! It is so fluffy, light, and creamy at the same time. The crumbs on top is so fine and perfect. I have not found a better cheesecake than this yet.  It is a small shop and they close in the summer months.  Call ahead to reserve your cheesecake because it always sell out by mid-afternoon.
author: Sarah L.

description:
Hands down my fav cheesecake spot!  This is coming from a guy that never liked cheesecake.  Their cheesecakes are best described as light and fluffy.  So much that they give you a string to cut it!

Their pretty popular, so you gotta order them ahead of time.  So worth the effort and wait...  It's literally a mom and pop shop, where the mom runs the front of the store, and the pop bakes.

My fav is the blueberry.  Although they offer strawberry, rasberry, and mocha flavors.
author: Lawrence L.

description:
Cheesecake?  No...no.... this is Angel Cake.

The sad part is that I didn't try Zanze's while I still lived in SF.  In the 5 years that I lived in this area, I've wanted to try this place but somehow never made it out here.  Now, I have to cross the bridge to savor this piece of heaven.  

It's not your typical commercial cheesecake.  This is the real deal, yo.  The owner, who still greets customers and takes orders in an old-fashioned kind of way, recommends beginners try the plain angel cake before exploring their other flavors.  That way, you can really appreciate the cake just as it is in all it's nakedness.  It's kind of like how I determine whether a froyo shop is good: Try the original first.

I definitely don't feel guilty eating this.  The texture is silky and smooth, creamy and light-tasting but sweet enough to be a dessert.  The crumbly crust compliments the cake very well.  It's a little sweeter but never over powers the main act: The Angel Cake.  I'm a big fan of cheesecake crust and would prefer more but then again, it's still pretty bodacious.  (...Is it weird to ask for extra cake crust on the side?  heeh...)

Homemade with love and celestial expertise.  That's Zanze's Cheesecake.
author: Kat C.

description:
I bought a raspberry cheesecake last week for my girlfriend's mom and she loved it. Make sure you have some cash with you because they don't accept credit card. Inconvenienced!! 
Cake was pretty good though. Will be back sometimes.
author: Jerry K.

description:
WOW!!! Melting in mouth and full flavor.
Now I have to drive all the way here from East Bay for their cheesecake.
author: JK C.

description:
At my friend bday was when I first met my first love of cheese cake. I had mostly the whole small size cake after we finished our dinner and I finished my piece of orginal cheese cake and ate all of my friends leftovers... pretty much the whole thing was in my belly! That good to me...

It was light not over sweeten just works with the sweet topping.
author: Jossy S.

description:
I go on a cheesecake hunt whenever that episode of Friends where Chandler and Rachel eat a delicious cheesecake that was wrongly delivered to them comes on.  So, after seeing the rerun, I jumped online to find good cheesecake shops in the city.  The first one to pop up was Zanze's.  So I rushed over there one afternoon to find that it was closed for some reason or other.  Undeterred, I wrote down the date that they would reopen and would come back later.

A few weeks later I came back when I had the free time and ordered a medium original (before you wonder if it was just for me, it wasn't, I mean I probably could've polished it off by myself, but I didn't).  Mr. Zanze asked if I'd ordered one before (I was about to pull the "Does this look like it's the first time I've ordered a cheesecake!" line, but I don't think he would've gotten my joke and it was too early to ruin a perfectly nice guys day with a bad joke), I told him no, so he explained how to cut the cheesecake with the fishing line.

As everyone else has written, this isn't your typical cheesecake, it's super fluffy and the graham cracker crust is on the top instead of the bottom.  It's also not overly sweet, but it still pairs well with whipped cream or a fruit coulis (You like that fancy food lingo, ladies? This is probably why I'm still single...).
author: Joe N.

description:
Co-worker:  "What kind of cake do you want for your birthday?"

Me:  "Cheesecake"

Co-worker to Yelp: "best cheesecake San Francisco"

Yelp: Zanze's

Me: Best birthday ever.

Light.  Fluffy.  Not too sweet.  Yum.
author: Kristin P.

description:
Just tried their chocolate cheesecake (like I promised I would) and WOW....it was simply amazing. I am as much of a chocolate fanatic as I am of cheesecake, so this combination already screams perfection (though I usually prefer plain cheesecakes.) Anyway, as I was cutting it with the fishing line and doing a quick food porn shoot, I was already salivating and couldn't wait to devour it after a long day at work. 

One bite and it was truly orgasmic. I really loved how the chocolate didn't over power the cheese and vice versa. Most chocolate cheesecakes I've encountered are way too chocolaty, rich and dense. Not Zanze's - it maintained Zanze's cheesecake's characteristic (light and fluffy) while bringing in a moderate hint of milk chocolate taste. It was simply perfect. I might like it more than the original....!!!! 

My sister and I pretty much killed the cake in 5 minutes (darn them for being so easy to eat!) My sister even said it was the best dessert she ever had. Though I can't say that's true for myself, it's certainly one of THE best desserts I've had in my life so far. 

Saving the bigger traditional cheesecake one for Chinese New Year dinner tomorrow night :)
author: Grace C.

description: Mouth watering deliciousness.  It really is the lightest cheesecake I've ever tasted.  It's now my go-to cheesecake spot.  I wish they were open on Sundays, but it's probably best they aren't, or else I would get one for every Sunday dinner.
author: Kim K.

description: it's very fluffy and at the same time cheese-y enough, unlike in most regular cheesecakes. I'm normally not a cheesecake person at all but I went ahead and tried theirs. it's not too sweet which was why I liked it. difference sizes for different catering purpose so it would fit everyone's unique occasions. I recommended to other friends & they are loving it too!
author: Eva J.

description: By far the best cheesecake. It is hard for me to compare if this place or the Cheesecake Factory. The only thing about this place that I dislike are there isn't that many flavors, and don't sell it by slices. But it is still the best cheesecake I ever had. When I have time I'll try all there favors. I will come back and visit no doubt.
author: Timothy W.

description: I've been wanting to try this cheesecake forever... Finally got to try it tonight. While it is light and fluffy... My enjoyment was cut short because I kept finding plastic Saran Wrap pieces in my slice.
author: G Y.

description: Awesome cheesecake's! Soft, fluffy, light, and tasty! Love it!
author: Jem C.

description:
THE BEST CHEESECAKE I HAVE EVER HAD!!

ive only tried the traditional one so far but i love it! the graham cracker crust is on top, sprinkled with some powder sugar, and it comes with a fishing line for you to cut the cheesecake with.

it isn't too sweet, and is super light and fluffy! 

cash only and even though they do have a limited amount ready for walk in purchase, i highly recommend you call in to pre-order (especially on holidays and weekends)

everyone needs to give zanze's cheesecake a try!
author: Katherine C.

description:
Mom doesn't like cheese, therefore, she does NOT like cheesecakes. At least, until she was forced to try Zanze's cheesecake. The result: she really loved it and kept asking me to buy her more. 

I need to be a good daughter and get her one soon before Mr. Zanze takes another long (but well deserved) vacation.
author: Alisa M.

description:
The cheesecake is out of the world good. It is not the typical 'heavily-dense' cheesecake that you normally buy at the store or restaurant. Always freshly made. Mr Zenze would put the toppings right at the minute you order the cake. 

The store reminds me of a old-world european style moms and pops store. So not pretentious but what a jewel. You need to give it a try. It is nothing like you've tried. Believe me!
author: Harle Q.

description: Best Cheesecake!!! I love the fluffiness. You have ruined my cheesecake standards!  The people are pleasant and friendly. See you soon!
author: Dimples P.

description:
FYI - Zanze's is closed for summer vacation until 8/17/11
(as of 7/2/11)
author: Jodie J.

description:
Zanze's Cheesecake was Bookmarked for Father's Day, just knowing I was going to bring a cheesecake over to Mom & Daddy's to celebrate the best Daddy on Earth - counting down the days until I could swing by & pick up this scrumptious-sounding treat 

This was my first foray into the realm of Zanze's & the owner was so incredibly friendly & helpful - explained how to use the fishing line to cut my cheesecake, suggested the appropriate number of slices & as I'm walking out, this family who came in behind me said, "You're gonna love it".....they were right! 

Fluffy clouds of the most flavorful sweet cheese & a generous dusting of graham cracker on top - very light & refreshing & this is something I never thought I'd ever be saying about a cheesecake b/c they're known for being rich & heavy! 

Opted for the Plain - since this is what most reviewers suggested (but can't wait to try their other flavors!!) 

Had my suspicions it might be lemony & I'm not a citrus dessert fan. Even the slightest hint of lemon (which people feel they must infuse in all things "plain") & it's ruined for me so when I heard plain cheesecake, I thought, oh lord, here comes the lemon..... 

Happy to report no lemon flavor here! Just smooth, creamy, cheesy goodness.  Everyone loved it!! 

I'm now the rock star of our family!
author: Adrienne G.

description:
Owner is super nice! Make me feel very warm and happy after going into the store.He just have a warm big smile. Make me feel like I want to go back very often. Especially the cheesecake is amazing, I can't said no to them.

I brought the small size original favor, I had it a while before during my friend birthday and i had miss the favor, what I had remember is delicious cheesecake. But still, I was craving for all kind of cheesecake lately.
And since today it was my mom birthday and her favor cake is cheesecake and I doesn't like the American kind of cheesecake. It just taste super rich for me, make me feel like I am eating cheese, more than eating a cake. So I order one for my mom and YES, she LOVE it. She love the texture and the smoothness and slight favor of the cheese and the best thing is as a dessert. It wasn't too sweet.   
Well~~~ But I never get a chance to try the chocolate favor one. And I will definitely be back soon and try that! lol* =D
author: Joyce W.

description: Wow. I'm a huge fan of the dense NY Style cheesecake. Most others won't do in my book. However, Zanze's cheesecake was a revelation. It's really good. It was served at a friend's house with whipped cream and fresh blueberries. Heaven.
author: Scott R. D.

description: I'm not a real cheesecake nut, but when it comes to Zanze's cheesecake, I can eat a LOT of it!  That's probably because it's very light and not too sweet.  It's definitely the best cheesecake I've ever eaten and, as a bonus, Mr. Zanze is the sweetest man!
author: Annie W.

description:
I've been coming here since I was about 12 so that makes it, 13 years. I remember when I tried it for the first time, I couldn't believe how it tasted. Me and my mom would actually buy it once a month. And then Zanze's cheesecake became our every occasion cake. 

Their cheesecake is out of this world, fluffy, light, and extremely addictive.
author: Anita L.

description:
I was introduced to Zanze's a couple of years back by my sister and mom bc we LOVE cheesecake and I LOVE supporting mom and pop shops so here we are.. 

Zanze's is located on Ocean Street, in the Ingleside neighborhood so street parking is only available. It's a small shop but well worth your time and money here. 

I can't tell you how much I adore the owners. They're a sweet couple, very kind indeed and makes the BEST cheesecake in the neighborhood. You can tell he puts time and effort into making these cheesecakes bc they're moist, soft, very creamy and he even shows you how to cut the cheesecake with a piece of thread. **Seriously, a piece of thread bc it's that soft and oh so damn good!!**

For a great tasting cheesecake for that special someone, come to Zanze's bc it'll be worth it to see the smile, the cheesecake will put on their faces :)
author: Anonymous P.

description:
Zanze's cheesecake is very sneaky. You take one bite and you're surprised at how smooth and creamy it is. Then you take another bite to have that taste again. You take another and another and before you know it, you've finished the entire cake. I don't think I'll ever look at another cheesecake the same way again. So worth the commute going there. In fact, I wanna go over there right now!

And the shop smelled sooooo goooooood!
author: Jaclyn A.

description: This is not your ordinary cheesecake, it is MUCH better! I used to ONLY like NY style cheesecake until I first started going here about 10+yrs ago. I LOVE this place. The owner is a very nice gentleman and makes every visit enjoyable. I always just want to buy like 10 cakes and eat 9 and give one to my guests ha ha. REALLY REALLY love this cheesecake...can't wait to go back and get another. Hope this place never closes!!!!
author: Austin C.

description: Not much to add here: a light and very delicious cheesecake. I was a little sad that there isn't a crust, but maybe that's just me. Highly recommended.
author: Sven S.

description: I was pleasantly surprised. I am not much on sweets and typically yet if I do eat sweets, I prefer  things in the European fashion. The cakes are super light, very tasty and not overly sugary. I will surely be a repeat customer. Everything is decadent and presented elegantly. They have quite a few smaller options for those with only a slight sweet tooth like myself. I had a pistachio cupcake that was out of this world.
author: Out O.

description: Zanze's cheesecake is good, if you compare them to traditional american cheesecake...the only  differences about this cake is that its light and melt in your mouth. But the reason its not getting too much stars from me is because its still too sweet for my liking.  If you compare this with asian cheesecake. Asian cheesecake will always be less sweeter. And because of that, Nijiya cheesecake will always be my kind of cake. Beside its cheaper too.
author: Aniko N.

description: Fluffy and light. The mister and I had half of the raspberry cake with our Chai tea for Sunday breakfast, oh so good.  They put Cheesecake Factory to shame!
author: J L.

description: I am extremely upset that anyone would give Zanze's anything less than 5 stars. You can literally taste the passion this place has for cheesecake. The owner is a super sweet guy who stands behind his products and is still excited to talk them. To me Zanze's represents what the San Francisco food industry used to be. Small, family owned specialty shops and restaurants ran by people who really care about their products and their customers. Bravo Zanze's, way to keep the old school alive.
author: Norm N.

description:
I'm not a huge desert guy but when I want to impress some broad I will pick up a cheesecake from Mr Zanze.
They are the nicest people. 
I feel like I just went to church when I stop in.
author: FLICK R.

description:
Mr Zanze... how do you do it?  How do you make it soo delectable?  tell me your secret!

I've been coming here ever since my epicurean cousin referred me. Forget cheesecake factory... they have nothing on this... THIS IS HOW  CHEESECAKE SHOULD BE.  Zanze's makes you question all the other cheesecakes you've had in life.  It is super light and fluffy but not super rich and dense like other cheesecakes you've had.  Just be careful not to eat too much in one sitting.  

There are a few varieties of cheesecake: Traditional, blueberry (sweet), Raspberry (a little tart), Sour Cherry with Kirsch (fruit brandy).  All are available in small, medium and large sizes.  With each cheesecake comes a fishing line that is used to cut the cheesecake. 

Mr. Zanze is a very friendly guy and occasion Mrs. Zanze will ring you up.  Both are very kind folks who make you feel welcomed in their small shop.

Although it is pricier than other cheesecakes, this is worth trekking here  for those special occasions.  Would definitely recommend.
author: Jay W.

description: THIS PLACE IS THE BEST. I love their cheesecake, it's very authentic and legit. Their owner and workers are so nice! :) I came here a couple of time but the last visit was different. I went in to do a interview for my school's project and I had to interview the owner about his business. They are the nicest people ever! And also very family orientated! MUST GO. MUST MUST MUST. :)
author: Sandy C.

description: Best cheesecake I've ever had.  If you like one of those dense, rich, ridiculously sweet cheesecake that you buy from places like The Cheesecake Factory, do not bother to come to Zanze's.  If you enjoy light as air and not so sweet type of cheesecake, please do yourself a huge favor, GET THE CHEESECAKE FROM ZANZE'S! You'll never regret it!
author: Janet H.

description: If you are looking for a really good cheesecake that's also light, you must go to Zanze's. It is by far the best cheesecake I've ever had. You don't need a knife to cut it, they give you a fishing string to use to cut it. It's that light and soft. Man or man, Zanze's is so good. It's only in SF, so anytime you're in SF, you should pick one up.
author: Vy H.

description:
OHHHH was is so delightfully good! My mom brought it one day and it's like a pillow of nirvana in your mouth because its' down right moist cheese and delicate. So delicate, the box comes with a string to cut the dessert which makes me want to squirm while waiting.

Great gift mom and zanze, how did I fail to know about your excellence until today?
author: Iris Y.

description:
I think I've died and gone to Cheesecake HEAVEN!

I heard so many wonderful things about Zanze's Cheesecake( http://static.px.yelp.com/bphoto/3jV6yM18ugSXoPHzsZFSwA/l ), and I FINALLY got the chance to try it for myself.  I called a few days in advance to put in my order and since it was my first time, I was told to get the Traditional since its what they're known for.  I purchased a 10" traditional for a Chinese New Year dinner, and a 6"( http://static.px.yelp.com/bphoto/iPtLtwePD0GOQ-pnAGpiDw/l ) for my friends to eat with me later.  I stuffed myself at dinner, but I made sure to save just enough room for cheesecake.

They tape a nifty little fishing line to the box so you can neatly cut the cheesecake....a knife would definitely butcher this wonderful little dessert.  I finally got my hands on a slice and OMG, it was sooooooooo good!  The BEST cheesecake I've ever had!!!!!  It was so light and fluffy.  Its definitely not your average cheesecake.  There's no graham cracker crust....they sprinkle the top with graham cracker crumbs and powdered sugar.  I wanted to devour the whole thing, but my stomach wouldn't let me eat more than one slice!

The next day, I took the 6" out and shared it with 3 friends.  We just cut it into 4 slices, and ate it straight out of the box like savages!  Everyone loved the cheesecake!  That little cheesecake didn't stand a chance against us!

I love you Zanze's!  I will definitely be back for more!!!!
author: Patra I.

description:
Best Cheesecake in the CITY! For any one who does not like cheesecake because it is too heavy or dense, try this place and then you will reconsider. The cheesecake is so light and fluffy that you need use a fishing reel line to cut it! The only knock on this place is that you never know when they are open because the owner is on vacation all the time and gone for 2 months at a time. But if you do get that chance to try this elusive cheesecake, you will be in sweet heaven till the last bite!

Highly recommended and best thing to do is call before stopping by.
author: Elliot T.

description:
Was five stars but see below...I have been going to Zanze's for 30 + years. 

Now I live out of the area, but every time I am in the City it is a must....

Just ate a slice of the Rasberry Cheesecake I seriously could eat the whole thing...

Mostly great People...Great Place.... 

I only hope the recipe is handed down because I would be devastated if they went away.

I need to lower it a star as I was just in formed by a rather anoying employee by the name of Ari of a change in policy and I would not be able to pick up a raspberry cheesecake today as I have for 30 years because I did not call 2 days in advance...BS
author: Matthew R.

description: Well worth the drive from San Jose. A great cheesecake and a great establishment to do business with. We will be back.
author: Tommy L.

description: Loved this chess cake. More light and fluffy then others. They give you a string to cut it. Something to try for sure.
author: Princess D.

description:
My boyfriend and I continue to follow the 7x7.com list of 50 sweets in San Francisco you must eat before you die and Zanze's cheesecakes was on their list so we came here last weekend to try it.

As it was our first time Zanze himself (?) recommended that we try the plain cheesecake.

If you're one of those people that think New York style cheesecake is the only type of cheesecake out there you obviously have not had all there is to try when it comes to cheesecake. 

Zanze's cheesecake reminded me of cheesecake that I've had in other countries or recipes from other ethnicities - it's very light and foamy (think mousse) so you don't feel like you've consumed this heavy, thick piece of cheese-block at all. 

And I loved how there's this graham-cracker crust sprinkled on top of the cheesecakes (think the topping on coffee cakes). The box also came with this fishing line taped on that we were told (and demonstrated) was to be used for cutting the cake into clean pieces. We've kept the fishing line instead of using it for this particular cake since we started eating the cake when we got to the car with the forks we had in the glove compartment. 

As it says on the sticker on the box, they're good eaten at room temperature or chilled :)
author: Mona Lisa M.

description:
This place is amazing!  Sam the owner was great..had some good stories to boot too..

Make sure you bring cash or a check book...no credit cards

Good parking all around

Sam was just a nice guy giving me and my gf a good down low of his masterpieces which are amazingly good. 

Fluffy and just great cheesecake

All I can say in a cha cha harmony is Fluffy fluffy FLUFFY!!!
author: Ami J.

description:
Wow!  I've tried cheesecakes in more places than I can remember, but I know I've never had one this good, yet be so soft and light.  That's a dangerous combination as the cheesecake's lightness leaves you feeling like you can take on an extra slice.....

...Sorry, I actually went to the fridge and ate that extra slice.  Back to Zanze's review...

In addition to the great tasting cheesecake, we had a  wonderful experience with the owners.  We were in the area on a Saturday afternoon and had been warned that they normally sell out before they close at 4 pm.  Unfortunately, by the time we got to Zanze's at a little past 3 pm, they were sold out.  They told us we could pick one up at the local Molly Stone's and gave us directions.  While one of them gave us directions, the other person got on the phone and started calling customers to follow-up on order pick-ups.  He found someone that wasn't going to pick up their order and offered it to us!

We happily took that cheesecake, but we also went to Molly Stone's to pick up a second one to share for the next day's party!
author: Eric D.

description:
It's like eating mousse when you are eating Zanze's Cheesecake.  It was so light!!  Very different from the traditional New York cheesecakes that I am accustomed to.

That being said, it is still irresistible and I can always cheat myself by telling myself "Since it's so light, I can afford to eat more slices..."
author: Mindy C.

description: This unique bakery is a cheesecake lover's dream. With a simple menu and clean display, you understand that they are very serious about one thing, and they do it so well. The woman behind the counter instructed me as to what to buy my first time. She really knows what she is talking about. I love cheesecake and have looked for years for that perfect one. I believe I found it at last. I can't even describe all the flavors dancing across my tongue. It was light as a feather,and rich and creamy at the same time. I gave a sample to a friend of mine, who told me later how amazing it was. Words are failing me here, just go and try it for yourself. One bite is all it takes and you will be in cheesecake heaven.
author: Jacob R.

description:
Best cheesecake in the world.
Extremely fluffy and soft. Light cheese but satisfyingly rich flavor.

Secret family recipe. Please keep up the great work!
author: Kent T.

description:
I was craving something sweet today AND my palate got me thinking about Zanze's cheesecake.  Zanze's cheesecake is a SF staple just like Mitchell's ice cream...it's just where the SF locals go and wayyy before yelp, social media etc was around people knew this place is the place to be ... and continue to go since the place is so darn good at what they do and it' can't be replicated.
The cheesecake here is fluffy and not at all dense like most/ALL cheesecakes.  Fluffy cheesecake?!?!? ....well, I tell ya t....he cheesecake is soooo fluffy that you have to use a fishing line to cut it (which Zanze's provide)...oh yes we tried to cut it with a sharp knife but it just ruined the cake.
Their standard cheesecake is the best but they also have strawberry and chocolate if you want to try something different.
author: Blue S.

description:
Do you remember that commercial with the floating candy bar whenever someone opened their purse and they'd do whatever they could to grab their chocolate bar of goodness...well...that pretty much sums it up for this place's cheesecake...it's SO light and fluffy.  It almost looks like it could float and believe me I would definitely do whatever it took to catch it if it floated out of my bag (not that I'd be keeping cheesecake in my bag or anything...haha)...but you get the idea.

The graham crackers are lightly dusted on top of the cheesecake...not too much and not too little...just enough to make its presentation known.  And speaking of presentation, this cheesecake is presented as simple as can be.  There's a little doily under it to make it look a little bit more elegant but that's all.  There's no fancy decorations, etc.  It is what it is and you get what you pay for.  It's simplistic presence is no match for its melt in your mouth flavor.  This flavor is so hard to describe that you will almost feel a dream-like state when you take a bite into this cheesecake...believe me, it's THAT good.

So...what are you waiting for...give it a try already!
author: Mia D.

description: Best Cheesecake, nice and friendly service and dental floss cut nice and light.
author: Chris D.

description: Fluffy fluffy fluffy. Not too sweet. Sooo yummmm :)
author: Amy C.

description:
Great cakes and GREAT owners! 

For this past Christmas, I ordered a cake for my family dinner and several cakes for my friends' families. When I got there (which by the way was 20 mins before they closed for the holidays) there was a line out the door. Thank god I called in advance to order the cake! I was the last customer and the lady who took care of the front (the owner's wife?) was so delightful, even after such a hectic day! 

But the real treat is the cheesecakes itself.. it's so fluffy and light! I feel like I can eat the entire cake by myself! The menu consists of three sizes and we ordered the largest one but still we didn't have enough to feed 7 people... that's because we all wanted seconds!

I used to be a one cake kind of girl-- always opting for a princess cake. I think this year for my birthday, I will trade in my princess cake for another Zanze cheesecake!
author: Tiffany U.

description:
I admit it, I was sucked into the madhouse of Zanze's Cheesecake because it was always featured as #1 on Yelp's restaurants page for San Francisco.  I was desperate, "What is so fabulous about this place?!"  

The first time I ventured out to Zanze's, I woke up early just to take the bus out here.  Imagine my horror when the only option was a whole cheesecake and to go!  I knew I had to say no to that.  At this point, I only wanted just a taste, a slice of what all the hype was about.  I couldn't very well buy a whole one yet!  

The next time around, the BF and I made plans.  He called ahead for a  large cheesecake to feed my whole family.  They claim it can feed 14-16 servings from one of their big ones.  And so, that's what we did.  

As we used their complimentary fishing line to slice up this delicate cheesecake, I expected bliss.  Bliss is not what I got.  It was light, indeed very light.  Too light for cheesecake in my opinion.  I'd call it a mousse rather instead of a cheesecake.  I wanted something heavier, something orgasmic-worthy, and I wasn't getting it.  The woman who sold us the cheesecake said it would be "The Best...guaranteed!"  Well, sorry to say lady - "This cheesecake is not the best, at least for me."  (Now, if you ask the BF, he'll tell you otherwise.  He had about three to four servings all to himself.)

So, I was disappointed.  Zanze's Cheesecake is okay, but nothing for me to rave about.  You won't see me getting out of bed early again for one of these things.
author: Teri C.

description:
No thorough review needed. 5 Stars, a must try if you have not. Make sure to check their business hours before going. If you go during the holidays there will be a line out the door! 

-SFCheapGrub
author: Mike H.

description:
Very cute place that only sells cheesecake.  This place has been around for about 35 years.  Great to see a small shop do so well.  And after trying their original cheesecake I can see why they are still around.  Best cheesecake I've ever had.  Light and creamy.  Will be back to try some of the other types of cheesecakes.
This place is cash only so come prepared.
author: Annabelle K.

description: scrum-tious (adj.): Highly pleasing and addictive taste of cheesecakes at Zanze's, which has just the right amount of sweetness and not dense nor heavy like ones at The Cheesecake Factory.  Describes luscious creations Sam and Joyce Zanze have been serving for 27 years in a little takeout only store.  Zanze's cheesecake ranks with some of the best quality cheesecakes in Tokyo as one of the best I've had.  It's the best cheesecake in the area for sure.
author: トモ T.

description:
This place has been in business since 1979. It's only open 4 days a week (Wed-Sat).
Sam and Joyce Zanze are the owners. Joyce was a teacher at CCSF.
I believe that Sam's 75th birthday is this year, I just don't know the exact date. Happy bday Mr. Zanze!
(My apologies for divulging your age, in case I wasn't supposed to)

This is a European-style cheesecake (delicate and light in texture), unlike the dense New York-style cheesecake that most people are familiar with. It has graham cracker crumbs and powdered sugar sprinkled on top. Always a good choice to celebrate special occasions.

When they go on vacation, the store is closed. So Sam makes extra cheesecakes, available in the frozen section of Molly Stone's at 635 Portola Drive.

Sam is super duper nice. Always takes the time to explain how to use the fishing line string (included, taped to box) to all newbies, in order to cut the delicate cheesecake.
The cheesecake is available in small (6"), medium (8") and large (10").

Traditional cheesecake: $13, $20, $26.
Blueberry, chocolate, mocha, raspberry: $14, $22, $28.
Sour cherries with Kirsch: $16, $24, $30.

A pumpkin flavor is available during the holidays.
author: Luis C.

description:
Would definitely be the dessert if I had a last meal on earth.
The lightest cheesecake you'll ever have.  I've had it on my birthday maybe 4 years running now, probably the best part of my birthday every year.
author: Garrett T.

description: The cake is very delicious. Fresh, light, and soft. I like it!
author: Kaiqing Y.

description:
HANDS DOWN THE BEST CHEESECAKE I'VE HAD!

Cheesecake factory is NOTHING compare to this.  As a matter of fact, thinking about Cheesecake factory cheesecake right now doesn't even sound appetizing after having Mr. Zanze's cheesecake!

We had a huge dinner at home tonight with a bunch of family friends.  One of our friend bought over a original cheesecake from Zanze.  We were so thrilled!  Zanze's cheesecake is not your typical cheesecake.  
You cut the cheesecake with a fishing line.  The cheesecake has a fluffy, light texture and it melts right when it gets into your mouth.  The taste is so flavorful and it is a bit on the sweet side, but i love it.  I think everyone should come here and try their cheesecake at least once.

Mr. Zanze makes his own cheesecake.  Take note that the store is very tiny and there isn't glamourous decoration or displays.  But who cares?  His cheesecake rocks!  If you're a coffee person, you might want to try the Cappachino cheesecake also!

The large cheesecake was able to feed 10 people and still have leftovers, $27.  I know their small is $13, and the medium is $21.  A bit on the expensive side, but it is totally worth it!
author: Stephy L.

description:
I was greeted by the INFAMOUS Mr. Zanze. He asked me if I've ever had cheesecake from his store and shamefully I answered no. I think everyone should at least come here once in their life. Boyfriend haven't had Zanze's cheesecake for over 10 years and finally the original Zanze cheesecake and the love of my life meets again. 

As we walked into the tiny shop I already saw my boyfriend's face brighten. I know he missed it. Why wouldn't he?? We got the small original cheesecake for $13.00. Expensive? Well you are paying a taste of heaven! Before I even tasted the cheesecake i know it was good from the smell of this shop and from the smell when I opened the cheesecake box. He even provides a little wire string for you to cut the cheesecake!

My first bite;;;;; wowww how soft and fluffy! I almost mistaken it as tofu. It was that light! Sorry Cheesecake Factory. THIS is it. THIS is what you call cheesecake. 

Thank you Mr.Zanze for opening your store in the heart of San Francisco.
author: Tracy A.

description:
I thought I loved cheesecake before but after trying Zanze's...Now that's a good cheesecake. I never knew it could be so light and fluffy. Going to this place to get cheesecake was great. Opening the door and walking in, the cheesecake smell hits you then you see all these rows of cheesecake. It's great! 

The decor is rather non-existent. Actually I don't remember, I was just focused on the cheesecake and the little kind of retro board with the choices and prices.
 
Definitely coming back for some awesome cheesecake. Excited for the holidays so I can try their pumpkin cheesecake.

Note: They don't sell slices, just whole cheesecakes in small, medium and large. (Original, blueberry or raspberry) 
And they only open Wed-Sat.
author: Katie M.

description:
I had another taste of this delicious cheesecake today. 

Graham cracker topping, light & fluffy cheesecake that feels like it'll fall apart. Too fluffy for my taste. Maybe one day I'll like it more & give it a 5, but for now it stays at a 4.
author: Kylie L.

description:
Zanze's does not make cheesecake, they make a cheesecake-flavored mousse dessert. This is perfectly acceptable in the same way that blueberry cheesecake ice cream is not cheesecake but ice cream. But don't call it cheesecake when it's not.

I love cheesecake, almost all kinds, from the ones I make to crappy Sara Lee, but I dislike Zanze's intensely. Why? Because I don't like mousse. The best I've had in the City is at Max's, where it's tall and medium dense, and full of creaminess.

Zanze's mousse dessert is like taking a great milkshake and adding seltzer water to it: sure it's lighter, but the flavor and the mouthfeel suffers.

I have no argument with people who rate this mousse dessert 5 stars because obviously they enjoy that texture, heck I'd give it 2 stars if it weren't called cheesecake, but since it is, I have to give it 1 because as cheesecake it's inexcusable.
author: Rob C.

description: Excellent cheesecake. The owners were very nice and taught me how to cut the cheesecake with the provided fishing wire. We had the medium chocolate shavings cheesecake for around $26. It was fantastically fresh and extremely light and soft. Definitely the best cheesecake I've eaten in my life.
author: Andrew C.

description:
This is the first time I've ever had Zanze's cheesecakes and it was awesome.  The store is quaint and they specialize in cheesecakes.  I bought a small raspberry and could eat the whole thing in one sitting if I just let myself.  

Mr. Zanze packed up my cheesecake and he is so friendly.  You can taste the love in these cheesecakes.  They are so special.
author: Chrissy M.

description: Best. Cheesecake. Ever.  Just go with the traditional.  Putting any topping on this cheesecake is like putting pinstripes on a Ferrari...totally unnecessary.
author: Zoran L.

description: Been coming here since middle school and their cheesecakes were just the best!  Light but super tasty and it was just simply delicious!  Almost sold during holiday time and they take long vacation too. The original and blueberry were my favorite.
author: Vic L.

description: Cheesecake heaven! It's super light and fluffy, not dense like any other cheesecakes i've had. It has to be my favorite cheesecake i've ever had in my life! But beware that they do close a few times a year! And sometimes for months at a time .. I believe summer? It's definitely worth it to find out when they're open and go try it! It's not expensive at all .. cash only though.
author: Jennifer W.

description: Was told they had the best cheesecake in SF , true story ! Very polite lady and delicious cake  .
author: Tsz Chung W.

description:
If heaven had a flavor, it would be Zanze's Cheesecake...

Perhaps one could even go as far to say, if the clouds in Heaven had a consistency, Zanze's Cheesecake would be like nibbling on Heaven's clouds.

But enough of my banter - the only thing you really need to know: this is DAMN good cheesecake, made locally in a nice little mom and pop store.

And yes...it's heavenly!
author: Christy L.

description:
Don't want to use the overrated word on such a sweet little family business but I do not think the cheesecakes here are worth what you pay for. Overrated is definitely too harsh of an adjective given the quality of these masterpieces. They look amazing and taste just as it looks. Great selection of flavors like original, cappuccino and blueberry. You can tell there's a lot of love and dedication in each and every cheesecake.

I think people are amazed at how light and fluffy it is but I rather go for dense cheesecakes that have substance and not eat a lot of air. The demand is so high that they sell out pretty quickly and there are long waits/lines. Lastly, these heavenly cheesecakes costs more than an arm and a leg. Given these mitigating factors, as good as these suckers are, I can only recommend people try it but not make Zanze's a habit.
author: Ed L.

description:
Zanze's cheesecakes are THE best. Seriously. It's one of those hidden gems of history in San Francisco. I've been coming here at least once a year for the last five years since I was introduced to it. I love the consistency of their cheesecakes because it's so light and FLUFFY! It's almost as if it melts in your mouth.  If I didn't have to share... I think I could finish a small one (in the span of a few days).

I personally don't like the dense heavy cheesecakes that you get from Cheesecake Factory or other bakeries--they just feel so heavy. If you like the heavy dense stuff, don't hate on Zanze's, just move on and go enjoy your heavy cheesecakes.

Wise advice: call and place an order for a cheesecake before heading there to pick up, prefer a day or a few days ahead because these cheesecakes run out fast!
author: Natalie G.

description: opposite of cheesecake factory.  if you want something light, fluffy, airy, then this is probably the closest to a perfectly whipped-like light cheesecake.  could use a little more crust portion since it's so light otherwise.  taste is great.  currently $15 for a small.
author: Rob C.

description:
My lady co-worker loved it! She requested me to come back again to try the other flavors on the little board: Blueberry and Cherries w/ Kirsch brandy. 

I was actually expecting the cheesecake to be flavored but its actually just toppings along with some whip cream. I think I'll stick back to the original/traditional since the blueberry is a buck more and the cherries with brandy is 3 bucks more than the traditional. They're a good touch though.

Came here on a quieter day so it was only me, the guy who mans the cashier (Perhaps he's the son or relative?) and Mr. Zanze working in the back. The man who takes your order may seem a little cold at first but if you chit chat with him, he'll crack a couple smiles =)!  What made the visit special was Mr. Zanze coming out of the kitchen to give me the cheesecakes and thanking me personally, wowow! Here I was thinking I was just a normal customer buying something and leaving but for the boss to come out and thank you is really sweet and is a great attribute in customer service and relations. Four for you Zanze coco. You go Zanze coco!
author: KD M.

description: What more can one say other than wow! I bought one of their large original recipe cheesecakes due to the adamant recommendation from one of the employee at the front counter, and I asked him to put chocolate shavings on the top. He told me it'd be a few minutes but the cake was ready in no time at all, and he even brought it outside to me because the store front is really small so I went outside to wait. The packaging was tasteful, as they use strings to secure the folds of the box instead of scotch tape. There was also a short spool of fishing line attached to the top of the box, which I couldn't figure out what it was for at first,  but was later informed it's used to cut the cake. At first bite the cake reminded me of Yoplait's whipped yogurt, but it was thicker with a moose like consistency. If you've ever had in the New York cheesecake you'll know that sometimes it can stick to your mouth, but this cheesecake is very fluffy and light. The sweetness of the cheesecake was just right, however, I do like my desserts on the sweet side. Another thing that I really liked was there chocolate shavings. Most chocolate shavings that I've had are usually tasteless and hard like plastic, but their chocolate shavings actually tasted like chocolate and melted in my mouth. The overall experience was exceptional, even if it's a little pricey at 32 dollars for a large cake. If you like cheesecake please give this place a try!
author: Yang L.

description: Call a head to order as they do most of the orders that way and you may get turned away.  They do not do slices.  The cheesecake was light and fluffy instead of dense and packed.  Very delicious and a nice dessert to bring to a dinner party!
author: around town e.

description:
Zanze's Cheesecake is the BEST :]

 It is light and fluffy and its just amazing. This is the only cheesecake I eat. I don't like the heavy cheesecake that people usually have -- where you can take a bite and it gets stuck all in your mouth -- yuck. ZANZE's cheesecake on the other hand is delicious and made to perfection. 

I love the classic cheesecake that they have although their blueberry is phenomenal as well =) Try them both, I am sure that you will love both of them! OH, and the graham cracker crumbs are so amazing with it and makes the cheesecake even more to love.

Not only is the cheesecake super tasty and yummy, Zanze (the owner) and his wife are very sweet and very nice. Zanze just makes you smile. He's so kind. 

All in all, this cheesecake is the best that I've ever had. It's not heavy like the usual cheesecake that you see at the cheesecake factory. It is fluffy and almost souffle like. It's very delectable and I urge you to meet Zanze for yourself and try his wonderful cheesecake.

YUM!
author: Amanda C.

description:
My Favorite Cake to Have ( Especially My Birthday Cake ), is always from Zanze's Cheesecake. By The Way, Just wanted to Add this Little Trivia. Today I found out that Mr. Zanze's mother and I share the same Birthday (which is February 13)!!! Mr. Zanze mentioned she's 95 years old!!! WOW!! I Hope and Wish to God, I will Live that LONG TOO!!! So I can EAT more Cheesecake! hehehe

So Let's get back to the Business at Hand. So, How do I describe Perfection??? Let me start by saying, I only eat Cheesecake From Zanze's, Why??? You asked, Please, People Let Me Count The Ways:

1) The Taste and Feel of Cheesecake  in my Mouth is like I am eating a piece of Heaven or Cloud: So Light,So Soft,Airy, Foamy and Fluffy. Not Overly Sweet, Just Right! You can even have Seconds or Third Helpings, if you WANT!!! Hehe (or in my Case Second Helpings).

2) The Scent or Aroma of the Cheesecake, that Hits my Nose, while I am opening their Large White Box!!! It's Indescribable! I smell:  Cream,Sugar,a Hint of Vanilla,Butter,Cheese,and a Little Dollop of Sour Cream to balance the Flavor. HINT! HINT! Mr. Zanze I was Trying to Guess The Ingredients of Your Famous Cheesecake! What's YOUR SECRET Mr. Zanze??? Just tell me 4-5 Ingredients that you use.I promise that I won't DIVULGED YOUR SECRET!! It will be between You and I,till the day I die! :-D

3) I've never quite had any Cheesecake Like this Before! It's a Unique, DELICIOUS DIVISION all by itself! Once You had it You will NEVER,EVER,EVER want any other Cheesecake than from Zanze's. Keep Up the Good Work! Mr. Zanze. NEVER EVER RETIRE either, or CLOSE the SHOP!!!  Cause You Will make Thousands and Millions of People: Sad,Crazy,Depress,SUICIDAL and HOMICIDAL!! AND I KNOW ONE OF THOSE PEOPLE WOULD BE ME!!! :-D
author: myra a.

description: Absolutely the lightest cheesecake I have ever eaten! My friend took me here right after picking me up from the airport and got me a cheesecake! Too bad he didn't get to even have a slice. Sad. :( Got the original cheesecake without any toppings and it was very different, in a good way. It's like a soft ..pillow! That was a bad analogy. It is so soft and light that they provide you a fishing line to cut the cake, but I'm a savage (kidding) so my cousins and I just forked it. What I wasn't aware of was that it was CASH ONLY! So keep that in mind, and bring some coins for parking meters!
author: Vicky N.

description:
I had recently heard about this place from some co-workers so I immediately yelped it and was anxious to get a taste after reading all of the rave reviews.  My co-worker/carpool buddy and I decided to stop by on our way home one evening.  We usually cross the Bay Bridge to get home but took a detour since traffic was crappy - and hopped on 280 instead.  Location was less than 15 minutes from work and easy to find.

We walked in and Mr Zanze was packing a cheesecake for a family who were also virgins of this popular spot.  The front area was tight and cozy but you can see that the kitchen behind it is huge.

Mr Zanze is wonderful - he was calm and patient yet eager to chat about his cheesecakes and their history.  Five stars for the service alone!

We each decided on a medium traditional and went on our merry way.

The cheesecake is yummy - so light and fluffy that, as many reviewers have mentioned, you don't feel guilty eating two or three (or more!) slices.  I personally prefer the dense NY style cheesecake (thus, 1 star removed) but will definitely return to Zanze's for more - especially to try other flavors.
author: Flory T.

description:
This place is an institution! 

Yet, another place to thank Jonas T. for introducing me to. :)

Zanze's cheesecake is really light and fluffy, it is delicate and has minimal crust. However, the crust crumbles on top definitely are a nice touch. It is delicate and soft, so he will teach you how to properly cut the cheesecake. You truly must go in to see how its done.

Once, we ate it after it had been sitting in our mini fridge at work after about four days and we just dove in with forks without checking the freshness. We were willing to risk it, that alone should stand testament to how GOOD the cheesecake is here.

A SF MUST.
author: Stella C.

description:
I love cheesecake and this is my #1 favorite spot for cheesecake.  Zanze's cheesecake is fluffy and not too sweet.  You have to cut it with a string because it will just stick to a knife.  It's hard to eat too many slices because of the richness.

Zanze's is top notch cheesecake quality.  Thanks to the owners for making such a great product.  For me it's perfect.  Not like that heavy junk they make at the Cheesecake Factory.  For some Zanze's cheesecake is too rich, but not for me.  Zanze's cheesecakes are awesome.
author: Cynthia B.

description:
To quote my friends... "it's like eating a cloud" *drools*

This cheesecake is not your typical dense cheese cake, this one is light and fluffy. So light in fact, my friend admitted to eating an entire cake himself. I personally wouldn't suggestion that but you get the idea.

From what I have been told, Zanze takes some random holidays at times. I have wandered upon Zanze closed in the past. But luckily for me, I was able to find Zanze open this weekend! Excited? YES!

Since this was my first Zanze cheesecake, the lady suggested I try the traditional plain cheesecake. I was staring at the chocolate one for a while but I took her suggestion in the end. The owner taught us how to cut the cheesecake using the provided fishing line. I got a large, suggested serving size 16, but I tried to feed a LOT more people with it (50+ bite size pieces). Sharing is caring.

Be aware that Zanze is cash only!  Luckily there is a bank nearby. Bring some change for the meter too.
author: Angela T.

description:
CHEESECAKE of my dreams. i love me some cheesecake also!
Sooo light delightful and FLUFFY. The cheesecake melts in your mouth. His cheesecake is not like regular cheesecakes that are thick and dense, which what makes it so great and different. I never thought I could have a cheesecake that was actually light.  

Mr.Zanze is such a great man, sweet, helpful and kind. You can tell that he loves what he does and is very skilled at what he does also. He's just as welcoming even if you have never been there before and will teach you how to cut the cheesecake with plastic string he provides. :)
author: Julie B.

description:
This is the best cheesecake I've ever had, hands down. The soft fluffy airy texture with the perfect whipped and shaped whipped cream top, and the perfect ring of blueberry on top. Wow.

Mr. Zanze is the sweetest man ever, showing us how to use the thin wire to slice the cheesecake.

I see the prices have only risen a dollar since 2007. Bravo to keeping it real and still serving the best cheesecake.

Cherry on the top? Getting a parking spot right outside. And apparently he's going on vacation from 10/03 to 10/13, so I made it just in time!
author: Katherine P.

description:
So I'm going to come out and just say it, I LOVE a heavy and dense cheesecake. It's worth the calories! That's what makes it so good, when you can feel it coating your mouth and you need a gulp of milk to swallow the sweet creaminess down. The crust is also one of life's pleasures, especially when it's a substantial thickness of crumbly graham cracker crust.

I knew coming into Zanze that their cakes were light and airy but I didn't know just how light they would be. I wanted a small blueberry cheesecake ($13). I didn't pre-order so I was in luck they had one left in the back! The man at the cashier (Mr. Zazne?) was very soft spoken and I had to repeat my order three times to him. He took great care and time to tie up my cheesecake box and to explain what the fish wire was for, though I read all over yelp reviews of its exact purpose.

I tore up my cheesecake box when I finally made it home. My first bite was definitely a big surprise! The blueberry cheesecake had the consistencies of a mousse. It was so light, I ate 1/4 of it before I even had to put my fork down. It felt like I was eating sweet nothings. I don't know if I would call mousse a cheesecake with barely any crust even though it makes a delicious dessert. It just doesn't have the denseness that I am used to. However, it is a good alternative to traditional cheesecake. People who aren't fans of cheesecake will probably like Zazne's mousse like cakes. Give it a try!
author: Julia T.

description:
OMG!  I love Zanze's!  They make some of the lightest cheesecake around!  You won't feel guilty after you eat it (it's not like the other cheesecakes that are dense and sits in your tummy for a long time!).  You gotta try this place.  They have a no frills shop but I guess that's ok since the low overhead makes the cakes reasonably priced.

They are usually closed towards the end of the year (the only time the zanze's take a vacation!).
author: Wendy H.

description: BEST CHEESECAKE EVER HANDS DOWN!! Incredibly fluffy and moist, and instead of a graham cracker crust, it has a top and dusted with powdered sugar. Amazing amazing amazing.
author: Maria R.

description: Best cheesecake EVER! melt-in-your-mouth goodness! I live in San Jose and this is the only place I come to get my cheesecakes.
author: Phuc N.

description: I'm not a huge cheesecake fan, but wow this is some pretty good cheesecake. The thing I don't like about most cheesecakes is that its usually dense and too much. This is so light and fluffy (as fluffy as cheesecake can get). Its like almost like an Italian cheesecake turned upside down with the graham crust on top. Good stuff. Maybe he uses ricotta but who knows. Nice little surprise.
author: Augusto M.

description: The service inside was exceptional and the gentleman working there couldn't have been nicer. The place only accepts cash, which is a bit annoying. Does the cheesecake live up to the hype? Hard to say. It was very good but I don't know if it was the best I've ever had. I tend to prefer Italian style cheesecake, which is why I was so excited to try this place but if you are going because you like Italian style cheesecake I think you might be a little disappointed. It isn't the kind of Italian cheesecake you will find in NJ. Very good, very light, yet somehow still rich and creamy. Very unique take on cheesecake unlike anything I've ever had, but I still prefer traditional east coast Italian cheesecake.
author: Jackson B.

description:
Came to try out the cheesecake since I passed by this place for the last 6 months.  Got a small original and OMG it was SO GOOD...very light, not too sweet and taste amazing.  Very friendly services too...when I mentioned that this is my first there, the sweet lady at the cashier said she'll show me how to use the fishing lines instead of the knife (fishing line come with purchase).  
Will definitely come back for more...:)
author: Bonnie L.

description:
A different cheesecake than I have ever tried before.  European style, its very light and airy.  The owner is very nice and makes a great cheesecake.

Ive only done the regular cheesecake and its fantastic.
author: Rich C.

description:
If you believe that proper cheesecake is dense as lead and four inches tall, Zanze's is probably not for you.

For everyone else, this is the best cheesecake you'll ever eat.  Period.
author: James B.

description:
My mom had ripped out an article from the World Journal -- a Chinese newspaper -- about this place and put it on my desk earlier this year. I finally got the chance to visit this past week. For some reason, I had the feeling that you had to preorder, but you really don't need to, because I called in 1/2 an hr before I went to pick it up and it didn't seem to be a problem.

Mr. Zanze is really nice, and he takes the time to talk to each of his customers. He makes sure you know how to cut the cheesecake properly, etc.

The cheesecake is very good. It's very light but sweet as well. I tried the raspberry flavored one and would recommend it. I want to go back soon to try the other flavors! It reminds me a lot of cheesecakes you would get from Asian bakeries and that appeals to that population -- probably the reason they were featured in the World Journal and that while I was there, the Asian man in front of me bought 11 cheesecakes...
author: Jessica W.

description:
was totally elated and excited to be here...I wanted to meet Mr. Zanze, he looks so sweet in the pictures!!!

But alas...they're on vacation. :( until august 17th.  

I will be back!!!!!
author: Eileen K.

description:
After Eileen's Special Cheesecake in NYC, this is the best I've ever tasted. 

SO! FLUFFY!
author: Nicole R.

description:
If you say you love cheesecake you HAVE to try the ones made here. 

The cheesecake here is not like any other. It is fluffy and mousse-y and amazing. It is so delicate and fragile that you need to cut it with a fishing line. Crazy huh? Definitely a sign that the cakes made here are unique. 

Zanze's is a family owned business and you definitely get that aura when you walk in. The employees here are happy, friendly and kind.  

Have fun when you get your first cheesecake and make sure they teach you how to cut the cheesecake correctly. =]
author: Jayne A.

description:
Just wanted a slice but this is not possible at Zanze. Boo hoo . I was "forced" to purchase an entire small cheesecake.  Fluffy and light and actually improved with age over four days. Yep, that's how long we made it last. It became a bit more solid over time which we prefer. Plain was the cheesecake of choice and it is pure and luscious. Creamcheese,eggs,sugar. ..no flour or fillers.
Mr Zanze showed us how to slice the cheesecake with the little rolled up piece of fishing line that is attached to the top corner of every box. I'll never cut cheesecake any other way.
author: Bleep S.

description:
I had the pumpkin cheesecake.  In short order:

- Excitement: palpable -- *everyone* talks about this place!
- Service: personable -- thanks, Mrs. Zanze!
- Texture: exquisitely moussey
- Flavor: delicious, with just a hint of pumpkin flavor (too little?) 
- Crust: non-existent -- boo!

Solid, solid 4 stars, not quite the taste extravaganza I was prepared for...
author: Laurence W.

description:
LOVE LOVE LOVE their cheesecake and the service is always top notch! The owner is very informative on his cheesecakes, and you can tell he loves what he does. 

Their cheesecake is very light and fluffy, definetly not like the rich, dense traditional cheesecake. Ask him how to cut the cheesecake! He'll give you a cute demo.
author: tee c.

description:
The cheese cake is SO DELICIOUS! You MUST get some!

My BFF bought it for me and kept it in a cooler for half a day and it was still SOO GOOD!

No other cheese cake can compare to this. You don't get sick of it if you eat too much of it because it is so light and fluffy. It is like the Japanese cheesecake from JJ Bakery but 10x BETTER!

The cake comes with a fishing string to cut it. First time cutting a cake with a string but it came out perfectly cut. Great invention!
author: Lin D.

description: Can't say much about there cheesecake(didn't even get a chance to taste one) I called them up one day to see what kind of cheesecakes they made, and when I asked them if they made a nice red velvet or key lime cheesecake the guy who answered the phone responded rudely by saying I should go to the cheese cake factory and maybe they would help me... Sorry but if your customer service sucks that's an instant fail to me!
author: Chris W.

description:
I've been a loyal fan of Zanze's for YEARS. It holds a a spot near and dear to my heart ;). Their cheesecake is the fluffiest, softest, creamiest, richest, most delicious, everydelectableadjective-est, in the world! It's rich without being overwhelming. Flavorful without the intense cheese after taste. It's simply amazing! Plus, there is a reason why they provide you with fishing wire. Don't want to crumble that cheesecake using a regular ol' knife! That's how fluffy it is! Oh and I LOVE that they put the graham cracker crumbs on the TOP instead of as a crust on the bottom. It sounds a little quirky, but that's just another thing that makes Zanze's special.

Another thing, they do constantly change their store hours so I like to call in to make sure they're open. The owners like to go on vacation during the summer so they're usually closed for a few weeks during that time. Speaking of whom, they're super nice and sweet! They like to get to know their customers which is probably why they have so many devoted regulars :)

I recommend the original for the Zanze's newbies. It's the best! :)
author: Jen L.

description: Might be the best cheesecake on the west coast. Light, fluffy, perfect.
author: Patrick T.

description:
I don't know if you've watched Despicable Me, but there's this part where the little girls just screams, "IT'S SO FLUFFY I'M GONNA DIE." 

Yeah, the cheesecake here is like that.
