There's been a couple times in the last few months where I've kindasorta been in the area but for one reason or another, didn't end up making the trek/commitment to getting one and then I just kick myself for DAYS afterwards thinking about why I didn't do it. Don't make my mistake. Just get a goddamn cheesecake and eat your heart out.
author: Amy L.

description: 4/12 stars. Not a sweets person, but I will eat the cheesecake from here. Super light and very tastey! Love it!
author: Karen H.

description: Best Cheesecake I have ever had.  Service is excellent as well.  Be sure to call ahead to see if they are sold out or open.
author: Dinesh P.

description:
Still the best cheesecake I have ever had. I bought a book on World cheesecake's and have made 5 different recipes from it recently, but Zanze's is still my favorite. Light and fluffy, not too sweet, and ooooh soooo delicate and divine.

Mr. Zanze and his wife are also the nicest people you could ever meet. I love sharing their cheesecake with the uninitiated. It will change their perceptions on how cheesecake should really be.
author: CJ W.

description:
my absolute favorite place to get cheesecake!!!!!!

I love how it is packaged with the string to cut your cheesecake.
It's not by the slice! I am sure you can eat one on your own because it is so good! I actual ate 80% of one. Felt fat and decided to share. Sharing is caring they say.
author: Chatree T.

description:
It really IS light and fluffy!!

All these yelp years, I've been wanting to try this place. I finally had my chance a few days ago...

While helping my cousin with some craft projects for her sons baptism, one of her friends stopped by to help us out. With a box in her hand, she told us she brought some really good cheesecake. I quickly asked her where it was from. While waiting for her to answer, I kept my fingers crossed and asked myself "could it be? what's the chances of that?". Her answer...Zanze's Cheesecake. As soon as she said that, I dropped my scissors, jumped out of my seat, and yelled "YES! At last, we meet".  

After my over-excitement, I calmed down a bit and enjoyed every little bite of my blueberry cheesecake slice.  It seriously melts in your mouth - you can't help but eat it too fast; it disappears so quickly! 

Mother's Day is around the corner - giving me a good reason to place an order :)
author: jesiree b.

description:
My roommate let me have a slice of his blueberry cheesecake. I hate him now for introducing me to such a delicious creation; it's going to be the reason I turn obese. It's definitely not the traditional cheesecake I've had throughout my life. This cheesecake is extremely light and fluffy. 

Definitely coming in to check out the rest of the cheesecakes! =)
author: Melanie L.

description:
Hands down the best cheesecake in the city. Also a plus because it's literally right next to where I live! :) Zanze's gets so much business that it can afford taking summer vacations; it was closed for a month this summer. It's also opened only on certain days, and it has a waiting list around the holidays so better get in line quick.

The cake is so light and fluffy that it requires a fishing line to cut it - come on, how tight is that. The crust isn't too hard or anything, it's flakey in a really good way. My cousin saved one for me from his birthday and it tastes just as good as ever.
author: Christine A.

description: What more do I need to say? Extremely light an fluffy cheesecake! Not too sweet, the flavor is just perfect! I haven't tried the other variants but the traditional one is EXCELLENT!!
author: Elaine B.

description:
This place was recommended to me by a close friend and fellow yelper a LONG time ago, but I never was able to make my way there.  It's kinda far out there, and their hours are not the most friendly, since they close at 6 most nights and at 4, I think, on Saturdays.  On a recent day off, I was driving around the area, and thought "why not today?"  

When I first walked in, I saw a few different-sized cheesecakes, with a crumb topping, and I got excited.  I was then greeted by a very nice gentleman, who packed up my small cheesecake for me.  He asked me if I knew how to use the fishing line, and when I said "No," he smiled and asked if I was a first-timer.  Pretty obvious, I guess.  

The cheesecake was a little pricey --$14.00 for the small -- but I knew it was going to be good.  It was tough waiting for my wife to come home to eat it, because I didn't want her to see that I had taken a huge chunk out of it, but when I finally cut into super-soft and fluffy cheesecake, it was worth the wait!  I don't think I've ever had a cheesecake that was that fluffy.  The only thing that threw me off was that there was no bottom crust, and the topping was only "crust" on the cake.  I would've liked more crust, but it's hard to complain when the pure, unadulterated taste of cheesecake shined through -- it's not called "crust-cake"!  We've been snacking on it over the past few days -- before dinner, after dinner, even at breakfast time -- and we're both sad that there's only a small piece left, but it's probably better for my "diet" that we're almost done!

They also have blueberry (and strawberry, I think) cheesecake, and I look forward to the next random afternoon that I'm in the neighborhood so that i can get another cheesecake!
author: Pilan C.

description: OMG!!!!! This is the best Cheesecake I've ever tasted in my life. Someone told me it's the best cheesecake in San Francisco and I was like, I'll be the judge of that, and I was blown away. I love cheesecake and they take the cake on this one. It was like biting into air. It's not bland and it's not too rich like some that I have tasted. It is perfect. I highly recommend this place. Lucky me that I work a couple offices down from them.
author: Shanic M.

description:
Ever see that Friends episode where Rachel and Chandler repeatedly steal cheesecakes from the old lady because it's so good? THIS IS THAT CHEESECAKE.

http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=98KZNd03l4U
author: Michelle N.

description:
Zanze's Cheesecake...Simply the best.
There's nothing that beats it. There's a reason why reservations for the holiday season are annually saved months in advanced. 
Great family tradition in San Francisco and nice owners.
author: Matias G.

description: Wonderful, light, awesome cheesecake.  And the owner is sooo nice!
author: Tiffani C.

description:
This really is as good as it gets.
Every now and then, I get the hankering for a really good, kick ass cheesecake.  Sure, you can go to some bakery in the City or some mass produced Cheesecake Factory cheesecake or perhaps some gourmet cheesecake from some patisserie or something similar.
But nothing ever tops the cheesecakes from Zanze's.

My family lives just a few blocks down the road from Zanzes, and we've been getting cheesecakes from there ever since I can remember -- at least the early 80's.  The shop has changed little in that time and neither has their cheesecakes.  And that's a good thing.  

The cheesecakes themselves are light, fluffy, and airy.  If you like those thick, heavy, sit-in-your-gut cheesecakes, go somewhere else.  Zanze's cheesecakes are almost like a mousse.

I don't go to Zanze's as often as I like.  But when I do, I always get a a mocha or the traditional plain cheesecake.  My favorite is the mocha.  It has been for many years.

In short, there really is nothing like Zanze's out there.  It's definitely one of the many hidden treasures of San Francisco.
author: Marc E.

description:
I like cheesecake but I sure do LOVE Zanze's Cheesecake! Definately light and fluffy like everyone said. 

I noticed this place years ago while driving by on Ocean Ave and always see it closed.  Just recently I have been craving for cheesecake and figured I would look it up on Yelp for reviews and business hours.  With all the good reviews I had to come and check it out for myself to see what all the fuss was about. 

For my first time there, I decided to buy 2 cheesecakes. One small traditional cheesecake for myself and fiance and a medium blueberry to bring for my mom and brothers.  Once I got home, I couldn't wait to try it out! It was really good and not so filling compared to other cheesecakes.  Like everyone mentioned, usually one slice would be enough but Zanze's cheesecake makes you feel you could eat 2 or more slices. It's not too sweet and it's so rich in flavor! I was worried the blueberry won't be as good but that was awesome too! 

Only downside for me is they don't have strawberry and no thick crust (which I love in cheesecake!). Other than that, I would love to come back to try the others and this is a great cake to bring to parties. My whole family loved it! Prices are fairly reasonable too.
author: sidney c.

description: I actually haven't written a review in a very long time, but I have to write one for this awesome cheesecake place. The owner of this place is a old man and a old lady that's married and have a worker that helps out the old man. When I went into the store the old man was very kind. Friendly old man that asked me what I wanted. I order a medium cheesecake with chocolate shave. He kindly asked me of I wanted a happy birthday sign for the cake since I told him it was my friend birthday.  I would say the best service ever. But the cake is even better. The texture is so soft and fluffy. And the cake itself it just so good that I wanted more.  I am most definite going to recommend this place to all my friends
author: Yannie C.

description: The cheesecake here is really light and fluffy, which makes you feel less guilty eating it - OK in by book! Ignorance is bliss, after all. I wish it had more of a crust texture though, but the actual cake part is very yummy!
author: Freckles H.

description:
For a die-hard chocolate lover like myself, Zanze's is the only one to make me choose cheesecake over chocolate for dessert.

Chocolate, I still love you! Please forgive my lack of will power as I slowly slice myself a piece of this pillowy dessert that is so delicate that it needs to be cut with fishing line. 

Please take me back after I bite into this sinfully rich, yet deceivingly light and so utterly delicious cheesecake that I can eat a whole 6" myself.

Honestly though - how can anyone resist? Even you, chocolate, won't be able to resist the traditional, crustless cheesecake lightly dusted with graham cracker crumbs. Simply presented, but just wait. One bite of this silky smooth version of a classic dessert will have you unwillingly craving for more. Good luck trying.
author: Kimberly S.

description:
Unique, delicious, one-of-a-kind cheesecake crafted by an elderly figure who is so kind, you'd think he'd stepped out of a fairy tale. A fairy tale that revolves around magical cheesecakes. 

Luckily, I was able to drop by before Zanze headed off for vacation. Closed, June 27th-August 18th 2010. Looks like I'll need to wait a while before I can get my hands on the other flavors.
author: Liana L.

description:
Cheesecakes to die for.  All right, I exaggerate, but close enough to the truth.  Amazing amazing secret of San Francisco, tucked away in a neat little shop on Ocean Ave.  

Cheesecakes that melt in your mouth.  Delicate flavor, just sweet enough but not overwhelmingly so like some cheesecakes get.  You never get tired of the light and fresh taste....

The owner is a sweet man who bakes his own cheescakes, and offers a surprising and ingenious way to cut the cheesecake, using a simple everyday item.  I was skeptical at first, but it works like a miracle.

I'm not going to overdo this, but you simply have to try this for yourself.  If you call yourself a true cheesecake lover, you have to experience this for yourself.  Don't take my word for it.  Judge for yourself.
author: Nip Y.

description:
Mr. Zanze knows how to bake!

I love how intimate he was to each of his customers and has been baking that cheesecake for 32 years.  Best thing was that there weren't 1500 selections to choose from, but just 3 simple flavours.

The cheesecake itself is definitely not like any other you've tasted before.  Upon first bite, I was in shock.  I had never tasted anything so light and fluffy, I could have probably eaten 3 slices without feeling anything.  That being said, I am a huge fan of the heavier cheesecakes so my rating is only 4.  If it weren't for that, Zanze's deserves a 5.
author: Alice F.

description: Cute little store with the best cheesecakes. They are light and fluffy. The staff is always nice and helpful. I suggest calling first to see if they are open, as they are often closed or on vacation.
author: T D.

description:
Please don't hate me for giving it a 3 star.  This is just my own honest personal opinion.  
I got the blueberry cheesecake.  I heard a lot of good stuff about this place and really wanted to try a good cheesecake.  
Price was $23 for medium blueberry cheesecake.  Cash only.  I don't think it was worth that much personally.
The flavor is very simple. The texture is too fluffy for a cheesecake. This style of cheesecake borders on mousse/soft like.  There is also barely/no crust for those of you interested.  
I think the cheesecake would be perfect if it was a little less fluffy and "in between" the common/thicker/creamy cheesecake, then it would be delicious.  
The cheesecake is not as fattening as the usual cheesecake but I would have to say there's nothing extraordinary about it.  Maybe it is because I had Asian cheesecake and cakes that taste exactly like this before and that might be why I was disappointed.  The blueberry topping is delicious though, flavor of the blueberries are very intact and fresh, glaze not too sweet. 
The cheesecake is light, fluffy, lacking in what I would define as a real cheesecake texture and flavor.  It just hit the halfway mark, and if it was just a tad bit more dense/creamy and I could taste the cheesecakeness of it, it would be the perfect cheesecake, not too rich and thick like the Cheesecake factory and not too fluffed up would be the bulls-eye.
I think maybe it's the fact that it is different from the usual cheesecake and lighter in texture and flavor that makes it different from the usual cheesecake.  It's appears to be healthier/less calories.
I don't regret giving this place a try and I will continue searching for the most delicious cheesecake. I'll know when I find it.  I'm not picky but I know when something is really good.  And yes, everyone's taste is different thus, the wonderful experience of trying new things!
author: Josephine C.

description:
this place is literally a hidden gem.

when you walk in, all you feel is coziness. 
this place is warm, and the smell, is soooo, cozy? LOL. i know you cant really describe a smell as "COZY" but everything about this place was so quaint. 

walked in, and was welcomed by a friendly hello. 

bought a small cheescake to bring home. the lady described EXACTLY how to cut the yummy cake.
now, on to the cheescake....it was SOOOOOO good. 
i cut the cake exactly the way the lady told me how to, put a piece in my mouth. and omg...that cheescake was soooo soft. sooo light. soooo fluffy.
(i know, a lot of ppl are use to the HEAVY cheesecake) but this one is similar to japanese cheesecake (for those of you that know what im talking about, YAY.) :D

but back to zanze's cake. one word; YUMMM! :)

theres a label on top that also gives you details in case you cant finish it. you can freeze this wonderful cake up to 3 months!

would i recommend it? heck yes. EVERYONE and their MOMMAS need to try the cheescake here!!!
author: Jackylyn C.

description: a fishing line to cut cheesecake..what?! as others have said, fluffy cheesecake, very light, and very delicious. cash only, 15 for a small. friendly owner.
author: Long C.

description: This place is more of a 3.5. It took me three attempts to finally get this cheesecake. First time, Sam was on vacay. Second, it was closed. I really looking forward to trying this cheesecake bc of the reviews and I think that businesses owned by an old person must be good bc of their top secret recipe. I got the biggest one for $27. The cheesecake is light, fluffy, and delicate. It's different from what I've had before. It melts in your mouth. The crust is on top and made of sprinkled graham cracker bits. It was good but not my kind of cheesecake. I wouldn't buy this cheesecake again for myself but maybe for friends. I prefer my cheesecakes to be rich, creamy, and have a thick crust. I was puzzled by the fish wire that came with the cheesecake but found out that it was to properly cut the cake. Kind of silly but cool. Try the cheesecake if it's going to be your first time.
author: Vivian L.

description: Great cheesecake! It even comes with dental floss after you finish eating...LOL
author: Dan P.

description:
There is no other cheesecake like Zanze's.  
Just as everyone says, it's as light as air, fluffy like clouds, so delicate it can be cut with fishing string.  You can easily eat several slices in one sitting (no comment on whether that happened or not).

It's a good idea to call your order in a day or two before in case they sell out.  Or if you don't want to do that then make sure to come early in the day!  Cash/check only I believe.  And don't forget to feed the meters; them metermaids are on a mission in their little cars.

This cheesecake is truely a delight.  I've only tried the original, but i've been told that every flavor is excellent.  Bought several to give as gifts, and everyone has raved about them.  Too bad they are literally at the edge of town and very out of the way for me.  4 stars instead of 5 because i'm not sure if it's so great that it's worth the extra 30+ min drive when i'm in the city.  I am sure, however, that Zanze's cheesecake is one of the best I've had!

Another great Yelp! find!
And people, don't hate on the no crust!
author: j h.

description:
I tried Zanze's Cheesecake for the first time with my friend and it was pretty amazing. It is not like any other cheese cake I've had. It's light and creamy and has a great consistency. 

The owner of the shop was a very warm hearted older gentlemen which my friend and I joked about adopting him as our grandfather. Overall the experience was great and I will come back to try the other flavors of Cheesecake. 

It is definitely not cheap but you pay for what you get. First timers, are recommended to get the traditional flavor. If you're hanging around Stonestown, drive up a couple of blocks and pay this wonderful shop a visit.
author: Sara B.

description:
I am not really a chessecake fan. However, their cakes are really fluffy! not too sweet. 
Since I needed the cake during the holiday season, I had to reserve a week or two ahead via phone. The owners/ staff were also patient enough to teach me how to cut/slice the cake using the wires. (yup, i have no experience with cheesecakes :)
Would definitely go back again!
author: RB B.

description: The best cheesecake I have EVER tasted anywhere.  It is very simple and not too sweet.  It tastes like eating silk.  As you step in to the store, it is impossible not to salivate from the wonderful smell of freshly baked cheesecake.  It's fluffy not heavy like store bought cheesecake. Although you may try the toppings they are not necessary and will only take away from the amazing texture and flavor of his cheesecake.  I have nightmares about this couple retiring.  I may never find a rival cheesecake if they close.
author: D M.

description:
Heaven on earth! 
The BEST cheesecake I've ever had. Light, fluffy and simply melts in your mouth. 

Mr. Zanze and the wonderful person who helped were both very friendly and greeted us like old friends- this was my first time in the shop.  It was worth the drive into The City for this delicious cheesecake. A drive I will not hesitate to make again :)
author: Linda L.

description:
I say this without hesitation--best cheesecake ever.....in the universe!

Zanze's is a San Francisco gem.  It's a small, shop that you could easily walk by if you didn't know about it.  

This cute couple some how turns clouds into cheesecakes--IT'S SO FLUFFY I'M GONNA DIE!!!! To give you an idea of how fluffy this cake is, you have to cut it with fishing line (included!) because it's so soft and delicate that it would just stick to the knife and you'd be left with mush...delicious mush...but that's beside the point.

The owner always suggests trying his plain cheesecake first before you try the flavored ones, and I agree.  The pure milky/ cheesey taste that you get from the airy cake is simply amazing.  I've tried all their fruit flavored ones, and although they too are amazing, my family and I always seem to go back to the original flavor.  

Normally, I'm not a huge fan of cheesecakes simply because they're too dense and way too sweet (even for someone with a mouth full of sweet tooths like me) and i get sick of cheesecakes after just a few bites, but not Zanze's.  If you want NY cheesecake, go to NY but if you want an ethereal twist on cheesecake, come to SF!   Forget the gallon of ice cream while watching chick flicks...I'll take a large Zanze's cheesecake please.  

The only thing that I hate about this place is that TOO MANY PEOPLE KNOW ABOUT IT and they sell out quickly!!!!!!!!!! Plus, they're only open like 3 or 4 times a week for like 6 hours per day....soooo around the holidays you MUST reserve a cake or two or three because well...that's the Zanze's rule.
author: Bridget K.

description:
if you do not like their cheesecake there is something wrong with your taste bud, i think their cheesecake is di-vine! 
that's all i gotta say, if you don't like it, then i wouldn't know what to say
author: Toni Rose M.

description:
My family has been getting cheesecakes from this place for a long time now. They are so delish! The cheesecakes are light and fluffy and not as dense as NY style cheesecake. The consistency is also very good. It tastes the same every time.


I would highly recommend everybody to try this place!
author: Jen F.

description:
This' has been a long journey trying to make it to Zanze's. Because everytime when I visited SF they were always closed! So, this past weekend I've made going to Zanze's a mission. Flew into SFO @ 1pm, got to Union Square dropped off our luggage at the hotel and dashed out to take the 3pm Muni($2) to West Portal, as we were waiting patiently at the station, the technician informed everyone that the electrical cables for the Muni has broken down, therefore we had to find some other way to get there. Being determined and desperate, we decided to take the taxi, 20min and $26 later, we've finally arrived at Zanze's. 

It was a very tiny shop, and there were already people waiting around for their cheesecake. Joyce Zanze was there to greet everyone, and really took good care of all her customers. I've called in a day in advance to reserve a 6" cheesecake, but after all these ordeal, I ended up getting the 8" one. 

Their traditional cake comes in three respective sizes: 6" and 8" and 10": prices are: $14, $21, and $27. 

After over an hour of Muni and Bus rides back to downtown, I've finally arrived at the hotel and eager to taste it~ it was light fluffy with a hint of tanginess, very tasty indeed~ but still wasn't as good as my favorite rear cheesecake from Bonjour Bakery in Torrance, and best of all,  I can drive there whenever I want~
author: Catherine W.

description:
You can't help but say mmm.... while savoring each bite!

Located on a quaint little street wedge between Glitz Salon and an Orthopedic shop. There's metered parking in the front. 

So glad my aunt introduced this place to me! The traditional cheesecake is sooo light, not overly sweet, and delicate! How delicate you ask? They provide you with a strand of fishing string on the box to get a clean cut, using a knife is too harsh. Check it out, it's definitely worth it! 

PRICES:
Traditional cheesecake: $14 SM, $21 MED, $27 LG
Blueberry/ Raspberry: $15 SM, $23 MED, $29 LG
Sour Cherries w/ Kirsch: $17 SM, $26 MED, $31 LG

Will definitely be back whenever I'm in town! :)
author: Misty F.

description: YUUUM. I'm usually not a fan of cheesecake, but Zanze's cheesecakes are amazing. Light, fluffy, and absolutely delicious. I buy all of my cheesecakes for my cheesecake-loving bf from here. He loves Zanze's too. Cash only.
author: Sophia B.

description:
I had my first slice of Zanze's cheesecake last night and I'm HOOKED! We had a friend over for dinner and requested that he pick one up because we were too lazy to trek all the way out to SF to get one ourselves (heh). Who knew there could exist such a light and fluffy yet incredibly rich and satisfying cheesecake? It seriously melts in your mouth and feels like a mousse. It makes NY style cheesecake feel waxy.

I could eat the whole thing by myself, but for the sake of my girlish figure, I won't.
author: Bella L.

description: I only had one slice of Zanze's Cheesecake, but it was quite good. The texture is quite different from any cheesecake I've tried, which has been primarily been New York style cheesecake. Zanze's Cheesecake is very light and fluffy; aka, dangerous stuff if you can't control yourself. I'll need to "analyze" more slices in the future.
author: Michael H.

description: THE BEST cheesecake I've ever bought from a bakery! Fluffy, light delicious heaven :) The downside is that it's so light you will undoubtedly overeat and end up consuming half of the cheesecake in one sitting...(well, maybe just me). Zanze, I will be back frequently. Thank you for the one of the best cheesecakes of my life!
author: ashley d.

description: The cheesecake specialist! They only have cheesecake, no tables, no chairs, no others. Don't come expecting to get one slice. Get the smallest one for $14 and dig in. Fluffy cheesecake, the kind of cheesecake that you will never get sick of. No hard crusty graham, just a little graham dust on top. No knife needed.
author: Marlis T.

description:
I first tried Zanze's when someone brought it into work. I heard that this place was good so I had to try it. I grabbed just a small piece because I thought it would be too rich. I took a bite and thought "Oh my gosh".  It wasn't too rich at all.

The best cheesecake that I've ever had. Super light , fluffy and creamy. 
A must have.
author: Heather P.

description:
I don't even like cheesecake, but I will admit that Zanze's is extraordinary.  I love their focus on cheesecake (just cheesecake) and the fact that they make the most light fluffy delicate delicious concoction that I've ever tasted.  

Clouds of goodness in your mouth that you won't be forgetting!

Hope you can enjoy it at some point.
author: Margot L.

description: old fashioned cheesecake. light and fluffy. the owners even demo how to cut the cake properly. classic and simple. my wife used to live in the bay area and i picked one up for her while i was up there on a short trip. she says it hasn't changed. :)
author: Jay H.

description: Zanze's has the most amazing cheesecake in SF and possibly in the nation.  I absolutely love them! The texture is light , fluffy and airy. It comes with a string for cutting because its so delicate.The price is great and service is friendly. I recommend this place to everyone that loves cheesecake.  Way to go Zanze's!
author: Ellen T.

description:
More of a mousse than a cheesecake... (makes me feel less guilty so its a plus lol)
Not too sweet
Decent prices
Different flavors ( the original and chocolate are good. i still want to try the pumpkin!)

The owner is really nice and he will teach you how to cut the cheesecake with the string.
author: Stacy L.

description:
I was visiting San Francisco last weekend for my birthday and wanted to get a cheesecake here. When we arrived at the little shop, there was a sign on the door that said sold out! We all started to freak out since we had come all the way from LA and it was my birthday and all. We decided to go in and see what they could do for us.

There were two ladies at the register who asked us if we ordered a cake. It was at this moment I told them of how desperately we needed a cheesecake and if it was at all possible that they had any left. At this point, I was willing to pay any price! 

To my surprise and relief, the two ladies thought our story touching and decided to give us a small plain one for our troubles at no extra cost. They were extremely nice and warm, and even showed us how to cut it with the fishing line. 

And by the way, it was the best damn cheesecake I've ever had. Will definitely have to make a stop here each time I'm in San Francisco!
author: Justine T.

description: Sam Zanze has been making Cheesecake for over 30 years.  He's been working in the same kitchen all these years.  His cheesecake is not the typical NY Cheesecake which is tasty but hard and crusty.  His cheesecake I call the SF Cheesecake.  It is light, fluffy & delicious in every way.  It is so light that a fish line is used to cut the cake.  I do not know anyone else in SF that has his receipe.  You will be hooked if you try it.
author: Hoover N.

description:
First off, let me start out by saying I typically do not like sweets. 

One of my friends brought one of the cheesecakes for a treat to a meeting. This was the B-E-S-T cheesecake I had. Hands down!! Light and moist compared to other dense and thick/heavy cheesecakes. 

DROOLLLLLLLLL.
author: Jenn H.

description: For those of you who like Sara Lee's Cheesecake, don't ever ever come here.. b/c the cheesecake at Zanze's is a lightweight fluffy cloud-like thing compared to the heavy ultra dense crudity that is Sara Lee. The smell of Zanze's when you open the box upon arrival is quite heavenly. It would be effin amazing if Yankee Candle could make a Zanze Cheesecake scent. Their #1 seller in the bay area, promise.
author: Henry W.

description:
A long overdue review from a regular patron.

Without question the very best cheese cake in San Francisco. For years and years now! 

BRAVO MR. ZANZE! 
ENCORE!
author: Bill G.

description: Hands down the best Cheesecake in America! Mr.Zanze please don't ever retire.
author: Jenni C.

description:
I love the cheesecake from Zanzes.  There's just no other place that makes cheesecake like Zanzes.  The cheesecakes they make is fluffy and light.  I don't feel saturated after having a slice so I usually have two.  

I've gotten this for people's birthday before and here's a warning.  I've had trouble putting candles on it.  It's very fluffy and doesn't really want to hold your candles.  Plus, it's such a wonderful cheesecake it feels like a crime to subject this cake to holding candles for you, even if just for a minute.
author: Larry L.

description:
I have been lamenting on the best way to pay my respects to Bea Arthur for a week. I couldn't think of anything great until I watched a marathon of Golden Girls. What did the original fierce foursome do when they had a conundrum they could not solve? Eat Cheesecake. Ding! 

My best friend brought two cheesecakes over to sample. He is a big fan of the Austrian style cheesecakes and of Sophia (who doesn't love her best anyway!). He advised that the cheesecakes were best eaten at room temp. I knew I was in for something new when he started dividing the cake into slices using the supplied fishing line. 

The texture of the cake is lighter than air. I was sad to discover that it was crust-less. For my taste, I prefer the NY style cheese cake with a graham cracker crust. The mocha flavor was a bit more dense. I actually found that I enjoyed the cake more when it was right out of the refrigerator in the morning for breakfast. Cheesecake for breakfast? That is a true Golden Girl moment.

Here's to you Bea.  Hope you are having fun in the big lanai in the sky!
author: Monica L.

description:
Yum. Zanze's cheesecake is absolutely the best I have ever tried. Unlike other cheesecakes, this one doesn't feel so heavy on both your wallet and your tummy so you can eat as many slices as you want. ha! It's so creamy and fluffy, almost like a mouse with crumbs on the top but with a strong cheesecake taste. Absolutely one of its kind in the city, so you must definitely try it. Especially if you're like me from out of town where cheesecakes are always made so drab, heavy, overpowering crust types, Zanze's cheesecakes are a great change from those so don't expect a NY style cheesecake. Read the reviews.

The store is run by Sam Zanze who is the nicest guy. Talk about customer service, this guy tops it all. He will show you how to slice the cake with the fishing line attached to the box and he even wraps it up if you tell him that you will be bringing it on a plane. I've already got requests to bring home more the next time I visit, hopefully real soon.
author: Chris H.

description:
Zanze's makes the best cheesecakes ever!!!

I've only tasted their traditional cheesecake but I'd like to try their other flavors (blueberry, chocolate, mocha, and raspberry).

They are only open Wednesday through Saturday and you can call ahead to place your order and schedule a date / time for pickup. We tried to pick one up once during the holiday season and they were all sold out.

I talked to the owner and he said that you can also buy his cheesecakes from the Tower Market (Mollie Stone's) on Portola. However, I'm sure they are not as fresh as picking one up directly from the Zanze's store.
author: Lester W.

description: How do they make it so light and fluffy? soooo good. worth the drive to get one. you might want two so you dont have to share.  =)
author: S F.

description:
I got to know this place through a co-worker who only buys cheesecake from this place.  I had the traditional and pumpkin spice cheesecake today.  From my first bite on the pumpkin spice flavor, I can understand why it is my co-worker's favorite.  The cheesecake is fluffy and light, unlike other cheesecake makers.  I actually liked the pumpkin spice over the traditional flavor.  I tend to like flavored cheesecake by choice.  

Instead of using knife, the owner provided fishing string to slice the cheesecake.  This was an eye opening experience to me.  

Since I live in the south bay, I am willing to drive up over 50 miles to buy their cheesecake.  Kudos to Zanze's Cheesecake!
author: Anne H.

description:
My Mother had suggested this place. I guess this place has been around for some time since she was really young when she use to come here.

The place is run by a sweet couple. VERY NICE. They recommended the traditional cheesecake, which I had purchased in a medium size. It served 8 of us exactly. The texture is very mousey and you need to use this fishing line to cut the cake so that it's texture isn't ruined when serving.

The couple had explained this to me since it was my first time here. It was verrrrry good and I don't even like cheesecake!

I'm definitely coming back to get the chocolate cheesecake when they return. It turns out that they are closed June 28 to Aug. 20 for the summer.
author: Heather H.

description: i'm normally not a cheesecake fan, but Zanze's is good.  soft, fluffy, and light.  not overly bearing like a new york cheesecake, perfect.  i just wish they had crust.
author: Karen L.

description:
BEST CAKE EVER NO JOKE
FRIENDLIEST DUDE EVER NO JOKE
i never really comment but i just HAD to logon to give this guy a five cuz its THAT good
i dont even kno wt to say no more it was ineffable
back to my cheesecake :D
author: wilson y.

description:
When my friend bought me a small traditional cheesecake yesterday, I thought it would just be like normal cheesecake. When I tired it today, it totally blew my mind off. It is so fluffy and so delicious. My brother kept eating a piece after a piece and he literally finished 1/3 of the cake. Usually, I need a cup of coffee when I'm eating a NY cheesecake; but I don't need any coffee, water, or tea to eat half of the cake. It tastes very light, but who know how much calories is in one piece...

A must try cheesecake!
author: Tiffany K.

description: I am a cheesecake man.  My birthday was coming up, so naturally I requested a cheesecake.  My totally radical girlfriend proceeds to order it from this spot, and the rest is history.  Zanze, you are a genius.  This thing tasted like whipped cheesy cakey magical delight.  I can't believe how light it was.  I've had many cheesecakes in my life and I can whole heartedly say that this one is at the top.  I will continue my cheesecake domination quest, but there has definitely been a changing of the guards.
author: William B.

description:
When you take one bite from this fluffy cheesecake, your mind will register one thing: OMG.   You do not have to be a cheesecake foodie to enjoy this D-lightful dessert.

This family establishment is THE finest place in SF to get cheesecake for special occasions, like birthdays and anniversaries.  It delivers a consistent European-style cheesecake, which has graham cracker crumbs and powdered sugar sprinkled on top.

Their basic menu comes in three respective sizes: 6" and 8" and 10":
Traditional cheesecake: $13, $20, and $26.
Blueberry, Chocolate, Mocha, Raspberry: $14, $22, and $28.

Pluses:
+ Friendly, personable service from the owners, Sam and Joyce Zanze.
+ You will be taught the best way to cut the slices via fish line, taped to the box.
+ On occasions, they have made extra cheesecakes that welcome walk-ins.
   
Minuses:
- Tiny shop gets really crowded during the holidays. (Standing room only).
- Do not take credit cards.
- There is no place to sit.
- The store does close for certain vacations. Closed SUN to TUES.

Tips:
* Be forewarned, pre-order before you walk-in.  Just pick-up and pay   
   when you get here.
* Open four days a week.  Takes checks and cash.
* Please do not tell them that their cheesecake tastes better than
  Sara Lee.  They will chuckle, but will be insulted.
author: CT L.

description:
The best cheesecake in the world! 

You slice it with fishing wire it's so soft and fluffy! I need to have one soon.
author: Melissa T.

description:
Came here on Saturday afternoon. I bought the large traditional ($27) cheesecake. Hubby wanted the chocolate one but Mr. Zanze didn't have any. They only had the mocha and traditional that day. 

Mr. Zanze was such a sweetheart! He asked if we had the cheesecake before and if I knew how to use the fishing line to cut the cheesecake.

Parking- meters down the block. 

Will have to come back to try the chocolate and mocha one. 

This is a tiny shop but it smells soooo good! 

CASH only!

If the Olympians ate ambrosia, it was only because they hadn't tried Sam Zanze's cheesecake.  I'm actually not entirely certain that I can call this particular cheesecake, "cheesecake." Perhaps something closer to cheese-cake-mousse, but even the most delicate mousse can't compare to this airy, perfection in a confection. 

I *don't* cut it with the string that he provides because that would deprive me of licking the knife.

The owner, Sam, is also utterly enchanting.  Well into his 70s, this is the kind of gentleman proprietor whose store you want to visit when you've put on a summer dress and heels, just to do the grocery shopping.

Yelpers - indulge and enjoy.  An unreserved 5 star rating.
author: Theresa B.

description:
Ummm.... where is the FULL FAT version of this cheesecake?

Yes, it's so delicate that it must be sliced with fishing line (free gift with purchase).  It must also be eaten with pinky raised.

At over $10 per mini-cake (the same size as a personal pan pizza) I was looking for slightly more cheese in my cake.  The kind that you can stick a fork into.  Mmm-kay?  

You high-brow folks continue to enjoy the light fluffy delicate texture of Zanze's.  

I, and my unsophisticated palate, will be unceremoniously inhaling a block of philadelphia cream cheese at the neighborhood grocery store.
author: lulu p.

description: Wow. I had my first slice of Zanze's Cheesecake right now, and I can honestly say this is the best cheesecake I've ever had hands down. I never knew that cheesecake could be so light and flavorful at the same time. This is cheesecake perfection. If an orga$m could be a food, it would be a Zanze's Cheesecake.
author: JOSEPH Q.

description:
Mr. Zanze is a wonderful man. It would be difficult saying otherwise about owners of local candy/sweets/ice cream shops. How can one selling something so delightful for a living be anything but wonderful and sweet? The puzzle pieces just would not fit. And it's obvious that he's not doing his job to pay the bills; he's loving what he is doing. I'd love to be in that position one day. For now, I have bills to pay.

Mr. Zanze makes these cheesecakes - light and fluffy. He will ask you if you've had his cheesecakes before. He will give instruction on how to cut the cake with a fishing line. He will also provide other tips for storage of this tasty treat. Picking up a cheesecake requires good timing. Hours during the week are short. They will go on vacation for weeks at a time. Call ahead of time if you can.

If you enjoy your cheesecakes, all that coordination is worth it. If it is your first time, I would suggest trying the original/plain flavor first. Save the other flavors for subsequent visits because you know there will be subsequent visits! For the days and weeks that Zanze's Cheesecake is closed or on vacation, Mr. Zanze will provide Molly Stone's Tower Market [http://www.yelp.com/biz/mollie-stones-tower-market-san-francisco] with extra frozen cakes - how sweet is that?!
author: Tinna H.

description: I like cheesecake don't get me wrong. But this is more like a healthier, fluffier lighter version of a cheesecake. I have to eat the whole slice to feel like I ate cheesecake where I can just have a few small bites of a regular cheesecake and I'm good. Dangerous if you ask me. I have yet to try the awesome other flavors.
author: Gessa C.

description: Pumpkin Cheesecake, now available (thru December only) for your enjoyment!!  Sold out (in all sizes) on 2 different occasions...finally hit pay dirt on Saturday and was well worth the chase!!!  Mangia!!
author: Karen S.

description:
What is not to love about this place? It's by far the BEST cheesecake that has ever graced this earth. I'm not even exaggerating. The cheesecake is so fluffy, you can't even cut it with a knife. 

And Mr. Zanze is the most delightful man. He makes everything by hand and uses precision and care with everything - even the string he ties around your cheesecake box. Not to mention, he's so friendly and remembers everyone who walks through the door. 

ps - bring this cake to a dinner party and the guests will love you forever.
author: Grace L.

description:
The lightest, creamiest cheesecake I've ever eaten!  A great desert to bring to any dinner party too.

Few tips:
- It's best to call ahead to ensure they are open.
- Place an advance order with them if it is around the holiday's as they get very busy.
 - Try to keep the cheesecake out of the refrigerator if you are eating it same-day as this yields the best texture and taste.
author: Adam W.

description: Zanze did the cheesecakes for our wedding and they were an absolute hit!  Nothing else to say, too good!
author: Sailing A.

description:
So wonderful to see Sam Zanze and his marvelous cheesecake getting long overdue attention and praise.  I can't write about Zanze's without thinking of my late father, who went to high school with Mr. Zanze in Santa Cruz back in the late 1940s, and it was Dad who alerted me to this hidden treasure in the late 80s.  Since then, I've pretty much eliminated all varieties of cheesecake from my diet except those sliced by fishing line, which limits the field to Zanze's. 

While the cloud-like fluffiness of the cheesecake may tempt you to opt for super-size slices, don't look for Mr. Zanze to be your enabler.  He's quite content for you to enjoy his wares in moderation, and his obvious vitality and friendly demeanor would make him the perfect poster boy for the Cheesecake Association of America, if such an organization existed.  In other words, if you like your dessert to fill your plate, better take his serving guidelines and multiply by 2.

All varieties are excellent, but I hold a warm spot for both the chocolate and sour cherries with kirsch.  They also have blueberry, mocha, and raspberry, along with plain.  It's good to call ahead to make sure they're open, and that they haven't sold out of the variety and size you're seeking.

For all the contrived experiences that are foisted upon us as consumers, the individual expression of Zanze's Cheesecake is a delightful exception, with a unique and high quality product, delivered by a warm and sincere gentleman doing what he enjoys.
author: Hugh B.

description:
My sister and I love this place.  In fact, she is bringing me a few boxes all the way from the Bay Area.  They keep in the freezer for a few months...so all my San Diego peeps with December-February birthdays... you are lucky, lucky people!

We've tried all the the flavors, even pumpkin....but we really like the classic one...the cheesecake is not too sweet, fluffy (so fluffy you have to use the fishing line that is taped to the box and not a knife to cut it), and made in the classic Italian way with marscapone (not American cheesecake with cream cheese)...and finally dusted with powdered sugar on top.  The fact that you can cut it right at the table is also an added bonus; no cake cutting/serving fee unless you really want fresh plates and for the kitchen to do it...

The Zanze family is very sweet...we love hearing about their travels...

My sister and I often bring these sweet little babies to birthday parties at restaurants in the city...We've not had a single occasion where there was a single moist, delicious morsel left where we could carry leftovers home....we also often had a few on hand for our dinner parties and we always secretly hoped there would be one or two portions left to enjoy with our morning coffee as we sat at the breakfast table gazing out to the SF GG Bridge view...happy memories with my little sister!

I'm totally excited to be making room for some of these babies in my freezer...flown into San Diego just in time for the holidays...YAY!
author: Connie N.

description:
Update 3/19: Mr. Zanze epitomizes so many of the things that are so great about a small, neighborhood shop. He's a delight to talk with and called me on Saturday just before closing time to remind me I had an order waiting. I had not realized they closed early on Saturday and his thoughtful call meant I got my cheesecake. Thank you again!

I drive by this place almost every day and I've never really noticed it's existence. I've still never stepped foot inside it, but my roommate and his gf were UFC enough to have stopped in while walking around the neighborhood and realized they had stumbled onto desert gold. They brought back a small cheesecake topped with raspberries. The box had a small piece of fishing wire taped to it to cut the cake. That's right, it's so light you can't cut it with a knife without destroying it. Don't ask me how you're supposed to then lift the pieces without destroying the such beauty, but somehow we managed. Awwww yeahhhhh. My fork slide effortlessly through the cake and shortly thereafter my taste buds were freaking out and completely addicted for more. I've got a large on order to bring to work next Thursday and am probably going to go back to order another large for the house too. I have to try one plain and one of the blends (chocolate mocha sounds insanely tasty).
author: Todd F.

description:
Someone here said it well, Zanze's Cheesecake does not need another 5 star review but I couldn't live with myself if I didn't give 5 stars to Mr. Zanze.  

Here's how it went down:

We reserved a cheesecake after reading about this shop with very very high expectations.  Come Saturday, we drive up from the Peninsula with big smiles on our faces, wondering if all the fairy talesque stories were true.  We see the store -how cute and bright it seems- and we park.  We go in to find another costumer at the counter and a very cute 87 year old lady seating on a chair chatting the other lady up.  It is a very small place but it doesn't feel crowded somehow it is just inviting and cozy.

Out comes Mr. Zanze carefully holding the cheesecake of the lady in front of us.  He looks adorable!  Like he should be sitting down, surrounded by small children while telling them stories with some large, old book sprinkled with sparkling fairy dust!  He says hi right away and proceeds to box her cheesecake.  The old lady is telling us how Mr. Zanze is a great dancer, and how dancing has kept her young -all this while doing a little happy feet motion while on her chair-.  Mr. Zanze then proceeds to tell this lady to remember to eat her veggies before digging into her cheesecake as she happily takes off.

Our turn since the kind old lady seems more interested in chatting than picking up her cake.  Our first time there so he proceeds to explain all the details: how to use the fishing line, how long it'll keep for, how long it keeps if you freeze it, etc.  At the end, we're also reminded to eat our veggies.  He manages to say this with such warmth you feel obligated to comply (and you know you wouldn't be able to dig into that cheesecake with a good feeling unless you follow his instructions!).

I carefully guard this piece of heaven while we drive back home.  While sporadically muttering some words to remind the bf to drive carefully, we do have a cheesecake on board!  We get home, eat something healthy, and finally, it is cheesecake time....  It is so fluffy the fishing line is a must (I just made myself hungry *tear*), lift it carefully with a knife which is about the width of the pieces you cut and it'll come out no problem.

Finally, take a bite, *O-M-G*, *melts*.  How does he do it, my cheeks were tingling, I couldn't hold back a smile and a moan of pure joy.  It is so airy and fluffy and flavorful but still you feel so satisfied after one slice.  It has kept me happy since Saturday and I am sure it won't last too long so I am glad we got a large one.

When you go to Mr. Zanze's be respectful and polite, respect this place that has made so many people happy because after you visit him once, you won't be able to stop finding excuses to buy more cheesecake!
author: melisa n.

description:
I always drive past this little shop on the way to school each morning. So i decided to try this place out. I have to say ***DROOLS*** their cheesecakes are little slices of fluffy goodness. Compared to all the cheesecakes i've tried, this is by far the lightest and fluffiest i've ever eaten. I tried the original and the pumpkin. Both were equally delicious. 

On the plus side, zanzes has the nicest staff ever. They consist of elderly folks. You can really tell that they are doing what they love, which probably shows through their desserts. 

Just keep in mind that if you need to order your cheesecakes ahead of time during holidays like thanksgiving and xmas because they only make however much is ordered. Lines are also pretty long too sometimes, but its a totally worth it to try.
author: Mable N.

description:
The best cheesecake I've ever had. It's not as sweet as Junior's cheesecake, and it's not as heavy as the Cheesecake Factory's cheesecake. I could eat this all day. (I'm slightly exagerrating.) This is a mom and pops type bakery and the man was very friendly and helpful - he even teaches everyone how to properly cut the cheesecake without messing it up (by using a fishing wire). $13 gets you an 18 incher. There are about five different flavors (strawberry, pumpking, and I forgot).

JONASAPPROVED!
author: Jonas T.

description:
Every now and then we all need to fly in the face of the overwhelming majority.  Today is my turn.

Call me krrazayy but I like my cheesecake rich and creamy, not fuffy like a mousse. 

I relish the moment when you take that first bite and then have to actually chew and let the creamy goodness consume your whole mouth. If I am going to eat cheesecake... dammit..I am going to make those calories count! 

Joyce and Tom, if you are reading this don't take offense. I am not an ingrate - who poo poo's free dessert. It's just that when I heard cheesecake, I worked my panties into a bunch and then was surprised to bite into the fluffy cheesecake. You know... it's like drinking up a glass of water, when you were expecting 7-up. That kind of tastebud surprise. Love you guys... hope you still love me too! Come on' we're family! Hugs? XOXOX
author: Stephanie I.

description:
YUM YUM YUM YUM NOM NOM YUM YUM YUM YUM!!!!!!!!  Zanze's has the best cheesecake I've ever had!    

I was never a fan of cheesecake until I had a bite of Zanze's cheesecakes.  OMGee it was so light and fluffy!  Fluffy enough to be cut with a fishing line that's provided by Mr. Zanze.  He always makes sure his customers know how to cut it.  You can tell he puts a lot of heart into his cheesecakes.  

I really hate how hard it is to decide which flavor to get -- they're all so yummy!  I usually end up getting a traditional plus another flavor.  If you've never had it before, try the traditional one!    

Sometimes I'd drive an hour to SF just to get it.  When I finish a slice, I always end up going back to the fridge for seconds... thirds...  I end up cutting my slices really big!  haha...

I don't think I can ever eat NY style cheesecake again.
author: Chibi H.

description:
Let me start off by saying Mr. Zanze is the sweetest man ever!

As for the cheesecake, it tasted delicious.  Really the taste lived up to the hype.  My only complaint is that it wasn't as thick as I like my cheesecake. I thought it was a little to light.   I put it in the fridge to cool in hopes that it would get a little more thick and it worked.  Still, I wanted it a pinch more thick.  

I'd eat it againand again FOR SURE, but I'm still on my quest for the perfect cheesecake :)

3.5 stars
author: Angie C.

description:
10 out of 5 stars! 

BEST CHEESECAKE IN THE WORLD. 

An example: we bought a cheesecake for a friend who was visiting from Japan (she had lived in the US for a while before going back to Japan) and she exclaimed with joy, that she didn't think it was possible to find dessert this good in America (with respect to her tastes).

I always try my best to share The Zanze Experience with my visiting friends and family.
author: Aaron N.

description:
seriously, the cutest old man in the whole of God's green earth makes these AWESOMELY HEAVENLY cheesecakes. IS THIS EVEN FAIR????

i don't think i have to describe how wonderful his cheesecake is. 

if you like light, mousse like, non super sweet cheesecake, this is for you.

if you're a die hard fan of cheesecake factory type cheesecakes (dense, very sweet), this is the exact OPPOSITE of that. 

i feel like the people who give low ratings for this place have the WRONG idea of what kind of cheesecakes this place specializes in. so i feel like i need to UNDERLINE that one thing.
author: Irene C.

description: Cheesecakes are my favorite and a good cheesecake is very hard to find. Today, I went to Zanze's to give this place a try, let's just say "I've found my religion!" The dangerous and best part is...we happen to live close by. yikes! more, more more!
author: Ken S.

description:
You have to pre-order your cheesecake ahead of time for the holidays.
 Every year I look foward to coming into the Zanze shop the day before Thanksgiving to pick up my cheesecakes. Its part of my holiday traditions. Usually the whole family is there, and, its so nice to know you'll observe everyone there, helping out like you can only see at such a magical shop like this.

I also remember the very first time I bought a cheesecake with my own money.  Mr. Zanze was so sweet and lovingly showed me the wire trick, how to keep and serve it.  I tried to tip him, it was so lovely that he took such great pride and craft in his cheesecake. But he refused. He said "I charge a fair price for my cheesecake."  What a wonderful business, how can you not want to fill you family up with something from this man? That was over 10 years ago, and every time I drive by it, I smile with warm thoughts.  Mr. Zanze has a special gift to share, not only his cheesecake.
author: Cheryl D.

description:
If you only like your cheesecake dense, rich and creamy then you'll probably enjoy Zanze's, but it may not be a place you'll frequent often. If, however, you can get into light and fluffy cheesecake then this is your place!

I've had the blueberry and pumpkin cheesecakes (within the same week!) and both were fantastic, although I like the blueberry better.

If you follow the Zanzes' directions and use the fishing line (included) to cut your cheesecake you'll lose almost none of it to the cutting process. A hidden benefit to not using a knife is avoiding those embarrassing moments you're caught licking the knife clean...between each slice... 

I love the shop's laid back, minimalist feel, and the Zanzes have treated me well the few times I've been there...check it out!

If you still have any doubts about light and fluffy cheesecake, think about how much more of it you could eat (compared to dense, rich and creamy cheesecake) before getting full!
author: Art D.

description:
Wowwie, I can't believe I never knew this place existed! 

I've only tried their traditional cheesecake so far, and it's absolutely one of the best! It's not too sweet, and it's light and fluffy; so it's easy on your stomach after a big meal. Perfect dessert! 

I think they have seasonal flavors as well; such a pumpkin for the fall. I really want to try that one!

My mom loves it.
author: Nance W.

description:
good cheesecake just like the reviews mentioned. 

guy is super nice. kind of weird they dont accept credit cards. 

what is this the 90's? im sure they milk the cows in back too
author: Bobby B.

description:
The cute little Zanze's man wouldn't let us buy the mocca cheesecake because it was our "first time".  He forfeited the extra dollar he would have made by allowing us to get the more expensive cake and gave us a brief tutorial on how to slice our plain cheesecake with fishing line and explained whether six or eight people should eat the teeny tiny "Small" cheesecake.  The boyfriend and I gave eachother knowing looks because we had sinful plans to eat that sucker alone.  Just the two of us.  No witnesses.  It was gonna get UGHly with a capital *UGH*.

After a long night of eating, drinking and eating some more, we returned to my place and proceeded to defile the cheesecake with a plastic fork and spork.  My god it was good.  We thought we'd be able to live with just a tiny sliver of a taste before bed.  A sliver ended up being an inch wide and then turned into an additional slice and then ... I tied the dang thing back up in the box and sent it home with the boyfriend.  I knew I wouldn't be able to resist it, and I'm trying to watch my buddha growth.

Get it.  It's light.  It's creamy.  It's dangerous for your big G.  Why not?  Life is too short not to taste ...
author: Jenny K.

description:
Talk about old school. You step inside here, and it's like a time warp. His quaint shop on Ocean Ave has probably never changed since he opened. The charming owner is the lone worker, and he's obviously been at it for years, or frankly, decades.  

He walks you through slicing the cheesecake and what temperature to serve it, trust me, you don't get this kind of customer service anymore.  The cheesecake itself was light and fluffy, not dense and heavy like I've known them to be.  Speaking of which, let me get another slice now...
author: Derrick V.

description: Zanze's is the best place to get cheesecake IMHO and I am not even a big fan of cheesecakes. It's a small mom and pop shop that churns out little pieces of heaven. The cheesecakes are light, fluffy and airy. So much so that you need to cut it with a piece of fishing rod, which they provide for you. My favorite is the pumpkin flavored cheesecake. It is only offered during the holidays. Be sure to call ahead a few weeks and reserve your cheesecake for Thanksgiving and Christmas. They sell out fast. The owners are the most delightful people. I love supporting small businesses like Zanze's.
author: Chi N.

description:
I want to kiss the owner....muah muah muah....the traditional cheesecake is just heavenly. So light and silky smooth, slightly tart to the perfect balance. Sprinkles of graham cracker on top just to add some text and contrast to the smoothness. Think about Japanese or Taiwanese cheesecake...it disappears in your mouth within seconds.

They keep very well, I slice them with the string that's attached to the box, then freeze them so I can enjoy them whenever I feel the need for some comfort.

It's NOTHING LIKE your usual American cheesecake, for example, the ones at Cheesecake factory. They are gross. Some of them even calls for "no bake cheesecake"...yuck...that means it's just cream cheese and sugar. 

Check the days because they are not open daily, or call in advance. It's definitely worth a trip.
author: Yuchi C.

description: Zanze's cheesecake with chocolate shavings was a big hit among my friends.  It's so airy that it has to be cut with string!  That's pretty darn cool.  The shop is charmingly small and sort of quaint, and the man (Mr. Zanze, I imagine!) who sold us the cake was as sweet as can be.  It was a pleasure to buy cake from this little family business, and the cake was devoured within minutes.  Note - CASH ONLY!
author: Molly P.

description:
So much for 4 days of vegan diet aspirations.  
I buckled and bought a small cheesecake with sour cherries and kir cream.  This is cheesecake like no other.  The liquer flavor soaked cherries are wonderfully acidic and strong.  The cheesecake itself is definitely not like New York style.  It's super aerated and eggy in flavor.   So, it's almost like a flan in taste, but fluffy like merengue in texture.  In my defense, I didn't eat the whole thing.  But, this was definitely not vegan.
author: K W.

description:
a fluffy cheesecake.
wow!
supreme flavor, wonderful texture.
don't expect the dense heavy Cheesecake Factory version.
this is the bizarro Cheesecake Factory.
author: Jeff W.

description: The best fluffiest cheesecake ever!!!!! I've had it twice, once just with the graham cracker crust and once with a fruit topping. I think the original is the way to go. It's so light and heavenly. Don't bother reading the reviews, you must go there and try it for yourself!! AMAZING.
author: Christina S.

description:
First slice of cheesecake I've ever had was from Zanze's. Light, fluffy, not overly sweet. Even at the age of 8, I knew this was something special. The thing I looked forward to most on holidays and birthdays was a slice of blueberrry cheesecake from Zanze's.  I've had many cheesecakes since, but have always favored this lighter fluffy style of cheesecake. 

For those that find the cake too light, you can freeze it and eat it semi thawed. It's still great.
author: Wes C.

description:
Mmm. Really good. 
Just try. It's really good.
author: Green Mango Y.

description:
Being a crazy fan of cheesecake, I've passed by here many times and saw this place closed =( Last week I finally saw the magical OPEN sign as we drove down Ocean. I bitched the shit out of the driver (who came here once with me before on a closed day) and he bust a U under somewhat dangerous circumstances =P I then peeked in and let myself inside, into this cute little shop with this cute old man who greeted me! I swear.. it was just one of those moments like the ones you see in movies or cartoons (the familiar old man with white/gray hair who is so warm, friendly and knows how to cook). Maybe the old man at the candy store, a fine restaurant or a bakery. You know what I mean? Now those were just my thoughts, but they were definitely reconfirmed when my company told me the same thing as we walked out, "he seems very cute huh?" 

Anyway.. he asked if I had ever had any of their cheesecake before and I said no. He suggested the original and he showed us how to cut with the fishing line. He was very nice and conversational =)

The cheesecake was light and delicate as he mentioned. It was VERY light and not too sweet at all! I've never had anything like it and that's for sure. My company said that it was "good" as well and followed it with some "nods of approval" - something that he does NOT do often. I myself, am into the more heavier cheesecakes, but this was something unique. I finished half the cheesecake myself, within the same day =)
author: Elaine H.

description:
First time to the store. Tried the traditional cheesecake.

At first, my wife and I were alittle disappointed that they didn't sell the cheesecake in slices, but bought a small one anyway. We were surprised by the smoothness, the taste and the texture. Glad we didn't just buy a couple slices.

The cheesecake decor is plain, but it will command your respect after you put it in your month.
author: Benedict C.

description:
As soon as I tasted the soft, creamy, melt in your mouth cheesecake from Zanze's, I quickly said - if Diddy made "Da Band" walk across town for Junior's cheesecakes, I'd make my band (if I had one) walk 7 x 7 to deliver some Zanze's right to my door. Their cheesecake is soooo good that I did not even feel guilty eating two slices after a grueling 1.5 hour workout. Yum! 

I have yet to visit the shop and get the whole Zanze experience. My most awesome boyfriend brought home the yummy treat and raved about how cool Mr. Zanze is. One look at my boyfriend and Mr. Zanze's noob radar began to beep. Sensing that it was his first time, he gave my boyfriend the Zanze Cheesecake tutorial - what flavor to taste first, how to cut the cheesecake (their cheesecake is so delicate that each box comes with a piece of string to cut each slice), and he also dropped some knowledge on the shop's history. 

Zanze's is a local treasure. It's the cheesecake equivalent of Mitchell's Ice Cream (probably would taste awesome together too, lol). Best cheesecake hands down! 

Heard Zanze's going on a mini vacation....so get your fix before the end of this week because he's not coming back until August! 

Recommendations: 
Everything. =)
author: Lisa T.

description:
I was sent here by my wife to pick up a cheesecake. The owner is one of the friendliest guys that I have ever met. He was extremely helpful, and suggested that being a Zanze's Cheesecake Virgin, i should go with the original one. He asked how many people the cheesecake was for, and  suggested a size (although I ordered the next size up, because I was starving), and even gave a demonstration on how to correctly cut it.
We've lived just around the corner from this place for 10 years, and never stopped by until last week. We will definitely be stopping by more often.
author: Mathew J.

description:
Someone brought this over to my house when I hosted dinner. I thought the fishing lien cutting technique was cool.

Good cream cheese flavor, but I guess I prefer something heavier, so that's why I give 4 stars.

I'll have to go into the shop sometime to see what they're really all about.
author: Anita R.

description: Yeah. It's not like this guy has a shortage of amazing reviews. AND FOR GOOD REASON. Holy moly. They best cheesecake I have ever had. And I have had a lot of cheesecake in my life. LOVE IT! Fluffy amazingness!
author: David E.

description:
Rarely do deserts make me go head over heels, but this cheesecake was delicious! Very light and fluffy. Love it =D

Ricotta cheesecake actually feel like a dessert and not a heavy full course meal. 

Definitely the best! (IN THE WORLD)
author: Sheldon W.

description:
Deciding on a rating for Zanze's was very difficult for me.  I absolutely love cheesecake so when I saw the high average rating for Zanze's on Yelp, I had to make a trip down to Ocean ave to pick one up. 

What immediately struck me was how nice Mr. and Mrs.  Zanze are.  Zanze's is a mom & pop shop in every sense of the word and their warmth and enthusiasm is easy to feel.  

Unfortunately, after my first slice of the cheesecake, I felt somewhat unsatisfied.  While the flavor is excellent, I missed the taste cues that I normally associate with a cheesecake like a firm but soft graham cracker crust, a nice bite to the cheese filling and that hint of sour cream layer on top to add some taste contrast.  Instead, the Zanze's cake is more like a mousse cake.  The flavor is very good but when I was finished I just wasn't too happy.

I still give Zanze's 4 stars because of the excellent service and the fact that even though the cake was different than I was used to, it still was very good.  In the future though, I'll stick to more traditional, heavier cheesecakes.
author: Rishi K.

description:
They do one thing, they do it well, and they don't waste much space doing it. One of the finest desserts I've had in SF, good enough to stand alone (and plain) without extra sugar or sauce.  Although, I want to try that marinated cherry topping...

The gracious service and charming little shop are a bonus, and give you a story to tell when serving the treat to your guests.
author: Matt R.

description:
Let me start off by telling you that I don't normally eat cheesecake.  I just think it's too heavy tasting for me.  So when I read all these reviews about Zanze's Cheesecake, it peaked my curiosity.  

Once I got in the door, I felt better, it is a small shop run by a cute couple.  They only take cash, and they only make cheesecake.  Classic flavor and maybe a few other flavors.  For my first time, I got the mini sized classic which serves about 8 slices I was told.

I was amazed!  It had the flavor that I love about cheesecake without any of the heavy feeling!  It was amazing.  I will be honest, I ate three slices, and didn't feel guilty at all!  The bread crumb top was amazing and the cake it self was light and fluffy and cheesey.  

I am now a fan of cheesecake.  At least this one.
author: Denise B.

description: I was not a fan of cheesecake until Zanze's. The 'cakes' are so light and fluffy. So melt in your mouth! Not a heavy cheesecake that tastes like a cream cheese block. Yummy!
author: Janet B.

description:
I received TWO cakes for my birthday and they were HEAVEN.
Best cheesecakes I've ever had.
author: Angela Q.

description:
Sooo light n fluffy, i love this cheesecake vs. that heavy thick stuff. My mom used to get this cheesecake once in a while back in the day when the cakes were 6.50 for a small and 8$ for a medium. Still the excellent goodness. Mr Zanze has pretty good recommendations, but sometimes u just wanna order the large and eat it all!
The best is the fishing line cutting technique!
author: ToAsTy T.

description:
First off, I want to say that I am not a huge fan of cheesecake, except from what Cheesecake Factory has to offer me.

But in comes Zanze's. I will say right now, that i will be going to Zanze's this weekend because one of my friends from Vegas has heard us (me and another friend) rave about the cheesecake from this little tiny shop.

At first I thought it was a small cafe, but it's not. It's literally just a small shop, where seriously, only about 6 people can fit before you might have to go behind the counter. And it's a very quiet spot.

Being the only customers the first time I went to this place, the gentleman was really nice in helping us decide on what to do. He asked us if we've ever had the cheesecake before, and when we said no, he recommended that we go with the regular flavored cheesecake. This cheesecake is so delicate, and soft and literally melts in your mouth. It's so delicate that you have to cut it with fish wire to make the slices. It's fun to actually cut =)

Anyways, the second time I went back to this place was when it was packed with people. I also learned that they don't take credit cards during my second visit. So anyways, we tried the raspberry cheesecake and just as good as the regular flavor. =) Definitely a place I would go to just for cheesecake.

Only thing is I always get confused with the hours and times they are open.  I have  a business card from them, but I don't know where I put it. boo.

Try it. But don't take my word for this place =)
author: J D.

description:
I won't even begin to describe the day my three friends and I went through just to get us some of Mr. Zanze's cheesecake. I will say our adventure involved some tears, some blood, and at the end of it all...a melted cheesecake. Now if you asked me, would I do it all over again? I'd have a moment to silently ponder and then say YES!

I am not a huge fan of cheesecake (I find too heavy at times) but I was absolutely blown away by the cheesecake at Zanze's. It is amazingly light and airy...even ethereal (I'm not sure if you can use that word to describe food?). Not too heavy on the sugar either.  

I love the fact that is a family-run establishment serving an age-old family recipe.  Zanze's is a well-deserved five stars!
author: Priscilla M.

description:
The first time I had Zanze's cheesecake was probably 15 years ago.  It truly is the perfect cheesecake.  So light, so airy, so perfect!  I've never been a big fan of NY style cheesecake (too rich and dense), so Zanze's is true cheesecake heaven.

Somehow I stopped going there for several years, and I was convinced that it probably wasn't there anymore.  What a delight to know that Zanze's is still in business with so many passionate customers!  My husband picked one up for me a couple of years ago because I kept talking about it so much, but since then I haven't had it at all.  I'll have to make a trip over there sometime soon...
author: Mai S.

description:
One star because I got lost and couldnt find it.  When I did they were closed that day.  I'll change my rating if I am able to find this place again.  

**I know it was my fault for not checking busniess hours and writing down directions.  I am fat.  Forgive me.**

EDIT:  I finally had the opportunity to eat a Zanze cheesecake.  Since I am a yelp whore I told my sister I wanted to try Zanze's cheesecake.  Yesterday she calls and asked if I wanted a piece because she was in the area.  Of course I said yes (what fat ass wouldn't?) and she brought back a small cheesecake with raspberry topping.  The topping was really good and fresh.  She went to buy the cheesecake at 4pm and left it in her car until she delivered it to me at 11pm.  She claims they told her to leave it out of the refridgerator for 6-8 hours.  When we finally ate it the cheesecake tasted like whipped cream.  It had no body to it.  I was disappointed.  BOO!  This morning I woke up with a stomach ache.  But I think that was from the 8 pieces of popeyes fried chicken I ate along with mashed potatoes, beans and dirty rice, biscuits, and a mango.  Yum!
author: Fatty A.

description:
No doubt about it, Zanze's makes the best cheesecake in San Francisco. I definitely love it! But be forewarned that this cheesecake is not like the typical cheesecake you are used to eating. It is not the strong flavored dense cheesecake commonly referred to as New York Cheesecake. Zanze's cheesecake is of the Japanese version. It is fluffy and lightly sweet. It is best described as a delicate Sweet Cream Cheese souffle. To me, this version is the superior style when it comes to cheesecake, but please let yourself be the judge of that. 

Like the cake, the store is simple, traditional, and homey. Once inside please take a little time to talk to the owner. He is there everyday the store is open and is always happy and enthusiastic to describe his cheesecakes. I guarantee that you will return for seconds...
author: Simon L.

description:
My Absolutely favourite cheesecake.  It is not your New York Cheesecake, but light and fluffy.  you use fishing line to cut the cheesecake.  I like the cherry and kirsch the best.  original is always good, and their seasonal ones are what i wait for every Halloween, 

The owners are the friendliest people as well, so you cant beat Zanze's
author: ray l.

description: probably the best cheesecake i've had in SF after my trip from NYC. i got myself Junior's Famous Cheesecake in Brooklyn, and i def raised my standards for cheesecake after Junior's. Zanze's cheesecake is just as awesome as Junior's except in its own way. Junior's was a little heavier but i like the lightness of Zanze's.  i grew up in the area going to elementary school right across the street from Zanze's and had Zanze's for the first time recently in my 23 years of life, i must say, those first 23 years were 23 years i was deprived of Zanze's.
author: Tony L.

description:
Definitely good cheesecake, but I've had much better versions of the light and fluffy style. Zanze uses Philadelphia cream cheese in their recipe, but I think that's better suited for the dense style cheesecakes. Ricotta makes a much better fluffy style.

I ordered a small, regular flavor for $14 and waited a couple hours after dinner before digging in. The cake is very aerated and demands gentle handling or else it starts to get messy. The flavor is on the better side of decent, but the texture was a little too foamy for my liking. There was no need to wait two hours after dinner either, because the cake is so light it's almost not there.

My personal gauge for deciding how good a dessert is depends on whether or not I want to gobble the whole thing down in one sitting. The day after purchase, the majority of Zanze's cheesecake is still sitting in the fridge and I keep looking around it for something else to eat...
author: CrapulentMoose ..

description:
I didn't read any of the reviews for this place beforehand, but I guess today MUST have been my lucky day. Around 3pm on a Friday, I decided to go here and get my mom a cheese cake for her birthday. I found metered parking right outside the store, and upon walking in the door, I got blasted by this heaaavenly aroma. I don't know how else to describe it. There was one other customer there, and he was already having his order boxed up and tied together with the string. I heard the man talk to this kid about how to store, cut, and serve the cheesecake. When it was my turn, I ordered a small raspberry cheesecake (around $10-$15) for my bf and I to split and a medium of the same flavor (for my mom's birthday gift) which was around $20-$25. I don't remember how much each were, but I ended up spending a total of $38 for those two cakes today. I'm glad I didn't read the reviews because I was so surprised and delighted at how light and fluffy the cheesecake was. (Insert "Despicable Me"s "I'M SO FLUFFY!" line here.) No but really, there's nothing more that I can say that would differ from any other review about this place here on Yelp.

The man, I think he's Zanze, or Mr. Zanze, or whatever his name is, takes much pride in his cheesecakes. You could hear it in his voice and see it on his face how much he loves his creation. He was very accommodating and he says he usually recommends the regular cheesecake if it's your first time there. He teaches you how to cut the cake using the fishing line they taped to the top corner of each box.

If you're into the more heavier and denser cheesecakes, then maybe this place isn't for you, but it's still DEFINITELY worth a try.
author: Michelle B.

description:
Eat every bite with silence.
