If you never eat their cheesecake before, go to a room where silence prevails, slowly guide you fork on to the piece you are eating, and listen
author: Jonathan C.

description:
If there was a 6th star, I'd click on it...

I don't even like cheesecake. But when I had Zanze's cheesecake, I went to heaven and then back. 

If you want a cheesecake that just tastes like cream cheese & sugar, then this is not for you. But if you want to experience the ultimate tantalizing bliss, GO FOR IT!
author: Aya C.

description:
I would love to give Zanze's a sixth star. Boy does he deserve it. 
Zanze's cheesecake is one of the best cheesecakes in the WORLD!!!!
It just melts in your mouth like butter. Light and fluffy, creamy and dreamy.
If you live in the city this is a must have.
author: Nicole P.

description:
Where to start...

I gave it 4 stars for 2 reasons; service and flavor.

Mr. Zanze is probably the sweetest old guy in the world, in fact, I think my girlfriend fell in love with him.  Stupid charming old man with eyes of aquamarine. 

So, I agree with the haters one thing, the texture.  I loved the taste, but felt unsatisfied in the texture dept because it was just too damn light and fluffy. 
 If you're the person who opts to pay an extra buck for that whipped Yoplait, even though you realize there's only about a teaspoon of yogurt in there, then you may love this cake at room temp.

The good news is, if you can keep your greasy disgusting little fingers off of it for a while, take it home and refrigerate it, it becomes much firmer and more satisfying to eat.
Refrigerated, it's probably the best cheese cake I've ever had.
  At room temp it's just too damn fluffy.

so, keep an open mind and don't expect it to be like any other cheese cake you've ever had.

I will be returning, and probably trying the sour cherries topping.
author: Boiled H.

description:
OH MY GOD! There is a heaven on earth and it is called Zanze's!!!

You like cheesecake? Good cheesecake? The kind you get to cut with floss?! You will LOVE zanze's. 

Seriously, cheesecake is one of my favorite things on earth, and this place has the top cheesecake. Except of course, for my own creme brulee vanilla cheesecake. But you would have to be my friend to taste that sweet little treat....you're drooling now aren't you?!
author: Jacqueline M.

description:
This bakery whips up my all time FAVORITE cheesecake ever!!!!
(credit to Bender R. for the introduction)

It is fluffy and taste SO good because it is not too sweet and the crust is sprinkled on top. Always a hit when I bring it over for potluck dinners.
author: Katie K.

description: The perfect shop.  The perfect personalities.  The PERFECT Cheesecake!   I loved every bit of the experience.  Walking into the shop brings you back in time when things were simple.  They only accept cash and I love it because anything digital just does not belong.  Pure heart, gentle soft greeting.  This is the first chapter of a cheesecake romance.  I will never leave San Francisco without one of these specialties again.  Like stumbling on to the unexpected musical genius but the notes dance on your palate and into your mind.  All I see are clouds.  Thank You:)
author: Julius W.

description:
this store is so hidden that i had to go by word of mouth to search it ... i wish i had known earlier, being a frequent visitor of the sfsu area years before (when the boyfriend was still in school) ... but i think that would have been a bad thing to be addicted to these deliciously fluffy, airy, not sweet cheesecake so early in life - i would be not the size i am now. =)

the lady is very sweet, and asked if i knew what the fish wire was for (not for decoration..) it is actually used to cut the cheesecake since it is so dainty! what a fantastic idea. they shop is kept nicely. order them if you are not sure if the season is peak season. do call them in advance in case of holiday hours ... the cheesecake are SOOOOOOO reasonably price that makes you feel almost awful. i would buy 100 in one day if i could eat that many to make sure they keep baking what they bake!
author: Linda L.

description:
almost at the end of the world. kind of hard to imagine that it is at the same city. 
"almost at the end of the world" is a good description for the cheesecake. in other words: it is worth the crossing... 

my one complaint: by the time you make it there, all your enzymes are shouting zanze, which means that every minute you have to wait for it is ocean length (haha! pun), and that is excruciating. (in objective terms its probably not that long, but in zanze cheesecake terms it is a life time)

i have to apologize to a very nice lady who was behind me in line (of course she was behind me and not in front of me - at that point i wasn't feeling very amicable toward the people who stood to get cake before me). we were having a very interesting conversation which i cut short incredibly rudely when Zanze put the precious box in my hand. i don't even think i waved goodbye to her, being completely engrossed with the image of my future self drinking coffee and eating cake in my kitchen.
anyway, i'm sure she understands - after all, she was minutes away from her own slice of heaven.
author: tal n.

description: Zanze's is right down the street from my dentist, so after an appointment one day we stopped in to take a peek. We came at a good time, as they were whipping the cheesecakes up fresh, and we walked in right as the owner put a fresh cake it in the case! While we were torn between the different toppings, we wound up getting a small, plain Cheesecake to take home. It was fun using the little string to cut the slices - felt very old school traditional. The cheesecake was so light and fluffy - not at all too heavy. Very delicious!
author: Kristy C.

description:
I called for a sugar free cheesecake, as I read here that they had sugar free cheesecake.  I spoke with the staff and they said that they did not have sugar free anything and they did not know why it said they did here on Yelp.  They said they had no control over what it said on Yelp. 
I had spent a lot of time looking all over the Bay Area for my birthday dessert and this cheesecake sounds delicious, so I was very disappointed.
My review alerting people to these facts was removed and hopefully this more explicit review will not be removed, as people who cannot eat sugar have a hard time finding foods they can eat and don't need to waste their time and get their hopes up, when a place does not in reality make sugar free desserts.
author: mickey M.

description:
What's the point of reviewing a place so highly praised already?  Well, when it is THE best cheesecake I've ever eaten, it merits a review.   

It's so amazingly light and creamy.  I've heard of some people preferring a denser cheesecake, so if you are one of those, it may not be the very best you've ever eaten, but I can promise you - you will not be disappointed.

Zanze's is an institution.  Please, Mr. Zanzie keep pumping out those cakes.  Good health and long life to you Sir!
author: Alex I.

description:
I love Zanze's cheesecake so much, it's the best cheesecake I ever had! It's very light and tasty. I always buy another hole of cake to freeze and keep it for a couple of weeks. It lasts for 3 months in a freezer. I really like plain cheesecake but blueberry is also very good.

The people at the store is very nice as well, too.
author: Yoko S.

description:
Been here a few years ago and still remember how magnificient the cheesecakes are.  Heck, I'm writing this review base on my experience 3 years ago!  It's like food of the gods.  Only drawback is the hours of operation which seem to alway conflict with mine.  However, it doesn't matter since I would go out of my way to get it.  

I'm on vacation for the next 2 weeks and for sure I'll be dropping by for some cheesecake and rubbing in to my friends at work!  Mwahahaha

Current ranking favorite

Original
Blueberry
Raspberry
Chocolate
Mocha - Can't remember
Pumpkin - Have not try it.

You won't regret trying it!
author: Sum W.

description:
I am here to get a cheesecake a couple years ago because I had heard these cheese cakes were so great. So I went and got myself a $20 cheesecake. Took the cake and had cut it with the fishing line as instructed.

It wasn't typical firm or a heavy cheesecake. It was very light, fluffy, smooth, creamy, and crustless cake as people had mentioned. I just didn't see they hype of $20 for this thing was about.
author: M C.

description:
pretty good parking on the street.  either in front or across the street.  don't get hit by the cars going by, they don't like to stop for jaywalkers.

great place.  great greeting and wonderful service.

cheesecakes come in 3 or 4 flavors.  3 sizes.  mini, regular, and um, the next size.  lol.

the gentleman behind the counter is very open and honest and he generally asks if you've been there before.  he will recommend the regular which isn't regular but its covered with graham crackers.  Its before you choose one with fruit on top.  So you can get the taste and feel of their cheesecakes.  He wants you to graduate to the other flavors.

I enjoyed it, my family loved it.  Though my mom has grown up on Sara Lee frozen cheesecake she's all ready had two slices from the mini.

Okay, i can't believe i've even written this much.  I should have just said, TWO THUMBS UP!  GIVE IT A TRY!

prices are 13.00 for a mini, and i remember seeing a 26.00 in there.  So there might be one higher but i can't remember.
author: Bing D.

description:
Other than the fact that they aren't opened for a lot of the week, this is one of the best cheesecakes I had. It's a tiny shop front that does mainly orders for pick up. When I came in I saw that they only had about 7 cheesecakes to choose from and in 3 flavors.

So I got a regular one and was happily on my way and a bit excited about trying it out.

*note* if you like a dense, creamy and heavy cheesecake that would make an already full person explode then this isn't for you.

The cake was light, fluffy, rich without being dense and most importantly not overly-sweet. The fishing line that is used to cut the cake is ingenious. From a usual 8 serving cake we were able to cut it into 16 3-bite pieces which was perfect for sharing around the office.

The staff was very helpful and very sweet and the cake was delicious. So much so that I'm contemplating going back there after work to get a cake for home.
author: Vicky C.

description:
For a light, fluffy cheesecake, this is the place to get it.  It has a mousse-like texture.

I prefer a dense, thick cheesecake - but this was great!
author: Le T.

description:
5 stars all the way... the best cheesecake I've ever had. J thought I had lost my mind when I couldn't stop mmmming and aaaahing over how good the cheesecake was. It's been a few days since my first Zanze's experience and I haven't been able to get that delicious cheesecake out of my mind. I can't wait to go back! 

The shop is a cute little place. There's no place to sit and eat so you'll just have to enjoy the cheesecake elsewhere. They don't sell by the slice, but they do have a mini cheesecake for $9. I went with the medium for $19... pretty fair compared to cheesecakes from The Cheesecake Factory, of which I'm not a huge fan. 

Service was warm and friendly... Mr. Zanze is one cool dude... and he has the best cheesecakes in town!
author: Vitamin C.

description:
I also showed up at Zanze's due to Yelp reviews.

i can't think of anything to say that hasn't already been said.  Mr Zanze is a really cool guy.  Been making cheesecakes for 28 years.  man that is a lot of cheesecakes.

i had the original, it was very tasty.  i agree that you have to like the light texture.  i've always had the heavier kind and i think perhaps i prefer that slightly more.  but Zanze's is very good, and i'll be back for more. 

I suppose if i had the choices in front of me of cheesecake factory cake or Mr Z's i'd take mr Z's.  but if i had a choice between my mom's heavier style and mr Z's i'll have to say i'll take a slice of mom's.

actually i lied, i would try to eat both LOL
author: ken h.

description:
For years, I get the original cheesecake for any occasion I can think of. Birthdays, holidays, Mother's Day, anniversaries, anything! This is my go to spot for any potluck (I always volunteer to bring dessert) and for some reason, I'm always invited back...! Plus, people always get a kick out of watching a cake being sliced by fishing wire. I've gotten the blueberry once, and it's just not as good as the original. 

Call ahead to check if cakes are available so you don't make a wasted trip.

I always tell the owner I would drop everything and be his cheesecake apprentice if he's ever looking for one.
author: Anna Y.

description: I can't believe I didn't know about this place when I lived in the area!!  I had a slice of the original cheesecake last night at Pacific Cafe over in the Richmond district and WOW - just unbeliveably light and DELICIOUS!  After a lovely seafood meal I was hesitant to have dessert thinking I'd have no space to fit it in but somehow I always find space for dessert!  This cheesecake makes you feel like you're not piling on any calories and its just heavenly!   I plan to make a special trip to Zanzes to get my fix!!
author: Lyn M.

description: The cheesecake here is really really really good. Mr Zanze makes a light and fluffy cheesecake. Also included in your box is a fish wire to help you slice the cake. This is necessary unless if you want to use a regular knife and mush the whole thing. I'm like dense cheesecakes better, but i appreciate good tasting cheescake, which is what Zanze offers. I only order the small $14 plain cheesecake. And for some reason, i always eat 1/4 of it at a time. I really would give this place 4 1/2 stars, but since thats not available, this is rounded up then.
author: Steve T.

description: This cheesecake is so delicious and fluffy! Zanze is also super super sweet and the nicest guy you can meet =)
author: Stephanie K.

description: With over 300 reviews and averaging 4.5 stars, I don't think I'll have anything new to add. So I'll keep it short... if you haven't tried the cheesecakes here, you gotta go. Just do it!!!
author: Connie S.

description:
Summary:
Price: Fair
Food: Nice
Must Try: Cheesecake (Original Flavor)

It's something you can't imagine. When you take the first bite, you would feel like as if you were in heaven. And before you even realize, if not half, a quarter of cake would be gone. REALLY SHOULD TRY.
author: Jolin L.

description:
When I took a bite of this heavenly cheesecake, I immediately started thinking about how to take one back home to Seattle. Sadly, I had to drop the idea because I was traveling by air. Damn. If only I had driven... well, if I drove, I would probably eat the entire cake before I hit Oregon. 

Zanze's offers the lightest, fluffiest, and yet creamy cheese cakes. I only got to try the traditional, but I think it's a good one to start with. Really reminded me of a Japanese souffle cheese cake...maybe that's why I loved it so much (and my Japanese friends would agree with me). If you prefer a heavy, rich and super sweet NY style cheese cake, Zanze's may not be the right fit for you although you should still try it...you may end up surprising yourself! I personally loved it and think the craftsmanship is superb. This is definitely one of the places I am coming back to when I revisit SF.
author: Kaoru W.

description:
This is another one of the rare dessert places that I can not only stand, but I actually like a lot.  Many of my local friends have raved on about Zanze's and how privileged they were to have been indoctrinated into this SF tradition.  They lament on how hard it is to get one, how delicate the first bite is, how even though they might not ever find their favourite flavour all the time and how flipping cute the complimentary fishing line is!

So much talk that I'm dreading that the build up will spoil my experience.  Apparently not so.  I had an opportunity to try two slices (because you can't stop at one) a couple of nights ago and now I'm writing this on my second two slice experience with a happy face making yummy noises.  It is incredibly delicate and does almost illegal things to my mouth and tongue.  I am ruined for cheesecake forever.  Now I need to go practice my lament of trivial things.  Mmmmmm...
author: Chris C.

description:
Completely hidden! I LOVE this place.

Actually, I used to come in here as a kid after my dentist appointment which was next door, haha. Sorry Dr. Feldman! But talking to Mr. Zanze was always great because he showed you exactly how to cut the cake, which to me will continue to have the same mystique as it used to when I was seven. Just believe me that you will be floored with the taste. And I will admit it, I came close to eating the whole thing...many times.
author: Anne Julia B.

description: This place is tucked in there. You wouldnt even notice it was there since it's only open 4 days out of the week. The cheesecake is not New York style. It's more fluffy and creamy. It's a small shop and the old man that helps you is super nice he even teaches you how to cut the cake with fishing line. You can tell they handle each cake with a lot of care when making it. I'll have to get another one for the next special occasion. Highly recommend!
author: David L.

description:
Tried chocolate and traditional (again), and oh man.  They were good.
Next week, raspberry.

You won't regret for making all the way to Zanze's.  It's worth it.
author: Yoko S.

description:
coming here is like visiting relatives for the holidays. there's always a big smile on the owner's face(forget his name) when you walk through the door. if you look overwhelmed or confused over what to order, he'll be more than happy to help you out. no need to hurry, you will not be rushed!

these aren't normal cheesecakes you get at your local grocery store freezer where it takes a sumo wrestler to cut through the pie o no no. these are delicate creatures, so delicate in fact, that it requires a fishing line(included) to slice. and to add to that, there's a special way to do it! you'll get the lowdown when you go get your own pie...enjoy!
author: Melissa Y.

description:
Be very careful.  This cheesecake is so easy to eat and eat and eat.
I luv that the flavour is full on your palate but the actual texture and weight of the cheesecake is so light and fluffy.  
Even lighter than most mousses.

So light that all you need is fishing twine to cut this cheesecake.
author: M E.

description:
We went to this hidden place today, and bought a small one for $13.  Since this was our first time to been there, Mr. Zanze recommended us to try the traditional one. That's absolutely what I am looking for~ The texture is so special and great --- light and fluffy~ 
You should try~
author: Jun L.

description:
Zanze's makes the best cheesecake that I've ever eaten in my life.

If you haven't had it, you need to turn off your computer and go get one right now.
author: Brent T.

description: Disappointed. It tasted good, like cream cheese and wasn't too sweet. However, it was not what I was expecting from a cheesecake at all. If I wanted a cheesecake that was so light and fluffy, I would get a Japanese cheesecake, not this. I like the lightness of it, but wanted at least a bit of creaminess and smoothness, but was not getting that. Because it was so airy, there's almost a grainy-ness to it which is very unpleasant. Very one-note texturally too since there is no actual graham cracker crust and is just a very thin layer/dusting on top.
author: Victoria L.

description:
for sure 5 FREAKING Stars... i wish i can give like 10. HAHA
the cheesecake i got from a friend was awesome. it was so tasty, but then again it confused me. i was like WTF is this fishline for? being stupid, i didn't know what it was for, so i asked my friend and they said to use that to cut the cheesecake. the light in my head suddenly turned on, WHAT A GENIOUS. HHAHA

i'm definitely coming back here for cake, forget those chinese bakery stuff.
author: Eric Y.

description:
The cheesecake's different from what you normally expect from cheesecake--the new york 3" tall slices heavy enough to be a meal. Zanze's is super light, like a heavy whipped cream, but not lacking in richness. I recommend ordering with fruit on top. The plain allows you to concentrate on the texture of the cake, but the tartiness of fruit definitely kicks it up a notch.

One more thing, cash or check only, so be ready.
author: David G.

description:
I love this place! Their cheesecake is just what I am looking for. Something that is not very sweet not too heavy like cheesecake factory where u feel sick after two bites. The owner is sooooo NICE! He cares so much about his customers. 
Story: I attempt to buy the large cheesecake for 4 people but he insist that I should get a smaller one because too much cheesecake is bad for my health.... " I am speechless" 
I bought the large cheesecake anyway because I told him I wanted to last for at least a week. However that is not true because there is only two slice left and it's only been one day! Yes I ate half of the cake... =x
Yummy!!! Please don't stop making these Mr. Zauze!
author: Aylee G.

description:
I was driving down the street when I spotted this place and remembered all the good reviews.   It was around 5:45 on a friday and there was no one in the store.  Luckily they weren't closed and we ordered the raspberry cheesecake.  Mr. Zanze went in the back, made the whip cream fresh (I loooooove fresh whip cream), topped the cheesecake with the raspberries & explained how to cut it and what not.  He was the cutest ever! Even warned us to eat dinner before we ate the cheesecake. 

The cheesecake itself was so light and delicious...my sister and I seriously just sat there in silence savoring the flavor.  Then we ate some more for breakfast this morning. Oh, what a way to wake up in the morning. 

Just a note, there were signs in the shop that the Zanze's would be on vacation July 1st-August 22nd and the shop will be closed.  So if you are craving some cheesecake you better go stock up soon!
author: Kimberly C.

description:
Zanze's cheesecake is the Manolo Blahnik of desserts. Rumor has it that Mr. Sam Zanze has two sons, but neither plan to continue the business after Zanze retires. Like Manolo, he has no heir, so get it while you can! 

I can't say much that others haven't said. If you expect those heavy bricks that are New York style, you won't find it here. Think feathers and souffles. For first-timers, start with the plain and don't be surprised that it comes with a fishing line to cut with. The cakes aren't overly sweet and are made without butter or flour. 

Between the deliciousness and excellent customer service (virtually everyone that works there is as sweet as the cheesecakes), I rate Zanze's all kinds of awesome.
author: Esther L.

description:
This cheesecake was absolutely amazing.  It's perhaps the lightest cheesecake I've ever tasted.  Typically there's a lot of weight to them, but this one was as light as air!

Fantastic flavor... what are you waiting for... go now!
author: Aaron M.

description:
Good job on that Mocha Cheesecake.  You said that it was one of your most popular and now I know why. 

Easy parking but weird hours, so you better call first!!!  Never fear, I think they still sell his cheesecake at Tower, only in plain but still good.

stinky tofu
author: StinkyTofu S.

description: Finally tried Zanze's Cheesecake. That place has been on my mind for years every time i pass by it to go to City College or to the gym. The cheesecake is so light and fluffy that i fool myself that i could actually be eating something healthy, even though i know that's not the case. The guy at the place says they use Philadelphia cream cheese for their cheesecakes. But, I gotta say, i kinda wish i didn't try it. Now every time i'm running on the treadmill at 24 hr fitness or sitting in anatomy at city college, i'll always be thinking, "Zanze's is only a few blocks away...."
author: Douglas F.

description: I don't even like cheesecake.  but. holy. cow.
author: Julia C.

description:
I love these cheesecakes... what keeps me coming back to these delightful desserts are that they continue to be good in flavor and consistency. Remember to order ahead of time when it comes to holidays because Zanze's usually is filled to the brim trying to fill orders.

Furthermore, this is a family owned business of which the owner has told me the recipe has been passed down for generations. Not only are the cheesecakes great, but the family that stands behind the cheesecakes put some much care into each one. I love coming back to this place and will continue to support their business.
author: Maria C.

description: Zanze's Cheesecake is light and smooth in texture. I am a big fan of the chocolate cheesecake. Mr. Zanze takes great pride in making sure that his prized cheesecakes are taken home and cut properly with the fishing line he provides. The only downside is that they are always closed when I want one! Definitely worth the wait.
author: Sheila C.

description:
I ordered the raspberry one and didn't realize they only accept cash. The gentleman working was VERY nice and chatted with me while my boyfriend ran to the bank to grab some money. He took the time to show me how to cut the cake with the fishing wire. Another customer came in while I was waiting and raved about all his different cheesecakes (especially the pumpkin one around Halloween).

The shop is very simple, but that's perfect for the kind of cheesecake they make there. 

When we got home I cut the cheesecake and we both had a bite. It was very fluffy and light and the raspberries were nice and tart. We had 2 pieces each and had quite a bit left over (we ordered a small and split it between 2). If you want something heavy and super sweet, this isn't going to be what you're craving.

I'd recommend it to anyone who's looking to try a lighter, yummy alternative to the Philadelphia cheesecake.
author: Lindsay S.

description: On my 29th birthday, I had a Zanze cheesecake. It was basically perfection and I really didn't want to share. But metabolisms do slow down with age and I used my better judgment and shared.
author: Jane K.

description: Rich Gaddi brought a small sized traditional cheesecake last week for us to taste. It was our first time to have tasted that kind of unique fluffy & light but so super delicious cheesecake! I am telling you it's better than the cheesecake factory's ultimate red velvet cheesecake. My wish!? I wished that Mr Zanze would share the recipe with me, pls pls pls!!!?? We LOVED it!
author: Edith Christine D.

description: My Family and I have been eating Zanze's cheesecakes since I was a little girl.  There is no better cheesecake in the world!!  You have to try it, and I guarantee you've never had anything quite like it.
author: Christine Z.

description: I've been living near this place for over a year and finally tried it out yesterday. Mmmm...it did not disappoint. The cheesecake was light, fluffy, and so tasty. It was a hit at the party!
author: hyacinth d.

description:
The owner of this wonderful gem is an absolute delight. The cheesecake could have been awful, which it wasn't, and still made this establishment worthy of at least 4 stars. 
A small mom and pop shop serving delicious cheesecake. no more no less. 
I discovered Zanze's on Yelp and placed an order the day before for a cake for my brother's birthday. Mr. Zanze was more than accommodating with only one day notice.
Upon pickup we were given through instructions on how to cut the cake in picture perfect fashion. The cake was adorned by a marzapan happy birthday..which Mr. Zanze made sure to mention was edible.
The cake itself: a crustless fluffy light slightly tangy bite of melting heaven in your mouth. Perfectly dusted with graham crackerness. 
The cheesecake was the bell of the ball.....everyone could not sop raving about the sheer perfection. The cakes come in three sizes and are VERY reasonably priced. 
Please note: this is not a new york style Cheesecake.........But please don't discriminate. Zanze's Cheesecakes is in a league of their own.
We are all looking forward to the next occasion to pick up another one....anyone having a birthday???
author: Kelle K.

description:
This is the best cheesecake you'll ever taste in your life.

All I have to say for Mr. Zanze's Cheesecake is to get the traditional one. I'm not saying the other flavors are bad, but the best one is the traditional, very LIGHT, FLUFFY, AND CREAMY. 

Believe me, try it and you'll think you're in Heaven.
author: Billy L.

description:
Does Zanze need another 5 star rating?
no.

Am I writing one any-the-hell-way?
yes.

Why?
because they are that good.
If you like you like your cheesecake fluffy as a cream-cheese cloud,
this is as good as you are going to get without having to sell your soul.
And unlike deals with the devil, this one will only cost you about 25 bucks
and a few extra pounds.
Which you'll loose the next week from exaggerated hand gestures explaining how awesome it was.
author: Micah M.

description: Good bye, Cheesecake Factory! I found REAL cheesecake, and I'm in love! My fiance ordered the chocolate cheesecake and the traditional as a surprise, and I've never tasted anything like it! Each bite was so delicious and the texture was just perfect. A little on the moussy side, but who said cheesecake had to be hard anyways? I loved the chocolate one with all the shavings on top. The shop was also very cute, and the owner was such a gentleman, I wanted to ask to become his apprentice! Definitely coming back...after Mr. Zanze returns from vacation in August of course! Thank you for making my tummy and taste buds feel sooo good!
author: Ang L.

description: OMG! I can have an orgasm just eating the cheesecake. I waited too long to try this place. It is so light and fluffy, totally different from the rich NY Cheesecake. Dang it, I had to share it with 15 other people, when I could have ate the whole thing myself. =)
author: Erica B.

description:
i am curious since i am too lazy to sift through all 213 reviews, is he still serving these up with fish wire for slicing?  :)  

if you like a dense cheesecake or are wowed by cheesecake factory cheesecake varieties then Zanze's cheesecakes may not be your cup of tea.  

Zanze's cheesecakes are soo light and fluffy that i am happily deceived into multiple portions without guilt! 

this place is a San Francisco institution and is worthy of trying at least once but bring cash.
author: Eileen L.

description: YUMMMMYYY!! The cheesecake was so light, I didn't feel bad at all for having this for breakfast. Don't you even think of cutting this cheesecake with a knife, opt for a string instead.  The texture is nice, silky, and definitely feels guilt free! I definitely want to try the berry cheesecakes! I'll be back! :)
author: Jen P.

description: This is by far my favorite cheesecake in the entire San Francisco Bay Area. Just writing this review is making me think about the soft, light, fluffy cheesecake this place has. I've been a customer here for longer than I can remember and after trying hundreds of different kinds of cheesecakes, Zanze's cheesecake is still my favorite.
author: Carolyn F.

description: This cheesecake can turn anyone into a cheesecake lover. really light and fluffy and very fresh (they actually asks us to wait a day before we eat it). Trust me you dont wanna miss out on this cheesecake. I wish it remains open on more days and for longer time. This year I forgot zanze's vacation time of the and now wont be able to get the cheesecake till mid august.
author: Rushang M.

description: I know everyone else has said the same thing, but this is the lightest and fluffiest cheesecake I've ever tasted, while still having the perfect balance between "cheese" and "cake". And what a pleasant shop to go to. Big smiles from everyone in front and back. It was the perfect birthday cake.
author: Francesca A.

description:
I've had Mr. Zanze's cheesecake twice. Once, for my friend's birthday, and again for my sister's birthday. DELICIOUS! 

It's creamy, and cheesy. The scent is so fragrant I couldn't help but smile all the way home, thinking about eating it. And the flavor lingers in your mouth! It's a small cake, but you're meant to enjoy every morsel.

I have had an eye on that shop for the last two years, failing at finding occasions appropriate for cheesecake. It's such a treat, it should be for a special occasion.

Mr.Zanze is super sweet, the adorable old man baker. He taught me how to cut the cake with his fishing line, we talked about his wife who use to be a teacher at CCSF. And I was going to be in a car for 2hrs with it, so he told me exactly how to store it and how long I had before things spoiled. 

HIGHLY HIGHLY RECOMMEND!
author: Reggi L.

description:
i've been meaning to sample the infamous cheesecake, which many yelpers have been raving, about in a couple of tries for the last few years, only to find the shop closed every time i stopped by (either off hours OR vacation time!!!).  finally, my better half got it BARELY just 10 minutes before it closed as we were looking something to bring to our friend's home for their farewell dinner.

once we got to our friend's home, the zanze box's label along with a taped fish-slicing string instructed that we could eat it chilled or in room temperature, we opted for room temperature considering that it was cold and foggy outside. 

after a delicious nikko homemade comfort dining, we (six of us) were looking forward to munching the "eat me now" zanze raspberry cheesecake.  a friend who just happens to be a cheesecake connoisseur was yelping like a dog as i cut it into slices with the provided fish string.  

even though i do not normally eat cheesecake due to its usual heavy ingredients, i was quite pleasantly surprised to find it airy, fluffy, and easy. it was so frickummyilous that it had me tempted to lick the residue off my plate, but good thing i didn't as i was just being polite.  my "yelping" buddy has approved it though he would have loved to try it chilled since he said that the cake was supposed to be little more dense simply so he could savor the taste little more longer in this mouth, and after all, we gave him the last piece because he gave us an articulated lecture about the details on the density cheesecake. 

next time, i will definitely try it in its chilled mode and see if my buddy's on the spot about its density.
author: Gabe L.

description:
tried a piece of cheesecake from here last week and LOVED IT! decided to come get a whole one for myself =) 

great service. the only thing is that it's cash only
author: Priscilla W.

description: I loved it! This cheesecake is very lite and you can not stop eating until is gone.
author: Olga S.

description: My friends got me birthday cakes here.  I'm all over it.  If you like to impress someone who loves cheesecake, you can't go wrong with Zanze's.  It's simply the best!  :)
author: Jacky L.

description: You've really haven't tried cheesecake until you try  Zanze's Cheesecake.  The cheesecake you get from Zanze's aren't the same as you would be getting anywhere else.  Other places sells cheesecake that are as hard as a rock.  The cheesecake from Zanze's are light, soft, fluffy, and it melts in your mouth.  You can't cut a cheesecake from Zanze's with an ordinary knife.  It is absolutely a no-no.  When you purchase a cheesecake from here, a string is given for you to cut the cheesecake with.  This is a place where I would come back over and over and over and over again.
author: Bryan L.

description:
Their cheesecake is one of the best cakes i ever had.
but i think what makes them so special is because they are rare,
they close so many days in a week and they go out for vacation a lot.
you cannot get it  that easy, then you want more~, 
and finally you get it, and they satisfy your expectations:)
author: Chihiro O.

description:
I used to live 3 avenue blocks away from Zanze's and one of the sad things about leaving the neighborhood was being more than a 3-minute walk away to this heavenly cheesecake place.  They even give you a nylon string to cut it.

LIGHT, RICH and ADDICTING!

I now live in the Mid-Peninsula area and I still find myself driving all the way to Ocean Avenue for a box of cheesecake (or maybe two...).
author: MJ A.

description: This is my first time having Zanze's Cheesecake and I must say it was pretty amazing. I think depending how if you like the texture of your cheesecake you will either hate it or love it.   Most cheesecake you would find the graham crackers on the bottom as the crust but this one you will find it on top. This cheesecake is not sweet and is one of the most fluffy I ever had. My mom don't like the fluffiness so she don't like it and rather have cheesecake factory.   My friend bought me the original to try and told me to use the fish wire to cut the cheesecake with.  At first  I thought it was just a fancier way to cut it but you really do need to use it instead of a knife of the cheesecake will fall apart.
author: Nicole C.

description: Wow!  What delicious cheesecake!  My stomach says I can't eat anymore but my taste buds says "keep it coming!". I don't know if I'll be able to stop! Nice and creamy with the right amount of fluff and not too sweet. Perfection.
author: Cassandra H.

description: I really wanted to like the cheesecake here at Zanzes because of their stellar reviews.  In the end, it just didnt hold up to my expectactions.  Three stars alone for such wonderful, outstanding customer service. This cheesecake is very light and very fluffy, and has an almost mouse-like consistency.  I'm a huge cheesecake lover so I'm sticking to the original dense NY cheesecake.  The fishing line technique is pretty cool and it's even included in the box.
author: Lauren S.

description: After all the rave reviews on yelp I had to try it for myself. I love how the cheesecake here is light and fluffy yet it still tastes heavy and like cheesecake. I don't notice the cheesecake being foamy or anything weird like that. The one thing I could complain about is the price I guess as I felt like my 6in. cheesecake was tiny and $14 but maybe that is because next time I just need to get a bigger one to get more bang for my buck.
author: Em F.

description:
wow...

when i saw the cheesecake I thought...

wow...

when I used fishing line to cut the cheesecake I thought...

wow...

when I took my first bite of the cheesecake I thought...

wow...

this cheesecake is amazing...

wow...

i don't even like sweets too often...

wow...

Mr. Zanze is a cute old man...

wow...

I wish he could live in my apartment and make these cheesecake's for me every day...

wow...
author: Jen D.

description: unique take on cheesecake...fluffy sweet dessert....whipped consistency...cutting with string possible....gram powdered crust on outer instead of in....airy treat to share....guests gracious enough to supply....marvelous end to dining....zanze's cheesecake worth visit and try....
author: Hen A.

description: Fantastic family-owned little shop, Mr. Zanze bakes every cake every day that they're open (Wednesday through Saturday, he makes 50 per day), and they're each remarkably delicious.  It's best if you call in and reserve your cakes a day or 2 in advance, as they sell out very quickly.  During holidays, it's best to reserve a couple weeks in advance.  The cakes come in small, medium or large (6'', 8'', or 10'' in diameter), in 6 different flavors - traditional, blueberry, chocolate, mocha, raspberry and sour cherries with kirsh.  Not all the flavors are available all the time, hence it's best to reserve in advance if you know there's something specific you want.  The shop is very small, so it's basically a call-and-order then pick-up kind of place.  Metered parking is right outside, enforced on Saturdays, so bring change.  The cake prices range from $13 to $30 each, and they accept cash or check only.  The airy texture of the cakes reminds me of a mousse - I do not know of anyone else who makes this kind of cake - Mr. Zanze will bake extra cakes which can be found at Molly Stone's Tower Market (635 Potrero Drive) so that people can buy them when his shop's closed.  The service is excellent - they really seem happy to share their product with you - not surprising, as the cakes are wonderful!
author: Lyn Y.

description: I always say that we have some friends that are like cheesecake...you can only take a little bit of them at a time because too much kinda makes you ill.  This totally does NOT apply to Zanze's cheesecakes.  A Zanze cheesecake is like that best buddy that you just want to hang out with all the time.....never does anything to annoy you, and always has your back.
author: Cindy L.

description: Yes, this cheesecake is in fact the lightest and airiest around, so light you have to cut it with fishing line, which is a nifty gimmick at parties.  In fact, it's a little *too* light for my taste.  I really prefer dense cheesecake, and I've found online recipes that work perfectly and are super easy, plus, it's waaaaay cheaper than buying one here.  Still, a visit here is obligatory if you're a cheesecake fanatic.
author: Wes M.

description: this old man probably gets laid everyday.. from different women..
author: Sean P.

description: Tried this place for the first time today---cutest little place ever. The lady working the cashier was so sweet. Felt like we were walking into a grandmother's kitchen. The cash register itself was WOODEN, which goes to show you how old school this place is. The place is clearly very popular---the customers before us had all pre-ordered their cheesecakes (which I recommend since original cheesecake is the only flavor you can get on the spot). The lady's husband bakes the cheesecakes everyday! Anywho, tried the original cheesecake tonight, and it was DEEELICIOUS. FLUFFY, LIGHT, and MELTS in your mouth! =)
author: Diane G.

description:
I never knew that cheesecakes could be so light and fluffy!

Mr. Zanze is super nice and you can tell all the effort he puts into these delightful cheesecakes and his shop. He'll even ask if you have ever tried his masterpieces before... if not, he'll recommend the original vs. the other flavors. 

The cheesecakes do freeze well, too. I was kind of hesitant to buy a whole cheesecake and it eat myself.  

I'm not sure if the store is open on weekends, there were so many times that I passed by and the store was closed. Worth making a trip to if you are in the area on a weekday. =P

No seating inside, so make sure you have a fork ready in the car if you cant wait to get home.
author: Retired B.

description: Suffice it to say that, if heaven is a fluffy cloud of airy perfection, it's most readily embodied in Zanze's raspberry cheesecake... so if you want eternal bliss, be good and eat cheesecake!
author: G. J.

description:
i used to live on this one way street off ocean. walking, it would be about a quarter of a block to hit up the walgreens. driving, it would be about two and half blocks. i drove to walgreens all the time. 

zanze's more than THREE WHOLE FREAKING BLOCKS AWAY. i would walk here..........


if i had to.
author: Euge L.

description:
the texture & feel of this cheesecake alone is an exquisite experience........airy, light, mousse-like cheesecake... the moment you take a bite... the cheesecake dissolves & disappears, making you want more and more......... on top of all that....you feel guilt-free.....ya!!!!

the owner/baker  kindly suggested the original cheesecake, showed me how to slice the cheesecake with a fishing line & boxed my cake up.  he was really cool....he had this old-fashion, good natured, good neighborly feel about him.
author: Cindi N.

description:
This is a one of kind treat.  Never have I had such a fluffy light cheesecake...I love it.  And I don't even really like cheesecake.  This one just melts in your mouth.  We even considered using them for our wedding cake.  

FYI...they go on vacation and close the darn store for a few weeks...so no yummy cheesecake during that time  :( 

But otherwise, they are the best!  All flavors are tasty.  Our favorite is the original with the raspberries on top.
author: Yangy T.

description:
I realllllly really really want to give this place 5 stars because their cheesecake was indeed very very tasty.  But for some reason I had some problems buying it.  I was buying four cheesecakes for ladies I work with and they wanted to buy it for themselves and their families of four.  I called in ahead to make sure they wont run out of cheesecakes and the owner asked how many ppl the cheesecake was for, to which I answered families of four each.  He suggested that I got the small cheesecake and I'd never seen the cakes myself before so I agreed.  Once I got there I saw the size of the cakes and decided the ladies would need a larger cake, so I apologized and asked for bigger sizes.  For some reason, he was very very very reluctant to sell me three medium cheesecakes instead of three small ones.  I still don't know why.  Maybe there was a shortage of those cakes? I'm not sure.  He didn't explain.  All in all, it was a lot of hassle just to upgrade to bigger cakes.  Or maybe he was afraid we wouldnt be able to finish such big cakes.  But the mediums turned out to be too small as well (we're monsters here I know).  But, it is the best cheesecake I've ever had and the man was quite pleasant once he decided to sell me the cakes.  But sorry for being the one four star review among all these perfect five stars :(
traditional cheesecakes are...
small: $13
medium: $19
I forget how much the large cheesecakes were.

they also have mocha, pumpkin, blueberry, and raspberry for slightly higher prices.  call in ahead to order the cakes/place them on hold so they dont run out.
author: Peggy W.

description: This is the best cheesecake ever!!!  It's so soft they give a fishing line to cut it with.  I had the plain one just to taste, but the person that was lined up behind me said, that plain is good, but blueberry is better.   He told me that he moved out of the neighborhood and he drives 45 mins. just to get the cheese cake there.  The owner is really nice elderly gentleman.  1000% I will go there again.
author: Peter L.

description: This is the most amazing cheesecake I've ever tasted!  Cheesecake has always been my favorite dessert and this is by far the best I've ever had.  I tried the traditional plain (as I tend to be old-school minimalist) and the texture is so delicate and rich, it nearly melts in your mouth.  The cake is fluffy and creamy yet dense enough to hold it's shape and have that weight that cheesecake does.  The size is perfect (not huge) and the fishing line is a requirement to make each piece the perfect portion without ruining the integrity of the rest of the cake.  The light dusting of powdered sugar along with the perfect paper doilie makes the presentation very elegant.  The price is high, but worth the indulgence.
author: Stephanie W.

description: We used to live down the block on Santa Ana Avenue many years ago.  I often bought cheesecake from Zanze to bring as a house gift or something.  I haven't been there in a while but I still remember how very light and fluffy their cheesecake was.  Yes they recommend slicing it with fish line....that is how delicate it is.  Hmmm gotta go there this week-end!
author: Tess G.

description: The only site on Yelp that always gets 5 stars. I had to check it out. I had another friend visitging from NM and we decided to head over and see what all the hype was about. The hype is all about THE ABSOLUTE BEST cheesecake I have ever tasted. Smooth. Light. DELICIOUS. We actually showed up after they were closed, but we pressed our noses against the glass door, explained that my friend was visiting from out of town,  and the owner was kind enough to open the door and sell us one small cheesecake to go. I would rate this place 6 stars if I could!!!!
author: Jamie M.

description: Love their light and fluffy cheesecake!! Just wish they would extend their store hours, so that I don't have to rush there after work.
author: Bobby C.

description:
been eating these cheesecakes since 2004 when i worked at a doctors office down the street. i love the patients who bring their doctors food. i would always wait until someone else ate it first so i wouldnt look like a fatass. tasty though, and so small. 
came here a little while ago and someone was there to see about getting a cheesecake wedding cake, how nice.
author: just k.

description: 2 words...Over-Rated! You can get a better cake at Costco. After reading the reviews I had to try this place. It wasnt awful, but it was by no means good. Take a pass on this one.
author: Chris P.

description: omg, ate a medium all by myself! loves. when i got one for my bday a few years ago, i had to share...
author: kim w.

description: I finally ended up here today after wanting to try their cheesecake for a long time. We were greeted by an older gentleman who gave us some good advice about what to try and how to cut it. We ended up buying a medium plain cheesecake. The cheesecake is really fluffy, almost mouse like. It also tastes like a mix between cheesecake and flan. It has a strong egg flavor and a really light cheesecake flavor. If it were up to me, I honestly wouldn't call it a cheesecake because it's completely different. If cheesecake is what you are craving, this isn't for you. Overall, it is pretty unique and it does taste good but it isn't the best. If I were to rate the cake itself, I would only give it 3 stars but I just had to give them an extra star for the friendly service.
author: Diane M.

description:
One of the best cheesecake places I've ever been to.  I haven't tried the other flavors they carry but the original is delightful.

It's a small place but very well kept.
author: Peter W.

description: The lightest fluffiest piece of heaven you'll ever try. Its more of a mousse than a cheesecake. The owner Sam is helpful and nice. You can't find comparable cheesecake anywhere.
author: Carrie R.

description: I just had to visit the number 1 business on Yelp. Let me tell you, the place lives up to its name. Mr. Zanze, the owner, is one of the nicest people I have ever met. He was helpful and demonstrated the 'fishing line' cutting method. I ordered a large cheesecake and it was delicious. The store has  different flavors too. Great dessert to bring home!
author: Henry D.

description: They tape a little piece of fishing line to the box when you purchase the cheesecake, and the cute old men who staff the place advise to only cut the cheesecake with the fishing line.
author: Netty L.

description: Absolutely heavenly! Even if you are a fan of the dense and heavy cheesecake, you will definitely grow to love these fluffy cheesecakes. It's a small mom and pop shop but they take care of each of their customers and you can just feel the love they pour in to these cheesecakes. However, they're closed on Sunday to Tuesday, so order early!
author: Annie C.

description: yum yum yum! I like the texture, and light creamy taste of Zanze's Cheesecake. The warm welcome customer service is superb. I'll visit them again very soon
author: Elisa C.

description: My arteries are clogging even thinking about it... This is some of the lightest, creamiest and tastiest cheesecake on this here planet. I would go on and on but I am drooling on my keyboard as it is...
author: Robin S.

description: OMG...It is heavenly!  My friend actually ordered a few of these and used them as her wedding cake, and after just one bite, I absolutely fell in love with it.  So light! So fluffy!  It's just so amazing.  I have to now order an entire cake for myself :-p.   Ohhh...I'm craving it now!!
author: R. F.

description: It's a litlle piece of heaven, i try several cheescake's , but this so far is the only one make by hand , with the teste of grandma  kitchen ,actually I take one to chile, perfect , fluffy and deliscious,
author: Gus e.

description: Nothing turns me off of a place faster than the words "cash only". Although Zanze's was an interesting dessert, I would never imagine this texture to satisfy a cheesecake craving. Luckily I had Yelp reviews to prepare me for a cheesecake-like product. Zanze's is run by an adorable couple, so full of pride for their product. I wanted so badly to like it, but I didn't enjoy the airy foam with crumbs on top. It did make for a bit of fun party conversation. I can see the appeal, but it isn't for me.
author: Rachel B.

description: Never in my life did I think cheesecake could be so creamy and light.  My friends and I came in a group of 8 all expecting a single slice.  Much to our suprise single slices weren't available so Mr. Zanze(I presume) suggested we get one to share.  We split the cost and the kind man suggested the traditional flavor since we were new customers and showed us a ingenius way of cutting the cake.  We left with some plates and forks and divulged later on.  Mr.  Zanze displayed excellent customer service with quality cheesecake to match.  Definitely a five star experience!
author: Doogie H.

description:
mmm mmmm mmmm.  delish.

i'm licking the spoon clean.
author: Dorothy L.

description: Believe the reviews. It's simply awesome cheesecake. Can't wait for another reason to buy one! We got the medium pumpkin and it easily fed 8 adults.  One guest was on a gluten-free diet which was fine since there is no crust on the cheesecake.  Will definitely go back.
author: Laurie P.

description: This review is long overdue. I always thought this little secluded place was not so popular and I liked it that way. But I saw that it made Yelp's front page! Bummer, and I wanted all the cheesecake to myself! Let me put it this way, I've just never had cheesecake that tastes better than Zanze's. Not even close! I know a lot of people prefer the more solid cheesecakes and may actually not like Zanze's very delicate and refined texture, but ok, that's good. That just means more cheesecake for me! Their Kirsch cheesecake is beyond awesome. If you haven't tried Zanze's, I'd make any excuse to go there right now and try some! Oh and Zanze himself is one of the nicest and most cheerful person I've met.
author: Marv G.

description: This is THE cheesecake destination, forget the "Factory", the staff is as great as the cake tastes!!
author: Gary B.

description: I only found out about Zanze's after browsing through Yelp at work while I was hungry. As a result, I headed there after work and bought a small cheesecake for $13. It was sooo GOOD. As everyone else has said, its so light, but still creamy. I can see how it can be so easy to eat the entire thing by youself if you're not paying attention! It's one of the best I've had.
author: Kim C.

description: The cheesecake is very light yet it's made with real Phili cream cheese.  Unbelievable!  How does he do it???  I love baking and have made cheesecake many times but never this light!  The owner was very friendly and sweet and gave me a tip.  Sorry I can't share.  You'll have to ask him yourself.  I tried both the regular and blueberry and like the regular more.  I like that I can still have a piece of dessert after dinner and not feel stuffed cuz this is not too sweet and very light.  I like that it comes in a small size so even 2 people can finish it in 2 days rather than having a big ole cheesecake in the frig for the entire week.
author: Irene C.

description: Count me in as a lover of Zanze's!  Maybe I just don't know what cheesecake is SUPPOSED to be like, but who cares. These 'cakes are yummy and light and extra special. My favorite is the regular cheesecake but I also love the pumpkin one, come autumn.  Don't throw away that fishing line curled on top of the box- you're gonna need it to slice your cake perfectly.
author: Christine H.

description: I grew up on Zanze's pumpkin cheesecake.  Every year at Thanksgiving, we'd have it for dessert.  It's light and creamy with just the right amount of sweetness to it.  I give all of their cheesecake's two thumbs up...more if I had more thumbs.
author: Miss T.

description: Light, soft, buttery, and fluffy.  What more do you want on the cheesecake?  There are actually no crusts for this cheesecake, but i would not take off any points/stars b/c of this flaw.  The cheesecake that they whipped up are so yummy.  I had an entire slice and I did not feel like I was stuffed.  I can't wait to try out the other flavors.  I hope they are just as good as the original.
author: AhLin C.

description: Went here after reading a coupe of Yelp reviews because I love cheesecake.  It is a little bit hard to find as you're driving on Ocean Ave.  To call the interior of the store small is an understatement.  They only sell cheesecakes, I think they have like only 4 or so varieties.  The lady at the counter was very nice, although I never mastered the cutting technique with the fishing line she showed me.  We got a large one which was about $25, I think. The first bite was like heaven.  It is very light, soft, and super delicious.  They seem to have limited amounts on hand so order ahead.
author: Miss H.

description: My sister bought a small cheesecake here the other day. I (and the rest of my family) thought the cheesecake here is good, but it's not spectacular. It is fluffy and soft, and it's not too cheesy. But, there's no (not enough) texture on the cake. There's no hard cookie-type bottom. I still think Whole Foods' organic cheesecake is many times better (but almost twice as costly).
author: Sam W.

description: A family business, Zanze's make their cheesecake with a passion! It's so good, I dare to say it's one of the best in the bay area!
author: Will T.

description: Very nice/cute couple. I got a small regular (they insisted...), and a chocolate. both very light and super tasty. hours are a pain, but worth checking out if your around. i'll definitly stop in again to try some more...
author: justen e.

description: This is my favorite dessert of all time.  If you like cheesecake but have not had a Zanze cheesecake, you have not had a cheesecake.  The flavor is so delicate and the cheesecake is so light that a knife won't work, you have to cut it with fishing line.  It is like eating a piece of air with a light cheesecake flavor.  A cheesecake factory cheesecake does not even come close to a Zanze cheesecake.  The trip to San Francisco is worth it, you will not find another cheesecake that compares.
author: Casey F.

description: Mr. and Mrs. Zanze are good people...so buy their cheesecake, dammit!  a bit of trivia, his dad owned a restaurant somewhere on powell st. (errr, i think...) back in the day....that's where the cheesecake was unveiled.  it's like a cheesecake you've never had before...so light, fluffy, creamy...forget the fishing line they give you to slice it up...grab some forks and go to town!  hell yeah!
author: Miss P.

description:
light, fluffy, so delicious.
don't resist it!!!

zanze's iz zee best!
author: Tiger Lily ..

description:
airy and light creamy round of magic.

the little man who wants you to know specifically how to cut his delicate cheesecake with fishing line is adorable. he truly loves sharing his cheesecake with others and i guess i would too if i could bring that kind of joy to people just by handing them dessert. 

no frills about it kind of establishment. they just let the cheesecake do the work.
author: Regina C.

description:
Is a review even necessary?

One word for this place:

YUM.
author: Nicole R.

description:
I was taken here recently by someone formerly local to the neighbourhood. It was obvious at once that this was something special. The owners both knew my friend, even though he had not seen them in a while. Mrs. Zanze was behind the counter, and Mr. Zanze was in the back, baking. He could just be glimpsed through the window into the back, but you could feel the warmth from his smile. Their personal aura alone make it worth going back. 

The cake is not just icing on the cake, but an expression on themselves. (Note to those who say the cake's too light: leave it in the fridge for 4-5 days, and it will slowly descend into the realms that merely mortal cheesecakes inhabit.)
author: Adam K.

description: It's tucked within a small strip on Ocean Ave. by Junipero Serra, Zanze has some of the "bestest" cheesecakes I've ever tasted. No single slices here. All cakes are worth every penny. They'll show you how to really cut the cheese... cake.
author: Leroid D.

description: Zanze's chocolate cheesecakes are the best thing ever.  It's like eating a fluffy chocolate cloud, what could be better?
author: Ariel D.

description: Fabulous cheesecakes!   It's like an Asian version - light airy and subtly sweet - never overdone but slightly denser...  Mr. Zanze is such a sweetheart - you leave with a smile on your face!
author: sHoo o.

description: Zanze's make just about the absolute best cheesecakes. Sure they're not as thick and cheesy as most cheesecakes are but they set themselves apart from others by creating a wonderful, moist, fluffy, light delicacy for you to enjoy. Well worth your money.
author: Lauren L.

description:
it was my aunt's birthday, so my cousin bought a cheesecake for the family to eat and celebrate with later that night. i thought it was a regular cheesecake and didn't think anything of it. but when i said i had never tried zanze's, everyone was flipping out. WHAT you haven't tried it? it's soo good.

and wow, they were right the cheesecake was so good. it's not like the new york cheesecake that's really dense. zanze's cheesecake melts in your mouth. it's so smooth. and the crust goes very well with it. i'm glad i got to try it. definitely going back to get more.
author: Natalie B.

description: Just because I prefer my cheesecakes more on the denser side, I can't give them 5 stars. But the bf said it was one of the best cheesecakes he's ever had.  But thanks, Zanze. I now know what clouds takes like.
author: Jen Y.

description:
a cheesecake texture like no other

light and fluffy and not heavy on the cream, a cheesecake that actually taste like it might be good for you, every bite goes down your throat very smoothly unlike the types of cheesecake that require you to down 3 full cups of milk

if you're into the type of cheesecake that's on the heavier side, not for you

it's a small shop, so don't expect any seating b/c there isn't any, but rather take it to go

we had the original cheesecake and loved it
author: Veronica H.

description: Zanze's makes an incredibly light cheesecake in a couple of flavors. They are all delicious.
author: Chris S.

description: So my grandma's birthday was coming up and I had no idea what to get her. So I thought, what's better than a cheesecake? I walked into Zanze's the day before my grandma's birthday and I looked at the menu. There's nothing special about the menu so I asked the man, who I assumed was owner, what he recommended. I told him that the cheesecake would be for my grandmother and he told me that the traditional was Zanze's best cheesecake. He was really nice and showed me the proper way to cut the cheesecake. With a string. I was intrigued to say the least. On my grandma's birthday, I cut the cheesecake just like the way he showed me. This has to be the lightest cheesecake that I have ever eaten. I was expecting a dense cheesecake because that's what I usually get from cheesecake. But holy moses, it was incredibly light and so good. I didn't feel so guilty eating half of the cake. My grandmother had a slice and really appreciated my gift so thank you Zanze's!
author: Lauren L.

description: I can't quite remember how it tasted, but I remember feeling really good afterwards! The owner (or who I think is the owner) was really nice, and took time to show us just how to cut the cheesecake (after slicing the cake with string, you pull it through the bottom as opposed to pulling it up so that you don't ruin the cake!). If i lived closer, I'd go back... So as it stands, great specialty shop!
author: Simon L.

description: One of the lightest and best tasting cheesecakes I've ever had. Start with the plain cheesecake which is absolutely divine then go on to try other flavors. Bet you can't get enough.
author: InHo K.

description: A friend of mine brought one to a party.  I never knew cheesecake could taste like that.  Light, fluffy, and creamy.  I could've sat there and ate the whole thing.  They have a few flavors to choose from but the plain is so good it's hard to put anything with it.  You guys outta try it sometime.
author: CharBoiled ..

description: With all of the glowing Yelp reviews my expectations of Zanze's cheesecake were high.  Alas, the cheesecake did not meet my expectations.  The cheesecake was light and fluffy but nothing extraordinary.  I would rather go to Sweet Things in Cal-Mart on California for an individual cheesecake...yum!  I can satisfy my cheesecake craving without having to purchase an entire cheesecake.
author: Berna M.

description: I used to work right down the street from Zanze's, and they would bring a cake each birthday... man I miss working... Hands down the best cheese cake I have ever had. It is so light and fluffly and magical. You cut the damn thing with a string. A STRING! Ok, a fishing line, but still, you cut the damn thing in a not so conventional way. Fresh fruit toppings... friendly service... you don't feel like a total fat ass after eating a slice... or a whole cake.
author: danny e.

description: It's always such a delight to walk into this tiny little shop on Ocean. It not only means that I get to part take on the best cheesecake I have EVER tasted. It's so creamy and doesn't fall into your stomach like a brick. Plus getting a chance to speak to Mr Zanze is always a treat. He loves what he does and the cheesecake really shows it.
author: Robyn L.

description: Out of all the cheesecakes I've tried in my 24 years on planet Earth, this is the best. They're only open 2 or 3 days a week, but the wait is worth it. I've been known to refuse slices to friends and hog the whole thing to myself. Zanze's is to cheesecakes what Godiva is to chocolate: you put it under your bed (or in this case, in back of the fridge) and don't let *ANYONE* lay a finger on it...
author: Maurice R.

description: If you love cheesecake, you will like Zanze's cheesecake.  It's that good.  Would have been 5 stars if it's cheaper.
author: Alex D.

description: What can I say about this place that hasn't been said.  All they do is cheesecake.  That's all they need to do. I don't think you can even get a cup of coffee here
author: John G.

description:
The cheesecake is really light (but still rich), so if that's not your thing, try elsewhere. It's deceiving though, and you'll start to think you can get away with eating the whole thing because it's so damn airy. The owner is really sweet and friendly, and even though a line formed behind us, he took the time to talk to us since it was our first time there. My friend asked him if he took orders online, and his response was "Nope sorry. We use this old fashioned thing called the telephone." Adorable! hah There aren't many places with service like that anymore. The mocha looked really delicious, but like many before us, he persuaded us to try the original first.

I just wish there was somewhere to sit though. We wanted to eat it immediately, and the closest place was the car.
author: Tami H.

description: With all the positive yelp reviews, I just had to pick myself up one of these bad boys. I ordered a large cheesecake(original flavor) about 5 days in advance just so I can munch of one of these for Thanksgiving.  The workers are super friendly and nice and has the family owned business feel. You either order small/medium/large. You can't order by the slice just to have a taste of it before you order the whole enchilada. They instruct you to use their fishing line to cut the cake(marketing ploy), but you don't have to.  So...... what do I think of the cake?? It is by FAAAR the softest cheesecake I have ever tasted. Think of it like custard almost(but cheesecake flavor). The flavors were pretty good and I thoroughly enjoyed it. It might be even too soft for me haha. If you are looking for the softest cheesecake ever  that has good flavor, you better start looking up directions on google maps! If this place weren't so far from me I would totally come here more!
author: Ronald C.

description:
the BEST cheesecake, hands down! "it's so fluffy i'm going to DIE!!!!"
mr zanze is just adorable, and has excellent taste in classical violin music piping through the speakers of the tiny store-front. i keep trying to peek into the kitchen to learn some of his secrets. alas, they have no long-term plans to hire a baking intern...
author: annie c.

description:
I believe this in one of the best cheesecakes around especially if you like your cheescakes on the lighter side.  Mr. & Mrs. Zanze are really friendly and informative as well.    

Re: Mark P's review, I bought a chocolate cheesecake without ever having bought a cheescake there before.  The original plain cheesecake is still the best.
author: JERRY D.

description: This cheesecake is "excellentissime rare". Delicious and light with a wonderful fluffy texture.
author: Seema H.

description: YUMMMMMY. If you're a cheesecake fan, be sure to visit Zanze's. Cheesecake factory does not compare to quality and selection of Zanze's.
author: Teresa Y.

description:
not much i can contribute to this. i concur with all the positive accessments:

owner is the nicest dude you'll ever meet
cheesecake is the best that you'll ever eat
author: Kenny W.

description:
wow, this is one crazy cheesecake.
if you whipped a cheesecake and reassembled it, you'd have a Zanze's.
the only reason it's lacking a star is because after a week of thinking about the cheesecake i had, i'm still not sure if i like this unique cheesecake as much as the usual dense creamy cheesecakes you can get anywhere.
if you like mousse and cheesecake and the idea of the two intermingling then come here!
the service is great, the guy behind the counter seemed just as excited as i was for me to try his cheesecake! the store is small and hot, they don't accept cards and there's no seating so have a plan for your cheesecake, and get that puppy refrigerated.
the smallest original cheesecake was $14
author: Grace M.

description: I am nine months pregnant and was craving cheesecake last night.  My husband and I were about to head out to the Cheesecake Factory in Union Square when we stumbled across Zanze's on yelp.  The rave reviews on yelp sold us and once I walked in and smelled the wonderful cheesecakes I knew it was going to be good!  They were about to close, but luckily they had one small cheesecake left.  The owner was so nice and delicately wrapped up our cheesecake.  He also showed us how to use the fishing wire to cut the cake.  When we got home my husband and I immediately each had a slice.  It was HEAVEN.  I love that the flavor is classic cheesecake but  it was airy and fluffy not dense.  I will definitely be going back here for cheesecake and will try their other flavors.  The owner told me that he once had a very pregnant woman come in for a cheesecake and when he asked her when she was due she responded with "right now".  She was headed to the hospital to deliver but wanted to pick  up a cheesecake on the way!  I like her style and I may just have to do that myself! :)
author: Marivic T.

description: I have to say I really enjoyed the food and service at this location. Ok the pervious reviews are correct not your Typical NY style cheesecake. Zanze's creates his own homemade authentic style cheesecake which is  fluffy, tasty, and creamy all at the same time.   It doesn't leave you with that heavy feeling after like most typical cheesecakes do.  This cake is great for large parties as well, but some may be critical of the density of the cake. Nonetheless great find and thanks again yelpers.
author: mario S.

description: I am never disappointed by their cheesecake. When I am chilling at Wilson's Feng Shui, but don't feel like walking or driving my car down to the 7-11 down the road, I walk over here which is almost right next door, and then go back in. "Good times."
author: Michael C.

description: I just went for my first time after reading the reviews on Yelp, and this stuff is incredible!  It's so light, it doesn't feel like you are eating cheesecake, it's almost like a souffle.  He showed me how to properly cut the cake, and told me not to eat it all myself!  Loved the cake, I'm coming back for more as soon as possible!
author: Benji J.

description: ok, i hate that i have to put only 3 stars for cheesecake that everyone absolutely adores...but it just wasn't the texture that i normally like.  It was definitely good quality and I can see how people love the creamy texture of it, but I tend to like the style of cheesecake that has a nice thick crust and a denser filling.  I drove really far to get this (haha kinda), so i was a little disappointed that it wasn't the style of cheesecake that I normally like.  I would go back to this place only because I can tell the owner put a lot of love in his cheesecakes. It's such a hole in the wall looking place...with a baker/owner that looks like he takes so much pride in his cheesecakes...i love that.   Maybe I should try their pumpkin or their chocolate cheesecake...i want to love their cheesecake so much, but the first time just didn't do it for me.
author: sharon m.

description: Maybe I'm a tough critic, but Zanze's Cheesecakes, specifically the Traditional Cheesecake, wasn't as good as everyone made it out to be. I think it was too light and too fluffy for my taste. It really was almost mousse-like, and I wasn't expecting that in my cheesecake. I really wish I could have liked it more because of everyone's glowing reviews about the cheesecake itself and the wonderful owners, but sadly I don't think I'll be visiting Zanze's again.
author: Phoi B.

description: Please call ahead to see if they are open (at times they don't go by their operating hours.)  Once you get the yummy cheesecake goodness in your possession, run don't walk home to taste this delicious cheesecake. It is like taking a bite out of a fluffy cloud because unlike other dense cheesecake, Zanze's cheesecake is light , airy and moist . I'm guessing it is steamed baked. It is so light and fluffy that cutting it with a knife would crush the cake. Zanze's gives you a piece of fishing wire to slice the cheesecake(you get perfect even pieces!)  This is great Yummies!!!
author: Loun P.

description: Definitely worth trying once or twice... but do expect a fairly small cheesecake with lots of air whipped into it. It's so light you can cut it with the fishing line they tape to the top of the box. I also prefer my cheesecakes a little bit firmer... not like a rock... but a bit denser. We bought some yummier single serving ones for take out at Ruth Chris' Steak House.
author: jane f.

description: It's authentic, rich, creamy...and these just a few of the adjectives to describe the very best cheesecake you'll ever put to your lips! It tastes like heaven, and yes the one thing the owner will tell u when u buy the cake is, "please use the fishing line to slice the cake." who cares, it just adds to the heavenly experience you will get when putting the delicate fluffy sweet little thing into your mouth. Trust me, its THAT goodd!!!
author: Natalia T.

description: I love their cheesecake . It's very light and yummy . I really like it's texture . It's more like a mousse . The old man that greeted me was pretty friendly . He asked if it was my first time there and he recommended me the traditional cheesecake . He taught me how to cut the cake with a fishing line.  (which I didn't .. I got pissed off because I couldn't separate the pieces so I used a knife in the end) He also told me to make sure I eat it after dinner and not to eat it all by myself .
author: Eileen L.

description: my husband brought one home to surprise me one night, and I fell in love with Zanze's cheescakes; I told my husband to surprise me with one every week. I'll never go to cheesecake factory again!!
author: Joyce C.

description: I didn't have time to go to Ocean Avenue, but Tower Market carries these cheesecakes frozen. Me oh my!  A cheesecake to rival my own homemade. A great discovery. Time to trek to Ocean to see where it all happens.  Plus it feels good to support a family business whenever possible!
author: Celeste S.

description: The best CHeese cake ever so light and creamy.  I used to work on Ocean Ave and didn't think such wonderful cake can come from an old looking shop.  Do they sell anything else besides cheesecake?
author: Mar H.

description:
what a san francisco gem...
i was in love with this place from the moment i walked in and saw the simple cheesecake display and was welcomed by mr. zanze's warm greeting.   the traditional cheesecake was hands down the lightest most delicious cheesecake i've ever had in my life. if you live in san francisco and love cheesecake you just have to enjoy one of these. yum.
author: anne l.

description:
5 star, yaaaaay!! 

i love their cheesecake. it's delicious. i like how you can just cut the cake without a knife and instead with a fishing string. unique!
author: Valerie N.

description: San Francisco's hidden gem! I still drive right past it even though I've been here before because it's such a small place and part of a strip mall.  You literally walk in and all you see is cheesecake, cheesecake boxes and Zanze or a family member at the counter.  They are so friendly and will spend a good 20 mins telling you how to cut the cheesecake (fishing line!) or how to freeze it.  Did I mention it is the BEST cheesecake ever?  Fluffy, creamy and flavorful!  It's my go to dessert for any party!
author: SFFoodie F.

description: fluffiest cheese cake i've EVER tasted. It's so fluffy that you had to cut it with a fish line. Highly recommend the original. fluffy and yet so creamy!
author: David C.

description:
Holy shit. These are AMAZING. I'm actually lactose intolerant and can't stand the taste of milk or cheese usually, but somehow, much to my weight-watchin' cheese-hatin' mom's chagrin, both of us manage to finish off a small cheesecake in less than ten minutes. These cakes are fluffy, light, not too thick or rich, and with a thin layer of crumbling atop the whole delicious delicate creaminess of it all... So yeah, now we usually get the medium size and it lasts, well, a day - that's better anyway, right?

We just recently officially moved to the East Coast, so I haven't been able to get my Zanze on lately. Over the dismal East Coast winter, we became so homesick for Zanze's cheesecake that when my mom flew back to SF to visit friends, she actually came back with not one but THREE huge cheesecakes. And they were delicious. Apparently this is quite a common occurence, too - we were talking to the old man who runs the whole operation one time and he told us about how he regularly gets orders from out-of-staters intent on sharing the love, especially around the holidays, when he enlists family members to help him churn out the (family recipe) cheesecake.
