In my opinion, the original flavour is totally the best, but my brother is partial to the chocolatey cheesecake. The pumpkin cheesecake is also amazing. Remember to cut it using the fishing line provided!
author: L L.

description: Puts all other cheesecakes to shame.  It doesn't matter if you don't like cheese or cake, you'll love Zanze's.  It's that good.  Superior service, as well.  What else can you ask for?
author: Alex S.

description:
I first encountered Zanze's cheesecake in the early 60's - when Sam & His father had a restaurant on Grant Avenue, and the cheesecake was dessert.    My sister  and I took every opportunity to dine there. Not only was the Fruit Salad to die for, the cheesecake was like nothing we had ever seen.   HEAVEN !   

I thought the cheesecake was lost to me when Sam's Dad retired, but a few years later, there Sam was on Ocean Avenue - making  my very favorite dessert.  My prayers had been answered.

It helps that Sam is a local guy, and that my aunt taught him in grade school, and that he is quite personable & so very genuine,  but the cheesecake!  Wow!  

I once took cheesecake my cousin in Davis  - to thank her for favors she did for me.  One Saturday morning I got there at 9 Am, with one to eat, and one to freeze.  Her boys were small then, and she asked them if they wanted cereal  or cheesecake for breakfast - We had Cheesecake, of course..!!!!!

I must have more dinner parties  - I must visit Sam to get Dessert - I must have more dinner parties  - I must visit Sam to get Dessert -I must have more dinner parties  - I must visit Sam to get Dessert - I must have more dinner parties  - I must visit Sam to get Dessert

-MH
author: marci H.

description: i love this store's cheesecake, especially the regular favour. i brought several from this store. everyone in my family like it.
author: Ivan C.

description: This place is amazing! Cheesecake often leaves me feeling really heavy and uncomfortable bc it is so intense.  However, the fact that you cut into a Zanze cheesecake with string should give you an indication of how light it really is.  The Cheesecake gives you this "melts in your mouth" sensation that I have never experienced before with any other cheesecake.  While they may not have nearly as many selections as the Cheesecake factory, this is by far the best cheesecake I have ever had in my life.  Please please please give this place a try.  You will not regret it at all.
author: Winnie S.

description: Now I know what a Real Cheesecake is!  Not those "Half-Ton" overly sweet and chalky Brick Wedges that they serve at places like the Cheesecake Factory.  The Cheesecake from Zanze's is light, fluffy and delicate like a smooth mousse.  The taste is not overbearing and we found that it went great with a gourmet Pomegranate & Citrus with Chardonnay Fruit Spread from the "Made in Napa Valley" label.  The shop is very small, basically a sales counter for you pick up your Cheesecake, no table seating, the Cheesecakes are served whole and only "To-Go".   Mr. Zanze is a sweet Ol' gentleman who wants to make sure that you'll treat his Cheesecakes correctly before he turns them over to your care and consumption.  He instructs you on how to Freeze them and how to cut them with the fishing line that is provided.   To meet him makes you feel nostalgic of a time of hard work and innocence and to eat his Cheesecake makes you feel that you just tasted Tradition.
author: Doug L.

description: This place is sooo special. The cheesecake is unforgettable (esp. the pumpkin cheesecake in Oct/Nov) and there's a magical quality to the place. While you're waiting for Sam to put your cake in a box, you lose track of time.  The music playing is from another era and Sam's voice is soothing and soft.   It's not until you walk out the door that you remember you're in SF and it's 2010.
author: Jennifer A.

description: fluffy dessert isn't exactly my thing, and cutting food with a fishing line is weird, but it's a hit at dinner parties and potlucks
author: Charles C.

description: Best cheesecake ever.  I don't like cheesecake but this cake was amazing.  Light, fluffy cloud of deliciousness.  Worth the drive from the South Bay, yum!
author: Patricia N.

description: I love the "cheesecake" here. I wouldn't really call it a cheesecake, but I'm from New York so I consider a cheesecake too be this rich creamy thing. Zanze's is very different, but I do eat a hell of a lot of it. I crave it. I have to have it. You can even fool your calorie counting friends into eating it with you because it is so light and fluffy that it tastes lighter.
author: Emily D.

description: Been buying cheesecake from Zanze's for like...over 10 years...it is sooooo good... especially the mocha. You can't go wrong with any of the cakes.  I hope he stays in business forever.
author: T Q.

description: My wife absolutely loves their cheesecake.  I am not much of a sweets person but have to agree that they make the best cheesecake I've ever had.  My only complaint is their store hours.  It's not very convenient but I don't have the heart to take off a star.  That's how good their cheesecakes are!!!
author: California B.

description: It was a beautiful sunny day yesterday... one of those days that make you want to seek out the simple joys in life. I'd been meaning to try Zanze's for years, being a huge cheesecake fan and having read great things. I was indulging in one of those "take it as it comes" afternoons, and decided to venture on over at long last. The shop itself is pure and simple... they sell about 4 flavors of cheesecakes and cherries for topping. That's it. Don't go expecting fancy display cases. But do go expecting some of the best cheesecake you will ever have and the most friendly, wonderful greeting. The instant you start talking, you realize why word of mouth has built such a cult following for Zanze's. When I asked, the gentleman said this month is their 28 year (I hope I remembered the exact number correctly!) anniversary of being in business. All those years selling one phenomenally good thing to people who adore it. Now that's a good life. And when you bite into the cheesecake, you can understand why. Some people don't like cheesecake. I think they've been subjected to gummy, heavy cakes and soggy crusts. Zanze's is a whole different experience. It's feather light, melts in your mouth, and has no crust except a light sprinkling of crumbs on top. I ate mine with a few cherries and left it at that. Another charming touch is that they tape a bit of fishing wire on the top of each box, and you use that to cut your cake. They will explain exactly how, so that you can have the best possible pieces. The hours are a bit limited since it is such a family-run operation, but when you find a spare window of time to follow a whim, I'd highly recommend checking if they are open and heading on over.
author: Shoshana D.

description: Until yesterday, I was a Zanze's Cheesecake virgin.  I normally do not even like to eat cheesecake, but Zanze's is so delicious, I am a cheesecake convert.  I am officially hooked on it and my only regret is that I live so close to the bakery...oh well, the diet can start in 2007.
author: Tanya K.

description: Yummy is only  word I would like to describe the cheesecakes made by Mr. Zanze. I've been his customers for years. I used to work as a teller @ a bank down the street from his shop over 10 years ago, and that's how I know this place. Since then, I moved out of SF, but still going back to this place for cheesecakes from time to time.
author: Sophia X.

description: I've only been once, but I thought the cheesecake was only so-so because of its airy texture.  I do love that everyone I saw working in the store was at least 60, so maybe I'll go back and give it a second chance.
author: chini l.

description:
my mouth is watering just thinking about a zanze's cheesecake! 

it's not a ny cheesecake - which probably explains why i love it so much. i am not a particular fan of ny cheesecake to begin with. i'll eat it if it's around, but i wouldn't go craving it or anything. but zanze's is really heaven in a cheesecake!
author: Anne S.

description: The best cheese cake I ever had! So light, so smooth, so tasty.  The cake is so delicate that Mr. Zanze suggests a particular cutting method with a piece of fish line (probably) that attached to the box. (See my video clip at http://youtube.com/watch?v=fyyOCaNwMTs)
author: Kamome K.

description: Blink and you'll miss it, you'd never guess that inside such an inconspicuous place is where cheesecake worshippers gather.  Like any house of worship worth it's salt, it is closed quite a bit.  Sundays, Mondays and Tuesdays to be exact, and for those of you who didn't notice, they were closed like almost the whole month of July, but who's counting, right?  The owner is a sweet older dude, who I've learned is of Venetian origin.  He's really nice to my hell cats, so whats not to love.  I personally love the sour cherry cheesecake with Kirsch.  They also have blueberry, mocha and chocolate cheesecakes.  The cheesecakes are not "American" portion sized, in fact, the small really is just that, small.  But owner dude, Sam Zanze, actually recommends that it be sliced 6 to 8 slices.  Why, you may ask?  Because it really is that rich.  Unlike the American cheesecake counterpart, there is no graham cracker crust.  Actually, there's like hardly any crust at all.  They don't take credit cards, so have some hamiltons in your pocket before venturing.  And beef up on your parallel parking too.
author: brenda b.

description: i am pretty sure the first time i ever ate a cheesecake, that it was from zanzes. so i grew up eating these cheesecakes for birthdays and christmas! i love the light melt in your mouth feeling. it's absolutely heavenly and i love the graham cracker crumbs on top. we've tried the blueberry one as well, but i think we all love the plain/original one the most.
author: annie y.

description:
i luv luv this place! i even have a special place in my heart for the old guy that   runs the place i call cheesecake heaven! sometimes i describe it like eating clouds, because it feels so light and delicious (however i have never ate a cloud, lol) so do yourself a favor and pick up a cheesecake and bring cash! the last time i checked they did not accept credit cards

ps i recommend ordering in an advance any cheesecake order for the holidays, because they WILL sell out,
author: Tricia L.

description: Mr. Zanze is wonderful!  It's so light and fluffy!  I tried the original and blueberry cheesecake and they are both really good.  The cheesecake is so soft that you need to slice it carefully...but Mr. Zanze will show you.  :)  I had such a good experience there and will go back again whenever I crave for cheesecake.
author: C L.

description: the best cheesecake ever. A friend from la came up and we drove up here for some cheesecake. I was amazed how small the bake shop was, but the most surprising part was "they only sold cheesecakes" not other stuff like most bakeries do. We bought a small cheesecake and after being taught how to cut the cake with fishing line, we couldnt wait to return home across the bay to eat our cake so we went to a nearby coffeeshop got some hot tea and dived right in... SOOOOOOOOOOOO GOOOOOD. how do i say this so that the reader reading this review just springs up from their chair and drive there for a slice of heaven? It just delicate, moist, and not too sweet, just perfect...
author: Eric T.

description: very good! really light and fluffy, but still has the rich flavor of dense cheesecakes. at first I thought the cheesecake was a little too light and airy, but after every slice, the texture grew on me and I actually prefer this to heavier cheesecakes now. Isn't too expensive either, 21 bucks for a medium cake, which you can cut into 8 generously sized slices. if your feeding a lot more people though I'd suggest the large, because its much bigger for like 6 bucks more. I will for sure come back here for another cake for my birthday!
author: Ale x.

description: My parents used to go to Zanze's about 30 years ago (before Zanze's moved out of the city) on Tuesdays when they would come to the City . My mom always asks me to pick up a cheesecake there for her when I go visit her. Yummy. Very light and tasty. We're going to have some for their wedding anniviersary party.
author: B O.

description: the very best... truly an artisan cheesecake...  so good to the taste that  I actually take my time savoring each bite...
author: William W.
